name: Crawfish King
text: This is the best dorm in the entire University. I have a private room here.

name: Megan Rogers
text: If I could give them zero stars, I would. We bought a house in Camden Lake last year. First time being under an HOA. I’m still trying to figure out what I pay over $300 a year for? There’s no playground, no “hangout” area, half of the street lights don’t even work, and the “lake” doesn’t have a sidewalk to go around it for safely walking. They are definitely pocketing money from everyone. They have all kinds of rules that you must follow but yet offer nothing enticing to even care to follow the rules. The board members, what a joke! Plenty of people are moving out and we are one of them! No surprise their ratings are awful! Good riddance!

resp.text: We are sorry you do not like the benefits of living in a covenant protected community. The covenants were written when the neighborhood was developed, and are now a requirement by most municipalities before they will allow a new development. We did not write them, but they do create a fiduciary responsibility for the Board to make sure they are enforced, which is one of the tasks that we are hired to do.  It is the Buyers responsibility to obtain a copy of the covenants for a neighborhood and to understand them before purchasing.  The Realtor typically provides these to the Buyer.  Once we are made aware of the purchase and the new owners contact information, we send a welcome packet in the mail that includes the covenants.  We also provide an Owner Portal that has all of the Association documents for owner to access.  Spaces is not "pocketing money from everyone".  Spaces is paid a set Management Fee by the Association to handle all of the management and administrative tasks for the Association to operate.  This includes paying all Association bills, working with and overseeing vendors, answering Owner, Realtor, lender, and closing attorney questions, creating financials statements, reconciling the bank accounts, administering quarterly and annual meetings, etc.  The annual budget is set by the Board of Directors and is then presented to all Owners to vote to ratify at the Annual Members Meeting.  Spaces then operates the Association within that budget for the year.  Spaces provides regular financial statements to the Board, and approved financial statements are available to all Owners.  We understand that some people do not value the benefits of having restrictive covenants and a managed community, but most people do. For those who do not want restrictive covenants where they live, we recommend looking for homes located in the county or finding a neighborhood that does not have restrictive covenants.

name: Clay Williams
text: Seems as if the turnover is too high here within the management staff. I was talking with Heather about purchasing a place a few weeks ago, only to find out she wasn't there anymore when I called today with my final decision. She was very knowledgeable about everything with the process and had me at ease with my decision to buy. I'll keep looking, thanks for letting the bright spot in the office get away.

resp.text: We have a great team of managers at our corporate office and on-site at our communities that have been team members for many years and provide excellent service.  The goal of everyone at Spaces is to provide a great customer experience, and beautiful communities for all of our residents to enjoy.  We constantly work to improve and have the right people in the right positions to deliver on this goal.

name: LaMesha Hale
text: If I can give a negative star I would. This is the absolute worst HOA in the world!!! If you purchase a home & Spaces are over the HOA, RUN THE OTHER WAY!!! We have been here about 10 years & after they took over it has been HORRIBLE!! We cannot wait to sale our home to get away. The neighborhood is Maxwell Manor.

resp.text: We are sorry you do not like the benefits of living in a covenant protected community.  The covenants were written when the neighborhood was developed, and are now a requirement by most municipalities before they will allow a new development.  We did not write them, but they do create a fiduciary responsibility for the Board to make sure they are enforced, which is what we are hired to do.  We cannot speak to how the Association was operated previously, but a primary reason we are hired is to provide covenant enforcement for Associations.  If someone is considering purchasing a home in an Association we manage, they can expect an Association that operates within the budget set by the Board of Directors and ratified by the Members.  They can also expect the restrictive covenants to be enforced in a fair and compassionate way.  We always send a friendly letter for each first time violation to make the owner aware of the covenant violation and provide a timeframe to correct the violation.  This friendly letter results in 95 percent of the violations being corrected.  In the cases where the violation is not corrected, we do have a set policy that is equally enforced to bring the property into compliance.  The majority of violation letters we send are a result of a neighbor reporting the violation to us for enforcement.  By having a set system, it allows neighbors to be neighbors without having to get into demanding compliance with restrictive covenants.  We facilitate that process for the Board and neighbors.  We understand that some people do not value the benefits of having restrictive covenants, but most people do.  For those who do not want restrictive covenants where they live, we recommend looking for homes located in the county or finding a neighborhood that does not have restrictive covenants.

name: Cathrine Barnett
text: Great staff, great service. The managers are super helpful and professional.

resp.text: Thank you Cathrine!

name: Kristine Fitts
text: I first hand know what an outstanding company Spaces Management is. I have had two children graduate from The University of Alabama and while attending school in Tuscaloosa they lived in several of the properties they manage. Excellent communication, quality maintenance department and super smooth and easy move-ins. I highly recommend any of their properties.

resp.text: We are thrilled that you had a great experience!  Thanks for the great review!

name: Matt S
text:
Our neighborhood found out they were coming here. Everyone except (appointed, not elected board members) casted a vote to deny them the opportunity to manage anything.
This company is corrupt along with the people who planned this surprise HOA

resp.text: Matt, We have very recently been hired by the HOA Board to assist in managing the needs of the homeowners in the neighborhood but there has not been a meeting nor a vote by the membership for anything related to HOA business so I am unsure how you can adequately review our services at this time.  We look forward to meeting you at the upcoming neighborhood meeting where we are sure we can answer any questions related to the homeowners association.  If you have an immediate need please feel free to call us.

name: Travis McAtee
text: I rented a condo/apartment through Spaces Management and the whole process was smooth and handled quickly. Specifically, Pamela and Faith were very helpful with all of my questions, quick to get everything looked over and returned to me, and have made me very confident in the management team of Midtown. I have dealt with some bad management teams in the past and am super grateful that this is not the case here!

name: Jennifer Bryant
text: The WORST property management company ever. I pay $115 a month in HOA for absolutely nothing. I have dead trees falling on my property that are past my property line. But spaces management is telling me its my responsibility to cut down a tree that's behind the fence of my townhouse. Then when they call & tell you that & leave a number if you have any questions they don't even leave a number that is theirs. If at all cost avoid this company.

resp.text: Ms. Bryant, As a new homeowner, I encourage you to attend neighborhood meetings as soon as we are able to have them again, due to COVID, to meet your Board members and discuss any concerns with them.  As we discussed previously, this item needs further review from the Board.  If you were not given a budget for the HOA, I will be glad to send you one that shows where the funds are spent- which includes mowing the lawn and insurance on the buildings.   We provided the budget as well as the covenants and restrictions to the closing attorney to include in your closing packet.

name: Kristina Hales
text: Twyla is awesome they have been very helpful with dealing with repairs. Never had a problem in our 3rd year! Though I love TWYLA... Spaces has reached out to solve problems - as with all contracts keep your "receipts" and constant communication is key --- Five Oaks is still very old and the owner not SPACES refuses to repair it. Probably will be a tear down soon just like everything around UA.

name: Amanda
text: I will NEVER own another home under this management . They will give you a notice for any and everything possible. They do NOT address real issues within subdivisions. Please do your research before purchasing a home under their management!

resp.text: We are sorry to hear that you have had a less than 5 star experience with Spaces managing your HOA.  We assist the Board with all the issues possible with the HOA.  I'm not sure what you are referring to, but there are some outside the HOA jurisdiction, such as parking and road maintenance, that are ongoing problems.  Please reach out to us or a board member directly with your particular issue and see if it has been addressed.

name: Eman Smith
text: If I could give this housing authority zero stars I would. They are unprofessional, don’t abide by the HOA bylaws and don’t hold to their promises of the amenities in the newer subdivisions. People in my community are unhappy about the lies that were told by Brock Corder. We have a nice neighborhood but low quality management. HOA Fees go up every year without warning. It’s just RIDICULOUS

resp.text: Eman, there are several different issues that should be addressed separately in this review.  We are not affiliated with the Builder, however we have always found this company to go above and beyond in the neighborhoods they develop and homes that they build.  I cannot find a homeowner in our system by your name so I am unable to determine what neighborhood you live in to further address your issues.  If you would contact me personally at reception@spacesmanagement.com I will be glad to discuss them with you further.  If you do not have a copy of the HOA budget I will be glad to provide you one as well.

name: Michella Carter
text: I have never written a bad complaint about anyone in my life.But this was a lesson.Please be aware that these condos are individually owned by different people and managed by spaces management.If something goes wrong ,you report to a third party that has to get in touch with the owner before the issue is handled.Which determines how fast your situation is handled and the proper up keep of the apartment determines your owner financial stability.They will do everything in their power to not give you your deposit back.I have never in life had a deposit deferred for any reason.Its not enough money to sue but it’s my hard working money.Just be careful.

resp.text: Hi Michella, Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback. Spaces Management is a third party manager for the individually owned units at Midtown. Our goal is to provide the upmost customer service and respond in a timely manner to all requests. All units are inspected and photographed prior to move in to document the condition of the unit before occupancy. A second inspection is conducted during the residents tenancy to document the condition of the unit in preparation for the upcoming move out. The final and third inspection/walk through takes place to document the condition of the unit once the resident has vacated the unit. The security deposit is refunded less any damages, financial or physical property damages, to the forwarding address on file within 60-days of the lease end date. If you would like to speak about this further, please feel free to contact me at 205-342-3220. Best, Midtown Village Condominium Manager

name: Krystina Adams
text: If I could give them a 0 I would. They manage our neighborhood HOA and we literally pay almost $200 A YEAR for nothing. We FINALLY get a playground and it is a joke. No benches to sit on no trees around it. No pool. The front entrance road has been crappy and half finished for at least a year now probably longer. All they do is ride around and nit pick to fine you  then send you pictures of the minute things they consider not attractive. Hello... the unfinished road is unattractive. I cannot wait to move out of this neighborhood and get away from these”Nazi’s”.

resp.text: Krystina, Thank you for taking the time to voice your concerns.  The Board is diligent in keeping dues as low as possible while maintaining the common areas and adding improvements to the neighborhood as funds allow. Most recently the improvements included additional lighting and security cameras. The Board has also addressed the condition of the roads with the City and they have promised they will be repaired very soon.  This has been an ongoing issue with the original developer and the City of Northport and the Board has been communicating with them continuously regarding the conditions.    Spaces works with the Board to make sure that the neighborhood is the best that it can be.  Should you ever receive communication from us that you are unsure about, please do not hesitate to reach out to us so that we can help address the situation.

name: Melissa Spencer
text: Unethical company. We lived at Traditions Condominiums from February 2016 to February 2017. We were told in December 2016 that we have to sign a lease for fall 2017-2018. If we did not sign it by the end of December, they would start showing the apartment in January. Not sure what we wanted to do, we signed the lease. The apartment was small, no light, smelled horrible from old carpet as well as being a family with 2 teenagers, we were cramped and decided to look for a house to rent until we were ready to build. We found someone to take over the current lease as well as the next years lease. They were not subleasing, rather they were signing a new lease. Spaces Management charged us a fee for breaking the lease as well as a fee for each month. We tried finding this in the contract that we signed and did not find anything. When we called them about it, they told us that we had to submit it all in writing in email format. Even though we had an attorney, they threatened us to pay the fees or they would reassign the tenants that we found to a different apartment and not rent our apartment out. We would be financially responsible each month until our contract ended on their term. Just be careful who you rent with.

name: Arrow Xia
text:
One star for the never answered phone call and email. Whenever I was in town or moved out and tried to call them, they never pick up the phone!!! I moved out of town in July then received a bill in September, with a service that I never used. I tried to call several times, never get answered. I also emailed, no answer as well. They are doing a fair job at maintenance.
Another thing that happened when I moved out was all the UHauls were gone during that week, so I asked the main office if I could have a grace period for one day. The premise for me to ask this was my roommate is still leasing the apartment, and she has not found the new roommate yet. I assumed, if she agrees, then I should be good. I went to talk to the main office, the front desk told me to talk to the office at the Midtown apartment. I went there, the lady rejected my proposal and said they will have vendors checking my room right on the day I moved out and through my stuff out even if I have my roommate's permission to place them in the living room. So, I ran crazy for that week looking for moving trucks and finally moved out on time (actually two days in advance). I returned the keys and everything to the main office and told my story. Another lady, seems like the manager or some management-level person told me a totally different answer. She said if my roommate is keeping renting the apartment and agree to let me put my stuff in there, I could have the grace period!!! This is nuts! I was so upset for that day but decided to not give a bad review on Google review. This time, I really cannot. It is not about money, it is their attitude.

Updated

Around an hour than I left the one star review, they responded and someone finally answered the call. The answer I got for the charge is because of the wreath we had on the door🙄️so I told them that is not trash, that is what we used to place outside as decoration. Since my roommate is still living in there, it should not count as something I left not as trash. The new manager of the office said she had no other answer for my question other than I have to pay the “reasonable” charge. Oh, the most incredible thing for this management company is they will change the detail of the lease without notifying. Since I am moving out of the town and my roommate will stay, she renewed the lease. When we started to lease the apartment, we get told that we are only leasing our own room (we were paired up by the management company), which means we do not have to lease the whole apartment if we cannot find a roommate. After two years of leasing, our contract have never changed. However, they changed it this year without any notification, and my roommate did not look through carefully so she rent the whole apartment. This is the reason why I thought I should be ok to leave my stuff in the apartment with my roommate’s permission. Based on my roommate’s feedback, their maintainance worked as well as the office does. It took them over a month to get the sink fixed.

resp.text: We are sorry that you did not have a good move-out experience.  You can call our office at 205-750-2260 and we will be glad to assist you with any questions you have in regard to your security deposit statement.  The answer you received to move out by the end of your lease term was correct.  The unit has to be inspected and room made ready for the next resident.  It is not up to your past roommate to allow you to store your items in the common area that the new resident will also be using.  We understand that the move-out time is very hectic as a large number of residents move out at the same time each year.  We cannot allow residents to keep their items in a unit past the term of their lease as we have to have it ready for the new resident.

name: Scout Gage
text: Super helpful! The guy that help me put up my tv was super nice and extremely helpful! And he actually saved me over $100 by recommending something other than what I already had in terms of how to put up my tv. His suggestion worked even better than my original plan and saved me a lot of money. Highly recommend! Great service, super helpful, very nice.

name: Wayne Parker
text: Great management company. Everyone was very helpful and always professional. I was helped at every step of the process. I highly recommend.

name: Malaysia Ford
text: I am a future resident of The Nine at Tuscaloosa owned by Spaces Management. Spaces has done a great job with the leasing staff at this property, they are super friendly and extrememly professional/knowledgeable. I am so excited to be apart of this community.

name: Brenan Hester
text: Have been in a Neighborhood since 2014 and done everything according to the original HOA. Spaces takes over it in 2019 and now I have violations that have never been before! Also there are different HOA for different sections of this 1 neighborhood! Absolutely a joke as my 2 violations are a new , Christmas gift, Basketball goal and my garbage can beside my garage!! Seriously nearly every home in America has this and they are saying it’s devaluing a neighborhood! Would give them a 0 if possible and just to note their not BB accredited!

resp.text: Mr. Hester, As we have discussed, Spaces does not make the rules or create the covenants, we are hired to assist the Board or Developer in managing the neighborhood which includes collecting the dues, paying the bills and enforcing the covenants as they are recorded in the Probate office.    Although we are not BBB accredited we do have an A+ rating.  Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback.

name: Danielle Festino
text: Day 2 of no air conditioning. Put in a maintenance order yesterday. Then called 3 times today. Tomorrow will be day 3 of no sleep because of 80+ degree apartment.

resp.text: We are very sorry for We are checking into this with our vendor.  It was assigned to them shortly after you made the request.  A lot of vendors are backed up because of all of the apartment turns throughout town.  We are following up with the vendor this morning.  Again we apologize for the delay.

name: R Entsmingr
text:
Andy and Spaces Management take no responsibility for Two Maids and NOT the highest rated and reviewed Trainwreck.  The maids are awful and Andy's latest errand girl does nothing to help resolve my complaint.

Don't go near this company.  They falsely advertise and send you lazy maids that smoke more then clean. Andy Turner and Spaces Management, I'm calling you out.

If anybody has had a bad experience with two sad maids like I have post your complaints on spaces management.  Also call spaces management and don't hang up until you get hold of Andy.  ;)

resp.text: We apologize if you did not have a positive experience with Two Maids and a Mop, but it is a separate company from Spaces Management.  Spaces Management strives to provide excellent customer service.  We reached out to the Manager of Two Maids and a Mop, and they do not have a record of R Entsmingr as a customer.  The manager reinforced that they have a "pay for performance plan" and if a customer is not satisfied, they return to address any areas that are unsatisfactory to the customer at no additional charge.  After looking into this issue further, both Spaces and Two Maids are working with Google to address what appears to be fake accounts created under the names of R Entsminger and Laura Smith as neither person has ever been customers of Spaces or Two Maids.  If either R or Laura would like to meet with the owner of Spaces to discuss their issue, he is glad to meet with them.  To schedule a meeting simply email reception@spacesmanagement.com with a few dates and times and a meeting will be set to resolve any issues.

name: Nicholas Ellis
text: The properties are nice and well maintained, but management is rude and mostly unresponsive. The company uses predatory business practices to relentlessly gouge university students. These practices are unethical, and I cannot recommend anyone to do business here. Another thing to note: as I have scrolled through the reviews for Spaces Management here, I have noticed a few 5 star reviews from people that I know to be Spaces employees. So, they are artificially inflating their rating.

name: Get Hauled
text: The best property management company in the business. Highly recommended. A+

name: Carolyn Roberson
text:
I can't rate a zero but I would if I could. River point apartments are horrible. Bugs are everywhere and I don't mean a few, it is CRAWLING. We've begged for pest control to no avail.

When my son first moved in a downstairs unit the bathroom had worms coming up from the shower drain. And he went ALL winter with NO heat. They kept saying the heater was fine. So he moved upstairs and the new tenant downstairs left because of that every reason.

Upstairs the AC never worked. It was always hot and water leaked continually out of that unit. He kept a gallon pickle jar under it to catch the water and emptied it daily. Maintenance "fixed it" (haha) but it never worked.

The bathroom sink NEVER drained correctly and even backed up with fecal material. He constantly poured drain cleaner down it. And management NEVER did anything about it.

Roaches were crawling everywhere, in the fridge, from the ceiling where some wall was tearing away. Gnawing through food wrappers. It was disgusting. Colonies were behind the fire extinguisher. He left a month early because he was staying sick.

The owner showed the unit to a potential buyer and my son told him about the bugs and it embarrassed him in front of the potential buyer.

Now they are billing him for a BRAND NEW AC and NEW BATHROOM SINK. and want him to pay for the damage maintenance did changing out a ceiling fan.  $3000.00!!!!

Stay VERY FAR AWAY from Spaces Management and River Point Apts!!!

name: Meredith Simmons
text: Spaces management is great to work with! They care about each individual tenant, and want you to have the best experience while living in their properties!

name: Kristen Osborne
text: The people are fantastic and will go above and beyond to help you any way they can!

name: Eric Levitt
text: Let me tell you about my experience with these guys. My daughter is renting and overpaying for her unit at the UofA off campus. Her AC has had problems before but none like this. Keep in mind this is a brand new renovated apartment that we rented. When the AC unit again had a problem we were told, sorry it cant be fixed as the unit is out of warranty and we need Matt to okay the repair. Well at 830 at night there is nobody to sign off on the service with the temperature in the apt now at 82 boiling degrees. We had to move her and her dog into a hotel to beat the heat while nobody answers the after hours phone.

name: Carlie Chapman
text: Great company to work with! They made the transition to my new apartment so easy!

name: The RC1
text: I currently live at river pointe apartments, one of the properties spaces management manages. Let me tell you about my experience.  There was a leak in the wall of my bathroom last year right after i moved in.  I was displaced from my apartment for a little over a week while they completely ripped apart my entire bathroom to fix the leak and redo the bathroom.  I let them get started right away and found myself somewhere else to stay.  Well after they finished fixing the leak and redoing the bathroom they just left without cleaning up my apartment.  There was dust EVERYWHERE covering everything in my apartment with a layer of it.  I cleaned all of the furniture myself but the dust was embedded in the carpet and it took almost 2 MONTHS of me calling to finally get them to send carpet cleaners out to clean the carpets.  I'm a little concerned about the health effects of breathing that in for so long.  But the whole ordeal was awful and the worst part is they didn't even offer to take anything off of my rent for me being displaced for over a week and having to live in that dust for 2 months.  I would caution anyone moving into these apartments or any apartments that spaces management manages.

name: Land For Sale
text: Tried to buy a condo that was being managed by Spaces. We offered to let the tenants out of the lease as part of the sale but Spaces refused to terminate the contract. They keep 10% of the monthly rental fee which I offered to give them and they refused. They are pain in the butt just out of spite.

name: Jameson Hughston
text: Excellent company.  The staff is very professional, easy to work with, helpful, and accommodating.

name: Morris SMITH
text: They are all about the money! I receive fines every month without warning. Oh and don't have a Tenant in your home, you will be targeted.

resp.text: Mr. Smith, thank you for leaving a review for Spaces.  Unfortunately, tenants can be difficult to get to follow the rules.  We will continue to work with you to make ensure that they properly keep up your property and protect your investment.

name: Kelly South
text: Great management company!  I highly recommend.

name: David Kimani
text: Management is EXTREMELY rude. They will tell you something over the phone and once you bring it up at a later date, they act as if nothing was said. The management will also hang up in your face. Very unprofessional.

resp.text: We want all of our customers to have a great experience, and we tried to assist you with options to resolve your problem of moving out in accordance with the lease agreement at the end of your lease term.  In this case, our team advised that all items in the unit had to be removed at the end of the lease term.  We offered to have the items removed and stored, but you refused. You stated you would have someone remove the items.  We began the clean up of the unit after your lease expired, and the items that remained in the unit were considered abandoned.  No one hung up on you, but rather it was you who hung up when this was being discussed.

name: Jasmine Hughes
text: The Association Management is racist, trash, and discriminates. They also are uneducated with basic property laws. Avoid anything dealing with them.

resp.text: This review has been reported to Google as inappropriate.

name: Heather Mitchell
text: Helpful staff!  A great company to work with!

name: Jason Gray
text: Great management company with some great properties to lease.

name: Brian Randolph
text: Beware this management company. My son signed a lease only to find a week later he had lost his scholarship and would not be returning. We continued to pay the rent thinking they were trying to help sublease only to find they were turning people away. When confronted, they agreed to sublease to someone WE FOUND. Now to avoid returning our security deposit they have created damage that did not exist when we left but they are trying to get us to pay additional money. The initial conditions were terrible to start with. Think twice before renting any apartment they manage.

name: Spencer Wise
text: Great management and people.  Above and beyond service

name: Akia Austin
text: This whole company is awful. Lived in Capstone Quarters for 3 years and it gets worse every year. The management is unprofessional and the maintenance is unreliable.

name: Garret Leopard
text: Very Helpful staff, and beautiful and well kept properties!

name: Sven S
text: Not providing any service to the neighborhood. Instead they’re making up new rules just so and then have their agents solicit for any possibility to charge the residents!

resp.text: Thank you for leaving a rating for Spaces.   I understand that your landlord has provided you with a copy of the covenants that are recorded in the Tuscaloosa Probate office.  Spaces does not create these, they are developed at the time the neighborhood is planned.   If at any time, you feel that you are receiving a notice for something that is not set out in the covenants, please contact us so that we can discuss it further.  Our goal is to have zero violations noted for our neighborhoods.  We understand that there are always extenuating circumstances and will be glad to help resolve those if we are aware.

name: TJ Ward
text: They hardly ever answer the phones, and they never call you back when you leave a message. This place has some shady business practices. Avoid this entire company while looking for a place to live in Tuscaloosa. They charged me $895 when I moved out for having a pet, but I never had a pet when I lived in Tuscaloosa. After confronting them about it, they changed it to a charge for not moving out in time. They were unable to tell me what day they had me moving out in their records. Their Facebook reviews show other people having the same issues as me. Please save yourself some trouble by not renting from them.

name: Christopher Long
text: Extremely unprofessional and dishonest. Do not rent from this company.

name: Katlyn Caldwell
text: Great company!

name: Grayson Garrett
text: Fabulous

name: Chase
text: Lived in E1 my freshman year. Wish I could go back! I loved it.

name: Jeri Ward
text: Too small of rooms, and shower gets clogged too easily.

name: Christolyn Taylor
text: Really nice place!!! Nice residential community!!

name: MJ Latham
text: Wonderful dorms!!! Love them!!

name: Anna Gates
text: We have only lived here for a month but we are very impressed with everything. Sherri ( plus everyone in the office ) has been so wonderful to work with when it comes to some minor hiccups we've had. We really appreciate the help she's given us and how she's handled the situation. Coming from previous apartment that didn't do these things, it's refreshing to have a property manager that cares!

resp.text: Thank you for writing this review, Anna! We appreciate the kind words and are delighted to hear of your positive experience with us. - Sherri Young, Community Director

name: Zachery Simmons
text: We have just moved into the Peppertree apartment complex this week. So far we have had a wonderful experience. The office staff went above and beyond to make sure everything is just how we wanted it. I must give a big thanks to Sherri the manager and Ashley. They have been incredible. So if you are looking for a lovely community, come over to Peppertree.

resp.text:
Welcome and thank you for your five-star rating, Zachery! We genuinely appreciate hearing when team members have been helpful and responsive. We'll remain dedicated to your satisfaction for as long as you're a member of our community. We sincerely appreciate you choosing to make your home in our community and if you need help getting settled in, please let us know. We are always here to help!
-Sherri Young, Community Director

name: Stella Laguerre
text: The hospitality and customer care that I have experienced from Sherri  has been phenomenal! She responds quickly and truly works hard to meet the need of every resident and soon to be resident. I felt welcomed, never rushed and my concerns were always taken into consideration. Thank you Pepper true for your A++ service!

resp.text: We  would like to thank you for your review and for recognizing Sherri  as a valuable member of the team.  Our staff work hard to make sure residents are always treated with respect and care. We're glad to hear that you felt welcomed and that your concerns were taken into consideration. Thank you for choosing to make your home at Pepper Tree!

name: iz quezon
text: The staff is so nice and they accommodated my needs perfectly. I appreciate the staff and all they do here so much! If you live here, you will not regret it. The community is also really kind as well.

resp.text: Thanks for taking the time to submit this high rating of Peppertree, Iz! — Sherri Young, Community Director

name: Marice Tatum
text: The girls I’m the office are always so helpful. I went in today and they handled it so fast. They have the best costumer service ever! name: Laura Hughes
text:
Home Sweet Home.  My family and I moved from a large neighborhood with an expensive mortgage to Peppertree Apartments over five years ago.  Our intent was to "downsize" in order to afford to put our two kids through college, debt free.  What a great idea!
Our expenses at Peppertree Apartments are less than half of what we were paying, and we don't have to mow the grass, clean the pool, or keep up with any of the outside chores we used to have when we were homeowners!  Apartment life DOES have its advantages!
The complex has changed ownership 3 times since we first lived here, and currently it is run by a staff that really cares about their clients.  Our packages are received in the rental office and stored until we can pick them up.  Maintenance issues are usually handled within 24 hours.  Major repairs are taken care of --- or else the unit or appliance is replaced.
Pets are welcome, but management requires them to be on a leash when outside.  Neighbors get to know each other.  The staff throws occasional parties to encourage social interaction with new and old neighbors alike!
All in all, I recommend Peppertree Apartments for the 1) friendly staff, 2) prompt attention to maintenance and safety; and 3) the AWESOME convenience to everything in the Peppertree/Sturbridge area.  EastChase is just minutes away.  You can walk to the Walmart Neighborhood Market or several restaurants nearby.  Most of the stores are "pet friendly," so you have no excuse not to walk your pooch!
Kids are always having fun playing, neighbors watch out for their safety, the tennis court is newly renovated, and the living is easy.  While you may not choose to stay five or six years like we have, I really think that any time you spend living at Peppertree Apartments will be happy and satisfying.

resp.text: Laura, we appreciate you sharing you and your families experience with us. We're happy to read you all have had such a great experience and are happy with your choice to join our community. We're happy about it too! Please let us know if you need anything. - Deanna Moreland, Community Director

name: Janet Duke
text: I lived at Peppertree for three years; the first two and a half years were great.  Unfortunately, things changed.  Maintenance orders do not get repaired-when I was finally able to reach someone in the office to ask about my 3+ week old maintenance order the response was "oh, we don't check those messages."  I received two warnings for throwing cigarette butts on the ground; when I said "I don't smoke I think those butts are my downstairs neighbors (who did smoke) the response was "don't you live upstairs?"  When I said yes I was told "then they are your butts."  When I turned in my notice, I was sent a letter listing the things I needed to do prior to move out and to get my security deposit returned.  Three weeks after sending me the letter confirming they had received my notice the office manager told the new company I was trying to lease from that I had not given a notice; Peppertree was not aware I planned on moving.  The day I signed my lease with Peppertree I paid a $300.00 pet fee, provided a picture of my pet, and provided my pets vet records.  When my new landlord called for a reference he was told Peppertree did not know I had a pet.  It has now been four months since I moved from Peppertree; I have called eight times to ask about my security deposit.  Eight times I have been told "the manager is at lunch I will have her call you back."  I finally sent an email to the management company.  After sending the email, the Peppertree manager did call me; she told me they did owe me my security deposit and a check would be cut on July 17 or 24th.  Well, it is now August 3rd and no check.  I called today and the manager told me "the cycle of checks for July 24th were not cut.  I'll call you by the end of the day to let you know when you can expect your check."  Unfortunately a place that started out so great turned into a nightmare.  I would not recommend Peppertree Apartments to anyone

text: After reading some of the comments on this page I see we aren't the only people having problems with Peppertree, My husband and I moved here in March of this year and have had problems since day one. The number one concern we have had is outside of our building the ground stays flooded, even when it has not rained which may be part of the water damage we have had. When we moved into the apartment there was water damage all around the windows in the living room, my husband contacted the office and they sent someone out to "take care" of the issue, when we came back to the apartment they had just painted over the water damage. We had water damage under the kitchen sink which we reported to the front office, they sent someone out a few weeks later to replace the wood. We later found out that the reason the wood under the since had water damage was due to the dishwasher was flooding the kitchen, when we called about that issue it took weeks to have someone come look at it and then a few more weeks for the dishwasher to be replaced. For several months our outside lights did not work, we have had roaches since we moved in, after reporting that several times the pest control people came out and I was told that what they spray when they come out would do nothing for the roaches we had and they were not even aware we had roaches or they could have used other solutions to get rid of them. The guest bathroom toilet has broken several times and they finally after 6 weeks they came out and just super glued the piece back together. We have had nothing but problems with this apartment since we moved in and we will not be renewing our lease, nor will we recommend these apartments to anyone who asks. These apartments are horrible and have issues that management does not care about.

The Team at Peppertree

name: Kevin Morton
text:
As part of the Class of 2017, quite a few of my fellow classmates decided that it was important to point out a few pros and cons of this place.

Overall, this apartment has nice amenities and the units/facilities are very new. The environment is specifically designed to suit medical students (since only ACOM students and their families/pets can live there). And if you need the absolute closest distance to school, this is second to none. Also, the utilities are all included as part of the rent.

Pros:
- Distance
- Brand new
- Included utilities

Now onto the bad part, and why this review was only given 2 stars.
Firstly, the included utilities is a joke. You will almost always get an overcharge notice on your door before your rent is due. Even in two-bedroom apartments with two people living in it, you will still "exceed" the limit 10 months out of the year. So it's either pay up or get roasted in the hotter months (and it gets extremely hot and humid here).

Secondly, even though Corvias claims that it is competitive with the rest of Dothan in terms of pricing, this cannot be farther from the truth. The rent goes up significantly every year, while the limit for utilities, as mentioned above, stays the same. So you just get charged more. There are plenty of other better options in Dothan if you are looking for a good apartment. For example, Magnolia Preserve offers units for about the same price, but better amenities. Places like Fieldcrest offers much cheaper units while still being fairly close. By choosing NOT to live at Summerfield, you are looking at either better units/amenities or saving ~$200 each month.

Also, you only get a two day grace period for your rent. Yes you should pay your rent on time. But most places offer 4 days of a grace period. And if you are late by even a few hours, you will be charged a late fee immediately, no questions asked.

All in all, incoming ACOM students beware. Do your research and ask around. This isn't the worst option. But it is far from the best. If you don't mind driving, then stay away from this place. The gas money you spend will be worth it.

They have made my experience living at the crimson 100/10 and I am so thankful for their timeliness, friendliness and efficiency. Everyone that works here is awesome. name: Jacob Odom
text:
ROBBIN! That's the message!

I have absolutely LOVED living at the Crimson! But y'all, Robbin is a leader for the maintenance team and anytime I EVER have an issue, he will fix it immediately... No questions asked. The leasing staff 10/10. Maintenance staff 10/10. Best property to live at in Tuscaloosa. Like one big family here.

name: Teyah Giannetta
text: I’ve lived at the crimson this past year, and I love living here! I didn’t know anyone prior to moving to Tuscaloosa, and I was matched with great roommates. The apartments are super clean, and the maintenance staff is super friendly and always takes care of any issue I have, especially robbin! He’s always smiling and willing to help you in any capacity! I would recommend living at the crimson to anyone.

name: Jalen P
text: I had a wonderful experience gaining more information, as well as scheduling a tour at The Crimson. Amber was extremely helpful, thoughtful & gave me a ton of additional information that I didn’t even think about asking. I have yet to tour and I’m already sold on living at the crimson in the fall. This is the best experience I have had with an apartment complex in Tuscaloosa thus far!!

name: Jadyn Mckay
text: I feel inclined to write a review of The Crimson after my short stay here. The major downside of this complex is the safety. The Crimson has no concern for the resident's safety at all. No (working) cameras that we can see, dark and dingy breezeways, propped open gates, I could go on. They only look into things that will bring them money, but they won't look into things that value our safety. They check in on the apartments a lot for quarterly inspections plus every 60 days for air filter changes, I was told this by the front office in the fall when I realized maintenance was in my apartment every month. I have requested to be here when they enter from now on because twice now my door has been left unlocked by the staff after they entered and left (when our internet was redone over the winter break was one of them so who knows how long it was unlocked). I give the complex three stars BECAUSE the office staff is always friendly and sweet. The maintenance staff is always kind and fixes everything I need fixed which isn't a lot. They have been on top of everything since I moved in. Everyone waves when I see them, it's a very friendly environment. The biggest issue here, and the reason I tried getting out of my renewal and would not recommend The Crimson, is because I do not feel safe here.

name: AuntieMiaTV
text: Love the maintenance team, especially Shane. They’re nice and always get the job done. I love that they don’t take all day! Also, very caring!

name: Dawn Polite
text: I would like to shout out the staff members here specifically, Robbin Robertson!! I just moved into the crimson less than a month ago and he has been so helpful to me with getting things fixed in my apartment. He is very kind and fixed any issues I had and answered all my questions immediately.

name: Rebecca (Becca) Hanke
text: I have yet to live here but I am planning on living here next semester (Fall 2021)! I was lucky enough to safely tour in person with COVID still going on and the staff was a incredible. They provided upfront answers to any and all of my questions and they wanted to help with anything they could. Marlee was able to give me a tour and she was wonderful and so helpful! I see where all of these great reviews come from now that I have met her face to face. Lovely staff and I am so excited to live here soon!

name: Aliya Willis
text: Amber is amazing and did a great job of making me feel at home. She was very attentive to my questions and made me feel secure. Because of her, I would definitely recommend!

name: Kalysa Garrett
text: Beautiful place along with GREAT office staff. Marlee Ashcraft gave me a tour & was absolutely amazing. Super helpful & informative. I will definitely recommend this place to my friends & tell them to ask for Marlee! Thanks a lot

name: allison ryan
text: the staff was so sweet and helpful!! marlee is the best and she gave us a great tour and was so friendly/answered all of our questions! the pool and gym are great and the location is perfect since it’s so close to the stadium! 10/10 would recommend!!

name: Allison Hillman
text: The “waived security deposit” is actually a scam to screw you over when you move out because Alabama laws only protect you when you pay a security deposit. I paid on time the entire 2 years I lived there and left the place in better shape than when I got there, and I was still charged $150 for “paint” upon moving out. It was nothing beyond normal wear and tear. Staff told me not to paint (I called and asked when I was moving out) yet I was still charged. I emailed and received no response. I finally got a response after showing up there one day. The stairways were absolutely disgusting and the hallways were poorly lit. Not worth it at all for the money. There are much better places to live. All they care about is getting as much money out of the students who live there. Total scam!

resp.text: Hello, Allison, we appreciate your feedback and would love the opportunity to discuss your financial move out statement that you received in August 2020. We hate that you feel this way about The Crimson and our intentions are to assist in any way possible. If you have any more concerns, please reach out to the General Manager at (205) 469-9752 or email crimson@clsliving.com. Thank you. -Team Crimson

name: Malgorzata Patrick
text:
I was given a tour by Kyleen today. Her customer service was outstanding.
The Crimson is a beautiful place, the friendly staff made me feel very welcome. My daughter is so excited about moving into the Crimson this upcoming semester.   Roll Tide!!!!

name: Shalena Janae'
text: Marlee was extremely helpful with all of my questions and concerns regarding the available units within my price range! This was by far the most pleasant experience I’ve had with a leasing officer at any property here in Tuscaloosa!

name: asianna cochran
text: I was looking for a apartment because I’m moving to Tuscaloosa and I went to the crimson, when I walked in; it felt just like home . Lauren at the front desk was a great help. Lauren took me on a tour and I was amazed by her great customer service and her nice friendly attitude. Unfortunately, I didn’t choose the crimson as my place of residence but I would recommend anyone to tour there and especially tour with Lauren

name: Molly Manale
text: I live in building 4 which gets little maintenance, the elevators sometimes break and were just recently fixed two days later. There is little to no parking available for my building. I don’t feel safe living here. When I come home late at night from work I have to park two buildings away and walk to my building. I was fined $150 for a parking violation because of the lack of parking spaces. I contacted one of the managers to discuss my issues and he failed to respond for almost a month. After notifying the front office about this twice, he finally responded and thankfully reduced the fine. However, he responded in a snide manner as if he didn’t really care about hearing my concerns. Additionally, we pay for two gyms that are open 24/7. One of them is closed due to covid and the other one is only open during their office hours. I highly dislike the customer service of this apartment and do not recommend living here. I hate to leave a poor review but feel as if this is the only option.

name: Domenico (Domenic) Cesta
text: Good Apartment, you get what you pay for. If you’re ever in need for maintenance ask for Robb. Robb is a very down to earth guy, who knows exactly what he’s doing and has a very elated personality.

resp.text: We're going to pass along the kudos to Robb -- thank you! Continue to reach out to any member of our team if you need anything. -Team Crimson

name: Kyleen Patrick
text: I love living at The Crimson! Robin is always super helpful when I need anything fixed! Would definitely recommend living here !

name: Derrius Reid
text: Awesome experience on my visit to The Crimson. Amber was so sweet and genuine. I definitely have place the Crimson on the top of the my list.

name: maria patterson
text: I highly recommend The Crimson Apts. Especially Marlee Ashcraft. She was so helpful and patient with my many questions. She was thorough and informative making sure I had all the details I needed to make the right choice for me. When most places just tell you what they think you want to hear I felt she was honest and respectful regardless of what my decision will be.

name: David Ash
text: The maintenance does a great job at responding on time and greeting you in a professional manner. If you need any help give Rob a call!

resp.text: We couldn't have said it better ourselves, David -- thank you! -Team Crimson

name: fernando gomez malaver
text: Kyleen was extremely helpful. She answer all my questions and more. Super professional and friendly. Thank you so much!

name: Morgan Tingle
text: The staff is so friendly and they make you feel so welcomed when you walk in. You can tell they really care and want to get to know you and make you feel right at home.

name: Alfonso A

resp.text: This is so kind of you to leave, Bryson -- thank you! -Team Crimson

text: Great place 10/10 had a great tour with Marlee, she’s super sweet very helpful. If you’re  in the market for an apartment I would definitely ask for Marlee.

text: So glad I was able to come in and get an in person tour from Kyleen! She was a ton of help in helping me make the right choice on where to live in the Fall. The fully stocked (and beautifully organized) pantry during my tour was a great bonus too! Made me feel right at home. Thanks, Kyleen!!!

name: Marty Mills
text: Robbin Robertson does an awesome job. Great guy!

name: Sean Imlive

name: Addie Waldroop

name: John Podsednik

name: Deonna Banks
text: I would highly recommend. The staffing and management are amazing! It’s rare to find good staffing and management. They help with everything. Marlee is one of my favs <3...They are always having fun events, they give you something to look forward to! Maintenance is great as well , they are always really friendly.

name: Brianna (Bree) Kolibas
text: The Crimson is a great place to live! The management is fantastic especially Marlee Ashcraft. She is always there to help me with anything I need and goes above and beyond. She is also someone that gets to know you on a personal level instead of just thinking of you as a resident. All employees are very similar though and I love to go to the office just to talk to them! Definitely recommend.

resp.text: Hi Bree! Thank you so much for the review. We'll be sure to pass those positives notes along to our team!

name: William Patrick
text: Today's visit at The Crimson was extremely pleasant. Kyleen's professionalism and exceptional knowledge allowed us to get all the answers to the questions we had. Thanks again, RTR!!

If the gate closes on your car they won’t give you tapes unless the cops are called ! DONT LIVE HERE

name: Shelby Stewart
text: Came in for a tour with Kyleen. She was so nice and professional! Great complex.

name: Austin Eggart
text: I'm living here next semester (Fall 2021) and I absolutely love the atmosphere, and workers like Kyleen are very helpful and answer all your questions!

text: I have truly loved my experience at The Crimson. Lauren Sledge has been a huge help throughout my stay and has become more of a friend than just someone who works here. I highly recommend living here.

name: Remi Martin

name: John Evans
text: Overall it's a great place to live, the amenities are nice, the bus comes straight to the complex so it;s easy to get to campus. The staff is very friendly they treat you like family, marlee is amazing, she helps with anything that you ask and goes the extra mile even when it isn't necessary.

resp.text: Hi John! Thank you so much for the review!
