text: I went in recently to ask questions about the complex and one of the girls at the front desk named Kileen was so incredibly helpful and friendly. She was very professional and could answer all my questions!

name: Peyton Henderson
text: Robbin Robinson is the best maintenance guy you’ll find around here.

resp.text: Robbin is the best! Thanks for leaving this. -Team Crimson

name: Jalen Ifill
text: Ambernique has been very professional and helpful with me every time come into the office with questions. Can’t wait to move in‼️‼️‼️

name: Mike Murphy
text: As an out of state UA student, living at The Crimson has been great for our daughter!  Being so far from home, they have made her feel welcome.  We receive frequent updates from them and they've been very responsive to our inquiries.  Staff member Mackenzie has done a great job assisting and placing other students from our area at this complex.

name: Patti Murphy
text: Love all of the amenities that the Crimson offers! The apartments are well taken care of and the staff is extremely helpful! I had Mackenzie Murphy assist me, she was extremely friendly and very knowledgeable!

resp.text: Hi Patti! Thank you so much for the review!

name: Parker Ashcraft
text: The Crimson is one of the best places out there! In my experience, Marlee Ashcraft is top notch when it comes to any of your leasing questions and needs. She’s very professional, helpful, and really knows her job. Roll tide!

resp.text: Hi Parker! Thank you so much for the review!

name: triniti williams
text: I visited The Crimson and took a tour. The staff there were really nice and polite. I took a tour with Lauren and she was very informative and pleasant! I would define consider moving here.

name: Z MacK
text: The staff there was very welcoming and helped me with all my issues. One of the workers Mackenzie did an awesome job showing me around the place!

name: Roemello Coleman
text: Enjoyed my event and Amber was AWESOME!

name: james graves
text: great place to live and an awesome environment

name: Lauren Sledge
text: I have been living at The Crimson for the past three years and the entire staff crew are great! Mackenzie Murphy has helped me with any issues I have and I have enjoyed my years staying here!!

name: Dana Ashcraft
text: The property is very nice. I was very pleased with the help that I received from Marlee. She was very nice and friendly.

resp.text: It's awesome to see that a member of our team here made all the difference in your experience. We'll pass along the kudos! -Team Crimson

name: Chan Hill
text: Not worth living in a single there, I took over a sublease in 2019 and it was decent for the start then I decided to renew and that is where it all went down hill.  Rates went up and maintenance went down.  Lots days the stairwell smelled like piss.  Then I asked to fix where the carpet and hardwood meet in my room because I had nails sticking up and they came by multiple times just to hammer them down but yet would still keep popping up.  Overall the place felt very cheap to live at the amenities were nice when the pool was actually clean.  So if you wanna live on your own I recommend somewhere that is equally around the same cost because it is about a 25 minute walk to campus and you can hear the train all throughout the night.

resp.text: George, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback about your experience with us. Here at The Crimson, we are always looking for ways to improve; we appreciate your input. As mentioned on the phone, we understand your frustration with your move out statement and will be more than happy to work with you towards a resolution. Please reach out to the General Manager at (205) 469-9752 or email crimson@clsliving.com so we can address your previous issues. -Team Crimson

name: Mallory Harper
text:
Don’t live here. They sell this place on the tour and act like this place cares about its residents. Completely untrue. Don’t let Taco Tuesday that they do once in a blue moon entice you. The hallways smell like pee, the WiFi doesn’t function, and management is entirely unhelpful. Do not live here.
I thought to myself when I signed a lease, “Yeah, there are some bad reviews, but everywhere has bad reviews.” Big mistake.

resp.text: Hello, Mallory, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback about your experience with us. Here at The Crimson, we are always looking for ways to improve; we appreciate your input. We are in the process of upgrading the WiFi, and once COVID slows down we will be back to running several weekly events. If you have any more concerns, please reach out to the general manager at (205) 469-9752 or email crimson@clsliving.com. Thank you. -Team Crimson

name: Skylar Jordan
text: The employees here are dope and gave me free chick fil a

name: Sidney Ashcraft
text: Marlee Ashcraft is the best of the best at The Crimson! Always very helpful and answers any questions you may have with a smile!

name: McKinley Crone
text: I absolutely love this place!  They have amazing amenities including a pool and workout area, great rooms, and in a close location to campus.  To top it all off, the staff is absolutely incredible! They are all so kind and welcoming and always are finding ways to interact with the residents in fun ways!  12/10 would recommend.

name: grant albert
text: Didnt move in until last weekend in August. Called ahead week prior AND CONFIRMED someone would be there when we  arrived and let us into apartment. Bear in mind this multi building complex - its large. Called on arrival, "no one can come, no one will be there". This, after a 13 hour drive.  Turns out they have no one on site 24/7 and "policy" is apparently to make zero effort at reasonable accommodation for signed, paid up tenants to get into their apartments that they have signed leases for and have been paying rent on.  Spent $$$ in hotel and now apparently have late charges/fines associated with this dispute.  Poorly trained staff, lackadaisical management.   Capping it all off the AC, didn't work for 2 days in Alabama in August.

resp.text: Hello, Mr. Albert. We are terribly sorry that you were unhappy with your move in experience here at The Crimson. We strive to make everyone’s move in a great one.  At this time, we understand all work orders have been completed. If you experience any further issues, please reach out to us at (205) 469-9752. Thank you. -Team Crimson

name: Lee Applebaum
text: My daughter has a had a great experience living in the Crimson.  The leasing manager, Danielle Hewett is an amazing asset to the students/residents.  She alone is reason to live there.  If there was ever any concern/issue, Danielle took the bull by the horns and took care of it.  I feel that she is clearly looking out for the best interest and safety of my child, and honestly, there is nothing more important to me than that as a father of a daughter.

name: Taylor Morgan
text: I’ve lived here the past year and I’ve signed for the next year as well and I LOVE it. Danielle and Jeff are the absolute BEST and treat each tenant like family. Whenever I’ve had an issue it’s been solved immediately! The staff is always checking in on me and they are so caring! I have lived else where and NOTHING compares to this place. If I could give it 6 stars I would!!

name: Ameer Shuhaib
text: These apartments are great specially with how close it is to campus. A lot of fun activity to do and the community is great. Always feel safe. All the staff is very friendly and Devin is always there when I need something. You won’t find anything better for the price that is that close to campus.

name: Brittany Harris
text: This place is amazing! The apartments are nice and the amenities are unmatched! Danielle is sooo helpful in the office! She does everything with a pleasant attitude. I would give this place 10 stars if I could!

resp.text: You're amazing for leaving this, Brittany! Thanks so much for the kind words. -Team Crimson

name: Josie Seebode
text: Nice staff and fun events!

name: Gee Anne
text: I’m really happy we chose The Crimson for our daughter.  She’s very happy with the apartment and the facilities. She’s had no problems.  When she did need help, Devin was there to assist her. I would recommend The Crimson for your student. 🙂

name: Jennifer Lanigan
text:
Love  the friendliness and  theme of opening week ! Everyone was very helpful in answering my questions. Love Danielle, so full of energy , very helpful, and love her kindness
Love the gated atmosphere.
I feel like it is a safe atmosphere.
I was a little disappointed in the room , I felt like the room was not as nice as the one room we viewed before signing. I feel  like the hallway walking to your room needs to have more light. Overall it is good place ! It is close to the campus, love the shuttle bus to and from University and the Crimson has a shuttle bus that is provided on weekends.  I also like how Danielle and the staff provides different times by the pool for The Crimson family to meet each other. With a fun theme. Out of all the places we looked at, I recommend this place .😀

resp.text: Thank you, Jennifer! We're excited to have you here this year! Our units are made to be a blank canvas to truly make it your home away from home. We'd be more than happy to discuss our design secrets if you ever need any ideas on decorations.

name: Audrey Roy
text: A great place to live! I love all of the amenities this complex has to offer. They are always taking good care of their residents! Devin Jacob is always so kind and accommodating whenever I come in to the office! I love these apartments and would recommend to anyone looking for a place to call home.

name: Colin McCollough
text: The staff is extremely nice and can answer any question you may have. The place it’s self is a very fun place to live with events going on all the time and the fun pool parties. The maintenance  team is very good with getting the job done right and quickly. Overall a great place to live that is affordable and close to campus.

name: Charity James
text:
I have lived here for 3 years now and just recently moved out. I wanted to wait to leave a review because I wanted to have the full experience before posting. The office staff has been so friendly in my time here. Any issues that I had have always been taken care of so quickly. Even with the Covid-19 Pandemic happening, it has not stopped them from ensuring I was taken care of. The Account Manager Jeff has been by far the best. I actually lost my job due to Covid and he was able to set up a payment plan with me that allowed me to also not lose my apartment. He would call me regularly to check in and see how I was doing and not once was it to ask my about my payments.

Each experience during these crazy times is different and I actually had a very pleasant experience. I would highly recommend The Crimson just because of the people themselves. Just like me and everyone else that didn't know what to do when Covid hit, they were very helpful with communicating during the whole process.

They actually helped my friends find people to take over their spots since they were not returning once we all found out we were not coming back to campus. We all graduated in May, however I was the only one that decided to stay here versus going home. I am glad I did and I will be sharing my experience with others as well.

A big thank you to all of the staff for making my college experience so much better by living with you guys! :)

name: Sharon Phillips
text: I have a student there and was impressed with the layout and space for the 3-bedroom apartments. Halls and outside spaces were clean and they have fun extras like a volleyball court, pool, and basketball area. Pet friendly too with their own dog park!

name: firespur47
text: Had a great time living here and definitely renewing. Great amenities, not far from campus, and good parking around. Devin Jacob was also a big help anytime I needed something, and an awesome guy to get to know.

name: Mary DuBoise
text: These apartments are beautiful!! Not to mention the amenities are top notch! The staff are so accommodating, especially Devin Jacob. He always makes sure we’re taken care of and have everything we need. Would highly recommend living here!

name: joe Winkelmann
text: The worst company that I ever dealt with in 35 years of business. Did nothing to help residents or Parents that are paying for their students education during the worldwide pandemic.  In fact they increased Misc. charges during the entire Pandemic when the apartment was only 50% and 25% occupied for 4 months. Do not let you children live there and be under the  management of these horrible business people with terrible unpatriotic and uncaring  unyielding business practices that only favor their pockets. I will be doing everything  for the next two years to prevent any other family's from dealing with this horrible business,

name: WolfRainzZ Gaming
text: Helped me fix radio 10/10

name: Fred Roy
text: A clean, safe place for your student to live while attending The University of Alabama. Top of the line accommodations!  They have helpful, trustworthy staff like Devin. I highly recommend The Crimson. Roll Tide!

name: ToriAnn Parker
text: I really like that they are dog friendly. It makes it convenient to let my puppy run around in the dog park after coming home from class. I also like their resident events like Midnight Munchies! Props to whoever came up with that

name: Caitie Seay
text:
I just signed my lease for the upcoming fall of 2019. Danielle was extremely helpful and caring during my decision making process! The lease signing process is very user friendly. I highly recommend taking a look at the Crimson!
Edit:
I lived at The Crimson for a year and it’s a great community! It’s safe, clean, conveniently located near campus, and has great amenities. The staff is very friendly and helpful! The elevators are a little older but the property has done a lot of work on them and they no longer break down regularly. I highly recommend The Crimson for student living.

resp.text: It's awesome to see that a member of our team here made all the difference in your experience. We'll pass along the kudos!

name: Ifeanyi Udodilim Okpala
text: The Crimson is a good place to live. The staff are polite and very hospitable. I love the Gym facilities, the Cafe and the Resort-sized Pool. Above all, the premises is safe with a modern electronic access system. Everything regarding payment and putting in/tracking maintenance is done seamlessly online. More specifically, I was able to tie up the leasing process from far away Nigeria in time for Fall love-in. I am happy living here. Keep it up!

resp.text: This is awesome! Thank you so much for working with our team and for being patient with everything.

name: Brodie Andrew
text: Would live here just for Danielle. She always keeps it real and makes me feel like I'm actually cared about and a valued part of the community.

name: Specialist Thomas
text: Great staff they treat everyone like family. Absolutely love this place gives that home comfort feeling. Very convenient setting with a 24/7 gym you can go to any time. Management very kind and responsible and doesn’t look at you as just another number. Beautiful, peaceful, quiet, and that java bar really helps. Staff was extremely helpful when it came down to signing my lease and deal with any issues quickly and accurately. My experience here was absolutely wonderful. Excellent service they get you in and out quickly attending to your needs. Employees are full of energy and motivational, courteous, loyal, and hardworking. I definitely recommend this establishment to someone who wants to feel safe and secure and not deal with the other guys.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your positive comments about Crimson! We really appreciate you taking the time to leave this detailed review.

name: Arash Ghelichkhani
text: The Crimson is such a nice complex and conveniently located to campus. The amenities are unmatched and I would highly recommend this place! Devin helped me settle into my new home and was so helpful.

name: Douglas Kurczek
text: Gotta say, at all my time at Alabama, The Crimson was one of the nicer places to live in Tuscaloosa. As a frequent to this complex, I had a lot of positive interactions with the staff, especially Devin Jacobs, he's a straight shooter and kinda sad since the astros lost last night, but always a good guy to get help from. The amenities are great, whether you live in a 1,  2, or 4 bedroom place, plenty of space for functions and activities. They also throw a killer pool party once a term which is a great time.

name: Emma Thomson
text: Honestly, I am so happy I decided to live at The Crimson! This isn't just an apartment complex, it truly feels like a family. The staff at the Crimson have quickly become my family away from home and I can't say enough about all of them. Danielle and Jeff  are unbelievably amazing. Both went out of their way to make my, as well as my roommates, moving/signing process a breeze and more importantly, I have formed friendships with them that I know will last for the rest of my life . People look out for each other here and the staff put on creative and super fun events that allow people to come out and form new friendships. I couldn't be happier here. For all of the parents worried about a Safe place for their students, I would recommend this apartment. It is Safe, simple, great distance from campus, the BEST staff, and truly a great place to live.

name: C H
text: Danielle in the office is the best! She is always there to help residents and thinks of them over anything. She is always resolving any issues you have in a timely manner! Any complex would be so lucky to have her!!

name: Mike Diaz
text: Recently got to tour the complex and I’ve got to say the staff here are amazing!! I believe a staff member named Devin really took the time to help me feel comfortable and show why crimson is a place to be. Will be looking forward to moving in here as soon as possible.

name: Rylee Billings
text: A great place to live. I spent 4 years here and it was the best time of my life. I have so many wonderful memories of using the facilities and amenities with friends. The pool was a huge selling point and I couldn’t ask for a better place to catch some sun while organizing my next ponzi scheme. The apartment itself was a great place to live the college life, and my ferret and I have never felt more at home. The staff was out of this world helpful as well. I remember one time I had been locked out of my apartment wearing only a leopard patterned tutu and a horse mask, and Devin Jacob was more than willing to help me get back into my place so I could get my hula hoop. Overall the staff, service, and environment is a 15/10. Would recommend.

name: Ron Hunter
text: Been in contact with Devin while living here in Tuscaloosa. Really great guy and very knowledgeable. If everyone who works here is like him I would recommend this place 10/10.

name: Brittany Humphreys
text: Love visiting my friends who live here.  Pool is awesome, good location, staff are friendly and helpful. Devin Jacob at the front desk really went the extra mile to help my friend with move out.

name: Riley
text: I was really impressed with The Crimson apartments and the amenities it offers. Devin was really helpful getting me set up and I have enjoyed my residence here since I moved in! Best place I have lived in Tuscaloosa!

name: Chandler Cain
text: This is our second year here and we absolutely love it! The staff could not be more friendly and helpful. The 24 hour gym is awesome. AMAZING pool. And very close to campus and Bryant-Denny stadium. I highly recommend giving a visit if you are looking for housing. 10/10!

resp.text: Chandler, we are so happy to read such a great review about Crimson!

name: AJ Crooks
text: I just signed there recently to live there in the fall of 2020 and I couldn’t be more excited! Everyone there is so nice and helpful, and they genuinely care about you! I have yet to hear a bad thing about the Crimson.

name: Rebecca Phillips Webb
text: I have a student there and am very pleased with everything. Amenities are great, rooms are spacious. They have fun activities for the residents too!

name: Alysse Jackson
text: I'm from Arkansas and I love living here! I never seen one bug and maintenance is awesome! They also have great refreshments (cookies, cereal, milk, Starbucks Coffee Machine, and candy). The gym is a decent size and has great equipment. Management has never gave me problems and worked with me throughout the semester. The building I stay in is usually quiet and everyone is nice/respectful! The only request I have is extending the gym. Other than that, live here! It's great!

resp.text: Thank you for the review Alysse!

name: Msjpj6596
text: This place is great for my daughter! The front office is very competent and helped answer any questions i had!  Also Devin is amazing!!

name: Kathryn (Kat) Davis
text: Danielle Hewett has recently taken the job at The Crimson as the leasing manager. I have lived at The Crimson for 2 years now, the staff has always been super friendly and helpful, but nothing like Danielle. She has been extremely helpful to me not only because it is her job, but because she is genuinely a kind person. She works hard to make sure that everyone is happy with their living situation, I am so glad to have someone like her down in the office.

resp.text: Oh, wow, this is awesome to read! Thank you so much for choosing to leave these kind words -- we'll definitely pass this along to Danielle.

name: Kelly Han
text: Amazing staff! Super great corporate! :)

name: Nia Saye
text: I am SO excited to be living at The Crimson. I have never felt more welcomed by a leasing team in Tuscaloosa like I have here. DeJuan originally reached out to me with an amazing offer on a one bedroom, which I couldn’t say no to. Danielle is AMAZING and so kind. She talked me through the entire process, encouraging and calming my nerves the whole time! She was super helpful and has continued to be helpful even after move in. I am looking forward to my future as a resident at The Crimson! It is nice that I joined a community in which I feel valued as a resident!

resp.text: You're a part of our family here, Nia. Thanks for working with our team -- we appreciate your patience with us. We can't wait to have you here!

name: Jay
text: Really good experience with staff and learning more about the property!

name: Christopher Renteria
text: I Recently moved into the crimson in August. I absolutely love it. The staff is extremely helpful and understanding I want to mention specifically devin he’s always so nice and such a great help!

name: Thomes Stewart
text: I came in one day looking for a place to stay and Danielle was extremely nice to me! She gave me so much information that helped me realize that this is where I’d like to stay this upcoming Spring! Sometimes all you need is that one extraordinary person in the office to make your experience completely different! She is patient and understanding of my concerns for my apartment, and was determined to make sure my safety concerns would be met! I really loved that, thank you Crimson!

resp.text: Thank you for the review!

name: Jalyn Gregg
text: I have been living with the crimson for two years now and I have had a wonderful experience, as well as not having any safety concerns. Whenever I have any questions the staff is always efficient with answering any them, especially Devin Jacobs he was very helpful when I had questions about renewing and he is very helpful when I may need the occasional work order put in.

name: Livvy Sekelsky
text: The staff are all super friendly! I love the amenities, especially the pool. Overall a great place to live.

name: Norris Davis
text: The Crimson is really a great and convenient place to live near campus. I have been a resident for three years now and the management have been so kind and responsive for all of them. I hear horror stories about other complexes and I have no complaints about mine.The amenities are great and they keep renovating; I love the pool and gym as well as the events they plan on a weekly basis.  I recommend the Crimson to anyone looking for somewhere comfortable, affordable, and close to campus!

resp.text: This was so awesome to read, Norris! Thanks so much for choosing to live with us and for choosing to leave this for our team.

name: mickenzie sparks
text: When I toured the place a couple weeks ago I absolutely loved it! The new look is beautiful and so peaceful! The java bar is a great hookup as well for the late night studying! The apartments are cozy and with the right amount of decorations for apartment will make it right at home for you!!

resp.text: Late night java always helps, doesn't it? We couldn't agree more, Mickenzie -- your apartment is a blank slate to make your own. Thanks for coming to tour with us and hope to see you here next year! -The Team at The Crimson

name: Jolie O'Neil
text: I’m confused as to why people are giving this place 5 stars. The actual apartment and rooms are fine and clean. But the hallways and elevators are absolutely disgusting. Also, I have called and left messages at the crimson multiple times complaining about how the gate into our building has not been locked once this whole year. They keep telling me it will be fixed but uh... it’s been 6 months🤣 such a joke. They make it seem like it is so safe here but any one could easily walk into my building without needing any key.

resp.text: Thank you for speaking up to our team about any issues you might be having, Jolie -- this is what our team is here for. Thank you for continuing to bring these things to our attention and we hope to improve upon them soon.

name: Jalen Hutchinson
text: Great place to stay! The staff has been the best part because everyone is super engaging and they coordinate great mixers to meet other residents. Would definitely recommend.

resp.text: Thank you for the review!

name: milla lite
text: I've been here for 2 years, would highly recommend it! One of the best apartments in Tuscaloosa. The renewal/signing process is really easy too.

resp.text: This kind of support is so wonderful to read! Thank you for taking time out of your day to leave this.

name: Hyatt Webb
text: Great staff and really nice property. I've lived here for 2 years now and the staff and workers have always been very nice and helpful.

resp.text: We strive for this kind of five star experience for all of our residents here. Make sure you're following all of our social media pages to stay in the know with all of our upcoming resident events. See you at one soon!

name: T Scanlan
text: There is a hidden gem at The Crimson by the name of MacKenzie.  From the time she greeted us when we toured the property and made us feel so welcome, to the big smile and hug at check in, to her immediate response to a few issues, her ability to make each and every tenant and parent feel like they are her priority and her ability to work tirelessly to make sure everyone is happy, are just a few of her great attributes.  Her manners are beyond none.  She is part of the reason our daughter chose the Crimson and she is part of the reason our daughter loves the Crimson, and part of the reason our daughter will stay at the Crimson.

resp.text: It's awesome to see that a member of our team here made all the difference in your experience. We'll pass along the kudos!

name: Robert Berg
text: Love this place. Devin is always helping me out and making my life easy...;)

name: Shibria Aaron
text: The leasing manager, Ms. Danielle was very helpful in answering my questions about the 2BR/2BA B1 & B2 Deluxe apartments. She also explained the pet policy concerning my pet rabbit. I would like to give Ms. Danielle five stars for her services! :)

resp.text: Reading reviews like yours is so encouraging to our team. Thanks for taking the time out of your day to leave this!

name: Kathryn Rogers
text: Management is super friendly and makes you feel at home!! Would highly recommend living here!

name: Carmen Paige
text: I had an issue today regarding my car potentially being towed despite being parked legally with the proper parking pass. However, the leasing professional (Blake) was extremely helpful and really took the time to listen and explain the situation to me and made sure to take care of the issue. By far my best experience here.

resp.text: Thank you for the review Carmen!

name: Greg Liesen
text: Love it here! They accommodate to all my needs. I also enjoy the new management and always helpful maintenance. This place is the best deal for students at Alabama and people living nearby for sure

resp.text: Thank you for the review Greg!

name: Rachel Williams
text: Danielle and other people on staff made move in so easy. They’re very personable people and are always willing to help.

resp.text: It's awesome to see that a member of our team here made all the difference in your experience. We'll pass along the kudos!

name: Gator forever
text: I love living at the crimson! Although there are some problems, the staff is extremely helpful. I recommend it to all the other bama students!

name: devin jacob
text: The Crimson is amazing! They hold tons of events for us! The staff is also extremely helpful. Wouldnt trade it for the world.

name: Stian Leniek
text: I had been looking for a place to stay here in Tuscaloosa for a while now, and I think I found a place here in Crimson, with the helpful of a friendly staff member named Devin, I was able to get all the information I need to settle in smoothly. I can’t wait to get my new life settled at Crimson!

name: King Draco
text: Far as my experience with the crimson it’s cool paired me with the roommate I requested and if the manager couldn’t pair me with my roommate Mr.Franklin has been a previous manager On Helen Keller blvd...after he left I had a bad experience with Parker 301 and chose the crimson after realizing he was the manager, the crimson is a clean upscale friendly living environment. He is always involve with reaching out to residents far as hosting social events.

resp.text: Thank you for the review Dallas!

name: Mason Walker
text: I feel that this is the best place for a student, it’s a very comfy feel. Devin helped me see all of the options available and I was able to get just what I was looking for!!

name: Ashley Kavanagh
text: This coming fall will be my second year here at The Crimson (previously known as Crimson Student Living). I really love living here, I have all the amenities I need, I'm walking distance to campus and a shuttle bus is provided. The rooms here are really spacious and well maintained. Another thing is the security walking around at night and the multiple secure access points that only residents can take advantage of. The staff in the office are helpful and wonderful, and they put on lots of events throughout the year where they provide food, games, and give away some pretty awesome prizes; My roommate won a brand new Beats pill! Overall, I think living here is great!

resp.text: Thank you for your review Ashley! We're happy to hear that you renewed with us for Fall and that you love the community.

name: Mark Jacob
text: My son Devin stayed at the Crimson apartment his final 2 years at Bama. He had a great time there. Enjoyed it so much now he works there!

name: Stephen (Tyler) Compton
text:
I have been a resident here since August 2017, but it is only recently that I have discovered how poorly they treat customer service here. I haven't been able to get a response regarding a billing issue, not even a short email.

Take it from me, if they can't even respond to an email, don't even give them the time of day. The apartment is nice, sure, but if a problem arises, you're on your own. Unless, of course, they forget to charge something you agreed to, you point it out then they immediately resolve that situation. Pitiful. Live elsewhere.

resp.text: We're upset to see this is your impression of our team here. We always do the best we can to respond to and resolve any resident issues in a timely fashion. We hope to improve your time here soon as we're so grateful you've chosen to live with us the past two years.

name: Shannon Diaz
text: Went to look at the apartments for next year because a friend lives here. The staff seemed really nice, especially Jemma who showed me around. Hands down the best value I've seen for anyone going to UA. Roll Tide.

name: Oliver Conti
text: Probably the nicest place to live for it’s price that’s also close to campus. Also, I can’t get away from the staff, it seems like follow me everywhere, which is good considering most places management sucks... Definitely recommend for someone looking for a reliable apartment that is cost effective and overall one of the better complexes in Tuscaloosa, especially for students

resp.text: Thank you for the review Oliver!

name: Kailey Lones
text:
I had really no problems living here. The only two work orders that I filed (which were minuscule) were fixed before I returned back to my apartment for the day after class. The maintenance workers even replaced a light bulb they noticed that was out! Contrary to some reviews, I have never seen a single
bug inside of my apartment and I live on the first floor at that. The managers are also super helpful and very willing to meet with you if you need them. Definitely would recommend.

resp.text: Thank you for the review Kailey!

name: Jack Lombardo
text: Great amenities

name: Robynn Evans
text: Really loving it here so far, the staff really makes it feel like a family away from home especially Mackenzie and Danielle! No regrets moving here whatsoever!

resp.text: Well, we love having you here, Robynn! You're definitely an awesome part of our family!

name: ASHLEY SMITH
text: Gema Bellino is really nice! She was really friendly to me and my family. Her smile is brighter than the sun, and very welcoming.

name: Jayson Cordero
text: Great place to live! And shoutout to Devin for making the move in process super smooth!

name: Tiffany Johnson
text: I haven't been to the property just yet to tour however when I met Danielle and Alissa at the basketball game the other night they were so friendly and personal. I was about to walk by until I saw them waiving me over. Obviously I am going to a basketball game and not thinking I want to listen to a long drawn out spill on housing. They gave me just the amount of information I needed to really spark my interest. I look forward to bringing my friends in for a tour with me. If the property is anything like what I seen that night then I will be signing for sure! Roll Tide!

resp.text: Roll tide indeed, Tiffany! Thanks for stopping by our table -- it was awesome to get the chance to talk to you!

name: LL M
text: The Crimson is a great place to live! It's a short walk from campus, has great amenities and activities for residents and it's clean. Mr Franklin and his staff are also very helpful and nice.

resp.text: Our staff loves to see how much you enjoy living here. Thanks for the compliments to our amenities and how clean our property is -- that means a lot. -The Team at The Crimson

name: Kim Gwynn
text:
I would give this place a big fat ZERO if it was an option. Parents, do not let your student live here. My daughter stayed in these apartments for 10 months...they make you sign a year lease even though the school year is only 9 months with the promise that you will sublet for summer...only that doesn't happen. My daughter went through some medical issues and we had to bring her home before the year was over...they would not sublet or let us pay out of her lease even with documentation...and in our 10 months...these are the issues we experienced.
1) The model apt they show you is very nice. The one you end up in is shabby and barely held together.
2) BUGS!
3)They never take care of any of the issues that you submit.
4) complex is extremely loud. Constant arguing, trains, police sirens, etc
5) They don't help when you have issues with your roommate...and my daughter's issues were pretty severe.
6) Apartment was broken into and my daughter walked in on the person.

It was the worst experience ever but the worst part is the management's utter lack of concern for my child.

resp.text: Kim, we regret to hear that you had a negative experience with us, but would appreciate the chance to turn your experience around. Please reach out to us at your earliest convenience so we may further assist you in working towards a resolution. Crimson (205) 469-9752

name: Jordan Hadley
text: The staff are very helpful in replying to issues and problems in the complex. Work orders are always taken care of quickly. I like that it is generally quiet and the apartments are nice and furnished.

resp.text: This is an awesome review, Jordan -- we hope to earn that last star from you soon!

name: Morgan (Daulton) Newton
text: The Crimson is a wonderful place. It has a great pool, great gym, a computer lab that's open 24/7, and is withing walking distance to the stadium (Free parking for game day too). All in all it's a great place, and any problems are quickly handled by management, 5/5.

resp.text: Thank you for the review Morgan!

name: Andrea Noel
text: Great place to stay! Walking distance from Alabama’s campus and just 4 blocks from the football stadium. The staff, especially the property manager DeJuan, were super friendly and helpful and they take great care of the grounds and overall property. I highly recommend this place.

resp.text: Thank you for the review!

name: sam siettas
text: Great place to live! The amenities are plentiful and the staff is always helpful. One of the biggest advantages of living here is the close proximity to the stadium. I never had a problem with anything in my apartment personally.

resp.text: Thank you for the review Sam!

name: Brandon Dunning
text: This is an awesome place to lease at !!  Initially when I walked in the Danielle who is the leasing manager took initiative to make sure I was greeted personally after her staff had already greeted me . She had such a vibrant personality and was very astute of the market around Tuscaloosa and assisting me with my needs . The models were astoundingly clean as well and her staff was very knowledgeable as well . The prices were not bad as well especially considering the proximity to campus and the amenities .

resp.text: We're so thrilled to see that your experience from start to finish was so awesome! We hope to see you back here soon. -The Team at The Crimson

name: Joey Taylor
text: I lived here for 2 years (junior-graduation) and for the most part I cannot complain. The amenities are great as is the close proximity to campus. The rent includes everything except power which is nice. The place I lived before here constantly charged me with overages that I could never seem to figure out what for.  Overall a great college housing community.

resp.text: Thank you for the great review Joey!

name: Aiden Mould
text: Lived here for my graduate degree. Staff and maintenance were awesome, especially Devin! Top bloke.

name: Catherine Kinslow
text: Devin was wonderful! Great place and service. Thank you!

name: Anthony Michael
text: Loved living here. Devin was always very nice and helpful!

name: Kelsey
text: The customer service here is unmatched!! Devin was absolutely fantastic and knowledgeable about everything I wanted to know!!

name: OLIVIA NELSON
text: Gema is incredible! She had a great attitude. Thanks!

name: JACOB RAMOS
text: Gema was a great help! Love her to bits.

name: JAHDAI DONALD
text: The girl Gema did a amazing. Great work and perfect work ethic.

name: William (Jack) Hockman
text: I have lived at Crimson Student Living now for almost a year. It has been a great experience so far and have completely enjoyed my time there. The staff is wonderful and are extremely excited to help with any task you may ask of them.

resp.text: Thank you for the review Jack!

name: Ally Husband
text: Great location. Devin and jeff in the office are always super helpful!

name: james blakeman
text: The Staff is amazing and it just makes living here so much better!

name: Dakota C.
text: I lived here for a year and know others who have lived here. This apartment complex is livable at best. I had my car broken into, maintenance was slow and sloppy, I know someone who has their car stolen, friend has his car towed for no reason, apartments and amenities are old and have problems (that won’t get fixed efficiently), received move out charges pertaining to problems that were there when I moved in, and all around it was a below average experience, especially since there are much better options for the same price.

resp.text: Thank you for your review Dakota!

name: james gack
text: Love all the events they do here and the rooms are nice and clean!

name: Sepehr Karimiziarani
text: Very good location, pricing, and wonderful maintenance staff. They are always able to lend a hand, and have helped me out of a tough spot numerous times

resp.text: Reading reviews like yours is so encouraging to our team. Thanks for taking the time out of your day to leave this!

name: SABRINA L BEAUCHESNE
text: Gema is a great asset, she was so friendly and made me feel better about my daughter living there.

name: Cynthia Braithwaite
text:
To parents: don't let your children live here.
I don't safe at all living here. When I wake up to go to practice in the mornings and come home when it is dark I feel scared walking to and from my car to my building. A HUGE CONCERN that hasn't been fixed whatsoever, the gate never closes, along with the fact my building's keypad has been broken so anyone who is anyone can just walk into my apartment building.
The other issue there is is management. i have many friends who have had beyond difficulty getting help or there was a mess up in work orders. I understand they have a hard job but it isn't hard to be efficient. It honestly feels like this place just cons college kids and it is quite upsetting. Please don't waste your time with this difficult place...it is not worth the money.

resp.text: Cynthia, this is the last thing we'd want to read. We never want our residents to feel unsafe in any situation -- that is an absolute top priority for us. We can assure you we're working to fix anything that is broken and want to thank you for bringing this to our attention again. Always reach out to our team if we can help with anything else.

name: Shelley King
text: I signed my lease here for 2019-2020 and someone got confused and messed up my lease and I got put on the waitlist but through the whole process Danielle was absolutely amazing and helped me find a spot at the Crimson for the upcoming school year. Couldn’t ask for better customer service.

resp.text: We were more than happy to help out, Shelley! Thanks so much for being patient with our team!

name: Gabriela Lopez
text: Great staff that delivers elevated customer service to their residents!

name: Josie N.
text: Living here is a mediocre experience. The staff is young and the managers struggle to deal with problems in a timely and efficient manner. The halls and outdoor areas are disgusting and never taken care of by the staff. I would also consider this apartment complex UNSAFE. It is near a sketchy part of Tuscaloosa and there have been stabbings, break-ins, etc on the property. Overall, would not recommend!

resp.text: Hi Josie-  We are disappointed that you would not recommend The Crimson to family or friends.  We pride ourselves on resident satisfaction and apologize if you received less than exceptional customer service.  We are always looking for ways to improve our operations and appreciate your feedback.  We are always available to discuss any concerns.  Please do not hesitate to contact us directly at 205-469-9752 or crimson@clsliving.com.   Thank you

name: Nika
text: Although the Crimson has some problems, its still easily the best place to live in Tuscaloosa. I love the staff especially Jeff, Devin and Danielle.

name: Hayden Hamilton
text: I am so excited to move into the two bedroom next fall. The staff sold me on living here. Can’t wait!

resp.text: Reading reviews like yours is so encouraging to our team. Thanks for taking the time out of your day to leave this!

name: Stephanie Stephens
text: The Crimson is a beautiful complex with exquisite detail and design. All of the staff, from their leasing manager Danielle to student workers, treat guests respectfully and help with all needs.

resp.text: This support is more encouraging to our team than you know -- thanks so much! Always reach out if you need anything in the future.

name: Tylerrr 1121
text: Its good

name: Shemaiah Kenon
text: I’ve been staying here for a couple of years & enjoyed my time. There’s been a few issues, but DeJuan worked really quickly & professional to make sure my matter was handled. Whether it’s getting my clicker swapped out to making sure my lease renewal is properly handled, he’s clutch! Tuscaloosa is known for janky student housing, but I’d pick The Crimson over the others any day.

resp.text: You're the absolute best for choosing to leave this review for our team here! This kind of encouragement is much appreciated!

name: Jake Malone
text: If you don’t want to read my long review I will sum it up for you in one sentence. I’d rather burn $700 dollars a month than to live in 1010 the crimson on 17th Avenue in Tuscaloosa Alabama. I will start this rant with when I toured this place months before I actually moved in. They showed me a room that was way bigger, fancier, and overall more appealing than the room I wound up in. I would say the room I’m in now is at least 25 sq feet smaller than the one I was shown. On move in day I was greeted by an elevator that didn’t work (and I live on the 4th floor so carrying all my things up 4 flights of stairs was great!) gates that didn’t work, codes that didn’t work, a crew of movers that didn’t carry a single thing up for me and also a dirty room! As I got in and settled I couldn’t believe the amount of problems I discovered. A bathroom with no towel hanger, a clogged bathtub, a dirty room, a hole in the laundry room door, a non working garbage disposal and a door that wouldn’t close unless you locked the deadbolt. Not to mention that only about 3 wall sockets in the entire place worked. I’ve been living here for over a month and no, the gates have not been fixed, the elevator goes out on a weekly basis, and if you want to figure something out good luck with finding someone who even has a slight clue of what they are talking about. Sure some people may love this place but for a combined $1400 a month to live here, I would say that it is no where near worth it. This place sucks and I do not recommend it for anyone. 2/10 and that’s just because the people in the office are nice.

resp.text: Hi Jake, We're disappointed to hear your time with us so far hasn't been what you expected and want to do anything we can to help change that experience going forward. On move in day, all elevators were up and running and gates were propped open for residents and their family in order to make moving easier, so we are not sure how you encountered such problems on move in day. Also, whenever a problem occurs within your apartment please don’t hesitate to put in a work order. Our maintenance team works diligently on a daily basis to fulfill our residents work order requests yet our system doesn’t show work orders for some of your problems listed. Please reach out to us at (205) 469-9752 at your earliest convenience. Thank you!

name: Adam Eberhart
text: Amazing management especially Devin Jacob, loved staying here!

name: Kersey Hunt
text: Great apartments and very knowledgeable staff. Always willing to help with any issues that I have. Everything is always done in a timely manner.

resp.text: Thank you for the review Kersey!

name: Nikkie Martin
text: If you are looking for a great place to live with an amazing environment go see Danielle! She is absolutely amazing and go above and beyond to help you!

resp.text: Thank you for the review!

name: LIAM DAY
text: Gema is a good asset. Great attitude!

name: Tatum Martin
text: Great staff, so helpful and easy to get in contact with.

name: James habab
text: Came in for a tour the other day and the staff was super nice and helpful! Definitely one of the top choices in Tuscaloosa!

name: Cole
text: Hiatte showed me around and I fell in love with the place. Love how close it is the campus and everyone who worked there seemed really nice! Especially Danele, Deven and Hiatte!

name: Sameed Jawed
text: That boy Devin he a real one! always helpful and available when I need help makes living here a joy.

name: Alix McLaughlin
text: The staff at here is just incredible and super helpful! Emily and her staff make renting an apartment enjoyable and easy! Thanks so much guys! I highly recommend everyone go here if your looking for a place to live!!!

name: Jake South
text: This place used to have a 2 star rating until they offered a chance to win money if you left a review. That’s all that needs to be said. Their WiFi is garbage by the way good luck studying in your apartment

resp.text: We wish you enjoyed living with us more here at The Crimson, Jake. We do the best we can to offer both fast and affordable WiFi options for our residents -- please let us know in person if you're continuing to have issues with it.

name: Kiersten U
text: Thanks Devin for showing me around, great place to be!

name: Josh Hylton
text: Don’t live here. The constant issues with air conditioning, water heaters, and the impossibility of getting maintenance to fix these issues are out of hand. Like, for instance, having a pipe burst and allowing the water to set in the walls for 3 months, getting numerous people, other than my unit, sick for weeks.  They’re incompetent and are only there to steal your money and fine you every chance they can get, regardless if they are able to give you a decent place to live with the amenities they claim to give you. I would rather live in a box under an underpass than in this place. I’m not sure how people could rate this place anymore than 1 star.

resp.text: Hello Mr. Hylton,   We appreciate your feedback and would love the opportunity to discuss these issues with you. I apologize that you feel this negative about The Crimson. My personal email address is dfranklin@clsliving.com.    Best Regards

name: EVANGELINE KYTE
text: Gema is such a nice lady! Great service!

name: Mustafa Aslan
text: One of the perfect places in Tuscaloosa with their good location, especially maintenance guys very good and fast, no matter what kind of problems do you have, they solve in a day and rooms quite comfortable and functional.

resp.text: It looks like you really enjoy living here which is awesome to see. We hope to one day earn that last star from you. Let us know what we can do to improve!

name: JOSHUA NASH
text: the girl gema bellino is amazing great work she should get a raise

name: Robert Scott
text:
UPDATE: Owner provided a fake email to resolve issues.  Once again displaying what a crooked establishment this place is.

DO NOT LIVE HERE. I lived all over Tuscaloosa during my time at Alabama (4 years of school + 3 years of working) and this was the worst experience of my 7 years.

Not worth the amount that they charge for rent include overcharge for their "power surcharge" that they add to your bill. Management would not return phone calls or see us when we tried to speak with them about a discrepancy and maintence will lie about completely an issue.

Do not give these people any of your money. There are plenty of better places to live than this scam. There are not enough bad things I can say about Crimson Student Living. Feel free to reach out to me for additional information about this establishment. More than happy to share this unpleasant experience.

resp.text: Robert, it is disappointing for us to hear that your experience was anything less than great. If you are willing please contact our General Manager at Crimson-crimson@clsliving.com to discuss what we can do to help.

name: Justin Glover
text: The staff at crimson are the best ever!! The process wasn't long at all and it was easy and Aaron was the best he answered all my questions and more!! Great customer service!!!

resp.text: Thank you for the great review Justin!

name: J Walker
text: I was looking for a place to stay and Jefferey was extremely helpful, He told me everything I needed to to know! Definitely would recommend this property  !

resp.text: Thanks for coming by to take a look at our property, J! Continue to reach out to any member of our team if you ever need anything. -The Team at The Crimson

name: Rachael Gibbs
text: Do not rent your kid an apartment here. My daughter’s car was just towed on game day and she has a parking pass displayed! I don’t pay rent every month to have my daughter without a car! Very disappointing! Parents, save yourself from frustration and rent elsewhere.

resp.text: Rachael, thank you for taking the time to express your concerns to us. We are sorry to hear that your daughter’s car got towed. However, we send out emails and reminders to our residents that all vehicles without a visible valid Crimson parking decal or game-day parking pass displayed on the front windshield will be towed. We stress the importance of residents being in compliance by making sure that their parking decal is visible and/or their guest have a temporary parking decal for home games. If you would like to discuss this matter further, please reach out to us at the front office at 205-469-9752.

name: Emily Hartley
text: Great place to live and it’s very close to Bryant Denny.  Also the staff is very helpful

resp.text: We appreciate your positive review about your recent experience with us!

name: Madison Bedder
text: Staff is extremely helpful & very kind! I love the community vibe The Crimson gives off!

resp.text: We appreciate your positive review about your recent experience with us!

name: Melissa Allen
text: Stay away from this place. My children moved in two years ago to an apartment that had not been cleaned at all. Old toothbrushes, dirty Q-tips, mold in the bathrooms, carpet stains. They filled out the walk through and turned it in. The place changed management and now they claim they have no record of those things. They left the place cleaner than when they moved in but are the ones getting tons of charges for stuff they didn't do.

resp.text: Hi Melissa. We would like the opportunity to address your concerns. Please reach out to us directly at (205) 469-9752 when you have a chance. Thank you, and we look forward to hearing from you.

name: Elayna (Lanie) Viox
text: I’ve genuinly loved living here, I feel like the price isn’t bad for being so close to school. I didn’t buy a parking pass so sometimes I take the bus or I walk a lot and it’s only life a twenty minute walk. Maintenance responds pretty quickly, my only complaint is that when we moved in the countertop was burnt very badly in several spots and it has never been fixed even after asking twice. The gates and your gate keys do seem to break very often but at least it’s safe I guess. I’ve never had any issues with parking either, I always park directly in front of my apartment! I live on the first floor so I’ve heard it’s a little different in terms of flooring or ceilings but we have really high ceilings and it’s great. I would definitely recommend it!

resp.text: Thanks for this thorough review, Elayna! We loved having you here! We hope to one day earn that last star from you though.

name: Kase Adams
text: Gates never work really fun standing in the rain with a broken gate. WiFi is terrible. Only about 3 sockets in the whole apartment work. Maintenance comes quickly but the dishwasher was broken and supposedly fixed but barely cleans dishes. Water doesn’t drain in the bath tubs unless you get maintenance to come fix it occasionally. Tv in living room with work every now and the. But not enough to brag about. Wasn’t clean on move in day. Elevators smell awful, throw up in the bottom of it on many occasions. The room they show you is not as big as the one you will get so don’t buy too many groceries for lack of places to put them. Closet door in my room doesn’t shut along with bed room door. If you want the balcony door or the entrance to stay shut you have to dead bolt it. If you have a question and call the manager or front desk they will probably not answer or simply tell you they can’t help. Would not recommend or live here again especially not for the price. Paying a full months rent for the 12 days you live here in August all around bad experience and I have been here less than a month

resp.text: Dear Kase,  We are genuinely disheartened to hear that you have had an unpleasant experience thus far at The Crimson. We pride ourselves in providing exceptional service to all of our residents and we are concerned to hear that we fell short in your eyes. We would love the opportunity to converse with you personally to discuss your concerns. We want you to love living here so let’s work together to make it better! Please reach out to us at (205) 469-9752 to discuss this further.

name: Thomas Rhomberg
text: It's a great place to live and it has great amenities! The staff is very helpful and nice.

resp.text: All of these compliments are so sweet of you to leave, Thomas. See you around the property! -The Team at The Crimson

name: Kendall Jordan
text: The pros of The Crimson far outweigh the cons. As a resident for almost two years, I can truthfully say I've loved my experience here. The maintenance staff responds quickly, there are always activities and giveaways going on at the clubhouse, and being able to walk to the stadium on gamedays (and offer a parking pass to a friend!) are perks you won't find just anywhere. The only downsides I've encountered so far, just this semester, were an accumulation of trash/trash bags around the building I live at and many stray cats roaming the parking lot. Maintenance cleans up the trash quickly, but it gets left around frequently on the weekends. This could be a simple fix if residents would just take their trash to the dumpster, though! Nonetheless, I recommend this complex to everyone, for the location, amenities, and price are hard to beat in T-Town!

resp.text: Thank you for bringing this to our attention, Kendall. We want you to have a five star experience while living here. We'll work to improve upon the trash and gates ASAP. Hope to earn that last star from you soon!

name: Jason McClain
text: Best customer service in town!

name: Michelle Cain
text: The property at The Crimson is very beautiful. Thank you Danielle for the very informative tour.

resp.text: Thank you for the review!

name: Jeffrey Gregg
text: When I moved into The Crimson in fall of 2017, I had my doubts and concerns about the complex based on some reviews that I saw. But I fell in love with the properties proximity to UA's campus and the security that it offers. The units themselves are great and I have had very little problems. The few problems that my roommate and I have had have been taken care of in a short period of time. I have resigned and looking forward to living here again next year!

resp.text: Thank you for the review Jeffrey!

name: Garrett J
text:
2 stars because it’s cheaper than most places around campus and has a bus to campus. Other than that pretty awful place.

- terrible internet and if you ask them to do something about it they give you the internet providers numbers and tell you to call them yourself

- elevator has a 50% chance of working

- clicker to gate you drive through breaks every 3-4 weeks

- gate you walk through has been broken since I moved in over a year ago

- random charges for random things like a $100 fee before I even moved in for utilities I hadn’t used yet

- and to top it all off last Christmas our apartment got flooded because one of the apartments water pipes busted and they compensated us with a Papa Johns pizza. That’s it.

My roommates and I only resigned because it’s cheaper than most places and it has a shuttle to campus.

resp.text: Hi Garrett. It is discouraging to learn of your experience with us. Your feedback helps us improve and we would love to speak with you to address any outstanding concerns you may have. Please feel free to contact us directly or stop by the office. Thank you.

name: Barklie Chancellor
text: Super nice staff who will go above and beyond to help you!

resp.text: Barklie, this is so awesome to see! It's great that your experience here has been above average. -The Team at The Crimson

name: Ashlynn Pate
text: The Crimson is so lucky to have Danielle! She’s more than amazing!!

resp.text: Thank you for the review!

name: Elizabeth (Liz) Palasek
text:
This place is disgusting, have seen multiple cockroaches in our kitchen.
Dresser drawers are broken
No security, gates barley work.
Place is gross wouldn’t recommend to anyone

resp.text: Clean grounds and units are a top priority for our team here. If you're having any issues with bugs, please contact our office so we can help immediately.

name: Carl Leigh
text: havent had working wifi in months. it might work for a couple hours but I would say 75% of my day is spent on LTE. cant connect on phone or laptop to wifi. only thing that works is plugging in ethernet cord and only the living room ethernet cord works. the one's in the rooms dont fit it.

resp.text: We're sorry to see that this has affected your living experience here so much, Carl. We do the best we can to offer great WiFi at a reasonable price for all of our residents. Hope to earn those last stars from you soon.

name: Tao Liu

I will give a 0 if I can. The  new company here is the worst! The elevator is always broken and anyone can get into the building because of the broken front door. Internet is tooooooo slow here!!! They just keep asking for extra charge but not fixing problems.

Highly recommend you don't chose this place!

resp.text: Hi Tao. We would like the opportunity to address your concerns. Please reach out to us directly at (205) 469-9752 when you have a chance. Thank you, and we look forward to hearing from you.

name: Cassie Henry
text: This is an awful place to live. It's extremely dirty. On top of that, these people try to take your money by charging you for anything they possibly can. Do not rent from this place. The manager, Kim is extremely rude and very inconsiderate when it comes to negotiating. If I could give this place a lower rating I would. DO NOT GIVE THESE PEOPLE YOUR MONEY THEY WILL SUCK YOU DRY!!

resp.text: Hi Cassie. We would like the opportunity to address your concerns. Please reach out to us directly at (205) 469-9752 when you have a chance. Thank you, and we look forward to hearing from you.

name: Katrina Harden
text: Disregard any positive review about this apartment complex... They offer a prize amount of money to students who give good reviews about the apartment and then never follow through with paying. The apartment did no sort of cleaning before my move in. There are numerous alive as well as dead roaches swarming the hallways. There are bugs coming up through my sink. The elevator works 2 weeks out of the year. The entrance and exit gates have closed on several cars as well as my own, and granted I pay for my own bills working part time and being a full time student... THEY WILL NOT PAY for the damages that their negligence has caused. My roommate was allowing an abusive and dangerous figure in  our apartment.  the complex and "on site police officer" did nothing to move me to a different unit or ban the abusive person off the complex for me and my 2 other roommates' security. I SHOULD NOT HAVE TO FEAR MY SAFETY. On top of that, this apartment is "gated" but allows anyone through the gates... with that being said we are within feet of a very bad area. So do not be surprised if your car gets broken into, apartment, or you hear gunshots. And if you plan on graduating, they will still make you move out before your graduation date instead of staying 2 extra days to walk the stage. I live out of state and as you can see, i pay my own bills and as a full time student I struggle to pay rent on top of school so for the manager, Dejuan, to say "get an airbnb, hotel, or make some friends to stay at there house" shows how inconsiderate and personal this apartment complex is with there residents and the people that pay him to live there. Dejuan's excuse was that 4 girls are moving in august 1st for sorority recruitment when the recruitment does not even start until the 10th of august. Also the earliest this apartment allows move in's is august 6th, so Dejuan has contradicted his own words. Don't even take the time to seek help from the people higher than the manager because they will cease to return emails and help anyone out. This is the WORST experience i have ever had. DO NOT MOVE HERE. Waste of money. Seek The Lofts for residing!!!

resp.text: Thank you for your review Katrina!

name: Jaclyn Bunker
text: I've lived at CSL for a total of 2 and a half months and I could not be happier that I am MOVING somewhere else next year. My apartment was in poor condition when I moved in, the units are very cheaply made and so many of the appliances are faulty/need to be replaced. Even though there's a gate it does not feel safe at all because the gate is often broken and stays open and the complex is not secure whatsoever. To top it off the toilet in our bathroom started flooding so we called maintenance and waited for them for 3 and a half hours and called multiple times before telling them to just forget it because by that time it was 2 am. Luckily we turned the water off after a short time but they were not helpful at all. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND  living here to anyone.

name: Ozgur Satici
text: Good price vs quality

name: sgmarz
text: I've loved living at CSL. I wish that I could stay next year because it is an extremely nice apartment and it's very convenient to campus. It's too expensive to stay and live alone for me though. Maintenance is always quick if I have a problem, and everyone who works for CSL is kind and helpful.

name: Tyler Smith
text: Great place to live super close to campus!

resp.text: We love being so close to campus and the stadium too, Tyler -- it's cool to hear the games on Saturdays! We appreciate you taking the time to leave this wonderful review. -The Team at The Crimson
