name: LEAH WISE
text: the girl gema is amazing

name: Dallas Payton
text: Love the crimson!! Very nice place and the staff is great!!!

resp.text: Thank you for the review!

name: Brittany Jack
text: Crimson student living is the most terrible place I have ever lived in. The customer service and management staff is terrible and unorganized. The units are cheaply thrown together and OVERPRICED. DO NOT LIVE HERE.

name: Jessica Huff
text:
March 2016 Comcast came in and took the box.  Called the office they contacted Comcast and said a new box was coming.  Comcast then billed my daughter.  Took the bill in to the office 5 times between then and move out and it was to be paid.  On move out, after a nightmare of a year,  I gave the manager the bill again and it was to be take care of.  Now it shows up on my daughters credit report along with the person who guaranteed for her.  Cannot get anyone to take care of the bill.
Construction was a nightmare.  Men outside my daughters' windows at 6am.  By noon several were drinking. These men lived for free in building 5.  The gates were never locked.  Bikes took up Handicap spots.  There was dog pee in the elevator by a large male dog each time I visiting.  I called twice about seeing the dog do that and nothing was done.  Nothing was cleaned.  One day there was vomit in the elevator. My daughters were on the 3rd floor. There was no one to clean it.  By Sunday, it was so bad the halls were smelling.  Maintenance and comcast came in without prior knowledge.

resp.text: Dear Jessica,  While Campus Life and Style was not managing Crimson Strident Living during your stay, I apologize for this terrible inconvenience and poor communication that you have experienced. I understand that you are no longer living at Crimson Student Living, however I would like to take time to address your other concerns. I would like to inform you that all gates are properly working. At this moment, there are no bikes that are taking up handicap spaces, as those bike racks have been relocated. Our maintenance team takes great pride in our facilities cleanliness at all times. Because Crimson Student Living does allow pets, we do experience some pet waste on the elevators; however, when it’s brought to our attention, we address it immediately. I hope this information helps you have a peace of mind for current and future residents that live at Crimson Student Living. If you would like to express any other concerns or share more details on your living experience at Crimson Student Living, I will be more than happy to discuss this with you via email or be telephone. My email address is Dfranklin@clsliving.com and I can be reached at 205-469-9752.

name: Saids12
text:
***If you are considering living here or if you are a parent of a student considering this apartment, PLEASE read this!***

I signed a lease with them in December of 2015, and because of rooming situations, decided to look elsewhere for a place to live. As soon as the situation arose (first week of May 2016), I attempted contacting them via their "contact us" portal and by phone to see what options I had in regards to breaking the lease. I was never given any response and my phone calls were never answered.

If there is one thing you need to know about this place, know this: MANAGEMENT/FRONT OFFICE NEVER PICKS UP THEIR PHONES (unless they want money from you, of course).

I continued to attempt to communicate with them throughout the summer (I could not visit them in person because I am an out-of-state student at UA) and still never received any response. On August 9th, 2016 (6 days before move-in, I believe) I received a phone call from a young lady at their office saying I owed them rent. I explained I had tried to contact them for months to no avail, but that was no concern of hers. As soon as I moved back to Tuscaloosa (to my different apartment), I went to Crimson Student Living to talk to the manager in person and ask why I was never given any response to my inquiries. We were informed that one of the managers had quit and the others were too busy to return their calls. After a long talk with one "manager" (she was actually a student at UA, I'm not too sure she was the actual property manager), I agreed to pay the first month's rent and they assured me that they had people on a wait list that they could put in my room so I could sublease. Well, here I am, it's currently October 3rd, and no one was ever put in my room. I am still paying $640 per month to not live there, and yes, I still call them every few weeks to get an update and no, they never answer.

This apartment has the worst management I have ever seen. They are misleading and have no concern for their clients; it's all about the money to them. If you are looking for a place with good communication to residents, please look elsewhere. Their rude workers and nonexistent management are not worth the large sum of money you will pay to live there.

name: Desmond Poole
text: Aweful, first year I asked for roomates with no animals. I ended up with 3 dogs and a cat but no biggie and bugs don't let them lie always bugs in the place. Second year I figured would be better boy was I wrong. My apartment was extremely humid and mold began to grow. I had bad allergies and suffered that next year they cut the mold out from my walls but that didn't stop the mold spores that were already present. I put in a work order for my shower rod they never fixed. I bought my own and they charged me for leaving mine up and leaving there's in the corner. I put in a work order for my chair before I moved out it was never put into action and I was charged for the chair when I moved out as well. I still have pictures of all the mold and it even caused damage to my property they gave me a 300 dollar credit towards rent for my clothing damage though. I also still had roomates with pets that next year even though I pleaded no animals. They said there was nothing they could do.

name: jordan fix
text: Great staff, amenities, maintenance, and gym/pool!

resp.text: So many awesome things, Jordan! Let us know how we can earn that last star from you soon. -The Team at The Crimson

name: Susan Cooke
text: Never received our security deposit back, was charged for a damaged couch that was never damaged, and have been getting the run around since September.

name: Robert D'Andrea
text: This place is the worst. They just got bought by a company named Vesper Tuscaloosa LLC. It was bad enough to begin with but they raised late fees from around $9 up to somewhere near $50 or $60. They also raised rent for fall of 2017 for all units. If you want to pay rent online with a credit card they charge you $25. My room had a cockroach infestation that they "exterminated" but continued to appear for long after they came through my room. We are backed up to an animal hospital so the dogs bark outside starting around 5 AM when they open. The train comes by at least twice an hour and blares its horn across every intersection it passes which is right in your backyard. The only good thing about it is that it has a roof and electricity. I'm not usually one to write reviews but this place is definitely not where you want to live; there are plenty of other cheaper and nicer apartments in Tuscaloosa.

name: Ronald Causey
text: Wouldnt recomend working there or living there. Manager will still your money and cheat you out of your hours guess thats why the computers are always down. Yea I worked there a few months and if u are thinking about renting bad idea. Mold everywhere.

resp.text: Hi Ronald. Please reach out to us at (205) 469-9752 so we may address your concerns. Thank you.

name: Kristen Bobo
text: I would not recommend living here. I've had multiple issues. We didn't have cable for the first two months o living here, despite going to the office at least three times a week asking to get it fixed. They raised the fee for paying with a card 3 times just in the one year I've been living here. We've had a consistent bug problem, and have had pest control come out on 5 occasions. After the balcony incident, they changed the locks on our balconies (with hardly any notice) and we didn't have access to them for weeks. The reason I rate it 2 stars instead of 1, is because of the closeness to the stadium, and the lady who used to drive the bus was fantastic. She's since moved on, so all this place really has going for it is the stadium. My advice is to find somewhere else if you can.

name: Makayla Philip
text: Great place to live

name: Andrew Parker
text: Amber

name: Morgan Overstreet
text: everyone is so nice and helpful! the apartments are so nice!

name: Katey Redman
text: GREAT place to live 😍

resp.text: Thank you for the review!

name: James Ha
text:
Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else. There are plenty of apartments to rent in Tuscaloosa. they will overcharge you for electricity, not honor any deals you made, and decide you are to blame for the poor structural damages in your rooms once you move out.

Worst mistake of college was living here. Not too mention it is on the edge of pretty sketchy territory. You will hear a gun shot every other week. Or see someone being chased down by the cops outside your window.

name: Stux Aria
text: They trash out my stuffs for no reason, and refuse to pay me back!

name: Shelby Sanders
text: If someone asked me about Crimson Student Living I would say they are overpriced, charge you for every little thing, unresponsive staff, not worth the money, and the location made me feel unsafe at times.

resp.text: Hi Shelby. Our manager would really like to speak with you more regarding this matter. Please reach out to us at (205) 469-9752. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Anjushree Prasad
text:
This is absolutely the worst place I’ve ever lived in. The management is pathetic. The property manager has such blatant disregard for all my phone calls and emails and has willfully chosen to ignore my multiple attempts to get in touch with him in person, via phone or through email.

I’ve had issues with them right from the very beginning. The day I was supposed to move in, they gave me keys to an extremely dirty apartment unit. The bathtub and the toilet was in a disgusting state. I had to hire professional cleaners to bring the apartment back to a livable condition.
The rest of the building isn’t in a much better shape either. The elevator STINKS. I’d have to hold my breath every time I use it.
Moreover, every time it rains, the first floor corridor floods and people have to wade through water to get to their units.

On the day of my move in, they charged an amount of $103.01 to my account claiming it was “utilities”. Why on earth would I have to pay such a huge utility fee before I even start living there? I brought this up with then property manager. I demanded a utility bill with my actual usage before I make any payments. She agreed but the bill never came. After a few days, they started accruing late fee of $10 per day on my account. I reached out to the management again and asked them for a bill a second time and demanded that the late fees be removed since the delay was on their part in not providing me with a bill. They agreed but once again, the previous property manager did not honor her word. After a couple of weeks, she quit and was replaced by the current manager who just doesn’t seem to have the time to return phone calls or emails. The late fees kept accumulating and by the end of my stay, they gave me a move out statement with all the mystery “utility” charges and the accumulated late fee which amounted to a huge balance.
And yet - no bill.
I have tried to contact the management multiple times over phone. They refuse to connect me to the current manager claiming he’s unavailable. I had even personally gone back to try and talk to someone from the management but no one is ever available. Nobody bothers to return my emails or phone calls. They just couldn’t care less.

On top of all this, they charged me $25 for a “missing” parking decal which was never given to me in the first place.

They also stooped so low as to charge me another $25 because of a single bottle of bleach left under the sink that I’d forgotten to throw away. But then again, what else can you expect from a management who tries to swindle tenants of their money in any possible way? They’re corrupt beyond repair.

By all means, stay away! Take you money elsewhere.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to provide us with a review. We sincerely value your feedback. We want to extend our sincerest apologies concerning all the issues that you faced during your residency at The Crimson. We pride ourselves in maintaining the highest quality standards and customer service for our residents. Therefore, we hope you will give us an opportunity to discuss this further with you. Our GM, DeJuan Franklin will be reaching out to you personally, and we hope to resolve this to your benefit. We hope all has been going well!

name: Chris Johnson
text: In case you haven’t seen this enough already the WiFi is trash and you won’t be able to do homework from your apartment

resp.text: We can assure you we're always working on improving our WiFi and do the best we can to provide fast and affordable options for our residents. Please come by our office if you're continuing to have issues with it.

text: Love this place!

name: Jack S
text:
By far the best student living complex in Tuscaloosa. I usually move every year but I stayed here for 2 years. My two story townhouse was one of the best ones, with a beautiful view of the pools, clubhouse, and park (most people aren’t so lucky, but there was still a lot to like).

They continuously made improvements to the complex, with it recently being gated. The amenities are nice, maintenance was quick always, and location in Tuscaloosa is great. The “green space” in the middle of the complex is a huge area with a creek running through it, a soccer field, and a dog park. This was my favorite part of living here, in addition to the two awesome pools with a pool volleyball area. They always have community events and the clubhouse provided way more than you would expect.

The staff was also always great, especially Samson, who never failed to help me when I needed it.

name: shannon herbert
text: Moved my daughter there over the weekend and I was disgusted by the condition of the room she was given. I forgot to take pictures before we started to clean but I did remember to snap a few during the cleaning process. There were underwear in the corner, the layer of dust, grime and old food stuck to and in the furniture was appalling.  Stains  in the carpet  along with either dog or cat food left over bits in the closet. The bathroom was so gross. Still had urine left on the toilet from previous tenant, the grout was falling out of the tub. With the current virus situation I was hoping to open the door to the feeling of her being somewhere that cared for the safety of it's tenants, this was definitely not the case. After hours of cleaning and a full vacuum canister later (from one room!) It's now a decent place for her to lay her head but next year she definitely won't be signing a lease there. I give it a one star for the condition of the room and thanks to our cleaning I upped it to a 2 star.

resp.text: Hi Shannon, we are so disappointed that your daughter did not have the best move in experience. We never want that to be the case. I looked through the move-in Inspection that was completed by the primary resident and was unable to find some of the issues that are listed in the review. We also reached out via phone to chat with you about your concerns, but were unsuccessful with getting in contact with you. Please give us a call back at your earliest convenience and we will be happy to help sort out any issues that remain.

name: River Allbritton
text: Toured a couple weeks ago and immediately went back to sign the same day! Staff is HONEST and super sweet and understanding. They had the best rates ever too! Can't wait to live here starting Fall 2021!!

resp.text: Hi River, thank you so much for sharing your experience. We are happy to have you join us in August. Our staff strives to make sure that everyone feels this way. Please let us know if you need anything before move in!

name: Aidan Kushel
text: For the price you pay the amenities and quality of housing are above average, and management will often try their best to help you resolve issues. My main issue with this place is that all the residents for some reason have decided to delete their car mufflers and floor the gas pedal anytime the decide to go for a drive, incredibly annoying.

resp.text: Aidan, thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We value you as a resident and understand how frustrating loud cars can be. Though we can't quite people's mufflers we do ask that if you see anyone driving recklessly to please let us or security know immediately. Please let us know if there is anything you need in the meantime.

name: Re'Nigia Harkins
text: Very Good Maintenance and Management. They are very quick in getting anything you need done and fixed. I have enjoyed my time here. 10/10 Recommend

resp.text: Hey there, thank you so much for sharing your experience with us. We are glad our maintenance team has been able to provide you with an enjoyable experience and resolve any issues in a timely manner! We've certainly loved having you as a member of our community.  Please don't hesitate to reach out should you ever need anything.

name: KESHIA WILLIAMS
text: The is the worst apartment complex in Tuscaloosa. The apartment is just looks, poor foundation, mold not to mention water damage. Over charging and needs better management.

resp.text: Hey Keshia- We are so sorry to hear that you did not have a 5 star experience with our team. We would love to discuss these issues with you, as we do take pride in trying to resolve any issues with urgency. We do not have you listed as a resident or guarantor in our system, so please reach out to our office immediately so we can try to rectify any issues. Thank you!

name: Avery Lewis
text: My experience here has been nothing less than impeccable. The apartment was perfect and exceeded expectations along with the pricing. The staff is so friendly and helpful, I can’t find one thing that was negative with my experience. I would 100% recommend The Redpoint to anyone in the area.

resp.text: Hi Avery, We are so happy to see that you have had a 5-star experience at Redpoint. We really appreciate you sharing this feedback with us. If there is anything we can ever do for you, please let us know!

name: Lauren Peabody
text:
Unfortunately, what should have been a quality experience was quickly dashed due to a host of lies and changes in terms and conditions. Apparently the “Team” isn’t on the same page when having future tenants sign leases that later could not be honored. Employees went on record numerous times saying mistakes were “miscommunication” versus just being honest about their mistakes. Four different employees passed blame on other employees on why each day the terms were different.

It took calling the parent company to even get a call back from the “GM” Jen Banks who is listed as a marketing manager according to the parent company records. Jenn has been with the company for over ten years and was more than happy to claim she was the reason there was a problem but not willing to provide documentation on when she changed policies that had previously been honored. Jenn and her team need extensive training on setting unrealistic expectations and on fair housing practices. We were sent an approval letter but once corporate was contacted a decline letter magically appeared. How ironic for a complaint to be met with such leadership behavior.

Upon further investigation reviews show that Jenn failed to provide background and credit checks before approving people which is more than likely how crime was a problem here before it was rebranded and more recently before gates were installed. Also how it makes perfect sense approval letters are sent and then decline letters when someone asks too many questions when shady practices are transpiring. Hopefully since the Scion group has a Marketing manager in control spinning each and every mistake or problem, this review will be buried along with the others who were done by actual non-employees who see though the “miscommunication”.

resp.text: Mrs. Peabody - We are so sorry to hear of your less than 5 star experience. We take pride in educating our team members and can assure you that any mistakes that were made are being discussed to avoid them in the future. While we understand that you are going off of what you have read on the internet, please note that our company has screened residents backgrounds since 2017 and can assure that, although there have been issues previously, the safety of our residents is a priority.  Also, Jennifer Bridges has held a few positions within our company and her current title is General Manager of Redpoint Tuscaloosa. Again, we apologize that our team made mistakes and are working on a program to better help them understand our student versus non-student policies. We appreciate your candor!

name: Ladarius Foreman
text: Redpoint is a great place to live at here in Tuscaloosa. The staff members are friendly and nice. They try to fix every situation quick and they keep us safe .They treat you like you belong and respectful. They try to get all of their residents involved in activities throughout the year. They really love their residents, they even come by and check up on them as well especially during exam weeks so big shout out to them for that . Not to mention the excellent maintenance crew they’re on every maintenance request ASAP and you don’t have to wait long for them to come out and fix the problem. Redpoint invest in a basketball court though.

resp.text: Hey Ladarius, We are so glad you have been with us over the years. We are happy to see that you feel this way about our team, as it is our ultimate goal for all residents to feel that they belong at Redpoint. We will pass along the kudos to our maintenance team as well! Please don't hesitate to reach out should you ever need anything.

name: Kayla Simpkins
text: Such a friendly and helpful staff! Definitely one of the better apartment complexes in the area, and the prices are great as well. I’d definitely recommend Redpoint to anyone looking for an apartment in Tuscaloosa who doesn’t want to pay an outrageous amount of money on rent.

resp.text: Hi Kayla, Thank you for sharing this feedback with us, we really appreciate it. We are glad you have enjoyed your time with our team. Please let us know if there is ever anything you need!

name: Molly Giles
text: I love it here!!! They are always coming up with different events for the residents, great security and open spaces. The clubhouse is always clean and the management team and those who work in the office are AWESOME! Great place to meet and make new friends. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!

resp.text: Hi Molly, we are so happy to see that you are having a positive experience at Redpoint. We appreciate the kind words about our team. We want all residents to feel they are at home. We are excited to have you with us for another year! Please don't hesitate to reach out if you ever need anything.

name: Jeremiah Scott
text: Been living here for over a year now , and I very much wouldnt rather live anywhere else . Michael does a great job of taking care of his residents and he has an amazing team around him . Beautiful property and units !

resp.text: Hello Jeremiah, We are so glad to hear that you are having a 5-star experience at Redpoint. Thank you for sharing and as always, please let us know if you ever need anything. We're always here to help!

name: Marja Graham
text: I have had a great experience with the 2 bedroom townhouse at Redpoint. The space is an awesome set up that has a home-like feel and really pet friendly. The staff is super friendly and quick to help if any problems arise. I love that Redpoint staff is able to keep a safe community element during Covid -19.

resp.text: Hi Marja, We are so glad to see that you are enjoying your home at Redpoint. The 2 bedroom townhome is one of our favorite floorplans as well, and we are so happy to have you with us for another year. Please don't hesitate to swing by our office or send us an email if there is ever anything you'd like to discuss.

name: Maggie McMillen
text: This is my second year living at Redpoint and I absolutely love it! The staff is so caring! The complex is so much more relaxed than other apartment complexes. I feel so safe living here and I would not have chosen anywhere else to live!

resp.text: Hi Maggie, We are so glad you have made Redpoint your home for another year. We try to make things easy for our residents. We are thrilled to see that you enjoy it here so much. Please let us know if you ever need anything -- we are always happy to discuss any questions or concerns.

name: Aundria Sewell
text: I really like the set up of the apartments.  You would think for something on the cheaper side it wouldn't be as nice  but they're very nice!  The staff was friendly and helpful.

resp.text: Hi Aundria, Thank you for leaving us a 5-star review. We are glad to see you enjoying our open floorplans. We do our best to provide affordable living along with a great resident experience. Let us know if there is ever anything you need from us!

name: Sydney Kilpatrick
text: I have loved living at Redpoint ever since I have moved in last August, this is my second year living here and just renewed for next year! the staff and maintenance team truly go out of their way to help as much as possible! the time I have been they have always been making improvements! I have been pleased with my experience and highly recommend!

resp.text: Hi Sydney, we are so happy to see that you are having a great experience at Redpoint. We appreciate your kind words about our office and maintenance teams. We are so glad to have you in the Redpoint family for another year! Please reach out if you ever need anything.

name: Hannah Crutchfield
text: I was a little nervous moving in, but after a couple small issues, which were resolved very quickly, it has been a great experience. All my neighbors are respectful and the staff has been very attentive to all our needs, even when they are closed. Also, the free give aways are awesome.

resp.text: Hi Hannah, we are so glad to see that your issues were resolved quickly. We are excited to see you making the best of the Redpoint community. We are always here if you need anything.

name: Carlos B
text: Redpoint is a great place to live! Despite small issues that were quickly resolved, I have had zero complaints  during my 2+ years as a resident. The staff is cool, neighborhood is peaceful and being a resident here has its perks 😉

resp.text: Hi Carlos, we are so glad that you enjoy our team as well as your home at Redpoint. We do our best to make sure that any issues are resolved quickly. We are happy to have you in the Redpoint family for another year! Please shoot us an email, phone call, or stop by our office if you ever need anything.

name: Michael Calloway Sr.
text: My son currently lives at redpoint and we've never had any issues at all with them! The prices are great and we've already decided he's going to stay for another year. Definitely one of the best apartments in Tuscaloosa.

resp.text: Hello Michael, Thank you so much for sharing your experience with us. We are happy to hear that your son is enjoying his time at Redpoint. We are so glad to have him with us for another year! Please don't hesitate to reach out if we can ever help with anything, we're always here to assist with any questions or concerns.

name: Shelby Collins
text: The folks at Redpoint are amazing, they answered all my questions and made everything clear to me! The front office worker Mike explained everything to us in a way we could understand and was so helpful! Keep redpoint on your radar when looking for an apartment in Tuscaloosa!

resp.text: Hi Shelby, Thank you for sharing your experience with us. We are glad to see that our staff was so helpful for you. We will pass along the kudos to Mike! Please don't hesitate to reach out should you ever need anything in the future.

name: Kaleb Ambrose
text: We came on a tour here and the staff was amazing. I spoke with an employee named Daine and he was especially nice and helpful. I’d recommend to others just off the hospitality.

resp.text: Hi Kaleb, Thank you so much for sharing your experience with us. We are glad you enjoyed your visit with us and your time with Daine. We look forward to speaking with you more in the near future! Please don't hesitate to reach out should you ever need anything.

name: Dayton Frierson
text: I love Redpoint with all my heart. The maintenance crew is very great here and on time with everything. Apartment was very perfect when we got in. Also thank you guys for the new MacBook!

resp.text: Hi Dayton, Thank you so much for your kind words. We are so glad that you and your roommates joined the Redpoint family this year and are happy to see that you had a 5-star move in. We are excited to have you with us another year! Should you ever need anything, please don't hesitate to reach out -- we are always here to help.

name: Maurcia Smith
text: I have a daughter who has been here about 3 years now and everything has faired well. I love the staff and their engagement as well as professionalism. We both love it!

resp.text: Hi Maurcia, Thank you for sharing about you and your daughter's experience at Redpoint. We are so glad you both have been with us for so long. We do our best to provide excellent customer service to each and every resident, and are thrilled to have you recognize our hard work. Please let us know if you or your daughter ever need anything!

name: Kaylee Ann Garrett
text: I have lived here for 3 years now and I LOVE IT! I have never known any other apartment complex to be so understanding whenever it comes to not being able to make rent on time due to hardships and COVID hitting. Maintenance is SUPER timely, and we’ve never had much issue with bugs (except for the start of the rainy season). I’m gonna be so sad whenever I have to move out, but all good things must come to an end eventually.

resp.text: Hi Kaylee, Thank you so much for sharing your experience with us. We have enjoyed having you with us throughout the last 3 years. We understand that due the pandemic, things are a little different and we want to make sure our residents are comfortable. We will miss you, but wish you luck on your next adventure! Please don't hesitate to reach out to us should you ever need anything.

name: Cris Marshall
text: Redpoint is best apartment complex there is. The apartments are top tier inside and out. The staff blew away my expectations , any and e set problem that popped up, they handled. I just resigned because I couldn’t see myself anywhere else. I highly recommend anyone to move here!!!

resp.text: Hi Cris, We are so glad to see that you are having a positive experience at Redpoint. Our team's goal is to make sure that all residents feel at home, and we are so glad this has been the case for you. We are happy to have you with us another year! Please don't hesitate to reach out should you ever need anything -- we are always here to help.

name: Leonard Carpenter
text: I currently live here at Redpoint with two of my friends. Since moving in we’ve had no issues and already decided to stay for another year. If you’re looking for somewhere to stay definitely give redpoint a look.

resp.text: Hi Leonard, Thank you so much for sharing this feedback with us. We are so glad you and your roommates will be with us for another year. Please let us know if you ever need anything, we're always here to help!

name: Tony Simmons
text: I’m a past resident of Redpoint, and I loved my time there! The front office staff is really helpful and really take the time to get to know their residents.

resp.text: Hi Tony, We are so glad you enjoyed your time with us. We do our best to let residents know we care. We wish you the best of luck in your deployment. Thank you for your service! Please reach out in the future if we can ever help you with anything.

name: Really J
text:
Why, why, why are people still renting from this place? The rooms are tiny, it's dank, and has water leaking problems!

There are dozens of new apartment complexes with MUCH larger room and much better amenities, often times for much cheaper! Do a little research and look around, you'll find some place better within 10 minutes.

name: Brandi Garner
text: My daughter and I were just at Redpoint this week! We fell in love with this property, these townhouse apartments, and this incredible staff!!! It was an easy decision for us!!!!❤️☺️❤️

resp.text: Hi Brandi, thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We are so glad that your daughter is joining us in August. We are happy that you enjoyed your visit and our team! Please don't hesitate to reach out should you ever need anything from us -- we're always here to help.

name: Elizabeth Meads
text:
Redpoint is an excellent place to live if you're looking for off-campus housing. The rates are really great for what all is included in your apartment/townhouse (REAL grown ups know the value of a dishwasher and garbage disposal!). The Crimson Ride makes regular stops here, but if you prefer to drive then campus is literally minutes away. And you can bring your fur child!

I give 4/5 because there is quite a bit of traffic that comes through, as Redpoint is located next to Target and sometimes the greatness of Tuscaloosa overwhelms drivers and they just hammer down on the gas through the residential areas. Also, there are no quiet/courtesy hours, so it does get a little loud on the weekends. But overall it is a wonderful place to stay and the maintenance workers do a really great job at fixing problems ASAP. Make Redpoint your new home!

resp.text: Hi Elizabeth, we are so glad to hear that you are having a positive experience at Redpoint. We appreciate you sharing with us. Once the security gate upgrade is completed in full, traffic should slow down. We are happy to have you with us for another year. Please let us know if there is anything we can do for you!

name: Chris Jackson
text: Great location! Fully recommended it to anyone looking for student apartments in the area.

resp.text: Hi Chris, Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We are glad to see you are enjoying the location of our community and all that it has to offer. Please do not hesitate to let us know if you ever need anything!

name: KAY DP
text: 5 out of 5 stars! The apartments are luxurious at a great price and its located in a great location in Tuscoosa!

resp.text: Hello Kay, We are so glad to hear that you are having a 5-star experience at Redpoint. Thank you for sharing and please let us know if you ever need anything -- we're always here to help!

name: Kaitlyn Stapp
text: These apartments are honestly an amazing place to live if you're going to school. The staff go out of their way to make you feel comfortable and at home. Highly recommend and no complaints here!

resp.text: Hi Kaitlyn, Thank you for this wonderful review. We're happy to hear our team has provided an excellent experience and will continue to strive to do so in the future. Please reach out if there is anything we can do for you.

name: Alli Hodges
text: Redpoint Tuscaloosa is such a great place to live, not only do they have giveaways but they always try to include the residents into events so that we all feel like family.

resp.text: Hi Alli, Thank you for sharing your experience with us. We want all residents to feel like they are part of our Redpoint Family and we are glad to see that you feel this way. Thank you for choosing us for another year! Please don't hesitate to reach out if we can ever help you with anything.

name: Brianna Bonner
text: I love it here the management is amazing everyone is friendly I have had the best experience here! I will be redoing  my lease with them!  :)

resp.text: Hi Brianna, We are so happy to see that you have had such a positive experience with us. Thank you for taking the time to share this feedback. Redpoint's goal is for all residents to know how much we care. We look forward to having you with us another year! Please feel free to reach out if you ever need anything.

name: Rolanda Calloway
text: My son lives there and he absolutely loves it! The price is great and the location is very ideal! 5/5

resp.text: Hi Rolanda, Thank you so much for sharing about you and your son's experience at Redpoint. We are glad to have him with us for another year! Please let us know if either of you ever need anything at all -- we're always here to assist.

name: Aaron Casey
text: Very Clean. Maintenance timely. Lovely environment.

resp.text: Hi Aaron, Thank you for sharing this feedback with us. Our maintenance team works hard to make sure all residents are taken care of the best they can be. We are happy to see you enjoying your time at Redpoint. Please don't hesitate to reach out should you ever need anything, we're always here to help.

name: Daine King
text: Redpoint Tuscaloosa is a great place to live I am so happy I moved here! The housing is great, they have awesome amenities and great events that go on all the time. The staff is super friendly and always helpful. They always know how to help! The maintenance is also very efficient and they do a great job at fixing what needs to be fixed in a timely manner. I have never had a problem here and will 100% recommend it!!

resp.text: Daine, thanks so much for your feedback. We're so glad that you've had such a great experience living at Redpoint so far. Thanks for choosing us as your "Home away from Home!" Let us know if you ever need anything.

name: JC
text: Overall,  I love my experience here. The staff is so nice and accommodate very well with any issue. My room mates and I have grown very close and are renewing for next year. The resident events are always fun and a great way for the residents to interact and engage with the staff. Also, the property has great property upgrades and we are all so excited about it.

resp.text: Hi JC, we appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us. Our team goes above and beyond to make sure everyone feels welcome and is able to join in on the fun. We, too, are excited to see what 2020 brings!

name: Hope Corizzo
text:
It's all been fine until COVID hit, and then they shut everything down without a reduction of rent. Not the best part of town, but close enough to the school. The management team has no authority to do anything on site besides give out cookies. Trying to reason with them is moot. Don't sign a second lease before the end of the first one; it's not a great place to stay long-term.

EDITED TO ADD: I added a star because the parent company contacted me (after seeing this review) and helped me address the problems we were having. It was EASILY solved. My problem, still, is that the management on the ground didn't do this. It wasn't any secret trick (turns out I had my own log in from co-signing, and could fix the problem we had). Why doesn't the on-site team know how to work with their customers?

resp.text: Hi Hope, thank you for talking with me today. I am so glad we were able to chat about our restrictions due to COVID and we were able to resolve your issue with making your daughter's rent payment. We know this time is challenging and we are here to help you and our residents through it. Please let me know if you need anything else.

name: Jackson Sikes
text: Moved to Tuscaloosa in January and chose RedPoint to live because a few things, very friendly and acknowledgeable staff. If you have any issues with maintenance they are quick to help. The bus picks you up for Alabama so no need for a parking pass. Redpoint now has gates at all complex entrances to make you feel more secure and safe. Very close to Target with a 2 minute drive. Lots of green space if you like to sit outside and study. With any issue I have had, the manager Larissa quickly solved them and is extremely nice and willing to help you!!

resp.text: Hi Jackson, thank you so much for your kind words, we appreciate it so much. We are glad to see that our residents enjoy the easy access to Target and the CrimsonRide. We are also glad to hear that the gates have increased your sense of safety. At Redpoint, we love having room to roam and are glad to see you have had such a positive experience with our management team.

name: Elijah Teixeira
text: I’ve lived at Redpoint For The Past Two Years And I Have Seen A Tremendous Change From When I First Moved It. The Managers Have Made A Great Effort To Do Their Best To Establish A Positive Impact On The Community. In Crisis Or Holiday Cheers The Staff Will Ensure All Residents Feel Safe And Welcomed. Thank You Redpoint 🤗

resp.text: Hi Elijah, we're so glad you've had such a great experience and notice the efforts put in by our team. Thank you for the feedback!

name: Dakota J
text: Lived here for one year. Nice room, good space, and easy to get around.

resp.text: Hi Dakota, Thank you for taking time to share about your time at Redpoint. We know convenience is important and are glad to hear that you felt that we provided this. We wish you the best of luck on your next adventure!

name: Christina Colardeau
text: I signed to live here next year! I went through so many back forth of living in 2, 3 or 4 bedroom townhouse and Courtney was so easy going about it! She was so sweet and helpful! Everybody welcomed me right when I walked into the clubhouse for a tour with all smiles and hellos! I highly recommend looking into living at RedPoint!

resp.text: Christina, we are so glad you and your roommates will be here this fall!  We know that finding your future home is important, and we've enjoyed being a part of that experience for you.  Can't wait to see you around more!

name: Allison Wrenn
text: I have lived at Redpoint Tuscaloosa for 3 years now and I have loved it ever since my first night staying here. It is close to campus, literally right next door to Target, and right near McFarland Blvd. In other words, everything I need is right around me and I don't have to drive far to get places. The staff here is so welcoming and friendly and the property is spacious and full of open room to roam and enjoy the nature around us. I love that I can walk right up to my front door and that I have all the room I need in my room. I feel at home here and I really appreciate that the staff makes all of the necessary changes to make every resident feel well taken care of and safe in our community.

resp.text: Hi Allison, we've enjoyed having you as a resident at Redpoint, and are glad to hear your experience has been convenient and great overall. Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback!

name: Keenan DeBoer
text: Love this place, amazing staff and amenities. Best deal for college apartments in Tuscaloosa

resp.text: Hi Keenan, Thank you for your kind words. We are so glad to hear you are enjoy the amenities and our staff. It is our goal to provide the best customer experience possible. We are always here if you need us.

name: Leah Jack
text: I love living here!!! It’s very homey and little to no issues and even if there are some, maintenance acts quickly!!!!

resp.text: Hi Leah, We are so glad to hear that you are enjoying your time here at Redpoint. It is our top priority that every resident has a positive experience at our community, and we are delighted to hear this has been the case for you. Please let us know if you ever need anything!

name: Summer D'on
text: I am a current resident at Redpoint Tuscaloosa for the past 3 years. I have enjoyed my college career here with the friendly staff and updated security team. Resigning was made very easily by the help of Larissa in the Clubhouse. I really appreciated her customer care and service with my family and I for the upcoming year. Thank you!

resp.text: Hi Summer, we appreciate your feedback and are so glad your experience here at Redpoint has been a positive one. We can't wait for what the next year holds!

name: Telia Brown
text: Pretty good student living. Lived there for 2 years in a 4 bedroom. Maintenance responded quickly but they would sometimes leave the lights on when they came. Other than that pretty good!

resp.text: Hi Telia, thanks so much for the feedback! Our maintenance team works hard to get everyone taken care of, and we'll let them know to work on making sure they're turning those lights off. Good thing we have unlimited utilities, huh? We're glad you've enjoyed your experience!

name: jasmyne williams
text: I stayed at Redpoint Tuscaloosa for 3.5 years. My apartment truly felt like home I was actually sad to leave when I graduated. Management was great. Whenever I had a question they were prompt at answering the phone and replying to e-mails. Maintenance was also very fast at responding to any issues I had. Highly recommend if you are looking for affordable and nice student housing.

resp.text: Hi Jasmyne, we appreciate your feedback and are so sad to see you go. We wish you the best of luck in your journey to come!

name: Colby Boyd
text: I have been living here 3 years and they are the best apartments in Tuscaloosa worth every penny and more. The office staff and maintenance does a good job as well. I recommend living here if you are looking for student housing.

resp.text: Colby, we're so excited to hear you've had such a great experience at Redpoint. Let us know if there's ever anything we can do for you!

name: Genoa Rodgers
text: Redpoint has been an amazing community to live at thus far! The staff is always so friendly and truly try their hardest to give you the best service possible and fix any issues. The living areas and bedrooms are a great size and come with just enough room for storage. The amenities of the complex are free and with easy access so going to the pool during the summer or grabbing a study room during finals week is never an issue. If you are looking for an affordable yet worthwhile living experience, Redpoint is the place for you!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the feedback, Genoa. We love hearing our residents' favorite spaces to hang out and use throughout the property.  We're so glad you've enjoyed your experience!

name: Jeffrey Miller
text: Wonderful complex with great amenities! Staff will do everything in their power to make you happy and the pool is legit! Although Tuscaloosa doesn’t feel safe anymore, I always feel safe at my apartment! Pet friendly and the staff is always doing events with free food! Would recommend to anyone!

resp.text: Hi Jeffrey, we are so glad you shared your experience with us. Our staff goes above and beyond to make sure our residents have the best experience possible. It's great to have you in the Redpoint family!

name: Gianna Tecce
text: My move in experience started out a bit rough and we had some issues to get resolved. However Courtney and Rob have gone above and beyond to make sure that they personally took care of all of the issues.   I was happy to renew my lease knowing that if I had any issues going forward that Rob and Courtney would have my back.

resp.text: Hi Gianna, we're so glad we were able to resolve your issues at move-in and that you're now loving where you live. We appreciate your feedback and are so glad you're a part of our community!

name: Taylor Dobeck
text: I’ve absolutely loved my experience! I have lived here for over 2 years and never had any issues, when maintenance requests were put in they were done very efficiently. The pool is always clean and staff was always super friendly. Definitely would recommend Redpoint to anyone!

resp.text: Hi Taylor, thank you for sharing your experience!  We sincerely appreciate your recommendation, and please do not hesitate reaching out if we can be of any further assistance.

name: Jailyn Murrell
text: If I could leave zero stars I would. My first year living here was great, had minor issues but nothing too big of a deal. This year has been completely different! Management does not care about your issues until you contact corporate. They allow their on site courtesy officer to run and stomp PURPOSELY at all times in the night / morning. They blame it on his huge dog when I clearly know the difference between a dog running around and a human-being stomping. They do not enforce the rules to him. I requested moving (once again) but was not giving better options to move into. I truly wish I could move completely out of this complex! I would in a heartbeat and never look back. Would not recommend. Poor management, poor security.

resp.text: Jailyn, we appreciate your feedback and review of your experience at our community.  We're sorry to read that your experience has not been what you expected.  We wish that the options we provided to you would have been of interest to you. We are happy to discuss those options again in an effort to ensure your time remaining here is more enjoyable. Please reach out if this is still an interest of yours and management will be happy to discuss further with you.

name: Kensley Wright
text: Personally, my experience here has been fine. I know there are a lot of complaints against living here but I can’t say I’ve experienced them myself. I have never had a problem with staff help or maintenance requests. And I enjoy going to their events at the clubhouse. I’d say it’s one of the cheaper student living apartments around Tuscaloosa. Overall I’ve had a decent experience here and I do not regret living here.

resp.text: Hi Kensley, we're glad that you've had a pleasant experience so far, and would love any suggestions or ideas you have that would make it even better.  Thank you for your feedback!

name: David Kimani
text: Redpoint tuscaloosa has a great staff! The apartments are of great quality, with an on time maintenance team at your service when something needs to be fixed. They always make sure I’m left satisfied with each office visit/call. From breakfast they offer each morning to the giveaways, it’s evident that Redpoint cares about its tenants.

resp.text: Hi Kimani, we're glad to hear that you enjoy the space and lifestyle that Redpoint has to offer. Let us know if you ever have suggestions for events!

name: Jeffrey (Tyler) Mckinney
text: The staff is what originally won me over, but all off the free amenities definitely didn’t hurt.

resp.text: Hi Jeffrey, we are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your experience with our team members. Our goal is to always make sure residents feel at home with Redpoint. We are happy to see you enjoying the all-inclusive lifestyle, as well.

name: David Zheng
text:
Edited:
I lived here for almost three years now.
The staff are friendly and maintenance responds well when you submit work order.
The staff and maintenance are great and seem to improved. The area is more secured now due to adding security to both entrances and exits during the late evenings for security checks who comes in or out apartment complex. The board actually listened! Thanks much and good job guys and gals!

name: Keya Todd
text: I would rate this apartment complex a zero if I could.They look nice on the outside but the inside is completely different. Gnats, roaches and spiders. I’ve used hot shot bombs. I’ve used raid and they even supplied bug spray that I had to spray myself. They said the apartment sprays on some Monday’s and that the person spraying the apartments leaves a note every time they come. We never got a note. My daughter was not there long because they could never get the problems solved. The last draw was the shooting that happened. They have an on-site manager that I’ve had to speak with several times. Needless to say. I’m happy she’s in a better place.

resp.text: Hi Keya, we are sorry to hear that you did not enjoy your experience at our community.  Our staff works hard to provide a great experience for all our residents, family members, and guests. We appreciate your feedback on the pest issues and will communicate those concerns with our pest control provider. We are also making headway on further security measures for our community. We are sorry to lose Amber as a resident, but are happy to know that she's found a new home she enjoys.

name: Seth Martin
text: I've lived here since August 2018 and I can strongly say that for the time that I've been here it has overall been a great experience. I haven't had that many maintenance issues, but anytime I do, their maintenance team is always able to take care of it within 2 days. As for their staff, everyone that works there is really nice and they always greets me with a smile when I come into the clubhouse.

resp.text: Hi Seth, thank you for your feedback on our community. We're so glad you've enjoyed your experience here at Redpoint! Our team is dedicated to giving you the best living experience possible, from the beginning of your journey here until the end.

name: Sarah Gray
text: So far, I have enjoyed the two years that I have lived at this apartment! They always have great deals when you resign your lease, and the housing is affordable. Management is always very helpful and very nice!

resp.text: Sarah, we are glad to read that your experience at Redpoint Tuscaloosa has been an enjoyable one.  We work hard to provide a good experience for all our residents, and it’s great to know that we have delivered that for you!

name: Jordan Bates
text: I've lived at Redpoint for the last two years and it has truly been a pleasant experience. I feel as though it has been a home to me. I highly recommend this complex.

resp.text: Jordan, we're glad your experience has been a great one so far, and hate to lose you when you graduate. We wish you the best of luck, and appreciate your feedback!

name: Mary George
text: I literally cannot wait to move out of this place. the only thing these people care about is the money you bring in to them... don’t get me wrong the price is great and maintenance is also great but the company who owns redpoint is absolute trash. if you’re looking to live here, don’t. save yourself the headache.

resp.text: Hi Mary, thank you so much for your review of our community. We're so glad you and your boyfriend love where you live, and we will continue to do what it takes to keep it that way. Thanks for being a part of our community!

name: Hunter Ray
text: Redpoint is probably the best deal you can get in Tuscaloosa. Everyone is friendly and the clubhouse is amazing. Yeah people might think it’s “unsafe” but we’re in Tuscaloosa. Every off campus apartment place is going to have some crime. Just lock your doors and you won’t have any issues. I’ve loved my experience so far.

resp.text: Thanks for the feedback, Hunter.  We appreciate you seeing the bigger picture, and that we're doing our best to keep our area of Tuscaloosa safe. We love that you, your friends and roommates enjoy your experience here and participate in our resident events. Let us know if there's ever anything else we can do!

name: Samson Chism
text: First off before I make this review I would like to say that I generally don't care to voice my opinion and leave reviews unless it's something I feel can give insight and help some one else. With that being said, I honestly can say Redpoint Tuscaloosa has created a living experience that has earmarked the beginning of my college journey. From the staff members to my personal living space, Redpoint as a whole in my opinion will always be a great property and there's no mistaking that. Speaking as a student,  the pricing and the quality of living spaces (amenities and appliances)  Redpoint has to offer allows residents to live comfortably while taking their studies (or lifestyle) to new heights. If you think I'm lying pull up and you'll see!

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback, Samson. We're so glad you've enjoyed your time here so far, and will do what it takes to keep it that way! Thanks for being a part of the Redpoint community.

name: JayTee Taylor
text: Overall it was not bad living here, maintenance came in a reasonable time, reasonable on rent payments. There is no cable but there is internet and plenty of free giveaways. The staff is nice and it stays clean.

resp.text: Hi JayTee, we appreciate your feedback and are glad you enjoyed your experience at Redpoint.

name: Alana Nichols
text: I've lived here almost 3 years and had almost no problems. I appreciate the hard work of the staff when I need something like a maintenance request done. thanks yall!

resp.text: Hi Alana, we appreciate your feedback. So glad you recognize the hard work of our team, and that you've had a great experience because of that!

name: Stephanie Seda
text: Redpoint is a really nice apartment complex with lots of amenities that are actually useful for their residents. It’s central to Midtown, Target is in our backyard, it’s fully furnished, and the main office staff are great people. Pro tip: make friends with your neighbors! We’ve had lots of great connections with the residents in this community. The bus runs through UA transportation and is very efficient in getting here and to the bus hub in a timely manner. Their gym is fully stocked with everything you need and if you’re an early bird like me you get the place practically to yourself. It’s also comforting to see the cleaning lady there every morning which helps reassure that everything is always in good shape. We haven’t had too many problems in the apartment that has needed maintenance, but when we have maintenance is always really nice and comes within 48 hours, if not sooner. We have also had really nice times at Redpoint’s monthly events. They are always trying to keep their residents up to date on things that are happening and making sure we enjoy our time here. Overall, if you’re looking for a place to stay don’t pass up the opportunity to tour here. I had my doubts on this place from the way others talked about it, but when I toured I instantly fell in love with the environment and layout. I would recommend Redpoint to anybody who is looking for a new place to stay in Tuscaloosa.

resp.text: Stephanie, we appreciate you taking the time to post your review and for your recommendation, which we sincerely appreciate.  We want our residents' experience to be enjoyable and we're always open to feedback on how we can continue to improve.  When our residents call our community their "Home Away from Home," we know our efforts are working.

name: Joe Turner
text: Overall pretty good. Rent is pretty good for what you get. It's close enough to campus and everything else to make commuting easy, plus theres the shuttle. Work orders get filled quick and without issue. Management has changed like three times since I moved in (Fall 2016), but not much really changed for me. Haven't really had to deal with management, so I can't speak to that. Only ever had to resolve an issue with utilities payment, but that went smoothly. Units themselves are pretty nice, more than enough space for the average person, personal bathroom, kitchen area is also pretty good. I do recommend getting either your own mattress or a mattress pad, mine at least was like a wood plank to sleep on. There have been some issues with other residents causing trouble, but between security and local police that's been taken care of pretty quick while I've been there. Only thing holding the Woodlands back from 5/5 is that it's just a pretty good apartment complex. If you're on a budget, this is a great option, but otherwise, there are better options at higher cost.

resp.text: Joe, we appreciate you leaving us a review and your feedback on your experience at the Woodlands of Tuscaloosa.  If we can be of any further assistance, please do not hesitate reaching out to us.

name: Steven Samsel
text:
Overall, there have been a lot of positive changes, most notably to management. They fired the previous managers and brought in competent experienced adults who not only seem to care about my problems, but have been given the resources and capability to fix them.

I personally prefer Kelly and Michelle over the younger manager, but the younger manager is more geared towards their typical demographic, younger students. For students who have been around the block a bit and parents I would strongly recommend speaking to Kelly or Michelle (not saying that the other manager is anywhere near as bad as previous managers, she seems nice, I simply prefer the more experienced of the lot).

There has also been a push for better privacy (managers do inspections not college student employees) and security. There are still instances of security issues but action seems to be being taken towards fixing that.

The grounds are still great but it is worth noting that the A/C units here are awful. When they work they are fine but they go out a lot. This is no fault of current ownership, because the original owners made a foolish call of buying cheap A/Cs in Alabama, but hopefully soon they realize that buying better ones will save them a lot of money on repairs in the long run.

Overall, I would, for the first time in a few years, recommend living in Redpoint. If this is a trend then the incredible grounds here could be complimented with a relatively stress free living experience.

The last star is if they bring back cable in the biggest football college in the world, and I personally have had a lot of issues with the switch to the discount internet provider.

resp.text: Steven, we are sorry your experience at Woodlands of Tuscaloosa has not been a positive one.  We encouraged all of our residents to read their Housing Agreements in detail, so they are aware of all policies.  Our staff is here to explain or answer any questions you may have regarding the agreement.  We notify all residents of our routine quarterly inspections, and any other time our maintenance staff would enter an apartment would be for service request or emergencies.  We would be more than happy to discuss your concerns further, if you would email us at office@woodlands-tuscaloosa.com.

name: alicia m.
text: Wouldn't recommend this place to anyone! I toured before signing my lease and on that tour I made sure to ask about cameras AROUND THE PROPERTY and I was told that they were in place. A LIE. Someone backed into my car and I still don't know who did it. Also, I was charged for bedroom paint at the time of move-out, but I knew that the charges had to be false because I carefully took down everything that was hung (and I used command strips). On top of that, I took pictures of everything afterwards - bedroom, bathroom, kitchen, closets, etc - for that specific reason. I responded to the email regarding the charges by saying I had photos and the manager tells me she "accidentally" charged me instead of my roommate who had moved out the semester before. Was it really an accident? I think not. Please beware and document everything!!!! Ask about your charges because you have a right to know what you're paying for. Plenty of "accidents" seem to happen here.

resp.text: Hi Alicia, we appreciate your feedback. Unfortunately, we are not able to locate you in our system but would love the opportunity to talk with you about the issues above. We do apologize if there was miscommunication, but there are no cameras around the exterior of the property. As far as the move-out charges go, we open our doors for anyone to ask for documentation of charges and why they were charged. If there are errors, we do our best to correct those. Please let us know if we can assist you with anything further.

name: tori peterson
text: Me and my roommates moved here to be in an apartment complex that felt alittle more comfortable and homey, it definitely is and I really like the location. Being 5 mins from Target is a big help. I did wish there was more room for supplies in the kitchen though. Overall I really like it a lot

resp.text: Hi Tori, we appreciate your feedback and are so glad your experience here as been a pleasant one so far. Being so close to Target and other shops is something we love too! Thank you for being a part of our community, and let us know if we can be of any further assistance.

name: Lauren Wilson
text: They seem to never be able to get payments processed correctly. The app to pay only works sometimes, and if it does it does not allow for you to pay with credit or debit card. If you pay with a check, they usually still charge a late fee even if they were given the check on time. Honestly it’s just a headache.

resp.text: Hi Lauren, we weren't able to get in contact with you, but would love the opportunity to speak with you about your payments and previous issues. The resident portal app as well as the website should allow you to pay online as long as the account is in good standing. We'd be more than happy to take a look at this with you. Give us a call or email us at live@redpoint-tuscaloosa.com to speak with any manager on site.

name: Eunice Koomson
text: I've lived here for two years now and yea there a few issues here and there but  the staff was always reliable--like I knew if I had an issue with like my apt they would respond. Once I was locked out of my apartment in the middle of the night and I ran into one of the office workers and she was able to help me out and got maintenance to come. It was really sweet of her and she definitely didn't have to do that!! Great management

resp.text: We appreciate you leaving us a review regarding your experience at Woodlands of Tuscaloosa.  We are glad to hear that our staff was able to assist you when needed.  Please let us know any time if we can ever assist further.

name: Marilee Turnbull
text: This is not a great area for your student. Crime in the apartment complex. Also, management would not help when we could not even use the premises during COVID saying that they are not affiliated with the university even though they market straight to students.

resp.text: Hi Marilee, we are sorry to hear that you have had a less than excellent experience at Redpoint. We try our best to keep all residents safe, which led to closing the amenities due to the state of Alabama's and the CDC's regulations associated with COVID-19. We are also now a gated community. We would love to discuss these things further with you. Please contact us at 205-379-0088. Thank you

name: Mary (Megyn) Burnett
text: Not the most glamorous place you'll ever live, but they do their best to maintain a clean and safe complex. I love that I have my own bathroom and there is a washer and dryer in the apartment. Lots of good amenities and an overall beautiful complex.

resp.text: Mary, we appreciate your review and feedback on your experience.  We work hard to provide and a safe and enjoyable environment for our residents.  Please let us know if we can be of any further assistance.

name: Daine King
text: I’ve stayed here for a couple months and already signed to renew for 2020. The apartments are really nice and really affordable too!!

resp.text: Hi Daine, we appreciate your feedback and are so glad you've enjoyed your experience at Redpoint.  We are looking forward to having you as part of Redpoint for another year!  Please let us know if you need anything.

name: Derek Biddings II
text: I have been a tenant at the Woodlands of Tuscaloosa since the Fall semester of 2012.  I have thoroughly enjoyed my time here as a resident.  The Woodlands office and maintenance staff have done a superb job in satisfying each and every need I've presented to them.  The Clubhouse's resources; the gym, pool, and especially the computer lab have really made my Woodlands experience that much greater.  Also, I would like to add that the "Resident Appreciation" events are always welcomed! Thanks again to the Woods Team for all you've done.  ROLL TIDE & CHIVE ON!!!

name: Duane Pigott
text: I love the awesome staff here. The Leasing Manager went above and beyond for me on move in day and made it the best experience EVER! Also, i love those creative events in the clubhouse.

resp.text: We appreciate you leaving us a review regarding your experience at the Woodlands of Tuscaloosa.  We are glad to hear that our staff was able to assist you when needed, and you enjoy our resident events.  Please let us know any time if we can ever assist further.

name: Lisa Martin
text: Love redpoint, I have lived here for two yeare and signed for the third. My favorite part about redpoint is how fast the workers are. I can put in a work order and they will be here to fix it in one to two days!!

resp.text: Hi Lisa, your experience is our priority, and we're so glad you've had a great one! Our staff goes above and beyond to make sure our community is taken care of. Please let us know if there's ever anything you need!

name: Jasmine Sanchez
text: The staff here is VERY friendly and they are always willing to assist me with any of my issues. I am in LOVE with the luxury style pool and you will always see me in attendance at their awesome events.

resp.text: Jasmine, we are glad to read that your experience at the Woodlands of Tuscaloosa has been an enjoyable one.  We work hard to provide a good experience for all of our residents, and it's great to know that we have delivered that for you.

name: MuliShaKala
text: they are HORRIBLE ...HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE..the GM is RUDE and will over talk you..i had bed bugs and bugs all in my apartment ..nothing was cleaned prior to my stay..and when addressed the GM was very rude and told me i was basically a liar..asked for her corporate number and she plain out told me NO..do not stay here..they only sell FALSE DREAMS ‼️

resp.text: Hello, We are disappointed to hear that you have not had a 5-star experience at Redpoint. We have submitted a maintenance request for your issues and hope to have them all resolved by the end of next week. Again, we sincerely apologize and hope that you are able to better enjoy your apartment once those are completed!

name: MICHELE EVERETT
text: When my daughter moved in the Woodlands the apartment was filthy and full of furniture from other apartments. We called the front desk several times requesting it to be moved so we could move her in we ended up having to move all the furniture ourselves as well as go buy cleaning supplies to clean the apartment.When we got ready to move out at the end of our lease we made sure the whole apartment was cleaned,even had a Woodland employee do a walk through and she commented we never have apartments left this clean. When my daughter got her final bill we were charged a 95.00 cleaning fee and 12.50 for 2 light bulbs. I called management at least 7 times with no return phone call and emailed twice with no response. I contacted corporate and I know now why the place is run like it is they were of  no help either.I would not recommend the Woodlands to anyone the pictures on the website are very deceiving.

resp.text: We are sorry to read that your experience at the Woodlands of Tuscaloosa has not been an enjoyable one.  We make sure to document all charges during our move-out inspection, and would be more than happy to discuss any questions you may have.  This time of year is one of our busiest times, so it may take a little longer than we would like to get back in touch with you, but if you would please e-mail us at live@woodlands-tuscaloosa.com our Resident Services Manager will contact you to discuss your concerns as soon as possible.

name: Calleigh Williams
text: I have lived here for 3 years now and no place is perfect but the staff in the front office has always been very kind and helpful with anything I have had problems with. Any work orders I had were completed in a timely manner and I was so grateful for that.

resp.text: We appreciate you leaving us a review regarding your experience at Woodlands of Tuscaloosa.  We are glad to hear that our staff was able to assist you when needed.  Please let us know any time if we can ever assist further.

name: Chris Ballentine
text: The woodlands has great facilities like the pool, gym, clubhouse area in general, and park area with a creek. Staff is nice and helpful and willing to do what they can to make the stay better. They even have a bus that will drive to campus on certain days which is convenient.

name: Lisa Findley
text: Could I give it a negative 5?  Move in day:  unit has not been cleaned. Filthy microwave, floors, bathtub w missing grout and had mold. Toilet in one unit does not work. Dryer broken. No stove in the unit. Dishwasher moldy. Missing kitchen table chairs, desk chairs. Multiple other parents in the office with similar complaints. General manager trying as hard as she can, office staff nice. But they don’t have the resources they need to handle all the issues. Very bad start to our year here. Management company reps not on site.

resp.text: Hi Lisa, we appreciate your feedback and are thankful that we have had the opportunity to reach out directly and correct the issues above. Our team's goal is to provide the best experience possible to each and every resident here, and our plan is to provide your students with nothing less than exceptional experiences going forward.

name: Robin Clarke
text: I've lived here for three years during college and I have had very few problems with the Woodlands. I wouldn't live here post-college, but it definitely fits all the criteria for a student living off-campus (plus the convenient drive to Target is amazing). The only issue I really had were bugs (ants, cockroaches, and spiders), but the instances were few and far between and could be dealt with using simple poisons/sprays. Also the amenities are great and the staff address maintenance requests very quickly. (Side note: contrary to other reviewers beliefs, I have never worked for the Woodlands and I am not writing this review for any type of compensation)

resp.text: Robin, we appreciate your feedback and are glad to hear that you have had a positive experience while living at the Woodlands of Tuscaloosa.  If there is anything we can assist you with, as always, please don't hesitate to let us know.

name: Collin Webster
text: Great place to live!  Great layout and if you have a pet, this is the absolute BEST place for dogs as well.  My dachshund, Olive, loves living here.

resp.text: Collin, we appreciate your review and feedback on your experience at the Woodlands of Tuscaloosa.  We are glad to hear that you and your dog have enjoyed living at our community.

name: Bradley Parks
text: The woodlands is awesome! I've been here for two years and have never had a problem. The amenities are great and the location is the best. Plus the bus that runs during school and nights to the bars is the best as well as all of the events and free food.

name: Tia S
text: I live in a 3 bedroom 3 bath town home and I must say I love it! The staff is very good is EVERYTIME I need something they are a phone call away they call me to check back and make sure that I am good! I would definitely renew if I wasn't moving! Also they have events at the clubhouse which is a great way to meet friends!

name: Aspen Ruff
text: I've lived in student housing for now 3 years. This is the first company where I have felt like any issues that I brought to the office was actually handled. Management gave me their full attention and made sure I had the best experience. I lived in a 2br town home. If I wasn't graduating this year, I would have renewed! I'm going to miss having the half bath downstairs that guest could use instead of using my bathroom upstairs!

resp.text: Aspen RuffAspen Ruff, we are glad to read that your experience at Woodlands of Tuscaloosa has been an enjoyable one.  We work hard to provide a good experience for all our residents, and it’s great to know that we have delivered that for you.  We wish you the best of luck in your next endeavor.

name: Jacqueline Timely
text: I have lived at the Woodlands for 2 years now. I’m an athlete and I have really liked being able to live with my friends.  Living here has really worked out for me because I like having friends around but I also need it kind of quiet because of my schedule. I would definitely recommend living here to anyone.

name: Jaquille (Jay) Ellis
text: So far living at The Woodlands has not been a bad experience.  I had the opportunity to work at The Woodlands this past summer and it was an interesting experience for me. I have no major complaints. I am considering renewing my lease.

name: Jannique Ellis
text: Sadly to say I have to agree with some of the comments that has been made concerning the Woodlands. I don't stay there but my son does and overages were added to his bills and he had not stayed in his apartment for about six months because he was home sick. There has to be a better way for students who struggle as it is to make it. I will not sign another lease for another year. Very very disappointed in management.

name: Owen Mattox
text: The Woodlands, while providing a nice space for the price, are lacking in customer service and structure. There were numerous occasions where the safety of tenants were at risk, whether it be physical assaults or shootings. I would advise against staying at the Woodlands unless you have no other options.

resp.text: We are sorry that you've seemed to have a less than enjoyable experience here at The Woodlands.  I am not familiar with the incidents that you are referring to, but I am more than happy to speak to you about them. Our Residents are our number one priority and we try to provide a safe environment by having security patrol the property 7 days a week, and we even have a Courtesy Officer who lives on property. Myself or a member of our staff would be more than happy to talk about any of these issues with you. Please email live@woodlands-tuscaloosa.com at your earliest convenience.

name: Brandon Johnson
text: The Woodlands definitely is worth it!!!! They do tons of things for their residents; including safety seminars, corn hole tournaments, and lots of free food. I don't see how some people don't' like it. I love it here!!! Definitely would refer incoming students to this place!!!!!

name: Ashlyn Soileau
text: The Woodlands of Tuscaloosa offer a unique experience with excellent customer service and a wide variety of amenities. The resident events are top notch, and the property is extremely well-kept!I would certainly recommend it to anyone looking for a fun and hospitable living experience in Tuscaloosa.

resp.text: Thank you for leaving us your feedback on your experience at the Woodlands of Tuscaloosa.  We are glad to read you have enjoyed our many resident events.  We are looking forward to another great year- please do not hesitate to reach out to us for any information or assistance.

name: Deven Wilson
text: Love living here, the property is great, spacious apartment, and friendly staff. It has a bad rap for being " dangerous" but its never been a real issue. Lived here for two years and enjoyed it. For the price and what you get its worth it.

name: Joshua Hale
text:
I have been living in the Woodlands of Tuscaloosa for over 3 years during my time at the University of Alabama.
