The residential community is beyond great as far as living within the means of college life. I have recommend many of my friends to the Woodlands and they have all said the same. I will continue to live at the Woodlands through my undergraduate years and will advise anyone to become a part of the growing community.

Joshua Hale

name: Hallie Swett
text: The amnetities here are AMAZING! The gym is always stocked with equipment and the clubhouse has the greatest games to play with friends! They are very interactive with the tenants and also guests that want to come check it out. They have events every month and always give away free stuff and food!! The rooms are very comfortable and everything is top of the line! It is a FANTASTIC place to live!

name: Caitlin Lissner
text: I really enjoyed living at the Woodlands. The staff was always caring and helpful. The apartments are roomy and the amenities are endless. They also put on great community events to be able to interact with and meet your neighbors!

name: Melinda Colson
text: I would highly recommend this property to anyone looking for housing in this area. The staff is very friendly and helpful and the property is very well maintained.

resp.text: Melinda, we appreciate you taking the time to post your review and for your recommendation, which we sincerely appreciate.  We want our residents' experience to be enjoyable and we're always open to feedback on how we can continue to improve.

name: Tre Anderson
text: Great customer service they fixed everything we had issues with within our unit in timely manner. Would highest recommend this apartment.

name: Katie M
text: I absolutely love the Woodlands! All within a couple hours of requesting information, I received a follow-up phone call, toured the complex, and signed a lease. The staff in the leasing office was welcoming, knowledgeable, and extremely helpful!

name: Ty Jackson
text: Comfortable living! Spacious bedrooms and bathrooms! Room mate matching is cool. They try their best to meet the residents' needs.

name: Brandi Todd
text: This will be my third year living at The Woodlands, and it has been a great experience overall! Problems have been few and far between, but when we have had issues, they've been dealt with quickly and professionally. Love the spacious apartment, well-kept amenities, and fun events!

name: Andre Souza
text: Not horrible but not the best. The management will "do their best" but they are sly and don't care about their residents. It has seemed to be safer since they kicked some of the shady residents out, but they need to get rid of their manager. She does an awful job and so does her little band of conniving staff members. It's too bad that the management team makes people want to move out. I would give it a 4/5 for the look of the community but the rest is a 2/5.

resp.text: Andre, we would like the opportunity to address some of your concerns further.  If you would email us at office@woodlands-tuscaloosa.com at your earliest convenience, we will be more than happy to schedule an appointment with you.  We look forward to hearing from you soon.

name: Sarah Beatty
text:
I've lived here for several months now and have had a good experience. The apartment isn't perfect, the main issue being that the front door and lock were replaced before we moved in. It's not perfectly sealed and the lock is a little hard to turn. We get stinkbugs from time to time, probably due to the not-so-airtight door.

That said, everything else has been good. Maitenance almost always responds to our requests within 1 or 2 days, and the one time they didn't, I notified the office and they have always called me to make sure my requests are completed since.

The noise levels are what they are at other apartment complexes targeted at students. I'm a light sleeper and this rarely bothers me, but this is still far from being the quietest community in town.

Utilities can get expensive, so if you have the opportunity to sign with unlimited utilities I would strongly recommend that.

Overall, The Woodlands is pretty good for the price you pay and is convenient to a lot of popular parts of town, as well as UA campus.  It's very reasonably priced compared to similar places.

resp.text: Sarah, we are glad to read that your experience at Woodlands of Tuscaloosa has been an enjoyable one.  We work hard to provide a good experience for all our residents, and it’s great to know that we have delivered that for you.

name: Timothy Gable
text:
Woodlands wants corporate profit over customer service
Had minor issue with bank payment.
Corrected payment within 45 minutes of being informed in writing.
Charged excessive fees for Credit card decline and late charges.
45 minutes from informed to paid. $97.00
Discussed with leasing manager, they hide behind their policies.
.

resp.text: Timothy, we are sorry you feel this way and want to ensure you that our staff is here to assist in any way we can.  We have certain policies in place and due to fair housing laws are unable to make exceptions.  If you have questions or any other concerns, please contact our Resident Services Manager at your earliest convenience at office@woodlands-tuscaloosa.com.

name: Sara Kulbacki
text: The staff is extremely friendly and the  maintenance request have always been completed very quickly. I enjoy living here at the woodlands.

resp.text: Sara, we appreciate you taking the time to leave us a review and are glad to hear your experience has been a positive one.  Please let me know if we can be of any further assistance.

name: Jada Posey
text:
Had some problems at first, but management and the staff worked so hard
to fix the issues.  I love it now, and I attend the events regularly.

resp.text: Jada, thank you for leaving us your feedback on your experience at Redpoint Tuscaloosa.  We are glad to read you have enjoyed our many resident events.  We are looking forward to another great year - please do not hesitate to reach out to us for any information or assistance.

name: Molly McElroy
text: The clubhouse hosts all kinds of events which are awesome and apartments/facilities are clean and maintained well!

resp.text: Molly, we are glad to see that your experience at Woodlands of Tuscaloosa has been an enjoyable one. We work hard to provide a good experience for all our residents, and it’s great to know that we have delivered that for you and your pups!!

name: Andrew Taylor
text: The Woodlands has so much to offer! A great comfortable living environment, free events and food, a convenient shuttle that takes you to campus or to the bars on the weekends, and an incredibly friendly staff! Highly recommend living here!

name: Ambria Brijea
text: I’ve been here a month, and I’m ready to go. This by far moving to Tuscaloosa has been the worst experience i have ever had dealing with an apartment. I had fraud on my bank account, and NORMALLY a complex will ask for proof of fraud and hold off on eviction processes as long as it’s valid and with thorough communication. BUT NOT HERE. First off when i moved into my apartment nothing was done that i asked to be done prior to moving in, my water is STILL white, I’ve made maintence request IN the front office for pest control because the amount of critters living here is awful. When i moved in i noticed they didn’t clean up because a notice from last September when someone’s car got shot into was sitting on my dining table. There is TOO many STUDENTS working in that front office that nothing can get done professionally, or in a timely manner. My parents were disgusted with the management and staff prior to my move in due to their lack luster abilities to be professional and reasonable. I will honestly say if you’re new to this city, and JUST moved here like me make this your LAST option. I’m not really here for the response from the complex either everyone gets the same response. But make it your business to get in contact with cooperate if you have any issues. SKIP THE LEASING OFFICE. Or if you’re like me keep track of everything for legal matters.

resp.text: Ambria, I am so sorry that you have had a less than enjoyable experience here at the Woodlands but we most certainly want to make this right for you.  We do have certain policies and procedures that have to be followed when filing for eviction , but we never want any resident to think that our staff doesn't have time to speak with them about their issue. I have emailed you hoping to send pest control to your apartment, and to also see if you would like to set up a time to speak to a manager. I am confident that we can get your issues resolved and turn your experience around.  We look forward to hearing from you soon!

name: Johnny Hattner
text: The woodlands is such a wonderful place to live as a college student. The amenities are super nice, I go to the gym and pool all the time. I've met some of my great friends through that, the bus going to and from school is nice so I don't have to drive. It even picks up from downtown and the strip on night we go out so we don't have to worry about a DD. Even the distance from campus is nice, I leave 30 minutes before my class starts and I can park and walk to anywhere on campus, and it's right next to target, the mall and midtown do anything I need is right here.

name: Zach Hays
text:
internet ok kinda not as nice as i would like but ye kno we out here tryin to get an education so its ok fo da money

Edit they fixed my problem and got the ethernet back it's just the wifi that is slow other then that this place is good would recommend

resp.text: Hi Zach, thank you for your review of our community. We have had a couple of complaints about the WiFi connectivity, and can provide you with the information for our internet provider, Because each apartment has individual routers, you will need to reach out to them directly and provide them with the information from your equipment, so they can better address the issue. If there is anything else we can assist you with, please do not hesitate to reach out to us. You can email management directly at live@redpoint-tuscaloosa.com.

name: Taylor Fendley
text: The Woodlands is a great place to live, I don't know why they have a poor reputation. The maintenance turn-around time is great. The only thing I would change is the addition of a gate, or security cameras.

name: Jake Zarobsky
text:
I've lived at the Woodland's for the past two years. In that time, there's been two buyouts of the property. This past year, they were bought out by another property management company that raised pet the pet fee to be a non-refundable $750 deposit and stopped giving deals (like this year I had $40 off rent and no overages on utilities). I understand that sometimes rent goes up, but not by the amount it increased this year.

Also, don't be surprised by the amount of positive reviews on the site. Most of the student workers in the office live at the Woodlands and probably wrote those because they work here.

As far as management and staff is concerned, the maintenance team here is impeccable. During off peak times they'll usually service the same day. However, management in the office doesn't respond to emails and they never have the answer to any questions that residents have.

I would love to live here again, but the increase in rent, pet fees, and just lack of knowledge on behalf of the management team has made it a non-starter for my 2017-2018 housing.

resp.text: Jacob, there appears to have been some miscommunication regarding rental rates as our current market rates are the same for the 2016-2017 year as they are for the 2017-2018 term.  Sometimes we are able to offer promotional rental discounts and you are welcome to contact the office at any time regarding those.  In addition, if you have a pet or plan to get one, please contact the office regarding the registration process and fees as they are currently the same fees that were previously required.  Our Management Staff would be happy to answer any questions you have and we appreciate your patient during the transition of ownership of the Woodlands of Tuscaloosa.

name: MultiplesOfNico
text:
They actually approved me for an apartment BEFORE doing a background, income and credit check.
If you want to slide and have easy access to getting an apartment, this is the place to be. I even told them I couldn't afford it, yet they still approved me anyways.
Looks like they really need money, even if the tenant doesn't have it.

name: Ariel Avery
text: I've lived here for a year and I've thoroughly enjoyed  it. Maintenance is  speedy and my apartment location is prime.  Staff is friendly and helpful.

name: Kelli Conerly
text: I love the woodlands! I have lived here for 3 years and each year the amenities get better! It's a great place to live and would recommend it to anyone!

name: Khaled AlAD
text: This the worst apartment that I have ever had the place is unsafe and some people stolen my passport and my laptop and other stuff I really don’t recommend to make a lease with them because they are very rude and when I asked them about the cameras they said to my it is not our responsibility when they realized we are stolen they made me to leave the apartment before the investigation comes to our apartment. Even though every week we heard a shooting in woadlands of Tuscaloosa.

name: Zachary Savankham
text:
Their overages are ridiculous and they always seem to be offering better deals but won’t pass any to current residents who actually live here. You would think deals would automatically be shared with current residents who have put up with the bs (gunshots, break-ins, expensive overages)
And now cockroaches 🙂

resp.text: Zachary, we are sorry your experience has not been what you expected.  Overages are based solely on usage, and we would be more than happy to discuss any questions you have concerning your account.  We do offer our residents a "Best Rate Guarantee" to those who renewed at the beginning of the year. However, if you are still interested in renewing your agreement, we would be more than happy to discuss the offers you are eligible for at this time.  Please feel free to email us at live@woodlands-tuscaloosa.com or stop by the office at your earliest convenience.

name: Johnny Ireland
text: When our daughter moved in the place was a pig sty. Her bathroom was filthy and the furniture was old and  disgusting. Then they had the audacity to send us a cleaning bill when she left. Don't be fooled by the photos on there website.

resp.text: We are sorry to read that your experience at the Woodlands of Tuscaloosa has not been an enjoyable one. We make sure to document all charges during our move-out inspection, and would be more than happy to discuss any questions you may have. This time of year is one of our busiest times, so it may take a little longer than we would like to get back in touch with you, but if you would please e-mail us at live@woodlands-tuscaloosa.com our Resident Services Manager will contact you to discuss your concerns as soon as possible.

name: Bethany Coley
text: Absolutely worst experience of my life. Managers are rude beyond belief and don't expect any compensation if you move in and your apartment is a disaster. Also anyone who has made a good review of this place are the people that work there, so of course they get top notch service.

name: Siamoiya Turman
text: The Woodlands of Tuscaloosa is a great student living complex. There are many amenities available to the tenants. The woodlands is located close to campus, and the shuttle is also a great asset.

name: Paul Miller
text: My son had a terrible experience here.  He saw one of the residents get shot at.  Be careful when considering this place.

resp.text: Paul, we are concerned about your report of a negative experience at our property.  We were not made aware of the situation you mentioned, but our General Manager would like to discuss the situation with you further.  Please contact our office at 205.379.0088 at your earliest convenience.

name: LaTanya Richardson
text: In coming parents please be warned that this company does not do a good job with maintenance repairs. Nothing about our experience has been pleasant. They did not properly clean the apartment upon moving in. There were many maintenance issue from the very beginning that one of the parents contacted a health inspector to come in. Throughout the school year maintenance repairs have gone unaddressed. My child put in serveral work orders​ to have her center air repaired​ with no urgency from the management to address the matter. When she moved in there was a leak and at the end of the year there is a leak from a unknown source. I am certain there is mold by now.  Warning!!!!!  Consider long and hard before considering moving your child in this apartment complex......... Since the University of Alabama virtually requires your student in their sophomore year to move off campus there should be a better regulation system in place based upon School standards for the apartment complex in the community surrounding the campus. They completely take advantage of out-of-town students who parents aren't accessible to them and cannot see the poor conditions​ in which they live. Our kids are so excited to have their own place they don't realize the conditions are not acceptable and fail to address them when issues arise.

resp.text: Ms. Richardson, we are sorry to hear that your experience with the Woodlands has been anything short of pleasant.  As far as we know, all of the issues and concerns you had are taken care of and were addressed in a timely manner.  If there are any outstanding issues that we can help you with, please feel free to give us a call in the office.  We look forward to having your student as a resident of the Woodlands again next year!

name: Trent McDaniel
text: I have lived here for 3 years, and have always felt great about living here! The amenities are wonderful and they're always giving away free stuff and food at events. And who doesn't love free food?

name: Sagacious Chambers
text: The staff here is absolutely AMAZING.I feel like they have gone a above and beyond to help me prepare to move and the apartments are gorgeous! I'm preparing to move in soon!

name: Michael H
text: Two of my roommates cars were broken into late at night. Caused thousands of dollars in damage. Highly recommend against living here if you value your safety.

resp.text: Michael, we are sorry to learn that you have had less than enjoyable experience here at our property. I am not familiar with the incidents that you are referring to, but I am more than happy to speak to you about them. Our Residents are our number one priority and we work hard to provide a safe environment by having security patrol the property seven days a week and a courtesy officer who lives on-site. We would be more than happy to talk to you about any of these issues if you e-mail live@woodlands-tuscaloosa.com at your earliest convenience.

name: Waverly Jones
text: Don't get me wrong, I love the location and the apartments are nice. I honestly have nothing but good things to say about the apartments or amenities. The problem lies with the staff. They are never helpful and completely unrealistic. I have been waiting on something to be fixed for 3 weeks and have been told 4 different times that they will be out to fix it "today" and then they never come. When I had over 1000 ants in my bathroom they told me they couldn't do anything for a week but said they would come spray some windex on them. They never came. Their staff is inexperienced and they will tell you anything to get you to hang up or leave.  So basically they are rude and lie a lot. It would be more efficient to not even have a staff.

name: Damien Reacts
text: Just received an email stating that my check did not clear when there is clearly money in my account. Leasing office was no help.  They didnt tell me check is not clear until I receive an eviction notice. Please dont not live her at the woodlands or should I say hoodlands. If you know whats good you will find other residency.

resp.text: Damien, we appreciate your feedback and review of your experience at our community.  Thank you for taking the time to further discuss your concerns with us directly after this review.  We hope you are satisfied with our help on finding a solution to this issue.  Please do not hesitate to reach out to us if we can assist you further.

name: D Math
text: Don't ever move here. Don't be fooled by the incentives or the 5 star reviews that the staff puts out here. I have lived her for 3 years and it has gotten progressively worse. There are drug deals, people getting shot and just last week someone was robbed in broad daylight at gunpoint. The staff is incompetent. Make sure you have EVERYTHING in writing, they will lie or act dumb. The "SECURITY" is a freaking joke! I'm currently in a situation where they are allowing more than 4 people to live in a 4 bedroom unit. They fined my roommate but that's it. They have nothing in place to get people out of the apartment. It is a safety issue and they probably won't have anything in place until someone gets hurt. My roommate boyfriend has been living here for 4 months now. They haven't done any checkups to see if he is gone or anything without protecting the other roommates.

resp.text:
D Math,

We are sorry that feel this way, we appreciate all of our residents and are glad to have had you as one for the past 3 lease terms. As far as security issues we urge you to call the police if you ever feel unsafe, as they are the best equipped for that kind of situation. Please call our office if you have any other questions or concerns and we'd be happy to assist you!

name: Nicholas Magin
text: Today while me and my girlfriend were playing at the park with our dog, we found a dead puppy in a shoe box at the dog park by the creek @woodlandsua. We went to the office to tell the manager and they told up we had to take care of it ourselves because we found it... What a great manager... So we called animal control.

name: hunter baldwin
text: This is by far the worst apartment complex in Alabama! Super unprofessional, had the mangers lie about several things multiple time, and all together a horrible idea to spend money on living here. Please DO NOT waste your time or money with the Woodlands!!!!!

resp.text: Hunter, we appreciate your feedback and review of your experience at our community.  Thank you and your guarantor for taking the time to further discuss your concerns with us directly, after this review.  We're glad we could work out a solution together.  Please do not hesitate to reach out to us if we can assist you further.

name: magical asian (Gimmedachocs.)
text: Whoever gives 5 star here are depraved liars. Woodlands is too busy to sweep criminal activities under the carpet. I mean, there was shooting on last September! I never thought there would be an apartment complex that is worse than Campus Evolution.

resp.text: Paul, we regret that your experience at the Woodlands of Tuscaloosa has not been a positive one.  Unfortunately, we do not have you listed as a current or past resident in our computer system.  We take the safety of our residents very seriously, and would be more than happy to address your concerns further.  Please feel free to email us at office@woodlands-tuscaloosa.com.

name: Caleb Helms
text: Wish I could do less than one star. This place is the epitome of trash. They said my boyfriends check didn't go through when he had the money in his account to pay it and he didnt get notified that it didnt go through until they came knocking on his door with an eviction notice. Also, today (1/1) his rent is due and the website portal to pay it online is down and the office is closed. Unprofessional and unprepared staff.

name: Austin Finnen
text:
Cheaper than the dorms but not by much.  They claim you can include your utilities in the rent fee for only $40 (that's $160/mo for water and power for 4 people) but somehow they will overcharge you $30 each ($120/mo total for a room of 4) in one of those small apartments.  They also refuse to provide you with the wattage read-outs since they know the power company only checks every other month and estimates the month they skip.  Aside from this, the woodlands also never cleans the pool during the summer so don't plan on using it outside of the fall/spring semester.  My roommate was robbed at gunpoint 10 feet from our door; then they finally replaced the street lights around the buildings.  The employees and maintenance crew are about as incompetent as it gets (aside from the office manager, who is very helpful when she can be).

The few pros:

Fairly clean; I don't know where all these other people are getting their complaints from about dirty rooms on move in.

Useful amenities: nice gym, tanning beds, pool, movie theater, free food occasionally (if you post how awesome they are on facebook)

Bus to take you to campus and back that runs throughout the day.

Ending notes:

All in all, it's an acceptable apartment complex, however there are others far better in Tuscaloosa.  I chose them without doing any research because I needed a room fast; got locked in base rent and all.  My roommate is currently subleasing to someone who talked to the front office about continuing the lease after the sublease ends and just said the rent was "pricey" and they knocked it down from $595/mo to $520/mo just like that. I think they are starting to realize they're in trouble with the Retreat and The Lofts moving in so you should be able to negotiate a fair rent with them nowadays.

name: Krystyna Kridos
text: Not the best place in Tuscaloosa but definitely not the worst. I lived there for two years and only had a problem last summer when I had to move because mold formed while I was home for summer. The overages are also crazy so just be weary of that. People complain about gunshots and break ins but you're in a college town and it happens everywhere. Also the break ins happened to unlock cars so just lock your car and you'll be fine. It's a pretty decent place to live, definitely better than the lofts or crimson.  Also I heard new management is pretty good.

resp.text: Krystyna, we appreciate your review and feedback on your experience at the Woodlands of Tuscaloosa.  We are under new management and are working hard on improvements for our community.  Thanks you for sticking around with us!

name: April Daniels
text: My daughter who was visiting with a resident, C Moody on August 5, 2018.  She was assaulted by that resident due to her getting upset about an argument over a sorority choice.  I asked this apartment if they had any security cameras around the back apartments. I was told there are no security cameras except around the club house.  This is not a good place to live when you have many students and no security cameras.

resp.text: We are sorry that your interactions with our residents have not been as you expected.  We want to provide our residents and guests with outstanding customer service, so we're sorry you feel this is not what you received.  If you have further questions regarding your experience, please e-mail us at live@woodlands-tuscaloosa.com or call us at 205-379-0088.

name: Keyeriah Miles
text: Everything was handled smoothly! I got the best service and still am. Megan was a great help!

name: Austin Miller
text: I currently live at The Woodlands in a 2 bedroom, 2.5 bath townhome and I absolutely love it! It's very spacious, and the extra half bath downstairs is super convenient. All of the finishings are flawless from the curved shower rod to the appliances! There's definitely a modern, but comfortable, vibe in not only the units but the whole complex in general. The clubhouse speaks for it's self with the full gym and media rooms! In regards to the staff, they are all hardworking and genuinely care about all the tenants and their questions and concerns. I've only had to put in one maintenance request and it was completed in the utmost timely fashion. DEFINITELY RECOMMEND THIS PROPERTY AND WILL BE RESIGNING FOR AN EVEN BETTER RATE AND NO UTILITIES/OVERAGES! The Woodlands is always running great incentives for any new interests and even renewals!

name: Chelsey Holifield
text: The Woodlands is the worst student living experience I've ever had! The staff is ran by a bunch of young people that don't know what they are doing. I had to put in a million request to fix something in my apartment cause something was always breaking down. They had to come spray my apartment countless number of times for roaches.I always had about $60 to $40 worth of overages every month, even when cutting back on electricity!The crazy part is the overages went up and up every month that I lived there and they charge each roommate the same amount for overages each month.So each of the roommates in the 3 bd rm I was in paid $60-$40 extra a month per roommate. I can go on and on but long story short DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!

name: Erica W
text: The woodlands is an awesome place to live! I've stayed here for 2 1/2 years! I like the price & how the staff involves all the residents in monthly activities!

name: Zachary Brooks
text: After reading all of these reviews I see many people were done like me... Getting charged $12 for a lightbulb?? or getting charged $100 for "clean up" when you have to clean it yourself?? And get ready for overage city. I didn't stay for a whole month and still got overages. I know a place has to make money but believe the negative reviews about the excessive charges. You can get an apartment on campus for what you end up paying here. Very upset customer that has spend THOUSANDS of dollars with you for 2 years.

resp.text: We are sorry to read that your experience has not been as you expected. Our staff continues to work hard to provide a great experience for all our residents and guests. We would welcome the opportunity to discuss your concerns and issues directly with you, so we can work on improving your overall experience. Please e-mail us at live@woodlands-tuscaloosa.com at your earliest convenience.

name: Sarah Lane
text: The POSITIVE reviews are mostly for students who want free stuff or people who work here. If I could give a negative star as well, I would. The managers only want your money and do not care about you whatsoever. People who are moving into The Woodlands now are hardly students, which I was annoyed with living with a non student when I was student! I've heard that it is supposed to turn into section 8 housing and I can emphasize once again how awful management is. If you don't have to deal with them you may like the place. Do not use roommate matcher unless you want to be miserable all you. Get all the free food out of them as you can because they're going to drain your bank account with overages.

name: Joe Stellarus
text: This place is absolutely horrible! Jennifer Lauth does not do her job well and will not return any calls. I have had to call the police multiple times because of people drag racing in the parking lots. I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy. I've been informed that this complex is getting turned into Section 8 housing. DO NOT SIGN HERE. Management does not know how to correctly run this complex or know how to hire knowledgeable staff members.

name: Lynn
text:
I would give a negative Star if Possible!!!   Terrible experience from beginning to end for both Student and Parent!
Nasty when moved in, Garbage was usually running out in the road from the dumpster----   of course the smell was always horrible!
Crime- gun shots, breaking into vehicles all hours of the night!   Police agreed that it was not unusual to get calls.
After 2nd month started receiving overages on utilities.  And no matter if anyone was there for 30 days, 10 days in a month (holidays) always an overage as soon as the 1st was received!

Charged for damage to a couch that was plastic and the only way it would not have torn is if it was put in a corner covered up and not used!

No one lived in the apartment for 6 weeks ---  All 3 tenants had moved out and AMAZING -- Overage on Utilities!

Staff if RUDE and MANAGEMENT IS EVEN MORE RUDE!

I never called with complaint or request that anything was ever done!!

RUN!!!!!  DO NOT GO THRU THE HEADACHE WITH THIS COMPANY!

resp.text: Lynn, we are sorry your experience has been anything less than pleasant.  The Woodlands of Tuscaloosa has undergone new ownership and we are undergoing improvements, including new management with a focus on quality, professionalism, and customer service.  We would love to discuss these issues with you further. Please feel free to contact our office at your earliest convenience or email us at office@woodlands-tuscaloosa.com.

name: Khalan Williams
text:
This apartment has absolutely suck from day1! Bad customer service! They wanted my daughter & her roommates to wash their dirty dishes in their bathrooms! Here’s the email to prove it. I copied & paste it... This sad! When I tell you! DON’T LET YOUR KIDS/STUDENTS MOVE HERE AT ALL! IM A PARENT OF ONE OF THE ROOMATES & IM PISSED! THIS PERSON THAT REPLIED WAS SAMANTHA! THESE STUDENTS LOST THEIR DISHES DUE TO SITTING WATER!!!!! THIS IS NOT HOW TO RESPOND IN A PROFESSIONAL MANNER! Managers never respond back in a timely manner at all! Again, IVE NEVER SEEN AN UNPROFESSIONAL APARTMENT COMPLEX EVER IN LIFE!

I apologize that the repair took longer than we had expected, but there are other sinks in your apartment that could have been used to temporarily clean your dishes. I also purchased paper products for you and your roommates to use since you couldn't wash dishes in your kitchen sink. ALL ROOMATES & MYSELF WILL BE CONTACTING THE BETTER BUSINESS BUREAU ASAP!

resp.text: We regret to learn that you did not enjoy your experience at our community.  Our staff works hard to provide a great experience for all our residents and guests.  We would welcome the opportunity to discuss your concerns and issues directly with you, please e-mail us at live@woodlands-tuscaloosa.com at your earliest convenience.

name: Stephanie Achilli
text: The woodlands is so desperate to get their rating up they’re offering a chance at $200 for anyone who leaves a review

resp.text: Stephanie, we are so sorry that you have had a less than enjoyable experience here at the Woodlands but we most certainly want to make this right for you. We did ask for our residents to write reviews, but there is nothing stating that they have to be positive. We just want feedback on ways we can improve! I am confident that we can get your issues resolved and turn your experience around, if you would call our office at 205.379-0088 or email us at office@woodlands-tuscaloosa.com at your earliest convenience. We look forward to hearing from you soon!

name: avery Montgomery
text: I love the community and the how the woodlands treats their guest we call woodlands home!! Keep it up

name: Ashley Wise
text: I first moved to the Woodlands in 2011 in the brand new second phase in a town home with my friends and absolutely loved it. After that it got worst, since the Woodlands isn't gated there would be a lot of 'local people' coming on to the property one night my roommates car got kicked in and shattered due to some people throwing a party. When one of my roommates decided to move out the staff placed a girl in our apartment that had two large dogs. She never cleaned up after them and destroyed our whole apartment. The staff even allowed her to bring in a large refrigerator because she 'didn't have room' in ours. Jennifer the leasing manager at the time told us to deal with our roommate and if she was such a problem then move out after she threatened our lives, NUMEROUS times. After forcing the office to move me to another unit since I couldn't find a sublease to get out of the hell hole my new apartment WAS NOT CLEAN, the bed was broke, there were stains all over the walls, the window was broken, nothing had been taken care of. When I told the office they needed to take care of this they never showed up, EVER. Later in the year there was a domestic dispute that involved TPD around my unit the gentleman destroyed cars in the parking lot and none of the Woodlands staff came out there, one of the property managers even lived in the building across from our building where it happened. I lived in a flat after moving out of my townhouse, during the spring the maintenance somehow never connected the hose to the apartment above ours washer after doing an inspection. That caused their apartment to flood which overflowed in ours through the ceiling my closet and bedroom were completely flooded ruining my belongings, our kitchen and dining area were flooded as well. They tore holes in our ceiling ripped up my carpet and said they would come back to fix it and never did. On top of our apartment being soaked they told my roommates and I that we needed to deal with and they weren't letting us stay anywhere else even though they caused this problem. Once I moved out they charged me over $300 in move out fees for things that I told them to fix, for a light bulb that was out, and a bunch of other ridiculous things. I knew they would expect money but not that much for little things, I thought that was the whole reason for a security deposit. If I could give this place a -100 I most definitely would. This place is AWFUL! I know the incentives sound good that's how they got me to renew my lease by offering $500 but this place isn't worth it, I had to deal with text alerts about muggings and gunmen on the property, there was a shooting in unit 2, and overall it lives up to it's name 'The Hoodlands' this place is the absolute worst and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. I'm so glad I was finally able to get out of the hell hole.

text: I have lived at the Woodlands for 4 years and have never had any issues. I find it super convenient and easy to live here. People who work here have been nothing but friendly and helpful. I wouldn't live here for 4 years if it was anything less than great!

name: Matthew London
text: Great place to live for anyone with Pets. I have lived here for two years and don't plan on leaving anytime soon.

name: Dylan P
text: I normally do not write reviews, but this place is a complete joke. Where to start? I was an out of state student and I regret not looking into other places. I lost a lot of money in this place and a lot of trust in any college amenity living. Overages every month, always something not working correctly in the unit, locks never working properly, staff who are clueless and I am surprised how they function day to day (I'm not joking.) There was never any clear reason for overages, they always would just compare it to the trends from the year before or say other units are paying overages too. So take this review whichever way you want, but my advice I can give everyone in Tuscaloosa, stay away from The Woodlands!!

name: Brittany B.
text: I have one word to describe this place. TRASH. There has been a problem with roaches in my apartment since the day I moved in. Sure, they send pest control out but that doesn't do much in an apartment complex if neighboring units aren't keeping their house clean and also recieving pest control. Anyone who does a lick of research would know that. Not to mention their "repairs" are garbage. Our control panel on the stove broke and you know what they did to fix it? They used duct tape. And what do you know..within the same week it was broken again. My roommate and I put in mulitple maintenance requests for the stove and you know what they used everytime? Duct tape. Woodlands, Do you know what doing the same thing over and over again and expecting a different outcome is called? Insanity. And that's exactly what this place is. The Woodlands is honestly a scam. Oh, and the clubhouse has roaches as well. I couldn't even enjoy a night swim in the summer because there were roaches living it up all over the place. I overheard the manager telling another resident over the phone that "we live in a pest filled world" and basically to suck it up and deal with it. PURE TRASH. Unless you like cohabitating with creatures or overpaying for certified garbage, I highly suggest you find somewhere else to live.

resp.text: Brittany, we appreciate your feedback and you taking the time to discuss your concerns with us one on one.  I certainly understand where your frustration lies, and in order to try and fully remedy this situation, we are going to have DC Scientific Pest Control, our pest control provider, come to your apartment each week until you feel more comfortable in your apartment.  I have reached out to you again via email, and please feel free to contact us if you have any further questions or concerns.

Do not move here at all

name: Caroline Pearson
text: You're better off living in a box than at the woodlands. This past year has been an absolute living nightmare. My roommate situation was awful and no matter how much I had gone to management my option was to pay $200 to move and then I was told I wasn't guaranteed the same rent rate because they didn't know what my apartment option would be. My roommate had a mini fridge full of maggots which was causing serious health/pest concerns and all I got from management was "we will see what we can do." I don't understand how a health violation is not a lease violation! I had been threatened by my roommate, intimidated, scared to leave my room, and I couldn't do anything about it because I was not financially able to do so. I believe there needs to be options for people in a position, that is documented, to get out of a dangerous situation but the Woodlands doesn't care about you as a tenate. My roommate also flooded her room by a clogged toilet which ended up leaking into the living room and all maintenance did was bring her a fan to dry her room. I ultimately got to clean up the flooded living room. This place is awful. Management has NO idea how to handle things and won't try to help you. Whatever you do, stay clear of this place. From the worst management I've ever dealt with to the lovely sounds of gun shots at night... beware!!!!

resp.text: Caroline, we regret to hear that your experience with your roommates did not go as you expected. We do our best to mediate roommate conflicts, but at anytime you feel unsafe we would instruct you to contact local law enforcement.  We did address the mini refrigerator concern and removed the refrigerator and cleaned it. If there are any outstanding issues or concerns you have, please feel free to reach out to us at office@woodlands-tuscaloosa.com.

resp.text: Ari, we regret to hear that your experience thus far at the Woodlands of Tuscaloosa has not been a positive one.  We appreciate your feedback and are constantly working to improve.  If you are still experiencing any issues, please contact our office so we can address and assist you with any issues you may be experiencing.

name: Josh Hylton
text:
Trust me. This review will be worth the read.

To start off, the phone number that you'll find on any site is not the right number; good luck trying to find it, can't really remember how I managed to get in touch with the 24/7 operator in order to be let back into my home. Also, I can count at least 7 times where I told them that the number was incorrect. So, just to start, this is what you're in for living here.

If you are unlucky enough to figure out what the number is, it's not like your maintenance request/security concern/need will be met or even humored. The security here is laughable, showing up high to just break up a small party or something and not even showing up when people are setting fireworks off and hitting the side of my apartment building. Speaking of the lack of security, there have been multiple firearm discharges and shootings here where little to nothing has been done. Or, even better, has been swept under the rug in order to maybe stop the running joke of calling this place "the hoodlands".

At first glance it looks like a decent place with nice rooms; which is true for the most part. I moved in without a mattress and my roommate moved in with God knows what on the carpeting in his room. So, if you're lucky, you won't have to deal with that. But then again, track record shows you will and it'll take quite a while to fix whatever issue you have.

The management is not great at all. I'm not sure if it's the work order making it to maintenance or maintenance following through with the request, but it'd be months before they come out to fix whatever it is. I had a hole in my door for about 4 months and ON TOP OF THAT they tried charging me for it when we (management and I) had emailed back and forth making it clear that I wouldn't be.

So don't be fooled by the nice pictures at any apartment complex, but please don't be fooled by The Woodlands. You'll have more headache here than imagineable and if you're a student coming here, you've got enough on your plate trying to keep up grades, sleeping, and a social life. There's no point in getting involved in an apartment agency that's only going to make your time here a pain; between the kinds of people that may be living around you, the lack of security, and the lack of caring by the management. I'm sure the owner will comment back on here trying to save as much face as physically possible, probably saying they've changed management and whatnot, but it hasn't gotten better me they've been in control since the top of the year. Don't live here, please. These people running this place, higher up than the students that work on site, need to get the idea that the way things are run around here won't cut it.

resp.text: Josh, we regret to hear that your experience thus far at the Woodlands of Tuscaloosa has not been what you expected.  We appreciate your feedback and you are correct we were recently acquired by new ownership and are in the process of undergoing significant improvements that include quality, professionalism, and customer service.  We would love the opportunity to address each one of your concerns with you further, and work together to come up with a resolution.  Please contact the front office at your earliest convenience by phone at 205-379-0088 or email us at live@woodlands-tuscaloosa.com.  We look forward to hearing from you soon and working together to improve your experience at The Woodlands of Tuscaloosa.

So i just moved out... and they are billing me with all kinds of charges... from the mail key to the wristband.. when i returned it... and im getting billed of other things such as the sofa cushion for over 100!!!! and there have been murders... shootings.. so no you are not safe here if you chose to live here... dont listen to the good reviews..

resp.text: The $90 move out fee covered the painting and cleaning that needed to be done for the new tenant that moved in this past August.  We are sorry that you do not agree with this fee, but it was clearly defined in Addendum A upon signing your lease with the Woodlands of Tuscaloosa.  It is very common to incur some charges when moving out of an apartment complex.  They can be much higher at other communities and are often times referred to as the “Redecorating Fee.”  If you would like to dispute any additional charges, please feel free to send an email to moveout@woodsua.com and our corporate office will look at the pictures we have on file to see if any charges can be adjusted.  If you have any additional questions, feel free to give us a call at (205) 758-0833.  Getting your issues resolved is important to us.

name: Madeline Everett
text: Nice place to live and the staff is nice!

resp.text: Madeline, we appreciate your review and kinds words!

name: Logan Ingle
text:
I moved into a two-bedroom flat at The Woodlands in 2012 and enjoyed it enough to sign again in 2013. My experience with management, the staff, amenities and my apartment itself were all pleasant with only a few bumps along the way that were properly handled as they came up. I hate to get on here and see such negative reviews, but I know many people will only speak out when something goes wrong--so that's why I'm here shedding some light on what an actual experience is like for the typical tenant at The Woodlands. I moved into my apartment the first year with a friend from back home and we experienced a speedy move-in process as far as paperwork and negotiating went. We walked in to find a very clean apartment that was in great condition. There was no sign of previous tenants--even the carpet in our bedrooms and drip pans on the stove had been replaced (which we later learned is standard upon every move-out). We were impressed. Our first few months there went well and without bumps, but then a couple of guys living in the town-home above us left the lid on their washer up and it flooded their apartment and ours. We had water falling from light fixtures, cracks in drywall sheetrock, running down the windows.. it was a nightmare. We contacted management at The Woodlands and they had ServPro there drying up the damage within 12 hours and they left fans and dehumidifiers in the apartment for 3-4 days in order to let it dry completely behind the sheetrock and all. My roommate and I stayed with friends in a nearby unit while this drying took place, as the fans and equipment was pretty loud. After the equipment was gone, we worried that we might have to pay extra in utility bills because of so much power being pulled to operate it all but they gave us both $50 Visa gift cards to offset the extra costs on utilities.

The bottom line is: The Woodlands is a nice and reasonably-priced place to live in Tuscaloosa. My roommate and I always tried to be reasonable and professional in dealing with management and staff when things would come up and they, in turn, gave us the same fair treatment we gave them. Jennifer, in particular, was always a pleasure to deal with and we usually tried to go through her. We always made it a point to keep record of all our communication and dealings with them so that even if they tried to be unfair, we knew it was possible to go to corporate with issues--although we never had to, thankfully.

name: Melanie Alexander
text:
The Woodlands of Tuscaloosa is a terrible sham. This apartment complex cons you in everyway possible. The staff is unproffesional. The amenities that are offered are just more lies fed to the tenants. For example, The Woodlands offer a package that is "all-inclusive",however, most tenants would recieve notices of overages. Those that did not recieve any notices were usually under a certain meter range (this is not discussed at the time of the tours offered or the lease signing) and any extra money that is paid for the all-inclusive is kept by the apartment (mho). The complex offers free printing as an amenity, yet the printer was ALWAYS broken. Upon moving out The Woodlands, tenants recieve insane charges. My roommates and I were charged for a damaged couch. I find that odd since we were not the most social bunch, and we did not congregate in the living room. I was also the last person to move out of the unit. I know for a fact that the couch was not damaged. At this time I had already renewed my lease with the complex before any problems had occured. My second year with the complex, my roommate had a dog. The dog damaged blinds in the living room, because the dog was in her contract I was assured that I would not be charged for damages SEVERAL times (I asked several times). My roommate also talked with the complex to make sure that I was not charged, but being ran by the imbeciles that they are, of course I was charged. There is absolutely nothing good about this apartment complex besides that it is appealing to the eyes. I suggest looking for other options. If you do live there, make sure that when moving out you take pictures of absolutely everything. If you are charged for damages, they will only be removed from your bill if you can provide them with photos.

Other fun facts about the woodlands:

1. When I moved into my second unit, the place was disgusting. I was told I could not move into my unit at a certain time because they were cleaning and painting.
2-10. Because I had lived there the previous year I was able to move into my unit earlier than my roommate who had not. Since her lease was ending with The Retreat, she had requested that she be able to move in early. She was currently in summer school. The Woodlands denied her request because they were "cleaning and painting". I allowed her to move her mattress and things into the filthy living room of our new unit, before we left for the east coast. When we came back she was able to recieve the key to her room. The room was filthy just like the rest of the unit. Men's underwear were found in her dresser drawer, as well as a set on the mattress in the living room. We do not know who they belonged to nor where they came from. She bagged the underwear and took them to the complex's office. She was met with laughs from the college students, and the manager shushing her since they were in the process of trying to con other customers to sign a lease.

Living here was a nightmare.

***The statements in my review about The Woodlands of Tuscaloosa are my opinion and not fact. My personal treatment at the complex is fact. Just a little disclaimer***

resp.text: Clanesha, unfortunately you were transferring to an apartment early and only that specific bedroom was ready for move-in.  After we spoke to you and confirmed that the apartment had been cleaned, we worked together to find the best solutions to your concerns.  From our last conversation we were under the impression that you wanted to start our delegation process.  We have tried to assist you in the best way we know how, but if we can be of any other assistance please reach out to us at your earliest convenience.

name: Charles Ellis
text:
Like many places in Tuscaloosa, this place is way overpriced and the staff is worthless. They have these 18 year old kids staffing the front and any time you have to work something out with the management, the little minions literally walk back and forth from the front to the back and be worthless middlemen.

They will try to take advantage of students at every turn. Make sure you get everything in writing.

name: Sawyer Bailey
text: Great place to live!

name: Tyler Torres
text: Absolutely terrible place to live. Avoid at all costs

resp.text:
Tyler,
Making your experience at the Woodlands better is a priority. Please give us a call at 205-758-0833.
Thanks.

name: tia magee
text: I love the woodlands!

name: Jerilynn Nicole
text: there's like always free food. Move here.

name: Jackson Goodwin
text: Very satisfied!

resp.text: Jackson, we are glad to hear you are enjoying your time at the Woodlands of Tuscaloosa.  If we can assist you in any way, please do not hesitate letting us know.

name: Kiana Bryant
text: Great place to live

name: Shamarkus Kennedy
text: Good morning to you

name: Andrew Reynolds
text: kinda dumpy

resp.text: Hi Banjo, we regret to see that your experience has not been a great one. If there are specific issues you're having, please reach out to us as we would love the opportunity to address them for you. Feel free to stop by the office or email management directly at live@redpoint-tuscaloosa.com. We look forward to speaking with you soon!

name: Teresa Faccas
text: the staff is wonderful!!

name: Fiona Coupe
text: A little sketchy

resp.text: Fiona, we regret to hear that your experience has not been what you expected.  We strive to keep our property clean and have a staff that focuses on doing just that. We also have a Courtesy Officer that lives on site, Security that patrols after hours, and there is always a Manager on call if needed. Our goal is to provide a clean, safe, and enjoyable living environment for all of our Residents. Myself or a member of our staff would be more than happy to sit down with you and go over any concerns that you have. Please email us at live@woodlands-tuscaloosa.com or stop by the office at your earliest convenience.

name: Taylor South
text: THE WORST

name: Neecee Michelle
text: Parents! Please! Listen to me! I'm a parent of a student that chose to move into these apartments! Do not let your child or anyone you know move in here! Terrible, dangerous place to live! Management are very unprofessional and are so rude and disrespectful! People who are writing good reviews are flat out lying! Close this place down! If I could give a negative 10 I would! Please trust me as a parent!

resp.text: Neecee, we strive for 100% satisfaction, and we regret to find out that this was not the case. We would like the opportunity to address your concerns. Please fee . We are here for you and would be more than willing to speak with you further about your concerns when you are able. Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you.

name: Ron Colwart
text: PARENTS DO NOT LET YOUR CHILDREN RENT HERE! It gives the illusion of being safe with the gate, but it hardly ever works.  There was a shooting here and the management didn’t think it was appropriate to contact residents about it.  We found out about it on the news the next day. Stairwells and walkways are dirty, trashy, bandaids, broken glass and poor lighting! Definitely needs a good cleaning! Charged my daughter $50 to clean the carpet at the entrance to her room.  We asked for a picture, they sent us the pictures of before she moved out.  The picture looked like it’s a shadow or the way the carpet fibers are move after vacuuming.  Wish I could upload the picture they sent me on this review! Totally ridiculous, they rip you off!

name: D KNIGHT
text: I normally don’t leave google reviews. But since I had a decent living experience at Campus Quarters I decided to leave one. I chose Campus Quarter because they were affordable and offer competitive rates compared to the other student housing properties. Also, compared to the other properties CQ looks nice inside and out. The property manager Mike is very helpful at fulfilling residents requests.  Any problem I had I went to Mike (property manager) and he insured me that he will take care of it. And he did. CQ is a very quiet property no complaints of noise or my neighbors. Parking also was convenient for me which was definitely a plus. In all CQ offers good customer service, good rates, and a good living experience.

name: Kelsey King
text: I love living here! Staff is very nice and helpful. Never had a problem that wasn’t fixed immediately. One of the nicer student apartments in the area and it’s fairly quiet most of the time. 10/10 recommend

resp.text: Hi Kelsey! Thank you for taking time to review us! We're so happy that you are enjoying living at Campus Quarters and that your needs are being met quickly and efficiently. Residents like you are what make us love what we do!

name: James Robertson
text: Very welcoming and  professional staff, they always go above and beyond to help out with anything from paperwork to finding the right roommate.  I went through a tough situation in life and they made everything easy for me to get settled in my place.  10 stars for the office staff!  The amenities are impressive, I love the fitness center.  I would recommend campus quarters to anyone.

resp.text: Hi James! Thank you for taking time to review us.  We are so happy that you are enjoying living at Campus Quarters and we are so glad to have you as a resident!

name: Nathan Schroeder
text:
Great staff! nice affordable living space and super close to campus.
Definitely recommending campus quarters to my friends.
Also the maintenance team is badass :D

resp.text: Thank you, Nathan!

name: Cole Zane
text: For anyone looking for an apartment to rent do not go to Campus Quarters. This is one of the worst places I’ve ever lived at. They will find everything to charge you for even if it has nothing to do with you. We had bugs in our apartment almost the entire time we live there and all my roommates were very clean. I said something to the managers about it and they said everybody has bugs there’s nothing we can do about it. We also experienced random power outages on a weekly basis. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!! I lived there for a year and half. Later I moved back thinking it had gotten better “they had a promo” is the only reason I moved back. They will hound you the entire time you live there about renewing your lease even after you tell them you don’t want to. Just a horrible place to live! Hope nobody has to go through all of this.

resp.text: Hi, Cole. We are sorry to see that you feel this way about our staff and that you feel that your experience has declined. We want to assure you that our staff values you as a resident and wants to see that your experience can get back to where it was. We are here for you and would be more than willing to speak with you further when you are able. Thank you. - Campus Quarters

name: Aeriell Lapsley
text: My sister lives at this community and she absolutely loves it. The community is extremely clean and the office staff is friendly too. 5 stars for me!!!

resp.text: Hi Aeriell! Thank you for taking time to review us! We're so happy that your sister is enjoying living with us at Campus Quarters!

name: Callie S
text:
Awful place to live DO NOT move into Campus Quarters. They will randomly charge you for unknown fees, not very accurate data as far as charges, balance and account statements, most of the time the gate remains open which is a safety hazard for anyone living there. The pool is closed most of the time because of lack of maintenance. The common areas are not always clean and you more likely will step on dog feces...
Customer service will put you on a loop in regards of giving you a concise answer to your concerns or questions on random charges on your account so that never gets resolved or it could take up to 3 months for your problem to be unsatisfactory solved. I would highly recommend to look around for a better place. Also Campus Quarters monthly rent is higher than any other student housing around the area. If I could give a ZERO on this feedback I would. Please do your research.

name: asia brackett
text: Best Living Experience as a young adult. I highly recommend ALL COLLEGE STUDENTS YOUNG Adult and really anyone to move in

name: Chantal Whatley
text: Friendly and professional staff! Felt very welcome

resp.text: Hi Chantal and thank you for taking time to review us! We're so happy to hear about your wonderful experience with us at Campus Quarters!

name: Brandon Dorsett
text: From the friendly staff and the maintenance team who were so proactive and helpful, my overall experience living here was great. Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback, Brandon!

name: Duane Clark
text: As a parent of a student I would suggest any parent thinking of putting their student here to rethink that decision.   Bug infestations are common at this place and additional fees are common place.  Be prepared to even pay out the butt at move out.  No matter how good the room is when your student leaves, plan on $150 cleaning fee for a single bedroom and carpet cleaning of $75 even if the carpet and room are better than it was when your student moved in. They rob students and families here and it's a shame

name: Tristan Garcia
text: If your parents pay your rent then I would suggest living here. Otherwise money hungry and will charge you for anything. Most positive reviews on here are fake.

name: Zadora Edwards
text: I have lived here twice now, once a couple of years ago and once now. This time I can honestly say that I had an amazing experience. Ms. Carletta and her staff are nice and helpful and they really care. Even when things are not going great financially they do their best to work with you and help you. They do everything in their power to give you a great experience.

resp.text: Thanks for the feedback, Zadora! Glad the staff has #1 customer service!!

name: Tyler Jernigan
text: I have really enjoyed living here over the past few months. I really enjoy all the accommodations that they offer and the staff is always helpful. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for an apartment

resp.text: Thank you, Tyler! Happy to hear our staff is taking care of you!

name: Christian Long
text: Do not let them scam you. Never pay the amount they say you do. Their system is set up to take as much money from you as they can, while keeping themselves in the clear. Apartments are not cleaned prior to move in. If you are going to spend this type of money, go get a real apartment. This place is not worth it. Not to mention the whole place smells like a marijuana dispensary. I looked at these reviews and gave them a chance, I don’t want you to make the same mistake.

resp.text: Hello Christian, I am sorry we did not meet your expectations. I am not seeing you as a resident in our system, could you please reach out to residentconcerns.com so we can assist? Thank you,

name: Em Ivey
text: Okay so long story but just don’t live here. It wasn’t so much the issues with the apartment as much as it was the issues with the staff. The maintenance people are great and some of the staff are too but I will say I went through a lot and no one did anything to help me. I’ve had several apartments and never have I had a management team that cared so little about the people that live there. My mother had cancer. I got a degenerative disk disease. And my little sister had a tumor. And then I decided to go into the military and I started looking for a sublet. I found one and last minute, it fell through, really screwing me on rent. So I asked for a minute to handle it after paying hospital bills and fines and such and I received rude treatment and no time to handle it. Then my hours dropped at work due to covid-19 and I was unable to do it within the time frame. So I just decided to move out and deal with the move out costs. I was treated horribly after doing so and today I received a call from Mr.Rosengarten who cussed on the phone with me and acted like my problems don’t matter. I told him that they were supposed to take off late fees but they never did (I wasn’t sure if that would help take down the balance a little bit) and he was incredibly mean to me about the fact that that wasn’t enough and that I was confused about that. THIS IS A COLLEGE LIVING PLACE. I’m in my 20s. I don’t deserve to be treated that way by anyone. I’d been through a lot and I was confused and he treated me like I was stupid and cussed at me. I DO NOT recommend living here at all. They are rude and treat you horribly.

name: Hunter Powell
text: I enjoyed living here when I did. The staff was nice. The game room was a fun and cool place to hang out with your friends. I highly recommend living here.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Hunter!

name: ABASMR
text: I absolutely love living here! The staff is great and it honestly feels like a family. Living here has made my college experience 100x better. I highly recommend living here!

resp.text: Thank you, Anna! We love our CQ Fam!

name: Madisyn Jones
text: If I could give ZERO stars I would!!! My friend has had so many problems with this apartment complex since the day she moved in last August... Broken Gates, Terrible Roommates (she requested not to live with any pets, she ended up with roommates that had dogs & cats with FLEAS), recently her apartment was infested with TERMITES!! (yet has done nothing about it) My friend had to check into a hotel because they’re everywhere, even in her bed!! The front desk people are unbelievable!! Completely disgusting! Do not live here!!

resp.text: Hi Madisyn, I see that you aren't a resident with us. Could you ask your friend to reach out to residentconcerns.com so we can address any issues she is having? Thank you!

name: Dyah LeDuff
text: Not a good place for college students to live. You will come out better applying for your own apartment. You stuck with whoever they put you with. They hit you with fees for anything. My advice if you gone pay this kind of money. You definitely don’t want an unknown person in your space. Prices are ridiculous. I won’t be resigning. Everyone experiences is different. It all up to you.

resp.text: Hello Dyah, we are sorry you feel like that and would like to help in any way we can with any issues you are having. If you reach out to residentconcerns.com we would love to discuss. Thank you!

name: Jordan Mitchell
text: Staff is always great, on point, & always ready to help at all times! All of the amenities are extremely useful and a nice touch to the property. My favorite part is the dog park they have in the complex for me dog to get some energy out :)

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback Jordan!

name: jermale daniels
text: I’ve been living at campus Quarters for 1 year. Front desk staff are amazing with friendly service. The turn around time for maintenance is amazing. They love their residents. It literally no place like CQ!

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback Jermale! I'm glad our staff has #1 customer service!

name: Kaylee Brown
text: Super friendly staff. The pool is beautiful, and the rates are great! I plan on moving there this Summer!

resp.text: Thanks for the feedback Kaylee!

name: Hailey Curtis
text: If i could leave zero stars I would. This place is a joke. Management doesn’t do anything if you have an issue. The woman in the front office rolls her eyes at you if you try to ask a question. The new people they hire are usually more helpful and friendly. Unless they know you’re renewing they couldn’t care less. You get charged a 60 dollar cleaning fee that they pocket because my apartment was absolutely disgusting. There were roaches in my room, bugs in the freezer, and an old donut box meaning clearly the room wasn’t checked. They put random charges on and since they assume college age kids won’t check, and they take advantage of you. They’re unprofessional and my power bill over summer was 20 dollars over. They put in a work order to check the apartment and the check wasn’t complete until 2 days after bills came out. They don’t care about residents just the money that comes with them. I wouldn’t ever suggest this place to a friend.

name: Christopher Nelson
text: Hey, I’ve lived here for three years. I’ve enjoyed every minute that I’ve lived at Campus Quarters. There is always a warm face greeting you at the office. All I can say is I recommend Campus Quarters!

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback Christopher!

name: Lauren Abbott
text: Super Friendly staff. I love how I always have a safe place to call my new home!

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback, Lauren! Glad you #LoveWhereYouLive!

name: Alex Hicks
text: The staff is great. The maintenance crew is super nice and get to me fast. The front desk staff is always nice and helpful. I love living here.

resp.text: Thank you, Alex! Glad you are enjoying your stay at CQ!

name: Brenton Weaver
text: Went to meet some friends and had a great time. Nice place that feels secure yet inviting.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Brenton!

name: Zach Francis
text: Very friendly welcoming place. Staff is great and  I enjoy all the amenities

name: Gage Coleman
text: I love living here. Staff is very friendly and the pool is great during the summer.

resp.text: Thank you, Gage! Be on the lookout for awesome resident events coming up!

name: hunter jernigan
text: It’s a great place to live. They take care of all the things you need taken care of and the pool is really nice.

resp.text: Thank you, Hunter! CQ's pool is definitely #1!

name: Taylor Cooper
text: This place and its staff was a big part of my college experience and I would highly recommend it!

name: Janet Kennedy
text: Campus Quarters offers great management and the satisfaction of its residents are very important to the staff. Kenyatta is a leasing agent for Campus Quarters and she goes above and beyond for her residents. Our living room carpet had been destroyed by the residents before us and she came herself with equipment to clean our carpet. Living here has been a great experience so far especially with the advantages of the pool, weight room, and computer lab which is great if you are a student!

name: Andrew Selph
text: I love living here it's great. The staff is amazing.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Andrew!

name: Jeff Hall
text: In the beginning it was pretty great, but then management changed. I wouldn't reccomend this place to anyone unless it is out of complete necessity. After checking your place, they leave room doors unlocked and lights on. Constantly getting bills wrong. Overcharging. If you don't say anything it won't be corrected. Its supposed to be a hated community, but the gates are usually broken. Maitanence is usually pretty good. Overall the last year and a half was horrible with the management team. Upon move out make sure that you asked them about the specific things you're responsible for. They charge a $65 cleaning feels for each member but that does not include the common areas so you might as well double that price. They're going to get their money one way or the other.

name: Jacob Warye
text: This 5 stars is for the maintenance team. All three gentlemen who do all off the maintenance here have always been a class act and are so helpful with the little needs we have had. These guys have truly made living in our apartment and keeping up with the demands of CQ excellent and these guys do an outstanding and exquisite job providing maintenance care to us and our apartment. Maintenance can be overshadowed at times but these guys deserve a ton of credit for CQ’s success. Props to you guys for all of your hard work and help in the past three years. 🤘🤘

resp.text: Hi Jacob! Thank you for your review and feedback. We are happy to hear the maintenance team has been so great :) High five to them!

name: A.Marie Murphy
text: Campus Quarters is a great place to have a first experience with living in an apartment. The facilities are nice and modern, they also offer pretty much anything you could think of an apartment complex having. Any problems that may be faced can easily be resolved, as maintenance is very easy to get a hold of and there's always someone at the front desk in the main office. The location is also extremely convenient, besides the fact that it's barely 3 minutes from USA; it is also near many restaurants and fast food places. To top that off, there are several groceries stores all within a 0.7-2.4 mile radius and it's fairly close to all of the entertainment that can be found on the Airport strip.

name: Joy McCloud
text: Do NOT rent here! I along with other student residents, lost our jobs when the University closed due to COVID-19, however, campus quarters refused to offer any assistance to those who may be struggling to make payments. Instead they have threatened to evict us and charge us with $100 late fees that they refuse to remove from our accounts. They do not have the well-being of the residents in mind!

name: Emily Huhn
text: Okay, the kitchen in the 2 bedroom is amazing. There's enough counter space for me to cook and make a mess. My roommate and I always have enough room in the cabinets too. We had a couple of things go wrong with our sink, but the office and maintenance guys took care of it super fast and was really responsive. After they did that, I renewed my lease for next year because it's hard to find apartments where the people care.

name: Lanace Davis
text: As a parent of a resident, I’d hoped for a clean safe environment. Move in day was a joke. You pay a yearly $75 cleaning fee only to have to do a major cleaning upon moving in. The vents were caked in dust, the floors and carpets were disgusting with stains. Half of the light bulbs were blown, I swept up, what looked like an entire bag of rice from the floor behind the refrigerator, along with a cell phone case and a hairbrush. It was just nasty!  Then come the “overages”. Almost every month it was something else. I paid twice for a window blind to be replaced and when the third charge occurred, I called and complained because it was never fixed, even upon the date my Son moved out. They claim to offer free WiFi, my Son was without WiFi for over 4 months, and reported it weekly. The security gate was broken close to 7 out of the 12 months he lived there and just stayed open 24 hours a day. There was a shooting in the parking lot and when I called to get answers about it the next day, I was told that they didn’t know what I was talking about. It made the news, but nobody in the business office had a clue. Find somewhere else to live!  Don’t waste your hard earned money on this place!

name: jakki amos
text: I normally don't write reviews, good or bad; however, I believe the issue I had with Campus Quaters was handled with professionalism by the management team.  Thank you Michael Quinn and Carletra Cheeseboro for resolving this issue for me!!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Jakki! Happy to hear Mike and Carletta took care of you!

name: Kellie Orewiler
text: Customer service is truly one of a kind. From the moment you walk in the door the staff is ready to assist with ANYTHING you need! As a resident you truly feel cared about! The gym is always open and the pool is the prettiest place to hang out with friends!

name: Brittney Booker
text: Rare is it that I leave a review, and I honestly tried not to, but they have no respect for the students they house. So, I'm going to be completely honest. They legitimately seem like crooks, and no one should stay here. It's September, my lease ended in July, and they're still trying to squeeze money out of me as they have been throughout the year. Whenever I go into the front office, they're either really nice or really dry. There's no in-between. The apartments themselves aren't bad, but they are very overpriced. Before you sign a lease, read it because there's all sorts of things they like to pull out of thin air *seemingly*. If you're smart and you care about your money, you won't stay here. There are other options, so I advise you to check those out.

name: CheekyWabbit251
text: THIS PLACE IS A JOKE. DO NOT LIVE HERE. THEY WILL TRY TO PERSUADE YOU TO SIGN AND ONCE YOU DO, ITS OVER. THEY ARE CONSTANTLY CHARGING YOU WITH RIDICULES CHARGES. THE MAINTENANCE WILL TAKE MONTHS JUST TO FIX THE SIMPLEST THINGS. THEY WILL JUST COME BARGE IN IF YOU ARE NOT THERE WITH NO BEFORE HAND NOTICE. I PROMISE YOU THAT YOU DO NOT WANT TO LIVE HERE. THE GATES ARE ALWAYS OPEN AND THE TIMES WHEN THEY ARE CLOSED, THEY DO NOT EVEN OPEN. THIS PLACE DOESN'T EVEN DESERVE A 1 STAR RATING.

name: Laury Blake
text: Extremely high rent prices. The place itself isn't well organized and the staff isn't very helpful stay away from this place.

resp.text: Hi Laury. I am not seeing any record of you as a resident or signing a lease with Campus Quarters, but do apologize for your negative experience. We are here for you and would be more than willing to speak with you further when you are able. Thank you. – Campus Quarters

name: Mary Fabbrini
text: I subleased an apartment at Campus Quarters this summer from May-July. The general layout was nice, a spacious living room and kitchen. And the front desk staff has always been friendly. However, I have been extremely disappointed with the way the complex is managed.
