resp.text: Thank you for taking time to give us a review. We appreciate all the feedback that you have given and will continue to make sure our residents are happy with the property and management.- Thanks Managment

name: Chayton Mowrey
text:
There are so many choices for apartment living in Tuscaloosa and from what I’ve experienced, no place will be perfect in every single way. My overall experience here was above average and I did enjoy living at Vie at University Downs, but it was a roller coaster. The staff is AWESOME. Nothing else to say there, they are all really good people and willing to help. I moved in fast and it was very easy, especially from a gentleman named Rulondo who helped me numerous times during my residency. Also, I want to emphasize how impressed I was with the security in the complex. There are numerous guards roaming and keeping watch, I felt very safe here.

In the units, the floor layouts are nice and the rooms are pretty spacious, the living/dining room especially.

I did however, have a few things I’d like to share. The first negative experience I had was after I was all moved in, I realized my apartment’s living room and dining room was unfurnished. I was informed that when the new ownership took over earlier in 2018, they furnished every unit with furniture. The one I lived in however, had a resident who had been in there prior to the change in management and had personal furniture already in his room. They told him that In order to get the living room stuff: couch, chair, television, tv stand, dining room table, chairs (basically everything one would need in a living space), that he must also accept the bedroom furniture. This meant he had to move all of his stuff out of there. Since he already had everything he needed, he declined.
Ironically, the other two bedroom units were furnished but the living room was still left empty. I tried numerous times to get furniture in this apartment but it felt like the staff really didn’t care about doing this and just didn’t want to deal with it. I was told numerous times that because we had already “opted out” of receiving furniture months ago, there was “nothing they could do.” Also, I know for a fact there was a plethora of extra furniture available. I let it go because I only signed a short term lease but to me this was unacceptable and simply just laziness on the management’s part.

In October, the whole complex underwent a network change to a company called Single digits. In summation, we were without internet connection for about two weeks and even after everything was “fixed” I still experienced issues. I discussed this with the staff and I can vouch for them that they did everything they could to get it up and running as fast as possible. However, I don’t know if they made the correct decision going with this company.

Something minor, but I felt necessary to be addressed is there are a lot of bugs. I am aware this was a problem a long time ago and the staff has previously addressed this, but I still had numerous experiences. Ant infestations: One in my bedroom from the trashcan and one in the kitchen pantry. This was fixed easily by a few and traps but still gross and took a while to clean up the dead ants. I am not sure if the property had been treated for bugs but mine definitely wasn’t, not to mention that there were roaches in the kitchen, often.

After seeing what other apartment complex’s are like. Yes, I had a few complaints, but I want to make sure the management can see these because feedback is a great way to improve. Vie at University Downs does have a lot to offer and it was a nice place to live. With a few fixes and changes, this place has the potential to be a top notch choice for living in Tuscaloosa, but changes definitely need to be made. They are upgrading the clubhouse and I assume it will be very nice.

resp.text:
Thank you so much for your useful insights. We are thrilled to hear that you are happy to live here, but I also wante to let you know that we are constantly striving to improve these aspects.
Best regards,
Management

text: Been staying over here at Vie @ University Downs since the fall and the new flooring just started in my apartment and they look SO good! Super excited to see the rest of the new renovations!!!

Hi Destiny!

Thank you for taking the time to let us know how we did. We are excited about the renovations as well! Our team strives to deliver an excellent experience, and are glad you have found this to be the case during your time with us. We truly value your feedback, If you have further needs or questions, please reach out! We hope you have a great day!

name: Landon Coffin
text: I do not live at University Downs because I am local, but I have had my share of friends live there through college. I love the relaxed atmosphere and they have the most fun pool in town! The Downs would definitely be my #1 choice!

resp.text: Landon Coffin, we are so pleased you enjoyed your visit to University Downs and especially appreciate the positive review!  Please let us know if our staff can do anything further to assist you!

name: parker bearden
text: The office staff is so helpful and I can’t wait to see the new gym! The apartments also have new appliances and painting compared to most student housing.

Parker,

Thanks so much for letting us know everything that you like! We work very hard to make your experience the best possible.

Best regards,
Management

name: Joshy B
text: The girls in the front office were the nicest, most helpful, friendliest group of people I've had the pleasure to meet. They went out of their way to help me and I greatly appreciate it. Oh and Jade was pretty cute too😉

resp.text: Joshy B, we're so glad that we were able to go above and beyond your expectations!  If there is anything we can do to assist you further, please do not hesitate to let us know!

name: Kory Weber
text: I've lived here for 3 years and highly recommend it to people looking for a place to live. The current staff has taken it upon themselves to personally help me with any issues and they take the maintenance of their amenities and properties very seriously. As a pet owner too my dog loves being able to stretch his legs and run around the gated park.

resp.text: Kory, Thanks so much for your positive feedback! We appreciate hearing from our residents, and we are happy to hear that you and your dog have had a great time here with us. We hope to see you soon! Thanks again! -UD Management

name: Cade Jones
text: I have lived here for four years and love it. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Safe community. Fun atmosphere. Perfect for dogs!!!! A lot of land for the dogs to run around.

resp.text: Cade, Thank you so much for your positive feedback. We truly appreciate your kind words and thoughts and we are so happy that you chose to call UD your home for so long! Thanks again!! -UD Staff

name: Jake Kingree
text: University Downs is a phenomenal place to live. The location was fantastic and even allowed me to bring my pets. The staff was nothing but helpful and I will miss living in this community very much. I just hope a complex as amazing as University Downs will welcome me in my future endeavors.

resp.text: thank you so much for these kind words! We can't tell you how much we appreciate hearing from you and knowing that you've been happy during your stay with us. We are going to miss you too!! Thanks again!

name: MaryClaire Wilson
text: I had such a hilarious tour with Freddie. He was so eager to tour me even though he has a broken leg.

resp.text:
MaryClaire,

Our office staff strive to make everyone's experience the best possible, no matter what it takes. Thanks for coming by!

Kindly,
Management

name: Taylor Saenz
text: I didn’t mind living here until just recently. With the new renovations for those who are moving in is literally outrageous. They are making it such an inconvenience for me to place my dogs somewhere while they do the renovations. I work in Birmingham and I don’t have the luxury of just rehoming my dogs for the day. And on top of that they are trashing and damaging my apartment while the do it. And all they do is tell me to take a picture of it and email to the company like I’m gonna get refunded for the stuff they damaged. They are doing the renovations on my dime. They should’ve compensated those who still live here the rent for the month of July. The new staff sucks and just blows you off. Like I said I liked the place until just recently but the way the company has been treating residents is awful. Do yourself a solid and just don’t live here.

resp.text:
Dear Taylor,
Thank you for sharing your feedback and for bringing this matter to our attention. I am very sorry we failed to meet your expectations. We would appreciate another chance to earn your trust. You may reach us anytime at manager@vieatudowns.com. Looking forward to hearing back from you shortly.

name: Dishon Ballard
text: Its Crazy How Something As Simple As Wifi Stopped Me From Renewing With This Apartment Complex. We Been Having Wifi Problems For 3 Months And It Still, To This Day, Has Not Been Resolved. So If You Are A College Student, Dont Expect To Have A Reliable Internet Source Because The Wifi Goes Out Every Week And The Front Office Will Juss Tell You They Are “Working On It” But In Reality, They Dont Seem Like They Really Care.

resp.text:
Dishon,
We are very regretful for your experience, and our team has been working diligently on ensuring the internet/ cable is functioning properly moving forward.
Please stop by the office and ask to speak with Garrett Galloway if you have any questions or concerns.
Best regards,
Vie Management

name: Grace Costello
text: I lived here for two years and couldn't be happier! After my friends saw my place, they all ended up moving here the next year also! Great location, and great staff to help you at all times if needed! Id highly recommend these condos and apartments. i have nothing bad to say about them.

resp.text: Grace Costello, thanks so much for the positive review.  We are so happy you are enjoying your stay here and truly appreciate the referrals!  If there is anything we can do to assist you, please do not hesitate to reach out to us!

name: Justin Chavez
text: I love University Downs! The apartments are very cozy and just what i need. The pool is a great time during the summer. They also have a gym and tanning beds. The staff has always been very helpful, too! I 100% recommend the UD!

resp.text: Hi Justin Chavez, thank you for taking the time to leave a review for us at University Downs.  We're happy we could meet your expectations!  Please let us know if we can do anything else to make your stay more enjoyable!

name: Barry (Bj) Briggs
text: The staff is amazing,however,  the management doesn’t seem to care at all about their employees. Their singular focus seems to be getting people to sign leases.

resp.text:
Hi Barry,

Thank you for your feedback! We truly appreciate all of our team members and all of their hard work. Please let us know if you have any other concerns.

name: Samantha Quraishi
text: My niece lives here and I absolutely adore going to visit her! This property is always kept clean and their front office staff is always on top of things. I'd recommend this facility to any young adult looking for an apartment.

resp.text: Samantha Quraishi, thanks for your praise and kind comments about our team.  We love referrals so please tell your friends and help spread the word about how great University Downs is!

name: DJ Lovoy
text: I loved living here! All of the staff was extremely nice to me, and the community in general is very friendly. Maintenance does a great job of actually fixing your problem when they come in to the apartment. The pool is awesome; probably the best apartment pool that I have had in Tuscaloosa out of the four different places I had lived in. Not to mention this place is a great place to live if you're a dog owner, with a dog area to let your dog run around in and play with other dogs!

resp.text: Hey DJ!!  We are so happy to hear you have loved your experience living here! We make it our priority to make sure all of our residents are taken care of!!

name: Smitty Johnson
text: The building numbers are not well marked, especially building 700 which makes no sense the way the rooms are lined out. The parking lots are not lit well everywhere either

resp.text:
Hi Nicholas!

Thank you for your feedback. If you have further needs or questions, please reach out! We hope you have a great day!

name: Andrew Fernandez
text: Just perfect. A friendly and efficient staff like yours is what separates you from the pack. Will definitely be recommending to friends and relatives. Great location, quality development, and an all-around lovely environment to live in.

resp.text: Andrew Fernandez, thank you for your kind review; we are happy to pass along your comments to the team here at University Downs!  Please do not hesitate to reach out to us if we can do anything to make your stay more comfortable!

name: Daniel Skehan
text: Sydney has been one of the most helpful and customer oriented rental agents with whom i have ever dealt. Not only was she easy to work with, she was easy on the eyes. Always energetic and colorful, Sydney has made this experience the picture of what renting should be!!

resp.text: Thank you Peter Pettigrew for sharing this experience with us!  It makes me happy to hear that our leasing consultant Sydney was able to assist you.  I will be sure to share your feedback with her and the entire team.  We look forward to your next visit!  Take care!

name: Madison Fincher
text: LOVE University Downs!! Super clean, great pool, & great staff. Sydney is my go-to because she is always more than helpful!! Would recommend to anyone and everyone.

resp.text: Thank you Madison Fincher for sharing this experience with us! It makes me happy to hear that our leasing consultant Sydney was able to assist you.  I will be sure to share your feedback with her and the entire team.  We are always more than happy to assist you if anything else comes up. Take care!

name: Olivia Acker
text:
management company = 0/5 stars.

New management has decided major renovations will be completed while current tenants still occupy their apartments. The schedules provided for renovations are incorrect and they expect you to remove all furniture from rooms so flooring can be replaced and to remove everything from walls so the apartment can be repainted. Not to mention the "minor" renovations they don't even feel obligated to give notice of (ex: replacing your door and painting the new one - leaving it wide open all day).

Love the unexpected 7:30am knocks on the door "I'm here to do XYZ." Don't worry if you don't hear them or you're not home - they'll let themselves in! It's thrilling to come home and see your door wide open and people coming in and out! No telling how many different people have been given access to our apartments with no management supervision. As I type this there are people in my living room/kitchen playing music while doing heavens knows what to the AC unit.

Bringing concerns to management is useless. They are far more interested in getting these apartments updated so that they can charge future tenants $300 more in rent than they are in listening to current tenant's concerns.

resp.text: Good afternoon Olivia, Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention. I apologize on behalf of everyone at Vie Management. We set a high standard for ourselves, and we’re so sorry to hear this was not met in your interaction with our business. We would appreciate another chance to earn your trust. Could you please contact Garrett Galloway, GM, Vie at University Downs at manager@vieatudowns.com to discuss further? Thank you.

name: Zhichao Hao
text: Withholding deposit for almost two years without any explanation! Nowhere needs this money to fix at all! Expecting to live here? Prepare to lose your money and even staffs there don't know why! All they could tell is we will work on it. Then? Your money lives in their pocket forever! I even stopped by the office and contact the Peak Campus for several times! Without any surprises, they've been making excuses all the time! Also my other friends who live in apartments provided by Peak Campus have the same experience! NO MORE UDOWNS & PEAK CAMPUS! KEEP IN MIND!

resp.text:
Zhichao,

Thank you for your feedback. As you may not know, Vie Management purchased the property at the end of January 2019. We hope that we will be able to assist you with your concerns and create a better living experience for you. We will be doing many renovations and strive to provide great customer service for all of our residents. Please reach out to Molly Crawford at mcrawford@viemgmt.com if you have any concerns that we can address today.

Regards,
Vie Management

name: The Regipea
text: University Downs is a great place to live. I have been living here almost a year and have renewed my lease for next year. I was looking for one bedrooms, and they offer the best bang for your buck, the great thing is the gated community because sometimes living alone can be scary, but with the gates closed at night, I feel so safe and at home here. I really love it. The new management has renovated a lot of things and it looks great!

name: Connor Galloway
text: Wow!  I applaud the staff, and the communities management for their due- diligences in making this community top tier. I am sure the availibility  is slim, call today for your new home!

resp.text:
Hi Connor!

Thank you for taking the time to let us know how we did. Our team strives to deliver an excellent experience, and are glad you have found this to be the case during your time with us. We truly value your feedback, If you have further needs or questions, please reach out! We hope you have a great day!

name: Catherine Gore
text: I have lived here for a year now, and it has been great. The staff have always been helpful, approachable, and welcoming, and the apartment grounds are consistently clean and peaceful. I also love that the pool is right here and well-kept, and the gym is open 24-7. The computers and printer at the Downs was also super helpful during the school year.

resp.text: Hey Catherine,  Thank you so much for your review. We love hearing our residents experiences with us! We hope to see you at one of  our upcoming events!

name: Elena Esters
text: One of my friends has lived here for two years and she loves it. I love coming to visit because we always have an awesome time at the pool and club house! Love this place

name: Stoney Sharp
text:
The hardwood floors in the condo units sold me on University Downs.
Solid construction, endless amenities, great location, professional staff.  I'd stay another year or two if I weren't being relocated for work.  Thanks for a great stay.

resp.text: Hey Stoney,  Thank you so much for your review. We wish you weren't relocated either but we hope to have you in the near future if you get relocated back!

name: Claire Bailey
text: I have an an excellent living experience at University Downs. I feel safe and love the neighbors here. I have never had to worry about studying at home from too much noise. The staff is friendly (even the overnight security guard) and are quick to help me with my problems. I am so happy I chose to live and experience college here!

name: Alyssa Bubello
text: The staff here is great, especially Sydney! Sometimes I head into the office just to talk to her for fun. The whole place is well kept and the pool is a plus!

name: Claudia Warren
text: My child has lived there for a year. The staff has been great, the complex is spacious, yet quiet. The common areas are kept clean and repaired. Plenty of parking for the residents. And the complex has a dog park!

resp.text: Mrs. Warren,  Thank you so much for your review. We love to hear from the parents of our residents and know they are happy with their children living here!  We hope to see you next time you are visiting!

name: Cody Leach
text: Internet down going on four days. Terrible customer service, and they honestly couldn’t care less. I hate living here. Highly recommend anywhere else.

Thank you for sharing your feedback. I apologize that we failed to meet your expectations. We are working diligently with the internet provider to remedy the outage. We would appreciate another chance to earn your trust. You may reach us anytime at manager@vieatudowns.com. Looking forward to hearing back from you shortly.

name: Robbie Malone
text: Looked at a two bedroom apartment. Large space with lots of storage. Rent is reasonable for the area and the staff were very helpful.

Thank you for your positive review. We are happy that you enjoy living at Vie at University Downs, where we strive to make your living with us an inspiring one. Kindest regards,
Vie Management

name: Nicki Conlon
text: Vie Is unprofessional, With no credibility at all. Prepare to be disappointed if you work with Vie.  No one at Vie has a brokers license, and they have no respect for the  leases/contracts, as long as it benefits them. They do not manage every condo, check with Spaces and other property managers who manage some third-party condos at University Downs.

resp.text: Good afternoon Nicki, Thank you for taking the time to bring this to our attention. We always aim to deliver a great experience. We are gutted when we miss the mark! We will use the feedback to make us better. We would appreciate another chance to earn your trust. Please feel free to reach out to Garrett Galloway, GM at Vie at University Downs at manager@vieatudowns.com to discuss further.

name: Virginia Carnathan
text: Close to campus and pretty quite. New management is great. Maintenance is pretty quick. Air company comes in frequently to check the system and make sure everything is working properly. Overall great place.

name: Tony Kirk
text: First off if i want to say university downs is not a bad place however I was put in a bad situation by them. I moved in late September to a 3 bedroom unit. However my garbage disposal has constantly went out every month, my hot water heater leaks onto the floor in the washing room and the dryer has to be rigged to keep running and this is just the beginning. I was moved into a unit that was already occupied in which it states on our move in lease if you moved in during the month of august you have 72 hours to get the lights in your name. So I think my apartment already has a power account attached to it that I just have to pay on. I gave something one month however in the month of December my power has been turned off due to it not being in someone's name. I was never notified of ANY of this and to make matters worse neither one of the two people I live with will reply to my text messages nor my calls. I'm just ready for my lease end honestly. If you already have roommates maybe it's not that bad but this is a very unacceptable situation. And to make matters worse the best option the leasing office could give me was to pay the start up fees and bill for Alabama power and bring in the bill and they will charge it to my roommates accounts. First off I shouldn't have to handle this myself, second off why would I want to continue staying in a unit where I can't get a answer from either one on A matter as serious as this. I'm the one without power right now while both of them are gone and nobody is helping me fix this

resp.text:
Hey Tony,

We are so sorry that you are having problems with your power. Please give us a call at the office at 205-752-3232 whenever you get a chance, or email me at tduncan@peakcampus.com

Thank you,
Taylor Duncan

name: Preston Schaulin
text: I went in four a tour got to see all the rendering of the renovations.Im ready to hang out in the pool all summer

resp.text:
Preston,

I'm very happy you liked what you saw. Please come see us again when ever you get a chance.

Best regards,
Management

name: Shannon Ryan
text: Love it! The staff is great they treat everyone like family and are always very cheery to talk too. Getting things fixed is never an issue if need be, the rooms are spacious, and the amenities are great! Highly recommend

resp.text: Thank you Shannon Ryan for sharing this experience with us!  It makes me happy to hear that our staff has been able to assist you.  I will be sure to share your feedback with the entire team. We are always here to help so please never hesitate to call us!  Sincerely, University Downs Property Manager (205) 752-3232.

name: BJ Robertson
text:
They had to redo the paint scheduling because one of the group of painters had got fired for stealing. The day they painted my apt, they stole some money from me. The way my money was put up(in a crate under a bunch of books), they had to been rambling through all my stuff to find it. [Smh if your 1st instinct is looking for something to steal, u don't need to be working for any company that requires coming into someone's home.] I walked up to their truck to confront them about my money missing, I notice them smoking/getting high off the money they stole from me. Of course, I reported them and they were fired immediately.
My only issue now is that it is Saturday noon and I'm just now getting my first call about roommates moving in Monday in mid July..

resp.text:
Good afternoon BJ,
Thank you for your review. I’m sorry to hear you had such a frustrating experience, but I really appreciate you bringing this issue to our
attention. We set a high standard for ourselves, and we’re so sorry to hear this was not met in your interaction with our business. Could you please contact Garrett Galloway, GM at Vie at University Downs at manager@vieatudowns.com? We’ll work with you to resolve any issues as quickly as possible. Thank you again for your feedback.

name: Courtney Victor
text: Overall a great experience. Were very accommodating when a personal situation required me to move apartments. The office workers are very friendly and maintenance is great and on top of things. Would definitely recommend!

resp.text: Thank you Courtney! We appreciate your kind words and we are very thankful for your recommendation. Have a great day!

name: Tracy Waldrep
text: My niece lives in these apartments, this was the first time I've ever visited. Let me say I was impressed! Perfect location and great team that keeps the place (inside and out) looking great!!

text: This is a great facility.  The staff is always helpful and polite and they keep the property clean.  And it's not very often that you find a pool that is always clean like it is here!

text: These apartments are old , outdated , moldy , haven’t been updated in 20yrs. The carpets are dirty , bathrooms haven’t been remodeled or recaulked in 10 plus years . The doors don’t lock or work and the decks are covered in mold . They are raising the rents $200 for remodeling . Don’t let them fool you it’s for outside aesthetics only !

resp.text:
Alix,

Thank you for your feedback. You may or may not know but Vie Management purchased the community at the end of January and we are making many different changes to the apartments. The renovations will include renovations to the interior of the apartments with faux wood flooring, new furniture, new appliances and more. We will also be updating and renovating the amenity spaces to make your living experience better. If you have any concerns please fee free to reach out to Molly Crawford at mcrawford@viemgmt.com. We appreciate you as a resident and look for honest feedback like this to be able to implement and change things to make your experience better.

Kindest regards,
Vie Management

text: I really like living at the downs. Maintenance is fast. The area is generally quiet and very, very clean. And the parties aren't half bad either. It's definitely the best place I've ever lived. And I wish there was a sidewalk leading to campus so I could ride my bike to class. But I don't think there's anything you can do about that.

text: My bestfriends live here and I love going to the pool with them and there's always plenty of parking. The club house is huge, too. I love taking their dog to the dog park and seeing all the dogs!

name: Ford Mcdermott
text:
No more amenities, not much maintenance, in fact, it's turned from a premier place to live into one where things are slowly being taken. I guess this comes from those of us who have lived here for 6 years.

Don't get trapped by the marketing. I used to give this place 5 stars, now it deserves a 3

Please feel free to come see us in the office, call us at 205-752-3232 or e-mail our Leasing Manager, Caleb McCants, at cmccants@peakcampus.com. We look forward to working with you in the future!

name: Derek Jones
text: Problems from day 1.  The apartment was filthy and nothing worked on move-in day.  The water heater, refrigerator, washer and dryer all had issues.  Knobs were missing from the stove.  We just assumed that it was very busy for move-in but then maintenance told us that the apartment had been empty for 6 months so there was no excuse for issues not being addressed before move-in.  The washer and dryer never worked properly the entire year that my daughter lived there.  Repairs were attempted but didn't correct the problems.

resp.text:
Mr. Jones,

Thank you for your feedback. As you may not know, Vie Management purchased the property at the end of January and are looking to create a better living experience for all of our new residents. We appreciate your feedback and apart of our renovation plan is to replace appliances with new GE appliances to ensure that they are all in working condition. If you have any further concerns please feel free to reach out to Molly Crawford at mcrawford@viemgmt.com.

Thanks,
Vie Management

text: Management and mantience is horrible! The dishwasher broke and the washer and dryer stopped and I requested it being broke. Still not mantience to show up for 2 months and it still wasn't fixed! If I could give 0 stars I would. UNIVERSITY DOWNS is a dump.

As you can see on other reviews, we are known for taking ownership and caring deeply about our customers. We can’t fix the past but since we are committed to improving the way our staff serves every customer we have put solutions in place so a similar situation doesn't happen again. Until then, please accept my sincere apologies on behalf of everyone on the team.

name: Bree Elder
text: The amenities are wonderful and the property itself is nice, however the overall management of this property is poorly cared for. I understand there is a large amount of residents that occupy this complex, but in-turn, office workers and management should be working urgently to process maintenance requests and to solve other issues to keep PAYING CUSTOMERS satisfied with their living space. This has not been our experience while living here. My sister and I have lived with UD for almost 6 months and requests we put in those 6 months ago have still not been taken care of. Don’t bother calling the office because they probably won’t answer. And they have neglected returning promised phone calls on multiple occasions. Office is known to close earlier than the hours listed on their door/website which is inconvenient for those of us who work, or interested people traveling from out of town. It is very unfortunate because we love the property, but until management changes I believe these issues will remain the same. If things do not change soon, I foresee this complex going downhill fast in cleanliness, safety, and appeal to possible leasees.

resp.text:
Bree,

Thank you for your feedback. As you may not know, Vie Management purchased the property at the end of January 2019. name: Tiffani Greene
text: I was beyond overwhelmed at the end of last spring semester with no place to live due to an unfortunate event with previous living arrangements thus leaving me with no options as to where to go for the coming semester. I went on about thirty different tours of different complexes in Tuscaloosa to view one bedroom apartments as this was my only option due to the issues I had leading me to needing a place. To say the least a majority of the apartment options in this town are sketch especially when its last minute last chance in May. However when I came to the downs, Bronson took me and my mom and sister on a tour and it was a great experience. I wanted to see the type of unit I would actually be living in as opposed to just a model unit and they understood my concerns so they made it happen. One of the other employees, Jade, let me go into her apartment and see what it was like since that would be the layout I would ultimately end up with, without hesitation or second thought. I ended up signing for this current year and have been here since August. I have nothing but great things to say about the office staff especially Andrew who truly makes anyone's day each time you see him. Being so far away from family no matter what year you are in is always hard but the staff always is so welcoming and caring. When you read other reviews they talk about disasters of maintenance and such where their needs aren't attended to but I have not seen where that's an issue. Like normal there are always going to be household things that need fixing no matter where you live, its just a part of life and being a tenant. I have had my fair share of unwanted critters (yikes its ok I am alive still) or leaks/minor breaks but no matter what the office always responded fast and urgent for me. People fail to forget that its usually just one person, Ryan, doing all the repairs so they need to cut him some slack and be understanding that the issue will be addressed quickly but maybe not immediately. As far as safety goes, I feel secure at the apartment and the one incident where I was nervous about someone near my apartment I called the office and legitimately a golf cart, and I am talking like one of those extended ones, full of staff came zooming in and investigated and checked in on me to make sure I was okay, including Taylor Duncan the leasing manager too. I find that the staff really makes the living experience worth while at apartment complexes which is why I gave 5 stars overall. I had a few hiccups here and there with maintenance or billing like I mentioned but those issues were resolved to a level of satisfaction which is the part that matters most. Now that this novel of a review is over have a great day and if you are in a predicament where you need not just a house but a home stop on over here at UD!

name: Zach Twigg
text:
Absolutely the worst experience I could've ever imagined. When I first began paperwork with them they were undergoing renovations, which at the time was exciting to see. When I came in a couple weeks later to finish my paperwork they had lost it! Papers that had my entire identity plastered all over them as well as my co-signers (parents) info! This happened TWO more times. When everything was finally taken care of I had signed during an incentive to get a $600 dollar gift card or use it as credit towards my first months rent, so being the poor college student that I am I put it towards my rent, well when it came time to pay first months rent they told me I couldn't use that incentive because I was in a privately owned unit. Why would you assign a resident who signed during an incentive special, a condo that's privately owned therefore cancelling out that incentive?

It's just one inconvenience after another with these guys. Probably because they can't get a property management company to stick around long enough for things to flow smoothly. University Downs has gone through three ownerships since I've been involved with them. The staff is almost entirely undertrained or under-qualified to be handling the responsibilities they're supposed to take care of with ease. Nearly every question is answered with "I'll have to check with my manger when they get back". Which then leads to nothing because the manager is never around.

Also if you're planning to live on the condo side rather than the apartment side then please know that all those inclusions they promise like wifi/cable or Google Chromecast are NOT included. They didn't share that until after we had signed or lease.

Truly an awful experience. Please do yourself a favor and look elsewhere for housing. Aside from the awful management the condos are higher quality builds than most of the newer places, however be prepared to do all of the move-in cleaning yourself, I've never seen such a gross move-in room. There was dog hair on the walls and black mold in my toilet.

resp.text: Zach, thank you for your feedback. We apologize for any trouble you may have had during your stay at University Downs. I hope that you are aware that we are now under new management with Peak Campus. We think that there will be all kinds of improvements for our Residents in the months to come, and we are excited to be a part of the University Downs family. Please feel free to contact us directly in the office at 205-752-3232 if you have any additional questions or concerns. Thanks again!

name: Colton Palmer
text:
It is atypical that I write reviews, especially negative reviews. However, my experience with University Downs in Tuscaloosa has been an absolute nightmare. The experience has been so negative that it warrants more than just a bad review, but also legal action.
After the new management company (Asset Campus Housing) bought the complex from Ellis-Trick, all of the services went downhill. From trash pickup to rent payment every facet of life at UD changed for the worse. Most importantly, the management staff (not necessarily the office staff) has been unhelpful, incompetent, and downright rude.
First, even though my name was on the lease (I am looking at a copy right now), my name was NEVER put into their system, so every time I called they couldn’t speak with me (or pull up my lease apparently). Furthermore, they never put any of the emails on my lease into their system. When my roommate wrote a check for $785 instead of $795 on accident, we were never notified of the “late payment” either by phone or email – even though they had both. So they after a few months that $10 charge grew into hundreds. They then had the audacity to place an eviction notice on my door. So they can walk to my apartment to threaten eviction but they can’t notify me of a $10 dollar payment??? Needless to say I paid the $10 dollars I owed them, but not a penny more! And I wished it ended there…
When I moved to a different city over the summer (and paid two rents because I didn’t want to sublease!) they actually moved another person into my apartment!!!! I found out about this when I went back to my apartment on checkout day (to turn in my key) and there was someone else living in there with all their stuff! I have had two UD employees acknowledge this, but they don’t see a problem with it at all – even though I was still paying rent!
Finally, after months of phone calls, emails, and weeks on end of no response, I still have not received my security deposit back. They have acknowledge – finally – that they owe me the security deposit, but now they said they “mailed the check.” That was over three weeks ago. This is on the point of ridiculous. The managers at the office do not care. They are rude and completely unprofessional. I have friends who have been through similar experiences at UD! And you should understand. I took pride in my apartment. It was always clean inside and out, and well taken care of.
I could go on for another page or two…
I am going back to Tuscaloosa in a few years, and they could not PAY ME to live there.
Finally, apparently the complex is being purchased by a new company in 2016. Don’t live there!!! They are keeping the same rude and unprofessional managers – so nothing will change. In fact, it will probably get worse.

text: If I could put ZERO stars I would.  My daughter moved out of University Downs last July 2016. She has been owed a refund of her security deposit in the amount of $200. We have called so many times that I have lost count, and talked to several people to try to obtain the deposit refund. The latest person I have spoken to is Vachelle,  who has promised that she will issue the check to us. I have called her four times this week, and at this point she is avoiding my calls and messages.  I guess I have no other recourse then to secure an attorney, because I have repeatedly asked for a corporate number or contact to call to have this taken care of. My daughter has lived in numerous apartments throughout her college career,  and the whole experience we had with University Downs has been the absolute worst by far.  Withholding a deposit after you have issued a letter stating that deposit will be sent is theft.

name: wilsta22
text:
Staff is awful. Maintenance would come fix some problems and ignore others. The appliances all do not work correctly. Staff/maintenance comes in whenever (literally they will knock and, from the back bedroom, not give us enough time to put pants on and go open the door before they are already letting themselves in) to fix or change things without even telling residents. They have just come in our place numerous times this year with numerous excuses. They tell you they would give residents a heads up if they have to come in, but that is not true. One day while we had multiple friends over, they came in and said they had to paint all our walls. Needless to say, that was the final straw and we told them they could not paint that day randomly without telling us, while we had people over. We live on the second story and one morning we were woken up at 8 am bc some workers had climbed up the back balconies and were on our back porch working, of course without telling us. I have never lived somewhere where maintenance just comes in without warning so many times in a year. Our friends have a joke going on about hanging at our apartment because maintenance will probably be joining us. Also, one day when they randomly came, we had an empty cat litter box. No cat, not cat toys/food, not even cat litter, just the empty box, and then they tried to charge us $500 by saying we had a pet and kept coming by randomly to catch a nonexistent cat in our place. Even then, $500 seemed like much for a cat. Another thing, along with not telling any residents about maintenance coming to do anything in residents places, they have also decided to change the internet connection and password without telling residents. We went almost a week, a school week without internet is very difficult, thinking the internet had gone out without being fixed. We finally called and they told us it had been changed. We told them we were not happy they would do that without telling us, therefore making us go without. The next day, after we had gone the week without internet and then resolved the issue, they came by and put a paper in our door telling us they changed the internet, so at least our complaining did something, even if it was a week too late.
Overall, you will not have the privacy you want in your apartment and do not count on the staff/maintenance to do great jobs. If you can get pass that, the pools and community itself is not bad, just needs better people running it.

name: Jenn Snyder
text:
My son has lived at Lark since they opened 3 years ago.  Great location and safe.  The staff at Lark, especially Crystal F, Is amazing! Crystal goes above and beyond for the residents and us parents.
She is so kind and sweet.  LITW is so lucky to have her representing their complex.  If you are her manager/GM , you need to acknowledge the amazing job she does.

resp.text: Hi Jenn, we are so glad to hear about your positive experience with the Lark in the Woods team, and that this contributed to an over all great experience for you. We appreciate your kind words about our community! Please don't hesitate to reach out should you ever need anything.

name: Ryan Voyles
text: I lived there for 3.5 years through all the name changes and the front office and maintenance staff have always been great. Whenever we had a problem it was responded to quickly and they were always transparent in what was going on.

resp.text: Ryan, thank you so much for your response. We have enjoyed having you as a resident and wish you nothing but the best. Please don't hesitate to reach out if you ever need anything.

name: Paige Brasington
text: Clean and safe. Great amenities and nice staff

resp.text: Paige, we are so happy to hear this. Thank you so much for your feedback and please let us know if you ever need anything.

name: Jennifer Smith
text: Love it here! The manager Crystal is great, and always helpful. Gavin and Elizabeth have been very helpful as well. Maintenance is great, and they're quick to respond to request. Love the amenities offered here and the pool is a great perk of living here. They're always doing fun stuff and putting on different events. You'll love it here!

resp.text: Jennifer, thank you so much for sharing your feedback about our property. If you ever need anything, feel free to give us a call!

name: Bree Elder
text: If you aren’t living here already you should be! I’ve resided in many apartment complexes in Tuscaloosa and nobody compares to Lark in the Woods! The employees are WONDERFUL! They take the time to make sure you’re not only comfortable and happy, but that you have a memorable college experience here! If I could give them a 10 star review I would! Love the place, love the people! You won’t find a better place to live! Lots of great events and perks, giveaways and contests! Go tour now!

resp.text: Bree, thank you so much for your kind words about our staff and property. We have enjoyed having you as a resident so much. Please let us know if you need anything.

name: Krystal Goodman
text: The rooms are great. There’s so much storage space in the kitchen. All the appliances and furniture are awesome. The managers and staff are so extremely kind! The pool area is beautiful. There’s grills so you can always hang out with your friends and chill outside. The clubhouse is amazing. There’s free printing that is soooo clutch. There’s study rooms if you need a quiet place or need to do a video conference or interview. There’s games all kinds of things to cure boredom. And to top it off, they always have fun events going on. If you don’t want to drive to campus, there’s a shuttle. But, if you do drive you’re only like 5 min away from the nearest parking lot, if that! Wouldn’t want to live anywhere else in Tuscaloosa. :)

resp.text: Hi Krystal, thank you so much for your positive feedback about our community. We love hearing that you enjoy Lark as much as we do. Please feel free to reach out if you need anything.

name: Kiara Peters
text: The Lark in the Woods are the BEST apartments in Tuscaloosa. Staff and maintenance are beyond great. Any person who has had a problem most definitely did not do the things they needed to do on their part because the staff there stays on top of business. They go above and beyond for their residents and I would HIGHLY recommend them to anyone!!

resp.text: Kiara, thank you so much for your kind feedback about our community. We are so happy that you are happy with our staff and maintenance. Our residents and their experience at Lark are always our top priority. We are so excited to have you for another year!

name: ml rolltide1
text: I absolutely love living at lark. Everyone is so friendly and I love how it’s still close to campus but feels secluded. The apartments are super spacious and very well kept. The staff always greets me with a smile and knows me by name. When they see me coming in for a package, they already have it waiting on the desk when I walk in. I love the pool and the clubhouse. My friends and I also love the huge poolside TV. I would recommend living here. You definitely get what you pay for.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback.  We're so glad that you are your friends are taking advantage of our awesome amenities.  Please let us know if you ever need anything.

name: Piper Daniels
text: It's a gorgeous, clean, friendly place to live. The gym and pool are top notch and the customer service is wonderful. I wish there was more than one garbage dumpster so I didn't have to walk as far but that's just me getting really nit picky. Really a great place to live.

resp.text: Piper, thank you so much for your kind review. Our staff works hard to provide good customer service for every resident, and we are glad to read that we have delivered that for you.  Please do not hesitate reaching out if we can be of any further assistance.

name: Lina Tavern
text: I loved living here! Management is really nice. I had an issue with my roommate and the girl i spoke to in the office was very helpful on the matter. Someone from the office even checked up on me a couple days later to make sure I was satisfied with the outcome. The property is kept up very well, especially compared to others I have seen. The apartments are clean too. I would have renewed for another year, but I graduated. Yes there were quarterly inspections, but we were notified before hand. They don't just bust up in your apartment without notice.

resp.text: Lina, thank you so much for sharing your thoughts about our property. We are so glad that you had a great experience with us during your time living here. We wish you the very best and if you ever need anything feel free to reach out.

name: Smitty Johnson
text: Nice Apartments, gate codes that work, buildings with apartment numbers on them and signs throughout that point to the  buildings

resp.text: Hello, thank you so much for your feedback about our community. We love hearing that you enjoyed your visit. Please let us know if you ever need anything.

name: Maddie Hatcher
text: I have lived here for 3 years. The staff is amazing. Maintenance always shows in a timely manner! Amazing place to live!

resp.text: Maddie, thank you so much for sharing your experience with us. We have enjoyed having you as a resident and look forward to having you again next year. Please feel free to reach out if you ever need anything from us.

name: ttowncat lady
text: I don't personally live at Lark in the Woods, but I visit my friends here a lot! The pool area is always kept very clean. The staff members always welcome me with a warm greeting. The units are new and look so modern with lots of natural light. This place is just beautiful and perfect for people who enjoy living in a peaceful environment.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback about our property. At Lark in the Woods, we strive daily to keep a clean and inviting atmosphere. We hope that you continue enjoying visiting with us. Let us know if you ever need anything.

name: Suzanne Talley
text: Elizabeth Talley is your girl! She will help you with anything! Give her a call, she’s a sweet girl and Very professional.

resp.text: Hi Suzanne, thank you so much for the review and kind words about our staff.  We will be sure to pass along your compliment, and please let us know if you need anything.

name: Melissa Pressnell
text: My son lived there for 2 years and it was the best experience we have had!  And then staff is always inviting!

resp.text: Hi Melissa, we are so happy that you had such a great experience with us and appreciate you sharing it!  If you ever need anything, we are only a phone call away.

name: Paul Talley
text: Elizabeth is very Professional, with a great personality, and is able to give you all the information needed to make the right decision to live at the Lark!

resp.text: Paul, thank you for the positive review about our staff. If you ever need anything, please feel free to reach out.

name: Jonathan Stines
text: Upon my move-out: I was charged over $70 for cleaning my room and also $360 for replacing the carpet in my bedroom. My carpet was not stained and did not need to be replaced. Crystal Farley has been no help at all. Boggles my mind that after all the times that various amenities at this complex didn’t work (gates, doors to clubhouse, hot tub, etc) they would try and scam me out of my money. Don’t live here.

resp.text: Hi Jonathan, we are concerned about your negative experience at our property.  If you would like us to explain these charges further, in addition to our prior conversations, we would be happy to.  Please feel free to give us a call of email us at live@larkinthewoods.com at your earliest convenience.

name: Natalie McCastland
text: Upon move out, I was charged $70 to clean my bedroom and bathroom AND nearly $300 to replace the carpet in my bedroom!! The carpet was barely dirty, and most certainly did not need to be replaced! I should be refunded money for all the times the gates were stuck open, resulting in no security!! What a scam - I will be not paying anything and will be fighting to get my security deposit back!

name: Scott Miller
text: If you are looking for a great place to live you have found the right place! The property is always so well kept and the management team goes above and beyond. Live here and you won't be disappointed.

resp.text: Scott, we are glad to read that your experience at Lark in the Woods has been an enjoyable one.  We work hard to provide a good experience for all our residents, and it’s great to know that we have delivered that for you.

name: Mixer Slic3r
text: Great place to live! The amenities are so nice and the staff is wonderful!

resp.text: We appreciate you taking the time to share your thoughts about your experience at Lark in the Woods.  We're glad to read that your experience has been an enjoyable one.  Please don't hesitate reaching out if we can assist in anyway.

name: Christy Manning
text: Great place to live!  Really nice amenities and friendly, helpful staff.

resp.text: Christy, thank you so much for your feedback about our property. If you ever need anything, feel free to give us a call!

name: Laura Mcginnis
text: This is a great place to call your home away from home!  The amenities are wonderful, awesome location and the staff is top notch!  You will not be disappointed.

name: Eleanor Wise
text: Anna was very informative  about the complex and the amenities offered. Go to see her for your tour of the complex!

resp.text: Eleanor, thank you so much for your kind words about our staff. Please feel free to reach out if you ever need anything.

name: Lucas Simcoe
text: One of the main reasons I decided to live at the Lark over other places was the hot tub, but it has been broken all year. I've sent lots of emails asking if there are any plans to fix it but I never get a response. The walls here are also thinner than paper I can hear the people below me breathing.

resp.text: Dear Lucas, we understand your frustrations with the hot tub not being available.  Our maintenance staff and vendors are working diligently to ensure this issue is addressed as quickly as possible.  We are sorry for the inconvenience and would be happy to discuss it with you directly to try to earn your satisfaction.  Please stop by our office or contact us at (205) 722-5400.

name: Calajah Bryant
text: VERY UNPROFESSIONAL!!!! My sisters and I were racially profiled while using the gym. They sent SIX different people to “check on us” & finally we were asked if we were residents because we didn’t “look familiar”....

resp.text: Hi Calaya, we are sorry you felt this way, as this was not our intention.  We welcome all of our guest to use our amenities as long as they are accompanied by a resident. All visitor and guest guidelines can be found in our community policies.  We are sorry for any misunderstanding, and would be happy to discuss this further if you would like to reach us at 205-722-5400.

name: Aaron Brewer
text: Would not recommend to anyone at all. Dorm-style constant walk throughs conducted by management, ridiculous pop-up fees charging gross amounts, had items stolen from property,  and very unprofessional service. Bill payment is almost intentionally hard for no good reason as the system constantly glitches or is delayed resulting in the false appearance of the tenant missing the payment date.The marble counter tops and brand new appliances appear nice on the surface, but after closer inspection anyone can tell the unit is likely to deteriorate very quickly. They will find any excuse to charge you money, which they are very quick to do but somehow painfully slow to respond to messages/requests. Think twice.

resp.text: Aaron, we are sorry to read that your experience was not a positive one.  Our maintenance staff do perform routine quarterly inspections in an effort to address any issues that have not been reported.  Our Resident Services Manager is available to address any questions or issues you have regarding your account.  We wish you the best of luck in the future, and feel free to e-mail us at live@the9tuscaloosa.com if we can be of any further assistance.

name: Jennifer Roswold
text: Love the Pool! Maintenance takes care of all issues in a timely manner! I love living at The Nine!

resp.text: We appreciate you leaving us a review regarding your experience at Lark in the Woods.  We are glad to hear that our staff was able to assist you when needed.  Please let us know any time if we can ever assist further.

name: Kayla Martin
text:
Really don’t know why there are so many negative reviews. Here are my negatives from living here:

-I was unaware electricity isn’t included, so I didn’t expect my bill to be an extra $50 a month. But that’s whatever, my fault!
-I have the WORST neighbors. Loud and dirty. But not their fault.
-rooms are all different sizes but are the same price. Luckily, I have the biggest room. But my roomies room is half the size of mine and she pays the same for it.
-1 thing that is their fault, is responses. They don’t answer half of the emails I send. For a range of topics. So really bad at communication but luckily, I’ve never needed anything resolved immediately!

Pool is great, they host fun activities, apartments are very nice, they’re very updated, furniture isn’t too bad (some furnished places have god awful furniture), super clean at move in, and shuttles a luxury, and there’s LOTS of parking!!

Overall, I enjoy it! I won’t be resigning, because I wasn’t expecting to pay $800 a month, when I can downgrade just a tad for a $600 a month apartment or live somewhere closer to campus for the price I’m paying now. But definitely a good living experience!! I wouldn’t trade it, but I was new to the area and if I had known I’d be paying $800, I would have lived somewhere on the strip.

name: Jessica Corn
text: Great staff! Great amenities! Perfect location! I wouldn’t choose anywhere else to live in Tuscaloosa!

resp.text: Jessica, we are glad to read that your experience at Lark in the Woods has been an enjoyable one.  We work hard to provide a good experience for all our residents, and it’s great to know that we have delivered that for you.

name: Kristen Hutchins
text:
EDIT: I have now filed 4 separate police reports on my roommate, one being a felony theft charge, and still management has not done a thing. If you value anything you own, or your sanity, DO NOT LIVE HERE

I would not live here again if my life depended on it. I will admit the apartment themselves are not terrible, but the management is. I had to call the police on my roommate 3 times in one semester. My things were stolen, trash was dumped outside my room for days straight, my cabinets were locked shut, drugs were done in the apartment and I cut my foot open on a broken wine bottle that was smashed outside my bedroom door and still management said they had no grounds to evict her. The utilities are a scam, my front door won't lock from the inside, the air conditioner broke multiple times and maintenance has yet to do anything (while it was over 90 degrees outside).

Payment is a joke, they have switched payment and utility companies three times in the year I've lived here, without any notice. When you are unable to pay due to their system AND notify them, you'll still get hit with late fees that aren't taken off your account. I did not set foot in my apartment for 3 weeks and yet still got charged $80 that month for electricity overages. Ridiculous.  Crazy how I still got 6 calls asking if I want to renew, because they're that desperate for money. They also will not respond to your concerns no matter how many times you email or call. You'll continually be waiting for a "call back" that doesn't come, they just want you off their back and make absolutely no attempt to look into, or solve any problem you have. Look elsewhere, you'll find better.

name: Jason King (Jason)
text:
Update:
This property didn't honor military resident apparently.
Try to terminate the lease earlier due to Army Permanent Station Change under The Servicemembers Civil Relief Act. Write a prior notice of intention 3 months ago. Send out the military order and the official request the moment I got it. Didn't respond to my email for a good few days. Finally got a respond until the beginning of this month so they can charge me this month rent. They refused terminate the lease at the time I requested, they refused to waive the late fee when we negotiate this legal matter either. Moreover, it took a whole week for the manage to realize I have returned the key to one of the staff.
This property used to be called the Nine. Now they change the name to Lark in the Woods. Management probably plan to get rid of the good reputation they've earned from the past year. But you know what, new name same management team, it still sucks. It's worse.

5 stars from outside POV, 1 star after living here for months

The hardware is great, so I just point out a few no-no.
- People stole from my car ALL THE TIME if I forgot to lock the car.
- My balcony chair was stolen ( 1st floor)
- One guy ran into my home at midnight and I called the police but there's no surveillance around building.
- Ownership switched then they switch up utility billing company as well. My caught-up utility bill was $251 last month and $245 this month. I live in a very very conservative way. There's no way I could use this amount of energy. Especially I live in a 2-bed unit as the only tenant.

Consider this before sign your lease.

name: Emma Gullatt
text: Loved living here, great amenities and you feel very safe. Maintenance and staff are wonderful, always come out to fix whatever the issue is, couldn’t ask for better staff. Really just wish it was a little closer to campus, but other than that you couldn’t ask for more. Never had a “random walk through” not sure what the reviews below are referring to, completely ignore that if “walk throughs” are something you are scared of when looking at a place to live. This place really goes above and beyond for tenants, not sure how their emailing works, I’m seeing that people have had trouble contacting the staff through email, but I’ve always addressed any questions/issues with the front office or via phone and my questions/problems were answered and solved within the same day. Yes, the room sizes are different, I have the smallest room of the three in my unit, but honestly how much floor space do you need? It’s college. I’ve been very happy with my experience here!

resp.text: Emma, thank you so much for your feedback. We loved having you as a resident and wish you nothing but the best on your future endeavors. -Lark Fam

name: Brandon Wood
text: I love The Nine! I’m so glad I chose to live here because the amenities and staff are absolutely the best!

resp.text: Brandon, thank you for leaving us your feedback on your experience at Lark in the Woods.  We are glad to hear that you have enjoyed the many amenities we offer at our community.  Please let us know if we can assist you in any way.

name: Keri Drake
text: The best amenities offered here especially the pool area, the units are spacious and homey. Great, helpful staff!

resp.text: Keri, thank you for leaving us your feedback on your experience at 9 at Tuscaloosa.  We are glad to hear that you have enjoyed the many amenities we offer at our community.  Please let us know if we can assist you in any way.

name: Jacob (Jake) Mcwhorter
text: While they do a poor job of notifying you if anything is delivered, their apartments and amenities are top of the line. Even better, they give you plenty of room to customize your place to help you feel at home.

name: Get Hauled
text: Unbelievable how nice this place is. Clubhouse and pool are amazing. So are the units. Highly recommend The Nine.

name: Jess Threatt
text: Our tv hasn’t worked since December. We’ve called multiple times and maintenance has came through twice to get  the serial number but still nothing has been done to get it fixed. The school year at this point is basically over and we’re still paying close to $800 for a tiny apartment that now has no tv🙂 you don’t get notified for packages anymore, the walls are thin so if you have someone living above you, be prepared to hear their stomping.

name: Nicole Ritter
text: Beautiful property with a huge clubhouse! The staff is very responsive and friendly.

name: Kaitlyn DeMarco
text:
From an outside POV this looks like a great complex until you are stuck in a lease.
My overages have been $150-$250 every month keep in my mind I live ALONE in a two bedroom. No matter how much I ask them to look into they refuse and say that is the correct amount I owe.
Literally unless locked my front door does not shut, literally can just push it open...!
I am having issues with my key and call up today to have Elizabeth “help” me saying she will figure out the problem and get back to me. 30 minutes later I calll up there to another worker answering telling me my key is right there and ready.. so why was I not informed?
My air conditioner is constantly not working, people leave trash outside their units for days and no one says anything leaving a horrible smell.
I truly would reccomend staying as far away from here as you can! The only good thing they have is the pool and the new assistant manager Crystal. Besides that absolutely horrible.

name: AB C
text: Poor management. Expect “random walk through” every other week. It feels worse than a dorm. The room sizes are smaller than a dorm as well. Constant water temp issues and power issues, very poorly developed. Avoid this place it’s aa upgraded version of hoodlands

name: Jordan Lombardo
text: At first glance, The Nine seems like a great apartment complex with awesome amenities. But I would NOT live here again. Management does not make an effort to fix issues or respond to complaints.They have had problems with the utility charges every single month we have been here and the walls are so thin I can hear my upstairs neighbors having a normal conversation. When we first moved in, we would get notified that people would be entering our apartment about every other week for "walk-throughs." These are just some examples from the list of complaints I have. The two stars are strictly because the apartment itself and the furniture it came with have been mostly alright. (If you are going to sign here, be aware the C room is waaay smaller than the other two.) If you want an overpriced apartment with noisy neighbors and bad management, this is the place for you!!

name: Sam Smith
text: I love the vibrant colors in the spacious clubhouse and around the Nine. Very convenient location and all of the amenities you need/want.

name: Kristen Osborne
text: Such a beautiful property and the management company and staff are fantastic!

name: Laura Hatcher
text:
I formally reviewed The 9 as a wonderful place to live with wonderful staff. I gave it a 5 star rating... Now I wouldn't even give it 1 star... I have lived here since the early move in last year. I have paid my rent and electricity on time with no complaints. I have even had 4 yes FOUR of my friends sign here for the next year.

Now a year later I have tried dealing with the management on two different cases, and I am extremely upset at the unprofessionalism of this place.

The first was a problem with a different room. We had to call Tuscaloosa Police Department, and they could not do anything about it. Only management could fix the problem. I soon sought out a meeting with the property manager in which I was told that she couldn't do anything. She could only speak with the other residents about the situation, but could not physically do anything. So either she lied to me or TPD did...

Case #2 I will have a new roommate next year. We are both in the band at Alabama. My roommate is a section leader and that requires her to be on campus on August 5th. She just recently had hip surgery and is unable to physically move items, and The 9 refuses to allow her early move in and instead is forcing her to board on a couch (WITH A BROKEN HIP) or pay for a hotel for 2 weeks. With me already living in the aprtment and only one new person moving in I asked if she could get in a few days early. Instead I was told that they would not allow any early move in's and that I would just have to leave her MY apartment keys to let her have a place to stay for the 2 weeks she will basically be homeless. Also, I would like to point out that The 9 refused to let her sign due to my current roommate not resigning yet. So not only did she not get any early move in, but she also recieved a rate that is $50+ more per month than she would have originally.

The most recent problem just occurred. I went in due to me not having 24 hour access to the club house. This is apparently a problem with all keys. I would just like to point out that it is now July 2018 one year later and nothing has been fixed. When they "fixed" my keys they instead cut everything under my name off. I lost access to locking/unlocking my apartment door, access to the clubhouse, and my cardeal stopped working. I am now on day 3 of dealing with this situation and I have only 2/3 of the problems fixed. The manager is the one who messed up my key, and refuses to help me because it is an "inconvience". However, the only thing she is inconviencing is me. I have spent at least 2 if not more hours in the office trying to get things fixed to hear that only the manager can fix it. I was also asked "Well can't you just leave your door unlocked?" So instead of making sure a resident who pays $756 a month not including electricity has a working door I was just pushed aside. It took me getting rude to actually get that fixed. Now I can't get my car fixed because the manager refuses to do anything.

For anyone wanting to live here I want to warn you of how little the management actually cares for you. They only care about their time and not about what you need. Just a warning from someone who did love this place, but now might not resign becuase this is ridiculous.

name: Nehal Vora
text: The place is too expensive for the living experience you receive.

resp.text: Nehal, we regret to learn that you have not enjoyed your experience at our community.  Our staff works hard to provide a great experience for all our residents and guests.  We would welcome the opportunity to discuss your concerns and issues directly with you, please e-mail us at live@larkinthewoods.com at your earliest convenience.

name: Nate Smith
text: The only nice part of this apartment is the amenities and the rooms, but 700 is still very pricy for what they give. The pool and grill area closes at 7pm everyday.

name: Connor Vanderbush
text: Only care about money not residents.

resp.text: Connor, we regret to learn that your experience at our property has not been a positive one.  We would love the opportunity to discuss your concerns and issues further if you would e-mail us at live@larkinthewoods.com at your earliest convenience.

name: eileen powanda
text: Horrible - concierge signs for packages for you and they disappear and they claim no responsibility

name: lauren shulman
text: Walls are paper thin. My door doesn’t shut unless it’s locked.

name: D Watts
text: All students looking for off-campus housing, please beware of Evolve. This complex is previously known as "Harbor on the 6th", and if you search for reviews with that name, you will definitely learn the truth about this complex. As many others have said before me, it definitely is not all that it is said to be. Starting with the apartments themselves, they are nothing spectacular. The walls are paper thin-you can hear everything going on around you, the carpet comes up so easily (even when you vacuum), and plenty of carpenter ants make their way through the windows even though the complex claims to provide their residents with pest control every month. There are also no elevators in most of the buildings so prepare yourself to walk a multitude of steps before making it to your apartment. The front gates to enter the complex never work and always seem to be broken! And people are typically going 50+mph while driving through the complex. The parking situation is another disaster in itself. Half the time, many of the handicapped spots are taken by vehicles that have no handicap tag at all. On top of that, there are typically no spots available close to your unit, and you have to park and take the hike from the parking deck (ex: this is awful when carrying groceries). As for management, it is truly a challenge to get in contact with the office. There have been plenty of times that I have attempted to reach out, and in fact, have received absolutely no response whatsoever. Please thoroughly research your apartment options before signing a lease here. It'll save you the trouble, and a lot of money. I understand that it is considered to be affordable student housing, but after all of the random charges that'll be billed to you, you'll definitely be paying more than you expected. Look elsewhere!

resp.text:
Hi D Watts,

At Evolve, we take pride in offering a great community and customer service for our residents. Your feedback is important to us, and we would like the opportunity to connect with you personally to address your concerns as soon as possible. Please contact us at 205-632-1213 so we may assist you. Our open-door policy also offers help for residents during business hours and by appointment if preferred. We are confident we are meeting the mark offering a stellar community, by addressing pest control concerns in a timely manner to ensure a comfortable home and weekly proactive services are in place. Months ago we also upgraded the community front gates and while speeding in the community has not been an issue, our speed bumps near the clubhouse help to ensure speeding is contained.  As a team, we hope to speak with you directly to further discuss your concerns and ensure you enjoy Evolve.

Sincerely,
Evolve Tuscaloosa Team

name: Aureola
text: If I could give this place zero stars I would. Beginning with the managemnet staff. They are EXTREMELY unorganized and will tell you different information over the phone each time you call. Kimberly the property manager refuses to do her job, for weeks on end she would tell me "okay I will do this by the end of the day" and it literally never gets done. Not to mention very unprofessional and petty. Moving on to the actual apartments, there is actual s*** and p*** in the staircases along with constant cigarette and weed smells throughout the hallways. The walls are paper thin and you can hear everything from the people to the cars outside. I have so many regrets and want desperately want to break my lease. If this message can prevent anyone from considering I beg of you to take it seriously, look elsewhere. Don't buy into the fake reviews here on google, look up the complex on yelp or the old name "Harbor on 6th." Those reviews are spot on accurate.

resp.text:
Hi Aureola,

We are disappointed to hear of your experience and would like the opportunity to address your concerns as soon as possible. We are confident our community team strives to offer stellar service and care to all residents. To help us provide you with the best support, please contact us directly at 205-632-1213. We hope to speak with you soon, your experience living at Evolve is important to us.

Sincerely,
Evolve Tuscaloosa Team

name: Smitty Johnson
text: Decently nice Apartments, Very Large with plenty of rooma. Wish they had a door entry code and signs outside the buildings letting you know which rooms where behind the outside doors. Building 5 has like 7 doors outside along the front & 25+ rooms per floor.

resp.text:
Hi Smitty,

Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We appreciate you recommending our apartment homes and value your suggestions. Please give our team a call at 205-632-1213 or email us at info@evolvetuscaloosa.com to connect with us with directly to review your concerns.

Sincerely,
Evolve Tuscaloosa Team

name: Bria Preyer
text: Recently moved out from here but I stayed here for three years with little to no problems. Rent is low, maintenance is always super fast and management always responds to problems. I loved Ms Tarlisha and Ms Kimberly while being here, you don't always get nice and prompt management! Definitely recommend.

resp.text:
Hi Bria,

Thank you for recommending Evolve Tuscaloosa! We are so happy to hear you enjoyed calling our community home and our team was able to make your experience a good one.  We appreciate you choosing us for three years and wish you all the best!

Sincerely,
Evolve Tuscaloosa Team

name: Lauren Tucker
text: I've loved living here so far and have even already renewed my lease! I love the spacious bathrooms/closets and all of the amenities offered here at evolve. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful and maintenance always solves our problems on the fly!

Thank you so much for the 5 star review and for renewing your lease with us another year. Our goal here is to give you the best living experience while away from home. Please feel free to contact me, Property Manager, Kimberly Harper at 205-632-1213 if you have any questions or concerns. Roll Tide!!

text: A lot of great hospitality they work with you and make you feel welcomed. They make you feel like you are a part of a family. I am very excited to move in and enjoy my time at Evovle.

Thank you for rating our community and sharing your feedback. We are very happy to hear that you have enjoyed your experience with our team. We look forward to continuing to be there for you and the place you call home.

Sincerely,
Evolve Tuscaloosa Team

name: Teneshia Dukes
text: Evolve Tuscaloosa is the best place to live. The people here are nice and I can honestly say the staff here really care about their residents. I would highly recommend anyone to live here.

Thank you so much for giving Evolve a 5 star review! Our goal here is to have great customer customer service, and to make you feel that this is your home away from home. Please feel free to contact me, Property Manager, Kimberly Harper 205-632-1213.

text: I am a current resident and I love living here. I’ve lived here since they opened, and the staff and management are very nice and helpful. Property Management!
