text: Very beautiful and affordable place to live, the staff is very helpful and care about the property and all of their tenants! i personally think that the reviews of this property does it any justice, its something you have to see and experience for yourself. The apartments and amenities are top notch and for the price and the location i can assure you that there's nothing better that's remotely close in proximity! text: Evolve Tuscaloosa is a great place to live! It's always clean and the proximity to campus makes it a wonderful location. The rooms are spacious and the complex has modern amenities.

name: Courtney Norred
text: Love this place and living here. the staff is so helpful with anything that you need, the management treats you very well and is always asking how your stay is. anytime i have a problem with my amenities in my room air, lights, cable etc. its usually fixed within the first 24 hours of submitting a work order.

name: Lauren Sledge
text: Do not let these reviews fool you. The real reviews are up under Harbor on 6th. This is by far the worst! Students and managers are leaving because the overall experience is horrible. I can not wait to move out. The staff are rude, parking is stupid, everything is just done poorly. Please take your money anywhere else besides HERE!!!

resp.text:

name: Jeremy Taylor

name: Allana Mariie
text: I give evolve 4 stars because of their willingness and patience to work with residences. I sign my lease very late in the summer and had to move in early, they made accommodations so that I could do so. Then I had to move apartments because my roommate who was already living there was allergic to cats and they helped me get into a new apartment. Every problem I had they were more than happy to help and was very patient with me. Evolve isn’t perfect but it’s not bad. I love my apartment and all the perks like free printing, and the shuttle that runs to campus every 30 mins (which comes in handy A LOT), plus all the cool events they throw throughout the year. Overall it hasn’t been bad, and they are continuously improving as they go.

resp.text:
Hi Allana!
Thank you for the review and it was great seeing you at our pumpkin painting event! We look forward to having as a resident again! We are going to have so much fun!  As always if you have any questions or concerns please contact our office at 205-632-1213!

name: Autumn Saffore
text: Management is extremely helpful with any and all issues tenants have. The amenities are available at all times to residents, and it's in a close proximity to campus.

resp.text:

Thank you so much for the awesome review. We're happy to know that your housing needs are being met, and we also would like to thank you for renewing with us for the second time around. Autumn please feel free to contact me if you have any questions or concerns.
Thank you,
Property Manager-Kimberly Harper

name: Timothy Kennedy
text: Great proximity to campus and Mid-town. Management cares for their customers and make you feel welcome.

resp.text:
Hi Timothy!

name: Audrey Frohlich
text: I used to live there when they were called Harbor on 6th. All the bad reviews are true. I had very loud neighbors above me and I remember one yelling match about someone needing to give someone’s phone back. So yes the walls, ceiling, and floors are in deed thin. At the time there were no locks on the exterior doors and no cameras were installed. I had walked from the parking garage to the hallway and was almost to my door when I was rob buy to guys. Unfortunately they were never caught. Just a month after that my rent went up. They find loop holes in your lease agreement to find ways for their residents to pay more. For parking, it is atrocious! No one wants to have to pay for a parking spot where they live. Let alone a spot that probably isn’t even close to their apartment. Out of the four years that I have been going to school at the University, “Evolve” was the worst place I have lived. It was brand new when I moved in and I took care of the space I lived in and even at the end I still had to pay a cleanup fee even though it looked as the same as when I left. It sucked up all the money I made and all I could do was move. From the newest reviews it does not seem much has changed.

resp.text:
Hi Audrey,
We hope that you had a great school year and you are enjoying your summer! We regret to hear that you moved out a year ago with your questions and concerns unanswered. We noticed that your concerns expressed in your review were either addressed or updated prior to Fall 2018. I still would like to speak to you just to make sure that all of your concerns have been addressed because we value the opinion of our current and past residents. Please give me a call at 205.632.1213 at your earliest convenience.

Kimberly Harper
Property Manager

text: I haven't had a single problem all year!  It truly is a great community and people!  The rooms are super nice and I love the courtyard.  Ten out of ten recommend.

name: Gina Malozzi
text: I honestly love the complex. While yes, it’s more expensive than living off campus, State makes it worth it!! Campus is walkable, so I don’t have to drive or bike, the environment is safe and quiet, the pool and dog park are kept clean, and maintenance is on top of everything!! The mail station is orderly and convenient, elevator works fast, the stairwell is kept clean, the parking garage is safe and orderly, the hallways are kept clean, and the courtyard is great to spend your time at with friends or if you want to focus on your work. The only inconvenience is the train, not because of the noise (it’s not that bad honestly), but for traveling purposes, traffic can get kinda annoying depending on where you need to go!

resp.text: Gina, thank you so much for the 5-star rating. We greatly appreciate your feedback!

name: Spencer Lowery
text: I love living here. The complex has everything I need, and is super close to campus and the stip. The units are nice and spacious, and the staff is super helpful. Cameron and Brant go out of their way to make residents feel welcome and plan great events.

resp.text: Thank you for your positive review! We are ecstatic to hear our team gave you excellent customer service! We will be sure to let Cameron and Brant know that you appreciate them. We look forward to seeing you soon, Spencer, have a great week!

name: Jennifer Vendela (Jennifer) Samuelsson
text:
State is a decent apartment complex in Tuscaloosa. The best part about it is the maintenance guys, they are the sweetest and quickest people alive. I have never had a problem they can't solve for me within 24 hours. Positives about the complex is that the pool is generally clean (watch out though, a lot of random foot traffic come through and don't care enough to clean up after themselves), the staff responds well to problems and concerns, and a courtyard is finally replacing the awful grey concrete slab we had on the second floor before. Also, the place is very safe (security access) and close to campus.

However, it is very overpriced for what you get (no gym, packages don't always make it to your door or mailbox, staircases are always filthy and smell of urine and beer), you now have to pay for parking when it used to be free, the floors in the hallways tend to have dog pee on them, and worst of all, you hear literally everything your next door neighbors and upstairs neighbors do and say. I had to listen to the girl above me fighting with her boyfriend, moving furniture at 3 am and even her listening to music. It was insane. My roommates and I left them multiple notes and called in a noise compliant and the girls responded by taping a nasty letter to our door. Not fun, and nothing we got help with. Also, I finally got used to the train after 3 years of living there, but it is really loud and will shake your whole room.

One thing I would definitely have loved to see is a night guard to just patrol around a little every now and then.

I'd say this apartment would be great for sophomores, but when you reach a higher age you probably want to head somewhere a little quieter and more budget friendly.

All in all I don't regret living here, but I wish I would have moved out about a year earlier.

resp.text: Jennifer, thank you for giving us your thorough feedback. We are happy to hear that overall you have enjoyed calling State your home! We have really enjoyed having you as a part of our community. I am sorry to hear about the inconvenience and that some of your concerns have caused you. Please call us at 205-210-4396 or email me at nathanc@huboncampus.com so we can discuss your issues. -Nathan Cook (Property Manager)

name: Erica Hummeldorf
text: I have had a wonderful experience here at State, specifically with the leasing office. They're wonderful and so easy to work with if an issue ever arises and living here has been great, the location, the amenities, it's all been amazing here!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the review! We hope to have you again next year! -Katrina Crowley, Property Manager

text: I live in a 4 BR 4 BA and we love it. Any issues that we’ve had have been taken care of my management very quickly. The furniture package is really nice!

name: Stephanie Rhodes
text: I love state on campus!!! It is my favorite off campus housing and is super nice! The closet is super spacious I can fit all my clothes, shoes, and extra items. The counters in the kitchen and bathroom are so nice. Also, a lot of my friends live at other off campus apartments and pay around the same price and their rooms are not nearly as nice and clean as ours. Also, state is very safe, you need a key to get into the door, and then you need a key to get into the stairs or on the elevator, which keeps randoms from coming in. Maintenance is another plus, they are so friendly and usually come within 24 hours of requesting service. I highly recommend living here :)

resp.text: Stephanie, we are so pleased to hear that you enjoy living at State! Thank you for the sweet words and as always feel free to stop in the office to say hey! Thanks!

name: Ashley Paige Josey
text: I have lived here since August and I could not be happier with everything. The staff is friendly and helpful,  the atmosphere is perfect. I have never had any problems with anything. One time the staff went out of their way on a WEEKEND, to help me. I had left early that morning for Ole Miss and when I got to Ole Miss I realized something was missing, my suitcase. I had a feeling I left it outside where my car was parked. I called the front office and left a voicemail. They not only called me back the second they opened but they checked out and checked my apartment for me to see if I had left there, which I had, and I was relieved. They went out of their way to help me and to ease my mind while I was four hours away. BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER. I'm am older than most of the students in the building so I was iffy about living and staying here but I am so happy that I have already renewed my lease. ROLL TIDE! Come live here because its affordable, has friendly service, PET FRIENDLY!, an awesome pool area, and it is just in walking distance of campus!

resp.text: Thank you for the helpful review, Ashley! We are so happy to hear that you are enjoying the State Tuscaloosa life and our staff is taking great care of you! Thanks again Ashley. - Nathan Cook, Property Manager

name: Mason Greving
text: The people that work at State are great and very helpful! Move in was so easy and they take COVID-19 very seriously with lots of cleaning and email notifications. Definitely a great place to live

resp.text: Thank you so much for the 5-star review, Mason! We sincerely value your feedback and are so happy that you are enjoying living here at State on Campus Tuscaloosa! We hope to have you again next year! - Katrina Crowley, Property Manager

name: Alexie Otto
text: I cannot wait to live here in the fall with my roommates and our cat! The staff have been super helpful, and our visits have been nothing but extraordinary. I would highly recommend living in this place to anyone I meet. State is conveniently located close to campus, has all the amenities a college student needs, and a gorgeous living space!

name: Julia Westerman
text: Living at State has been great! Everyone is really helpful and aids in fixing any problems quickly. I already renewed for next year and I can't wait!

resp.text: Julia, thank you so much for the 5-star rating. We greatly appreciate your feedback!

name: Katarina Palmman
text: 11/10 experience !

resp.text: Katarina, thank you so much for the 5-star rating. We greatly appreciate your feedback!

name: Sabrina Carmickle
text: The maintenance staff works with you very well at solving conflicts immediately. Our apartment had cockroaches when we moved in and they came and sprayed. We haven't seen one since. The downside, there are residents that leave their trash by their doors and it smells up the hallway. The train is also very loud but location is great when walking to class. The pool is very nice & clean. Everyone is super helpful and the apartment complex is well kept by the staff. When putting in work orders, maintenance comes quickly.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind review. If there is anything we can do further for you, please don't hesitate to reach out! -The State on Campus Tuscaloosa Team

name: Cassandra (Casey) Stephan
text: This will be my second year living at State and I have had a great experience so far! I have had very little to no problems with my apartment and any maintenance requests I have made have been completed within 24 hours.The community is great.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review, Casey! We're so excited that you are enjoying your experience at State on Campus Tuscaloosa as much as we love having you. Have great weekend! - Katrina Crowley, Property Manager

name: Emma Garan
text: I love state! Cameron and Brant are so helpful and the rest of the staff as well. Our apartment is very nice and me and my roomates love the pool!

resp.text: Thank you for the helpful review, Emma! We are so happy to hear that you are enjoying the State life and our staff is taking great care of you! Thanks again Emma!

name: Gabriella Meridionale

resp.text: Gabriella, you’re awesome! Thank you for the 5-star review!

text: Great place to live because of location! Would be a lot better if the office was here and not on the strip.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind review. If there is anything we can do further for you, please don't hesitate to reach out! -The State on Campus Tuscaloosa Team

name: Anna Crim
text: I love State Tuscaloosa! I have lived here for 2 years and love how close it is to campus. It is kept up very nicely with a great maintenance and office staff. I love the redirecorated pool area and am so excited to use the new study area! I highly recommend living here!

resp.text: Anna, thanks for your feedback! We are grateful that you have chosen to call State Tuscaloosa home and are thankful to have you as a resident! Thanks again!

name: Claudia Steenberg
text: I’ve lived here for the past 2 years and would definitely recommend this place. It’s an easy 5 minute walk to campus, complex provides a study lounge and a secure parking garage, and the staff communicates effectively with the residents. Never had a problem here and am planning on resigning.

name: Madison Schlueter
text: Love living here because of location and size of room. Wish the office was in the actual complex and not a mile away as it does cause a bit of disconnect.

name: Mackenzie Kramer
text: This is my 2nd year living at State Tuscaloosa and I could not have picked a better off campus residence. The location cannot be beat. It is a 10 minute walk to campus so you do not need to pay the crazy price for a campus parking pass. The new management company is amazing and they are doing so many great things to ensure all of the residents are happy. I highly recommend leasing at State!

resp.text: Mackenzie, thanks for your feedback.  We are grateful that you have chosen to call State Tuscaloosa home and are thankful to have you as a resident! Thanks again! - Nathan Cook, Property Manager

name: Ryanne (Joy'e) Gilbert
text: I absolutely love living here! I moved here from another student-based housing complex and absolutely hateeeeed it. The management, maintenance, and overall quality of the complex were seriously lacking in more ways than one but not at State!! The staff is super friendly and fast. The rooms are also quite large and have beautiful natural lighting and are a short 10 minute walk to campus- not to mention being across from the football practice field is super cool. Definitely recommend living here :)

resp.text: Joy'e, thanks for your feedback.  We are grateful that you have chosen to call State Tuscaloosa home and are thankful to have you as a resident! Thanks again! - Nathan Cook, Property Manager

name: Audra Phillips
text: Very excited to live here next year! The amenities and staff are excellent along with the convenient location to campus! I highly recommend State On Campus to everyone I walk to!

text: This is my first year living here and if I wasn’t graduating this year I would renew my lease. I live in the 4bedroom townhouse style apartment and it has treated us well. You will notice that the grounds around the building as well as inside the complex are rather clean. The new updated pool area is great too.

name: Dayne Shover
text: Great place to live. Plan on staying here until I graduate.

text: State is super convenient and I really enjoy living here.  Friendly staff and lots of opportunities to meet other residents.

resp.text: Thanks for your feedback.  We are grateful that you have chosen to call State on Campus Tuscaloosa home and are thankful to have you as a resident! Thanks again! -Katrina Crowley, Property Manager

name: Madeline Edwards
text: Great location and friendly/responsive staff! I have lived here 2 years and will continue living here for a 3rd year next year and it has been the best management yet!

name: Linzy Russell
text: I just started living here and maintenance is so on top of everything!! Everyone is so kind and the apartments are amazing!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review, Linzy! We're so excited that you are enjoying your experience at State as much as we love having you. Have a wonderful day!

name: Katherine (Katie) Grimm
text: State Tuscaloosa is a great location for walking to campus and the stadium on game days. Great staff.

name: maddi marshall
text: This is my second year living here. Most apartments near UA are small and expensive, but at State you really get your moneys worth! It is also before the train tracks, while many apartments are behind, making the walk more stressful to get to campus, which was a benefit to the State. There is a nice pool and courtyard. I also like the small feel to this apartment complex. The biggest issue is cleanliness. We have had mushrooms and cockroaches and have placed many work orders and was not very well helped. They also promised us $200 gift cards last year for resigning, which NO ONE recieved. They make a lot of big promises that are never fullfilled. I think its below average compared to the newer apartment complexes in the area. It is nice that it is not expensive relatively with large rooms, but you don't get the same PROMISED resident perks as the other places.

resp.text: Thank you for bringing this concern to our attention, Maddi! It is our priority to treat everyone with respect and ensure our residents love their home and community. We strive to achieve the best customer service. We regret that we did not meet your expectations and want to make it right. Please reach out to me at KatrinaC@HubonCampus.com so we can discuss finding a resolution to your situation. - Katrina Crowley, Property Manager

name: Addison Willett
text: Great location, great maintenance, and great community!

resp.text: Thanks for your feedback.  We are grateful that you have chosen to call State on Campus Tuscaloosa home and are thankful to have you as a resident! Thanks again! -Katrina Crowley, Property Manager

name: Alexander Wiederkehr
text: The complementary coffee in the lobby is nice and the staff are responsive!

name: April Stricker
text: This is my 3rd year living at state and I could not be happier with my experience. It is walking distance to campus so you do not need to buy a parking pass and it is overall a great place to live!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the review! We hope to have you again next year! -Katrina Crowley, Property Manager

name: Gina Briley
text: This place is not worth the $725 + utilities we pay for rent! The train shakes our rooms, stove top, microwave, and dryer stopped working, air conditioning sucks, internet never works, the sink leaked and flooded a cabinet. There's mold in our sinks/toilets, the showers/sink barely drain. The tile floor in the living room came up and they've done nothing about it but say they are getting a contractor. The best thing about this place is how close it is to campus.

resp.text: Gina - I am sorry that your experience has not been as good as we would hope.  While I can't do anything about the trains, there are things in your review that we can address.  According to our records, there were work requests that were put in and they're showing as completed.  But if they're not completed to your satisfaction, then we need to come back and address that.  I will contact the maintenance supervisor and see how we can get things repaired to your satisfaction.

name: Cameron Dobbs
text: Used to like living here. I don't anymore.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback, Cameron. We strive to achieve the best customer service. We regret that we did not meet your expectations and want to make it right. Please reach out to me at KatrinaC@HubonCampus to discuss the details of your concerns. I look forward to talking with you very soon! - Katrina Crowley, Property Manager

name: Cameron Dobbs
text: not good

resp.text: Cameron, thank you for your comment. We strive to achieve the best customer service. We regret that we did not meet your expectations and want to make it right. Please reach out to me at katrinac@huboncampus.com to discuss any further issues and concerns. I look forward to talking with you very soon! - Katrina Crowley, Property Manager

name: Sherry Cannon
text: I gave one star because of the horrible customer service! I've been living at the magnolia since august of 2020 and the employees at the time were great. The move in process was very easy and professional. Recently the office has hired a whole new team expect for maybe one employees (Dylan) who has been very helpful throughout this entire process. It has been very difficult to get in contact with the new property manager. It seems as if she's always unavailable, there are certain questions & concerns i have regarding my lease that only a property manager could answer. Don't get me wrong the new employees try their best to help! but i want need answers straight from the source.

resp.text: Sherry thank you for your review. After looking into this further we want to ensure that you have the correct contact information to reach our team directly. Please email info@magnoliaatauburn.com with your concerns so that we can address your situation. While we do have an entirely new team,  all of our team members are fully prepared and equipped to answer any questions. We look forward to hearing from you.  Thanks

name: A C
text: Leaving this for full transparency - many of the 5 star reviews without descriptions were essentially baited into existence. For example, residents were told there was a free Chick-fil-A breakfast, but upon arriving, were told to leave a 5 star review on Google and only then would they get it for "free". Not a good look!

resp.text: Hi A C, thank you for leaving us a review. While we like to incentivize our residents for taking the time out to leave us a review we always encourage honest feedback so that we know how we can improve. We'd love to hear from you regarding any concerns, please give us a call at 334.887.8740 and speak with our manager, Brittney. We hope to turn that 1 star into 5 stars soon!

name: sharon martin
text: The move in experience was terrible! We were told that my daughter and niece were moving into a vacant apartment and another roommate would be coming in August. We were also told the apartment would be cleaned and it was completely renovated.  Instead, someone was already in the apartment. The apartment was very dirty. And the cabinets were certainly not renovated. We were very unhappy and the office manager did nothing to correct the problem. She refused to give the deposit back or terminate the lease even though they did not provide what we were told they would. My daughter was in tears from the disappointment and I regret not reading the reviews before choosing this place. Please don't make the same mistake. While we were there I saw countless other students coming in with complaints as well.

resp.text: Hello, Sharon. Thank you for the detailed feedback regarding your recent move-in here at The Magnolia. We pride ourselves on ultimate cleanliness and apologize we have not lived up to these standards. We have taken note of your concerns and would like to further address this issue. We’d love to hear from you, please stop by the leasing office or give us a call at 334.887.8740.

name: Temple of Worship Fellowship church
text: This is an amazing place to live. There are some minor things that need to be updated but overall a great place to stay. We love to refer people to this place!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words. We appreciate you taking the time out to share your experience. We love hearing how we are doing!

name: Olivia Abrams
text: The location and price is perfect for the average college student! The staff is very helpful from receiving packages to managing maintenance issues. The amenities here are nice as well such as access to printers, personal mailboxes and good wifi. I’d definitely recommend The Magnolia Apartments to whoever is looking!

resp.text: Thank you, Olivia! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Magnolia at Auburn!

name: Nathaniel Taylor
text: Miss Averyon is one of the newest managers at the Magnolia and she  was more than helpful with everything she did. She was the most helpful on the staff and genuinely has the best intentions for the residents here at the Magnolia.

resp.text: Thank you Nathaniel for your kind words. We are elated to hear your feedback regarding our new team members.

name: Travel With B
text: Moved in February, it’s been great so far. Maintenance is quick, the office staff is nice, and goes the extra mile to handle any issues that arise and the location is minutes from everything.

resp.text: Thank you, B! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Magnolia at Auburn!!

name: Cheyenne Ashou
text: The place is a great location and has a nice staff; however, there are a few things that I wish were changed. First, the apartment complex advertises itself as a gated community, but I have not seen the gates being used once overall in the 3 months I’ve lived here. Secondly, it would be nice to have access to the gym. After all if Auburn University is allowing access to the Rec Center, it only makes sense that the Magnolia would do the same as well. I understand that there is a virus in the midst, but we are all adults here and can handle ourselves. Other than that, this is a great place to live.

resp.text: Hi Cheyenne, Thank you so much for the feedback! We are in the process of having our gates repaired and hope to have them back up and running before the end of the month. We also have started our phased reopening process for the amenities and should have the gym and study lounge reopened very soon. Our clubhouse amenities are opened again now as well! We apologize for any inconvenience and again appreciate your input. Thank you! -Christina Winslett (Community Manager)

name: Camron Garner
text: What a great place to visit , I’m here with my friends all the time

resp.text: Camron, thank you for leaving this detailed feedback about your experience here at The Magnolia at Auburn. Thank you very much for sharing these comments.

name: Lacey Holloman
text: I have loved living here! Megan, Averyon, & Drelyn are great!

resp.text: Thank you! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Magnolia at Auburn!!

name: alexandra wooten
text: i LOVE the new management team.... especially ms.brittney and ms.aevron (sorry if i misspelled your name). the new team is very helpful and very compassionate about solving any issues and problems that an individuals have within their unit. also the new management team is very friendly and warm welcoming. thank you to the higher ups for blessing the magnolia community with the management team because the last one  was dysfunctional and wack.

resp.text: Alexandra, thank you so much for your kind words! We appreciate you taking the time to leave us a review and share your experience. We hope all of our wonderful residents, like yourself, will enjoy the many changes and improvements to come.

name: Claire stewart
text: This is a great place in Auburn to live in. I’ve worked several times with Andrew who is a leasing agent there and he did a wonderful job explaining everything -very welcoming to say the least! Their staff is always super friendly and available just about anytime you need them. Would definitely recommend touring these apartments!

resp.text: Claire, Thank you so much for your review! It is great to hear such wonderful feedback about our team!

name: Anthony White
text: The magnolia at auburn has a very positive and cheerful environment I highly recommend

resp.text: Thank you, Anthony White! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us!!

name: Brittany lynn
text: I am beyond happy that I decided to move into this community after numerous tours. Christina was extremely helpful and efficient throughout the entire process. I have to say the pool area is my absolute favorite. So well kept and gorgeous pool furniture. I would recommend any day to anyone in search of a new home!

resp.text: Brittany, we are so happy you decided to live with us as well! We appreciate your feedback! We also really love the pool and can't wait until summer returns! Be on the look out for fun resident events and pool parties next year!

name: ThematicJ Savy
text: It’s very chill & friendly. I would recommend this complex to anyone looking for a comfortable place & safe place to live.

resp.text: Thank you so much! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Magnolia at Auburn!!

name: sarah t
text: I really have enjoyed living here! The employees are great and the amenities are really nice. I love being able to use our new study center and would recommend living here!

resp.text: Sarah, thank you for leaving feedback about your experience with The Magnolia at Auburn!

name: Colby Edmond
text: Great service! Loved how easy it was to move in. Great apartment. No damages! And I appreciate how everyone was willing to answer all of my questions.

resp.text: Colby, we love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Magnolia at Auburn!

name: Makayla Thibodeaux
text: Meet Andrew and Averyon today. Very nice and welcoming. The magnolia has a very nice gym and workout space. definitely look forward to visiting more often

resp.text: Makayla, thank you for your feedback!

name: Travtya Banks
text: Awesome place! I believe a young blonde man and a girl name Maggy helped my grandson find comfort in his new home. Everything on college is very close to him and he still was able to succeed in school, even from off campus.

resp.text: Travtya, thank you so much for your feedback! We are thrilled to hear that your grandson is loving his apartment and succeeding in his classes!

name: caleb ellerbee
text: Great place havent had any problems in the 3years ive been here!

resp.text: Thank you, Caleb! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Magnolia at Auburn!!

name: Asri Juniati
text: Cozy apartment, friendly management teams. I love the Magnolia because I always get what I want from the team. It’s only 10 minutes from campus . They often provide us with free breakfast and stuff even in corona time.

resp.text: Asri, thank you for your feedback! We love that you enjoy living at The Magnolia at Auburn!

name: Caroline C
text:
An overall good experience, but for the price, it's a great deal!

Pros: super spacious living room, generally quick responses for maintenance requests, property grounds are kept up nicely, walls are nowhere near as thin as other places I've lived

Cons: very slow internet -- I'm a student and when using Zoom, I can only get audio but it's not enough to stream the video content too--there was a pretty bad pest issue when I first moved in but they were quick to spray when I let them know, moldy air vents / cabinets

resp.text: Caroline, thank you for the detailed feedback regarding your experience at The Magnolia at Auburn! We pride ourselves on providing the best possible experience. Please continue to reach out to us if you have any further issues!

name: Kathryn Sweeden
text: Good place to live! I love the 3 bedroom 3 bathroom accommodations & the people in the front office have been doing their best with the COVID situation! Nice gym & pool.

resp.text: Kathryn, thank you for leaving a review! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us!

name: Gregory Walker
text: Fairly great place. Wish the gym were open and the gates would work but its been pleasant nonetheless. Maintenance always comes and resolves issues fairly quickly and the location is fantastic with two tiger transit stops. Definitely worth the price.

resp.text: Hi Gregory, thank you for your feedback! We are in the process of repairing the gates and hope to have them back up and running as soon as possible. We are also currently reopening our amenities on a phased schedule. Our clubhouse is now back open and the gym and pool should follow shortly. We apologize for this inconvenience. Please let us know if there is anything else we can do to assist you. Thank you! -Christina Winslett (Community Manager)

name: Madelyn Seaman
text: I just moved here this fall and I’ve had nothing but good experiences. The staff is very friendly and very interactive with their events. The Magnolia is in a very convenient place in town, being across from a Walmart and close to some very good restaurants. Overall I’ve really like living here and I highly recommend The Magnolia to anyone searching for an apartment.

resp.text: Madelyn, thank you so much for the feedback and review! We love hearing our residents have had great experiences here at The Magnolia.

name: Erryial Sanders
text: I love it here! Usually comes pretty quick with maintenance. Internet service could improve.

resp.text: Erryial, thank you for leaving your review! We appreciate your feedback and are always looking for way to improve!

name: Dhruvin Patel
text: This is a great place for students to live! It’s quiet and very affordable compare to other apartments around. They also have a really nice maintenance crew that comes around to fix everything if anything is broken.

resp.text: Dhruvin, thank you so much for the feedback. We are so glad you will be staying with us for another year. We always love to hear how our maintenance team is doing and appreciate your review.

name: Anna Arnold
text: Love this place and the amenities they provide! Very nice maintenance and staff in general, as well as great sized apartments for the price. It doesn't hurt that Taco Bell is less than 5 minutes away too.

resp.text: Thanks so much for your feedback, Anna! We also love being so close to numerous restaurants and stores!

name: Harli Willis
text: Amazing welcoming staff! Beautiful place to live! Well priced and worth it! Love that place

resp.text: Harli, thank you for the feedback! We love hearing that you love to live at The Magnolia!

name: Anna Arnold
text: Love this place and the amenities they provide! Very nice maintenance and staff in general, as well as great sized apartments for the price. It doesn't hurt that Taco Bell is less than 5 minutes away too.

resp.text: Thanks so much for your feedback, Anna! We also love being so close to numerous restaurants and stores!

name: Andrew Roth
text: I’ve loved living here through the past four years! Things have changed for the better in so many ways! I love the community, and the fact we are pet friendly! Hopefully there will be some more community event soon, they are always fun!

resp.text: Thank you, Andrew! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Magnolia at Auburn!!

name: Khadijah Graves
text: There is mold throughout my entire room. When you come inside, you can smell the mold. I made a request to get it fixed and it took maintenance 3 weeks to get to my apartment after multiple reminders. Once maintenance came, they only focused on my bathroom. They tore the wall down and placed  a dehumidifier in my room for about a week. They place me in what looks like an  abandoned apartment for the time being. Literally, nothing worked in the temporary apartment. Once they fixed the wall, they never came back to repaint it. I have reminded them over and over and its been 3 month and no one has showed up to finish the job. Now there is mold growing again! This is disgusting and no one should have to live in these conditions. DO NOT MOVE HERE! It's not worth it.

resp.text:
Hello Khadijah,

We are sorry to hear about the issues in your apartment. Our management and maintenance teams work together to ensure our residents enjoy a comfortable community, so we regret that this matter has not been completely addressed to your satisfaction. Our team wants to resolve this for you and did go to your apartment to begin the repairs yesterday.  The Community Manager will follow up with you once the repairs are completed to ensure you are satisfied with the results.  In the meantime, please do not hesitate to reach out to the Community Manager at  SocialMgr@WaypointStudentLiving.com if you need to share additional information.
Thank you.

name: Sylvia Masango
text: I lived at The Magnolia at Auburn Apartments for almost four years and thoroughly enjoyed my experience. The latest renovations provide great updated amenities and the apartment complex also hosts engaging events (prior to COVID). The location is also prime for the average college student. The staff are friendly and professional and will go out of their way to ensure their residents are taken care of. I'd like to give a special shoutout to Ms. Averyon, who just recently started working there. She will go above and beyond to make sure all your residential needs are taken care of and is incredibly kind and thoughtful.

resp.text: Thank you, Sylvia! We love hearing that you enjoyed living with us.

name: Ashley Glaze
text: I am super excited to live here next year! The girl that showed me around was great and super helpful answering my questions. The apartments are nice and the gym is huge!

resp.text: We cannot wait to have you as a resident, Ashley! We know you will love the community as well as the amenities! Keep an eye out this summer when we start hosting invents for our new incoming residents! Thanks so much for the review.

name: PoppinWithJo
text: Would only consider living here if you absolutely have no where else to live! The location is great! But that’s the only positive about this place. Maintenance doesn’t fulfill your requests in a timely manner and if they do, it’s never fully completed just covered up to where you’ll have to call and ask to have the same task completed again. They never notify you when they’ve been in your house, and they steal! They’ve stolen money straight out of my drawer before. If you happen to have issues with your roommate they DO NOT care, nor do they try to resolve the issue. They ignore your calls and emails and never actually resolve anything. When they do respond they say they’ll do things they never do! All apartments are INFESTED with gnats to the point where they end up in your refrigerator. Pest control may come, but never resolves the issue. Sometimes pest control says they’ve came and they actually never come so you’re left waking up with gnats in your bed! Renovated apartments look nice until you move in and find a ton of things need to be done. Gym sucks, pools are about the only great amenity. So please think again and again and again before deciding to move into this  place, unless sleeping with gnats and bed bugs doesn’t bother you and you don’t mind issues not being resolved. I would never suggest anyone move here!

resp.text: Ms. Mitchell, we are sorry to hear you had this experience. To our knoweldge, the office was not made aware of these issues and would love to discuss them futher to come to a solution. Please feel free to contact us, we would be happy to help in anyway we can. Thank you, Christina Winslett (Community Manager)

name: Jemma Constant
text: Do not waste your money here. The wifi constantly cuts out throughout the entire complex, and I have spoken to the staff multiple times about fixing it, and each time they act like it is the first time hearing about the issue. After speaking with Comcast, they said that the entire wifi system is very old and outdated, and needs to be completely replaced or the shortages will continue to happen. I will not be renewing my lease here and would not recommend this place to anyone. There is a huge lack of communication among staff, and nothing ever gets fixed. Also, the only reason why they have some good reviews is because they offer prizes to anyone who writes a good review, to try and even out all the terrible, truthful reviews.

resp.text: Jemma, thank you for your detailed review! We sincerely appreciate your feedback. Please contact the leasing office at 334.887.8740 to discuss these concerns further!

name: Caroline MacCaughelty
text: I would give 0 stars if I could. I was asked to take down this review by the property manager here at The Magnolia because she didn't want anyone to know what I really thought of this place and its management. Well, I'm putting my review back up and this time it's staying. The Magnolia has some of the worst management I have ever come in contact with. The managers are rude and dismissive of issues that I've had. They have allowed their vendors to enter my room without my knowledge, violating my privacy and then treating the issue like a small minor problem. Maintenance is stoned whenever they come to fix things, never in a timely manner, and the manager denies this fact. In the end, it doesn't matter if you fixed it or not, the process was arduous and awful for me. They were rude almost the ENTIRE time and did not treat me like a customer who is paying their salary. They in NO WAY went above and beyond to assist me. They did the BARE MINIMUM. I have many more complaints that I've already sent to corporate that contain way too much for one google review. To summarize, save your money. Magnolia IS NOT worth it.

resp.text: Ms. MacCaughelty, I asked you to please consider removing your original review because you posted it before allowing us an opportunity to fix the items in your apartment, all of which have since been fixed. Your claims against our team members are unfounded and slanderous. Our team has gone above and beyond to address every concern and service request in your apartment. However, regardless of which team member responds or interacts with you, you feel the need to belittle them and accuse them of false actions. Our team is committed to providing excellent customer service and assisting our residents in any way possible and we know we will continue to show you that through the duration of your lease. Thank you, Christina Winslett (Community Manager)

name: Clara Hanbyeol Jin
text: I usually don't write reviews but I am fed up dealing with this apartment. I have renewed multiple times due to the proximity to my workplace and the relatively low rent but working with management has been a nightmare. I have called and visited the front desk FREQUENTLY to try to get a hold of the manager but she is always conveniently "in a meeting." I believe the front desk student assistants do their portion of the job taking down my name, unit & phone # to have her call me back but I have NEVER gotten a call back. It has taken my roommate and I 2.5 YEARS of harassing the front desk student workers only to get a flooring issue "semi" resolved by the management. OCCASIONAL email replies as a result of the harassment is the only form of communication we have been receiving. I am also expecting TWO concession payments: one of which clearly states that it would be given out within 30 days (it has been almost two months now) of the lease renewal date and another for referring a friend. This latter one does not even have a contract or a form of agreement, so the only argument I have in favor of my case, is a screenshot of the advertisement from two months ago. When inquired about this issue, the office only came back to me and said that I would hear from corporate soon and took no action whatsoever to accelerate this process. The only positive side of this complex is that the in-house maintenance is usually quick to respond (and the high water pressure is a bonus). There have been more than enough hiccups with our air conditioning which eventually got switched out to a new one (most of the A/C units are probably in need of an upgrade due to age). Gates have been installed as a "solution" for all the shootings that have happened recently, but have not been activated as they are still waiting to pass out parking passes/gate access as we approach the THIRD month of the lease term. There have been three changes in management companies in less than three years, which should explain the mess that this apartment is in, but I believe the actual on-site manager, Christina, who has stayed at the site despite the changes, is a main source of all these negative reviews from current residents. If "short-staffing" is the issue here, please hire someone else to help her address these matters - this apartment is not maintained well enough to justify the rent and the lack of response that the residents are receiving.

resp.text: Clara, thank you for sharing this experience with us. We're pleased to know that you've enjoyed speedy service from our maintenance team and value our high water pressure! However, we are concerned with the lack of responsiveness you've received from management and can understand how that would be a source of frustration. We will call you soon to touch base and assess how we can best assist you, but please also feel free to reach out to us anytime at SocialMgr@WaypointStudentLiving.com. Thanks so much for your review and bringing this matter to our attention.

name: M H
text:
I have enjoyed my time living at The Social and plan to renew my lease for this upcoming year. I wouldn't say my experience has been perfect, but you get what you pay for. As The Social is one of the most affordable apartment complexes in Auburn, you shouldn't come here with overly high  expectations. For the price you pay, this is a great complex. They are not as renovated as I had hoped, but the appliances are in good working order, which is all that matters to me. Management has worked with my roommates and I each time we have had an issue. Recently, they credited our accounts after a broken AC unit ran up the power bill. Next week they will be replacing the unit. Maintenance can be slow to respond at times, but this typically coincides with times when many people are putting in requests, such as on move-in day. The staff at The Social are always helpful and have resolved each issue I have presented them with. I would say overall that The Social is a great place to live and I would recommend it to others.

Update: Since my original review, all of my kitchen appliances have been replaced. The kitchen was completely redone and I was told I should be getting new furniture in the near future. A new management team has taken over and made vast improvements to the property and to many, if not all, of the units. Currently they are resurfacing the front pool and soon they will be putting a dog park in the back of the complex. I am still very satisfied with my living experience at The Social and I still recommend it, especially now!

resp.text: Thank you, MK! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Social Auburn!! If you ever have any issues during your stay, please reach out to us and let us know!

name: Samantha Adams
text: The Social is a pretty nice place to live. The office staff is super nice and try to help you however they can. They recently changed management companies and there have been a lot of improvements since. The apartments are already upgraded, but they've recently been remodeling all of the kitchens and they look amazing. The prices are good and relatively cheap, and you get what you pay for. I would definitely recommend living here.

resp.text: Thank you, Samantha! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Social Auburn!! Let us know if you need anything during your stay.

name: a A
text: This complex is a joke. I’ve lived here twice and had 2 leases and I regret it. The first time, they charged me for rent that I did not owe after I went to the office multiple times to clear this up. This second time, there was a shooting outside my building and the power hungry management team  responded by implementing very strict parking rules that are not needed. The complex never issued us guest parking passes in the first place. They complain about non residents parking in guest spaces when they never gave their residents guest parking passes which would have cleared that problem to begin with. Most apartment complexes issue their residents one parking pass and a guest pass but not the social! It doesn’t matter if your friends or family come to visit and they leave their car for 49 hours, they will tow it. They obviously had massive resident backlash from this policy otherwise they wouldn’t have sent out an email basically giving their own residents the finger. last time I checked, Adults live here not children so management should stop treating us like children. Trust me. There are better apartment complexes in Auburn.

resp.text: Andrew, we regret to hear of your disappointment as our resident. It is our mission to provide you with an excellent home, and we're sorry if you've been displeased with our management and parking policies. Thank you for allowing our Manager the chance to connect with you directly this week, as we appreciate the opportunity to better understand your experience and address your concerns. And don't hesitate to reach out directly in the future, at SocialMgr@WaypointStudentLiving.com, if we can be of assistance in any way. We appreciate your residency.
