text: This place sucks. My internet has been down for more than a week. They told my roommate it should be fixed on a Wednesday and it wasn't. Then I asked and they told me Saturday, and it wasn't. My dryer takes 5 hours to dry a small load of clothes and I asked them to replace it and they haven't and I honestly don't think they ever will. Our thermostat isn't working properly so our air is usually running all day and we can't do anything about it. They still haven't brought us furniture yet and the "State of the Art" workout area is god awful. Overall the management f****** sucks, the employees suck, and the complex as a whole, and as an individual apartment sucks.

name: Lucas Elmore
text: This place has like 5 or more shootings per year, ran by scummy people, mediocre apartments. Don't live here.

resp.text: We are disheartened to read your review of our community. Since we strive to provide great service and an exceptional home to all our residents, we're eager to further discuss & understand your concerns so that we my address them directly. Based on the name provided, we are unable to locate you in our system, so please com by the office or email me at SocialMgr@WaypointStudentLiving.com to share any details from your experience. Thank you in advance for the opportunity to improve your opinion of our community.

name: Anonymous
text: I moved out 3 months ago, and I'm still be harassed about something that was "taken care of" in March. When you call to speak to a manager, you get the run around. I was personally in the office when someone called asking to speak to the manager; the manager proceeded to tell the receptionist to say that she wasn't in the office. How are you supposed to handle issues when you won't even talk to your residents/clients?

name: Kristopher McCord
text: Improved from last year. Main issue I have seen is that maintenance must be understaffed as work orders/requests take a long time to go through.

name: Alex Patellis
text: Would rate 0 if i could. Dark, musty, cant even cook without setting fire alarms off its by far the worst complex ive seen in auburn. Steer clear of The Social.

resp.text:
Hello Alex,

We are so sorry your experience hasn't been the best.  We sincerely value your opinion and would like the opportunity to visit with you in person to discuss and hear more details.  If you prefer to call us, our number is (334) 887-8740 or you may also email us at  SocialMgr@WaypointStudentLiving.com

We look forward to hearing from you soon.

name: Orange Jumpsuit
text:
Terrible place to live. Management is awful. My internet doesnt work and they dont even follow their own lease. They are lucky I have not sued yet.

UPDATE: They fixed my internet after 3 months. Thanks! Now the other things. 800 dollars a month for a one bedroom, ouch. The 1 bedroom apartments do not even resemble the layout that they show on their website or the ones THAT ARE IN THEIR OFFICE. There is a total of 3 lights in the one bedroom apartment. One for the door, one for the bathroom, and one for the kitchen. I hope you do not need a light for your bedroom!! The place was filthy when i moved in and I was promised new furniture in September.. Still waiting on that. The gift card that I was supposed to receive in August on move in day, I finally received in November. This place is awful. I cannot stress enough how bad this place is. Please do not live here. ANY PLACE IS BETTER.

-VERY unhappy renter.

name: Taylor Jordan
text: BY FAR THE WORST LIVING EXPERIENCE EVER. MANAGEMENT IS SO UNPROFESSIONAL AND RIDICULOUS! I DO NOT, I REAPT, DO NOT RECOMMEND ANYONE TO STAY HERE!

name: Clair Russell
text: DO NOT LIVE HERE!!!!!! It’s a scam, the office is brand new and super hip, the model room is extremely nice but the units are AWFUL!!!!!!!!!!!! Furniture is broken, paint is chipped, appliances are out of date. It’s WAY too expensive and the WORST apartment I’ve ever lived in. NEVER LEASE WITH THE SOCIAL!!!!!!!!!

resp.text: Clair, thank you for your feedback. It is our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory.  Our team would be happy to speak with you and resolve the issues you are having. Please contact Elvin Philpot at 334-887-8740 at your earliest convenience.

name: Laura LaChappelle
text: "Move-in ready" included a disgustly filthy kitchen (cabinet doors were black with grime, outside of stove and refrigerator had not been cleaned, etc.), stove was not functioning, dresser had a drawer that was clearly broken, kitchen furniture set was missing a chair--yet management INSISTS each apartment is "inspected" and approved as move-in ready. Two phone calls and an email went ignored for 5 days before I finally called again and caught a manager to speak with--very unimpressed.

name: Guillermo Nieves
text: Went through the application process on their website and signed for a 5 month lease. Go to sign my lease and notice that they gave me a lease for a year term. I called and was told they only do year long leases. Why even have the option to apply for a semester long lease then? Unprofessional.

resp.text: Guillermo, thank you for your feedback. It is our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory. Unfortunately we are not authorized to do any short term leases at this time. Good luck on your apartment search.

name: A
text: Horrible Customer Service!!!  Every call goes to an answering service and no one ever calls you back!

name: Camila Alves Leite
text: The place is so pretty but is not safe!

name: Winston Van
text: i dont even live here lol

resp.text: Hi, Winston! If you've visited our community and have any feedback to share, we'd love to listen! Please connect with me at SocialMgr@WaypointStudentLiving.com to share any insight. We appreciate your time!

name: Marc Roldy Presume
text:
Good experience!
Loving it

resp.text: Wonderful, Marc! We're so glad you've been impressed here at The Social!

name: Neil Postal
text:
Pros:
- Walking distance to walmart
- Cheap
- Tiger Transit Stop

Cons:
- Internet cuts off semi-frequently
- Too many gunshots
- Buildings are getting old

resp.text: Thanks for providing feedback, Neil. Since we strive to provide an exceptional living experience to our residents, we love hearing how much you enjoy our location and great value. That said, we're sorry if concerns about our community, facilities, and services have affected your happiness. We're already making great strides towards ensuring our residents' complete comfort in our community, but want to ensure your specific needs are heard and met. A member of our team will reach out to you shortly, but we also welcome you to connect with us at SocialMgr@WaypointStudentLiving.com as well. Thank you.

name: Gary Hoover
text: They upgraded the Internet, yet the didn't tell anyone how to log onto the new internet. I use my regular email and password yet I still cannot connect

name: Calin Ristau
text: Dont care about residents and do not fix problems

resp.text: We appreciate your feedback, Calin. Our mission is to provide you with a great home and outstanding service, and we care deeply about our residents. We're saddened to hear you are unhappy and we'd like to address your concerns promptly. Please consider visiting with us in person at your convenience. You can reach us at SocialMgr@WaypointStudentLiving.com if you think of anything else you'd like to share. We look forward to connecting.

name: Octavia James
text: DO NOT LIVE HERE. THEY CHANGE MANAGEMENT EVERY THREE MONTHS. BUT THATS ONLY ONE OF THE MANNNNNY ISSUES. SO UNORGANIZED AND UNPROFESSIONAL.

name: Berny Sheorn
text: The worst complex I have ever come across. There are break-ins all the time, and most buildings stink of marijuana. The staff is also largely unhelpful, and seem to always find a way to only halfway do anything. Look elsewhere for living arrangements.

name: Morgan Jones
text: Y’all said y’all open at 1 pm. No one is here to open the door. It’s ridiculous. The person being 30 min late to work when there are 4+ people here trying to make payments, get a parking pass, or etc. you need to do your job.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear this, Morgan! It's important for residents and visitors to always be greeted and receive prompt service. We apologize for any inconvenience this caused, as well as any miscommunication on our part.  Please know that you are always welcomed to reach out to us via phone, in person or via email.  Do not hesitate to email us if you would like an opportunity to further discuss this in depth.  We may be contacted via email at: SocialMgr@WaypointStudentLiving.com. We value the opportunity to address your concerns.

name: Ethan Hill
text: One of the worst places to live in Auburn, I lived here for a year and it was a miserable experience. Parking is impossible, rooms are poorly kept and the management just does not care. Things would break and no matter how much I asked the management to send a repair man, they never would. On top of all that once my lease was finally up and i moved out they charged me with a $250 bill for "cleaning and damages" but did not inform me of theses charges until 6 months later...never sign a lease here

name: Jamarcus Knight
text: My experience with the social as been a bit rocky when I first moved in there has been multiple problem with the apartment such as dryer & washer not working I put in a maintenance order to get fixed it took a few days so I contacted the property manager an he got it fixed the next day the rentovations look really nice but now my Internet does not work I have been contacting charter for almost 2 month an nothing still haven’t been does it’s VERY FRUSTRATING

resp.text: Jarmarcus, thank you for your feedback. It is our goal to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory. We have contacted Spectrum about your internet. You must call (855) 895-5302 due to you wanting to set up your personal equipment. Please let us know if the issue is not resolved after contacting that number. Thanks!

name: Traca Boswell
text: Car towed, didn’t know you needed a parking permit. No guest parking or signs to suggest

resp.text: Traca, sorry to hear about your experience. For future reference, we have signs posted in both entrances that state that all cars must have a parking tag, visitor parking is located near all buildings and is marked with bold white letters that spell out visitor. If you have any questions please feel free to reach out to one of our team members at 334-887-8740!

name: Hue Mungus
text: Very epic

resp.text: We love hearing that you've had an "epic" experience, Hue! Thanks for the 5 stars!

name: Matthew King
text: If I could give zero stars I would.

name: Steven Murray
text: I moved in August 2015. Management changes very often but that just life but it seems like no one communicates. First i was told that we wouldn't have to back pay for the power bill that had added up for almost 5 months, then all of a sudden we get a bill that has to be paid in 2 or 3 months. Second i was supposed to get $400 for referring another resident, at first i was told that we didn't have to fill any paperwork out and that the checks were going to be delivered. After that i was told by another RESIDENT not a front office staff that we had to come to the office to fill out a paper that would take 30 to 90 days befor4i received the money. I called at least once a month only to be told that it would be coming late February early March. Early March came and I went to the office to ask about my check only to be told that they lost my paperwork, so i refilled another paper out waiting for the check once again. I've called multiple times to see about the check only to be given a run around by the office staff.

name: Erica Lewis
text: The gym is still not available, however, it’s advertised as an amenity!  It has not  been open since August of 2018. It is now  2019.   It’s currently used as a storage room.

resp.text: Hi Erica, we hate that it took awhile to get things up and running and apologize for the inconvenience it may have caused you. You'll be happy to know that our basketball court is open daily from 9am to 10pm and the fitness center is available to our residents 24/7. While we are working to renovate and upgrade those facilities for our residents, with new equipment set to arrive in the next couple of weeks, we are working to limit the amount of time those amenities will be unavailable for you. We'd like to connect with you to  share the exciting plans for our new amenity concept, as well as answer any questions you may have, so a member of our team will call you soon. As always, we welcome you to reach out via email at SocialMgr@WaypointStudentLiving.com, or in person, if there's anything further we can assist you with. Thank you for reaching out, and we look forward to improving your opinion of our community very soon!

name: Gostop ss
text: Totally a freaking joke. So Bad!!!!!

resp.text:
Hello Gostop ss,

We are sorry to hear that you are unhappy with our community.  We value your opinion and and hope that you will stop by and visit us in person or email us at SocialMgr@WaypointStudentLiving.com.  We look forward to finding a resolution that would work for you.

Sincere thanks,

name: Janellza Hunter
text: Every time I’ve had a question the staff has helped me with it.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words! We strive every day to ensure that living at The Social is a wonderful experience. Please don't ever hesitate to reach out to us if you need anything. We are always happy help! -Your Social Apartments Team

name: Matthew Gage
text:
Management is not helpful whatsoever. I've put in 3 maintenance requests over the past 2 months and none of them have been met, nor have I even been contacted that they would be fixed. They are looking for anyone and everyone to move into these places and then are not helpful when they match you up with someone that does not fit your standards of life. Student staff help is terrible. After filing multiple complaints about maintenance issues, I went into the office and had to wait 10 minutes before I was waited on because the student staff were too busy running around the office playing tag to assist me with the situation.

The apartments themselves are newer but what ones I have been in are already so run down it looks like they were built 15 years ago.

Overall, like the title says, DO NOT LIVE HERE! GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!

name: Dr. Diggs
text: Whenever you call do not speak to the girl that says her name begins with a K, because whenever you ask her to do something she always days she will write down your email and name to give the manager but she never does because she is lazy getting paid to do nothing but sit and give tours!!!

name: Natcha Luechakiettisak
text: The service here is very slow. The information are kind of not connected with each other also.

name: Andrew Moore
text: Pretty unorganized.

name: YW L
text: Three months after renew the rent, I found that I paid more than I had paid before. It is cheating, i would never live at here anymore. When I returned to China, everything in the room was stolen.

name: Furkan Filiz
text: Nice place for living

name: Tommy Sledge
text: Just trust the reviews and don't live here

text: I won't be renting here.

resp.text: Awesome, Tamika! We're thrilled you enjoy our "nice and fun" community! :)  Please let us know if there is ever anything we can do for you.

name: Liu Chen
text:
(Translated by Google) The Chinese must read this comment:

You must never choose social as a ghost place to live. Office management and communication are chaotic to death, and emails are not answered very much. What you say to the front desk will never be conveyed to it. You can assign rooms to you, and there is no room for you. Packed up, the traces left by the predecessors have not been cleaned up, and there are shootings here every year, the door is never closed, just used to scare people.

Don’t live for cheap, or you will feel pain and uncomfortable

Should be your last option to consider to choose a APT in Auburn. The office very Chaos in communication and management just like the Trump White House !!!
