resp.text: Liu Chen, thank you for your feedback. It is our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory.  Our team would be happy to speak with you and resolve the issues you are having. Please contact our office at 334-887-8740 at your earliest convenience as we do not have you listed as a resident. Thank you- Christina (Community Manager)

name: 宫宇轩
text:
(Translated by Google) Property is disgusting and very bad living experience

(Original)
物业很恶心，非常糟糕居住体验

name: ZHAOKUN LI
text:
(Translated by Google) I still have more than 200 knives in my account, and I have been owing it for three months. I called 10,000 times and urged me to tell me that I still owe it because I destroyed the apartment.

(Original)
账户里本来还有200多刀 一直欠着不还 三个月一万遍打电话催促之后告诉我我还欠费 因为毁坏公寓 鬼做的吧大概 辣鸡

resp.text: Zhaokun, Please contact our Community Manager,  Elvin at 334-887-8740 at your earliest convenience. He will be glad to meet with you and discuss your issue.

name: D'Angelo Baker
text: I have lived here almost 5 years and I honestly love it. The location is the perfect medium between campus, downtown, and shopping. It's also only 5 minutes away from the interstate which makes it ideal for travel. The prices are amazing and you get so much for what you pay. Also, the new management, maintenance, and internet in the past year have been amazing. I definitely recommend this place if you’re looking for luxury off-campus housing that won’t break the bank.

resp.text: D’Angelo, thank you so much for your positive review! We take great pride in our prime location and friendly staff, and we are so happy you have found your home with us!

name: Forest Dewberry
text: I had black mold in my apartment. The reason being, (probably due to shoddy construction) whenever it rained a pool of water formed on our living room floor. We called maintenance multiple times but eventually stopped because they weren’t able to fix the underlying problem. However, maintenance was good at fixing appliances quickly whenever they broke. I set up auto-pay on the web portal but had to manually pay and reset auto-pay multiple times. Not a huge issue but it was an inconvenience I haven’t seen elsewhere. Finally, there were bugs called “silverfish” in the apartments all seasons, even winter, and the only thing that was done for those was stick traps were placed indoors - not very effective. Truthfully, the place should have been smoked out over winter break when we were all gone. All of this said, the price was less than $600/mo which is very competitive. There is also a pool which is fun to hang out at with friends. I hope this review has been informative.

resp.text:
Forest,

Thank you for the review. The maintenance issue pictured above was addressed as soon as a work order was placed. If it is an ongoing issue, please let the office know and we would be happy to get someone back out there! Additionally, if there is anything else we can do to improve your experience here, please let us know.

name: Alexis L.
text:
I have lived at this complex for a year now and it seems that every month we have a new problem. However, here are some good things about the Connection:
The maintenance guys are quick to come fix problems.
The price is competitive.
Management is pretty nice.
They have a lot of resident events.

On the other hand, some negatives:
Cleanliness: when my roommates and I moved in, all of our rooms and bathrooms were dirty. There was an abundance of hair in my dresser, mold in our bathrooms, and we had to scrub, not just wipe, every common surface. I’ve never had this experience with an apartment complex.

Communication: The complex does not notify us of many maintenance repairs; recently, we had the shower heads and sink faucets replaced (unfortunately, these replacements were major downgrades from the nice high pressure shower heads we used to have); we never got any emails or notifications that they would be coming, and it was a bit startling when people enter our apartment unannounced. This has happened a few times over the past year.

Amenities: the amenities are poorly maintained. The grills are dirty, the chairs are dirty, and really anything but the pool in the front and the clubhouse is run down. The gate rarely actually works, it stays open most of the time. If I had to estimate, it was working properly for maybe a total of a month over the past year. I don’t care for the gate, it wasn’t a selling point for me, but if you advertise yourself as a gated complex, maybe your gate should work.

Lighting: the parking lots are lit incredibly poorly and I feel uncomfortable walking to and from my car at night.

“Security”: On two accounts in the evening, I have been sitting in my car, or standing outside my car in the parking lot, being quiet and nothing of a nuisance, just enjoying the fresh air. On both accounts, security told me I had to go inside. Why can’t I sit in my car in the parking spot I pay for at the apartment complex I pay for?

resp.text: Hi, Alexis! First, we so appreciate your kind words! We strive for the best experience possible for our residents and your comments do not go unnoticed.  As COVID restrictions are slowly being lifted and summer months are approaching, maintaining summer amenities is one our top priorities and have already begun improving these areas.  All exterior lighting around the property and buildings have now been updated to state-of-the-art LED lighting.  Thank you for your patience as we worked on this project.  We cannot wait for you to see all the great additions we’re bringing to Connection Auburn!  We would like to hear your concerns and assist you. We’ll be reaching out shortly to set up a time to meet in person.

name: Angelique Cabanero
text: The reason I gave a 2 star rating is because I really like the actual space of the apartment. However, the maintenance and management greatly decrease my enjoyment in living here. Maintenance takes forever to be addressed. My roommate had a huge leak in her ceiling so for some reason maintenance cut a huge hole that exposed the piping and they told her they would come back and fix it. However they never came so we put in a work order, and since we made the work order, it took them a whole month to patch the hole. Did i mention when i first moved we had a flea infestation? Ya and it took forever for maintenance to address that meanwhile i was getting eaten alive by fleas. Management here does not really help and they make it seem like the security here is supposed to help us whenever we need them. But i have the most annoying neighbors on the planet and have called the security to ask them to to be quiet when they are making loud noises in the middle of the night, but the “24 hour” security is never available to speak to. The voicemail literally lies and says they will get my message to them right away, but I’m never contacted after leaving my number.

resp.text: Hi, Angelique! We are glad you love your space. On the other hand, we are so sorry to hear of the issues you have experienced.  In the future, we hope that we can provide a much better experience for you!  Also, we do have a direct line to security as well as a direct line to after-hours maintenance. Please make sure you are calling the direct line for security, as any calls made to our maintenance line will not go to security. If you are ever having trouble reaching security, please let the office know and we would be happy to reach out with them directly to remedy any communication issues!  We are fully committed to putting our time and our resources towards providing you with confidence and pride in your living environment.  Please let us know if you need anything at all, and we will do all we can to provide a better experience for you.

name: Amanda Foster
text: DO NOT LIVE HERE!!!! Most of the amenities are broken. The hot tub hasn't worked for at least 6 years.The office is rarely fully staffed. There is no way to contact management after hours if there is any activity against the resident handbook. They have a resident handbook, and they enforce zero of it. They have quiet hours, which residents do not follow. There are parties almost every weekend, and some are now in the parking lots at 1:30 am. There is zero security. People trespass all the time. There is a gate in the front and it has not worked in several years. Therefore, there is zero security. There are only supposed to be two guests per resident at amenities I think, and they have no way of assuring rules are followed. Maybe they should get a silicon wrist band system for residents and guests at amenities. When the office was called concerning illicit activity, they responded with "We can't do anything." You don't get what you pay for, so DO NOT LIVE HERE!!!!! If I could give zero stars, I would.

name: Fatima Almehamdi
text: This place has the worst wifi in Auburn. Oh and it disconnects sometimes and pray to god that maintenance does anything about it in less than a week. What a ripoff, you pay for everything and trust me you’re only getting your bedroom and then you’re on your own. Also, my friend once stayed the night and her car was towed! So no you can’t have a friend or family member over because you risk their cars getting and towed and lose a $100! One year lease and can’t wait to leave this nightmare in the summer.

resp.text: Hi, Fatima! We've upgraded our Wi-Fi last semester to the largest bandwidth in Auburn! We have received tons of praise and very minimal issues have been reported! It might be that you are still connected to the previous provider’s network if you are experiencing these issues.  While maintenance is not responsible for internet issues, we provide all residents with a direct contact to our internet provider. If you need further information, please contact the office and we can resolve this for you ASAP!   We have over 300 guest parking spots marked guest and we do require all residents to sign a parking agreement upon move in stating that any guest they have must park in a designated guest spot or they will be towed. In the future, please make sure they are parked in a designated guest spot and they will be good to go. If there is anything we can do for you, please reach out to the office and we would be happy to help!

name: Kaleb Hines
text: I've lived in many different apartment complexes in Auburn and this is by far the best. The units used to be a bit dated, but mine just got renovated and it is like brand new. I brought my friends and brothers to live here and will continue to do so. Staff is awesome and super friendly. Check your email regularly. They always send out updates on things such as if maintenance is running behind, events with free food, or just basic property need-to-knows. Definitely recommend!

name: Jennifer Cardwell
text: Very satisfied with my stay here so far. The staff and maintenance have been super helpful. Already renewed my lease and advised my friends to move here as well!

resp.text: We are so proud of Connection at Auburn and thrilled that you love living here! Thank you for the GREAT review, Jennifer! If you need anything, please feel free to contact us! Our management office is open M-F 9-6 and weekends!

name: cassie firman
text: Just moved in in August and it has been great! My roommates and I love it. I'll update this as the year goes on, but, so far so good!

name: Ryan Mckinstry
text: I have lived at the connection for 2 years now, first in a two bedroom and second in a four bedroom. It has all you need for what used to be the best price in Auburn. It's distance from campus was acceptable due to the price being so low, but with the price increase of $70 for the same place it is impossible to recommend. The wifi has always been problematic, but manageable so I'm glad that they are upgrading it (it was long overdue). The difference between the 2 and 4 bedroom was negligible considering the price difference so the 4 bedroom is really the only good option. The hardwood floor in the 2 bedroom I had was absolute garbage, I mean it was stained with paint and was chipped in multiple places, and that doesn't even mention the hardwood itself was like plastic more than it was wood. The appliance where all great, but the heating and ac always seemed to act up. Which wouldn't have been a big deal if they fixed it in a timely fashion. The selection in terms of the fitness machines is lackluster. The walls are paper thin and the big gap under the doors sure doesn't help. You can hear pretty much everything from all the neighbors. Overall though the connection wasn't bad for the price, with the price increase making it more like apartments closer to campus I can't recommend it. Why pay the exact same price for something that is farther away and worse quality.

resp.text: Ryan, thank you the review. While we are an off-campus student housing complex, the Tiger Transit does pickup at the property. In fact, it is one of the shortest rides to campus (10 minutes) and is similar to walking from a property located at a closer proximity. We do strive to offer the best valued apartment for the cost. As we do finish renovating units for the next leasing year, the rates will reflect these upcoming changes. In addition, as you have mentioned, we are doing a serious internet upgrade soon! If there is anything we can do to help improve you experience here, please do not hesitate to reach out!

name: Justice Purdue
text: The amenity I used the most was the gym! Overall, the whole complex is nice. It always helped that it was gated and security was always on patrol. I suggest anyone that enjoys being safe live here!

name: Tanner Hayes
text: The new staff has been so great and helpful! My maintenance requests are being completed much faster and all the amenities have tremendously improved since new management took over. They used to be disgusting and never maintained but now they look brand new. If I wasn’t graduating I’d definitely renew my lease!

name: Justin Turner
text: This is my first year attending Auburn and so far so good! Really love the staff and the swimming pools. Transit stop is super quick, as well.

name: weez Lartigue
text: Place sucks takes 3 weeks for maintenance to show up (if they even do), wifi is just about the worst, everything breaks

resp.text: We feel badly that you are not happy and would like to make your experience here enjoyable. Customer service is our priority and we will work diligently to ensure your happiness. We’ll be reaching out shortly to set up a time to meet in person!

name: Yingying Tang
text: Our mailbox was broken and we were not able to get any letters or any packages delivered by USPS. We reported the problem a hundred times and they did not fix the problem till we moved out... Our lock was broken and it took them a month to fix it. The fire alarms were broken and we were told to buy batteries and fix it by ourselves as they were really busy. I did not have any hot water if the shower takes more than five minutes. The roof of the living room was leaking. I really don’t want to waste any time with the Connection. Just don’t choose it

name: Brianna Washington
text: Do not live here ! I am currently living here and the staff and management does not keep their word! You can’t get in touch with management after hours, & they lie to you as well!!! I hate it here fr ! I’m bout to see if i can move out ASAP!

resp.text: Brianna, thank you for renewing and giving us another opportunity to rectify your concerns and change your opinion.  Resident satisfaction is extremely important to us!  You may contact our management office directly at (334) 821-3301 M-F 9-6, or email us at info@connectionauburn.com if you have any further concerns!

name: Ka'Mocia Terrell
text: The community here is wonderful! I was very skeptical of my future roommates considering I moved here from Chicago, but everything fell right into place. I could not be more happy with where I live and where I attend school. War Eagle!!!

name: Taylor Jefferson
text: I loved my roomies!! When I moved here for school, I didn't know anyone, but with roommate matching I got placed with people just like me. We lived together for 2 years, but now it's time to go our separate ways... Thank you connection for helping me meet lifelong friends!

name: Samantha AU
text: DO NOT MOVE HERE! This is my second year in the complex as a Auburn student. The first year was amazing BUT this year is totally different . I am very disappointed and feel disrespected as a renter that I’m not allowed to have guest !! I am a 27 year old women! Living here you have no rights! I also see no point of the extra security here. I feel less safe ! As a complex we need to come together and demand change because this is totally UNACCEPTABLE and DISRESPECTFUL! AGAIN, DO NOT MOVE HERE ! YOU ARE NOT ALLOWED TO HAVE ANY GUEST !!!

name: James Blount
text: The staff is very friendly and the amenities are very nice. I just wish the back pool would open back up. I only ran into a few problems with maintenance back in September, but I have not had a problem since then. Looking forward to another year here.

name: Jessica Fields
text: My brother may have had problems with his ceiling fan, but other than that my stay here was amazing. The back pool is a very fun place to hangout on hot summer days. I wish I didn't have to leave, but me and my brother have both graduated.

name: Sarah AU
text: Everything was going good until I wanted to swim. The pool is embarrassing !! I was so excited to swim in our pool for the first time this year after getting a email stating the pool will be opening back up.  I went to put my feet in the water and then my feet disappeared due to the pool being dirty! The other pool is closed off for some reason leaving us with no pools to swim in. I am not satisfied.

resp.text:
Sarah - Thank you for your review. We apologize for the condition of the pool upon your visit. A notice was sent out to all residents informing them that our pool would be closed and under maintenance to replace the pump. That said, despite delivery delays, the pool is now back in operation and ready for swimming! We also apologize for the closure of the back pools, this is due to Covid-19 regulations outlined in the most recent resident email regarding new restricted amenity openings for the health and safety of our residents.

Please let us know if we can help with anything else!

name: Christian Fields
text: The only reason I put 4 stars and not 5 is because of the problems I had with my ceiling fan when i moved in. It was so hot in my room for a week. After maintenance fixed that, I did not have any more problems. I really enjoyed staying here

name: Kae C
text:
Maintenance terrible I have same issues since August when moved in.. Parents do not let  your college students live there. My child has numerous issues No Hot Water for weeks. When you call with issues the property managers and staff let it go voice mail... Paying rent on apartment with no hot water. Don't sign a lease with The Connection...
.

name: Charles Woodley
text: I have been very pleased with my stay here. Unfortunately, I graduated so I will not be coming back for another year. Best complex in Auburn!

name: Rebecca Gladish
text: This place has DRASTICALLY improved over the last few months!! My work orders only take a day or two, management is way better and actually responds, trash has been cleaned up, and pool areas are super clean (finally). I was not going to renew, but my roommates and I have decided to give The Connection another year. If it stays like this, I will recommend to everyone!!!!

resp.text: Rebecca, thank you so much for the positive review! We have made serious effort to improve maintenance response time and resident satisfaction. We look forward to having both you and your roommates here another year!

name: Anissa Perkins
text: Currently finishing my 1st year at the connection. I Overall enjoy my experience. I renewed my lease because this place gives me no real problems. The leasing manager, Mikayla I think Her name is, is extremely nice and welcoming. Somethings the apartment can not control (I.e. people not cleaning up behind themselves) however everything else is fine. I will give another review before I move out next year. Nice place to live for the price. The apartment is in a very convenient location. However, the walls are super thin and the carpet should be cleaned regularly. Looking at the reviews, I hope I’m not charged for anything I forgot to mention we i first moved in.

name: jeff innmon
text: This place is outrageously bad. I was overcharged for everything. They towed my car because my sticker fell off of my dashboard. They charged me for electricity after I had moved out. I encourage all students to read their lease agreement and seriously consider other locations!  I gained fifteen pounds in my second year due to bad weather. This is unacceptable and I want an immediate refund for my troubles. The speed bumps where a pain to walk over. And gate wouldn't open on command and make noise that sounded like two grandparents going at it after a long day at bingo. I wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy! 0/5 thumbs up.

resp.text:
We are sorry to hear of your negative experience. Unfortunately, we do not control the towing on the property. Auburn Express Towing tows vehicles either parked illegally or without the proper decal for the safety of both our residents and their guests.

Additionally, we do not charge residents for electricity as long as it remains in their name for the entirety of their lease and the bill is paid. If you believe you were charged in error, please feel free to contact the office.

If there is anything that we can do to improve your experience, please reach out to us by phone or email and we will have a manager get in contact with you!

name: leon
text: Shower hasn’t been draining since 2 weeks ago. Called the maintenance about 5 times and went to the office. Several staffs have been promising it will be fixed but no one has came to fix it.

resp.text: We regret that you have had an unpleasant experience. Resident satisfaction is extremely important to us. Please give us the opportunity to rectify your concerns and change your opinion. Please contact us at (334) 821-3301 or by email at info@connectionauburn.com

name: Ree God
text: Do not live here!, terrible maintainness service, unfair extra charges, expensive monthly installation, And barely no interest connection will make you crazy every night!

name: Olivia Bingham
text: Very clean apartment upon move in. Very helpful staff. My only complaint involved drywall not being completely repaired when i moved in, but maintenance quickly fixed it.

name: Timothy Hardwell
text: I am very pleased with my stay and the apartment were super spacious. The only reason I'm moving is because we bought a house.

name: Christian Elom
text: Upon moving into this apartment, I was greeted with a room that was unkempt and dirty. My parents and sibling had to clean for about 2-3 hours to get it up to standard. While living here, maintenance calls were slow and over time the property devolved into a large dumpster with trash and cigarette butts found all over. Front gate did not ever work, and the lights over the covered parking space I paid an extra $25/monthly for went out and were never replaced. To top it all off, after leaving a spotlessly clean room I was hit with a $259 fee which eventually led to my credit being flagged due to the property manager not letting me know that. 10/10 WOULD NOT RECOMMEND.

name: david dixon
text: This apartment complex is the gilded age of apartments. They make it look nice and like a good place to live until you are actually there. Four months of AC trouble before they actually looked at it for more than 2 seconds costing the entire apartment almost twice as much in power. The “high speed” WiFi can barely load a single page. They final nail in the coffin was the price hike they tried to pull after giving terrible quality.

resp.text:
David,

We are sorry to hear of your negative experience. As technology becomes more prevalent, Wifi usage increases. To account for this, we will again be improving both our speed and usage limit with our upcoming internet upgrades! If you have any further concerns that we can address to improve your experience here, please feel free to reach out to the office to get in contact with a manager.

name: Cayman Smith
text: They're so power hungry that they don't let anyone into the complex without a hanging parking tag. The guy dressed in all black at the gate said he would tow me if I parked in the guest parking. What's the point of guest parking?

name: Mike Stanford
text: Awesome property. My only complaint is that they did not offer 1 bedroom apartments.

name: Anna Flurry
text: This was my first apartment and a great one! The staff is friendly and they are always putting on events in the clubhouse. I highly recommend!

name: Alissa Nall
text: I am currently trying to sublet my apartment it is a 4 bed 4 bath. The price is 540 which is cheaper than the apartment complex has it for. Message me if you would like to sublet. Just send a message on here my name is Alissa Nall you can also contact me through my email alissaclaire.nall1215@gmail.com

name: Susie Engels
text: Do not live here!  If you do not document every speck, smudge, ding, scrape, stain, worn carpet they will say it’s over the normal wear and tear and you will be billed an excessive amount to repaint the walls and for new carpet.  So basically we have paid for renovations for the next unsuspecting victims. ($700) They do not take payments and expect payment in full within 15 days or you can be sent to collections. They could not provide proof as to why it needed painting and they showed a stain on the carpet to prove all the carpet needed replaced.  No carpet cleaning was even attempted!  Also utility bill was always excessive. Beware renters!  Think twice!!

name: Amy Garrison
text: The Connection at Auburn has been a great fit for my student this year. She feels safe and the office staff has been super helpful and professional when I had questions. This is her first apartment so I wanted to be sure they would be responsive to any issues. We are very pleased.

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Amy! It is our goal is to assist residents as efficiently as possible. We are glad that your daughter has enjoyed living here and hope she continues to in the future!

name: Audra Froom
text: The new management has done WONDERS for us and my neighbors. I have been so impressed with the timely maintenance and communication!

name: Brittany Holly
text: Ok place to live. Not sure why this place's ratings are lower than the Hub but this place is far better than the Hub.

name: Harley Quinn
text: I wish I could leave negative stars for this place instead of one. Please be ware of renting. Not only are they dishonest the apartments are horrible. There was raw sewage in my sons apartment in the tubs and sinks. The carpet was molded and it smelled so bad. I have photo proof if anyone wants them I’ll be glad to share them. I would rather my son sleep in his car than in this disgusting place.

name: Scott Angus
text: I had some miscommunications at the beginning but the manager called and cleared it all up and we are very excited to have our daughter move in. Seems to be a very nice apartment complex with nice employees. I would recommend it to all my friends.

resp.text:
Good Afternoon Scott,

We are glad to hear that all of your concerns were addressed and are excited to have you living with us for the upcoming year!

name: Emma Porter
text: I like living here. Apartments are great for what I pay, amenities are typically good. Staff is nice. However, the hot tub has not worked for the 1 1/2 years i have lived here so that’s pretty lame and they don’t have intentions of fixing it.

name: ximin Gao
text:
The worst management. Damaged things, old devices and moldy walls.
Office do nothing! Terrible management! Terrible experience! Not recommended!

resp.text: Zoie, we are very sorry to hear of your negative experience. We are unable to find your name in our system, but would be more than happy to assist you with any issues you may be having. Please contact info@connectionauburn.com or (334) 821-3301 and we will get a manager in touch with you immediately!

name: Alex Henderson
text: love living here!!! everyone is nice and so helpful.

name: Jenny Galloway
text: This is my 3rd year staying at the connection, and I have got to say that it isn't worth it.  When I first moved to the complex, I was in a three bedroom and had absolutely no problem.  Fast forward to the next year, and I moved into a two bedroom.  When I first moved in, there was visible patching on multiple walls, warped floors, and not a single baseboard in the kitchen or bathrooms.  I went back and forth with the property manager for multiple months of false promises for fixing it.  A few months after that, I noticed mold in my closet and soaked carpet.  Okay, called maintenance, and the next day, I received a notification that the issue had been fixed .  NOPE.  For a whole week, I was back and forth with maintenance with this issue until I skipped a whole school day to make sure they did their job.  Sure enough, within thirty seconds, my closet wall shared with the bathroom starts gushing water from within.  Finally gets fixed, but they did a half way job of fixing the wall they had to tear down, and the shelving is not near as secure as it should be.  Fast forward again to the new management and other changes.  The internet NEVER works, even with an Ethernet cable, there is a huge pest problem (my roommate and I put in a complaint about mice, and it took three weeks and a day for them to even get Cook's out there to put down GLUE TRAPS even though pest control is supposed to be by once a week), and never have I ever had so many packages and mail go missing.  If you want to find a place where you won't be forced into a human stress ball, then steer clear of here.

name: Morgan Russo
text: Absolutely horrible ew

resp.text: All of our residents are important, and we are sincerely sorry that you have experienced a problem, Morgan. We would love to schedule a meeting to document your issues and concerns so you can be assured that they will be addressed. We’ll be reaching out shortly to set up a time to speak.

name: Michal Stinson
text: I’ve lived at the Connection for roughly two years. It has been a great experience thus far. The amenities are great along with the staff being super friendly. I highly recommend this as a place to live.

resp.text:
Michal,

Thank you for the review. We are so glad to hear that you have enjoyed your stay here!

name: Aahil Makhani
text: I’ve lived here for almost 2 years, about to be a third, and this place just gets the job done. it’s not the best place in the world, but it’s a pretty decent place for the price.

name: Keenan W
text: The Connection is honestly one of the worst complexes in the area. I moved into a 3 bedroom last year. On move-in day the carpet in the common area was completely disgusting with black stains all throughout the apartment. The carpet was coming apart from the flooring in several places. The entire apartment, including all three bedrooms, were filled with dust and looked as if they had been unoccupied for a very long period. The bathroom had mold in the bathtub and sink and the bathroom cabinets were flaking and falling apart. They didn’t even fill the holes in the wall left from the previous occupants TV wall mount. The bedroom had cobwebs in two corners of the ceiling. The mattress smelled like pure body odor. The outside patio/balcony had cigarettes all over it, even though we were in a non smoking unit. There is about a 2-4 inch gap between all the doors which means you can literally hear anything and everything your roommates are doing. Our kitchen sink had a constant link the entire time we lived in the unit. We contacted management and nothing was ever done about any of the issues. You’re very lucky if your maintience request is completed in a timely manner. After move out they tried to charge us for carpet replacement even though the carpet had been in horrible condition when we moved in. We actually hired a carpet cleaner so the carpet was in better condition when we left. They tried to use new carpet and appliances as a selling point to get us to re-sign, now they’re trying to charge us for everything. These people have no clue what they’re doing. The property looks decent from the outside, but I promise it’s a horrible experience and there are many other great complexes with cheaper rates. Stay away at all costs.

resp.text:
Hello Keenan,

We are sorry to hear about your frustrations with our property. Resident feedback is encouraged and we appreciate you taking the time to leave a review! Should you need anything, please feel free to contact us @ 334.821.3301 or by e-mail at info@connectionauburn.com.

name: matt davis
text: I think a lot of these reviews are exaggerated because residents don’t get EXACTLY what they want. The only bad thing about this place is the maintenance team. They don’t do much. If you’re polite and considerate, the front desk staff and management are actually very helpful.

resp.text:
Good Afternoon Matt,

Thank you for the review! We are sorry to hear about your displeasure with our maintenance staff. If you have any maintenance requests, please email info@connectionauburn.com and we will happily put in a work order for you!

name: J Hack
text: My daughter’s a/c has gone out 4 times this school year. It takes days to get a maintenance person to respond and when they do they rig something up that doesn’t last. These folks just don’t care. They’re taking advantage of students. Please visit this dump for yourself. The pictures are a lie. Buyer beware here. You will regret the money you wasted.

name: Elizabeth Richards
text: I have never had a problem while living here. I read some of the reviews that describe management issues as well as issues with payments and things like that but I have never experienced anything remotely similar. I feel like these people are just upset because they either just don't want to pay for damages  (which to me seem like a reasonable thing to expect when moving out of an apartment) or don't get exactly what they want when they want it. In my experience the front desk staff have gone out of their way to try and fix issues that are out of their control and I really appreciate it. The only complaint I have is that maintenance sometimes takes a couple of days to get things fixed. Overall I think that the apartments are great for the price and the front desk girls are always nice and helpful.

resp.text:
Elizabeth,

Thank you for the review! We strive to provide the best living experience possible and appreciate you noticing our willingness to do so. With maintenance issues, the turnaround time can vary depending on the situation, but we aim to handle them immediately!

name: Brenda Turner
text: This is my daughter's first year at The Connection.  It has all of the amenities that you need on site.  It is also one of the few gated complexes locally that is affordable. So far, it has been a great.

resp.text:
Brenda,

Thank you for the review. We look forward to your daughter enjoying the rest of the semester here!

name: Anna Massie
text: the pools and other amenities are nice n grounds are kept clean. i have upgraded stuff in my room for an extra amount per month and i like the furniture they give you for that. one thing is the way the lease is drawn up didn't include one of the surcharges i would be taking over (i subleased to live here). however the positives are the front desk workers are helpful and friendly, great location to be close to campus but not directly off.. but the gym could definitely use an upgrade

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words. Resident satisfaction is very important to us so your review made our day!!! Please let us know if there is anything we can do to help you continue to enjoy your home. 334.821.3301 connectionauburn@achliving.com

name: nottoostabby
text:
Rating 2-stars so you don't write this off as a disgruntled review written after having an issue with management. Make no mistake, this apartment complex is absolutely terrible. I lived here for 4 years, and had constant problems with management losing/returning my mail without explanation, threatening us with fines for keeping items on the porch of the apartment we paid to rent ("Unsightly Balcony" was the official "charge"), maintenance requests taking close to 2 weeks to be addressed.)
Features that were used as selling points stayed in disrepair (front and back gates were constantly breaking, forcing you to drive all the way down S college to go around if one was closed; hot tub was never working for more than 3 months the entire time I lived there) or were "closed" via security patrols after 9:00 (pool, basketball court). If you're not a fan of having the cops called on you for playing basketball in your own apartment complex, seek other arrangements.

The most recent and irreconcilable complaint I have, however, is The Connection's predatory move-out practices. After 4 years of occupancy, never having missed a month's rent, my roomated and I were told that we owed over $2,000 in combined move-out expenses to cover the slight cosmetic damage to the paper-thin, cheaply made couches they provide, very minor scuffs along the walls, and "cleaning costs". When I called to dispute the charges, I was told that my only option was to communicate through email, where I was basically told to pay up or be sent to collections.

I reccomend renting anywhere but here.

name: Connor Hall
text:
I have lived here for 3 years and have liked being in my 4 bedroom the whole time having my own bathroom and closet.

However, this last summer (2018) they waited until everyone was on break and gave a 1 day notice to remove bikes from under the stairs, they claim they would return them for free within 2 months and provided an email to contact to get them, I sent multiple emails to this address and never received a reply and when i went to the office they told me they could do nothing without the email, and i sat down with them in the office and sent it and was told to wait a day for it to be processed, I ended up losing a $200 investment due to their system not working properly.

They also contracted out the pool cleaning to a company that comes once or twice a week over the summer; however, during colder months when you would like to use the hot tub, its a joke, its always cold and green. Also with the front gate being open and a chain link fence around the back, people that dont live at the complex come in and ended up breaking the basketball goal that was at the pool. They did their best to enforce a 2 guest minimum per resident, but people would just leave and come back as soon as the worker left.

All in all, my experience was pleasant for the most part after i found friends to move in with, i made a lot of friends in the complex, but i am extremely upset about losing my bike due to poor timing of only having a day to move it and being out of the state for family.

name: Jeremy Oyler
text: I love living here because the staff is extremely nice and always willing to help. The Connection at Auburn also offers several opportunities to have a good time! You don't find very many apartments that offer the same kind of benefits as they do. I definitely recommend living here.

name: Dlock
text: They just want money, don’t have good maintenance or management, DONT LIVE HERE UNLESS YOU WANT TO DEAL WITH PROBLEMS EVERY WEEK

name: Wendy Lynn
text: Moved in August 15th 2019. The AC has been broken since move-in date. Temperatures have been consistently in high 80's through High 90's since move in. (Mostly 90's). Inside temp of Apt has been high 70's -low 80's. Have communicated with front office no less than 10 times. Management has known about broken AC before we moved in. They have about 20 units with similar AC issues (according to maintenance man), but refuse to fix them. I believe they take advantage of the fact that most of their residents are students-who will usually just quit complaining  after several requests to have AC fixed, which by then several months have gone by and weather is a little cooler so they quit complaining. I believe management counts on this. If most residents were in the adult work force age, the Ac's would be fixed bc broken AC's wouldn't be tolerated by this group. If more of the student's parents got involved, I believe the AC's would start getting fixed.

name: Molly MacRae
text: The apartments themselves are nice and reasonably priced but maintenance on the pool and in general is terrible. The pool and hot tub looks as if it hasn't been cleaned in months. The WiFi is also terrible, and I mean atrocious, which sucks if you're a college student trying to get work done.

resp.text:
Molly,

We are glad to hear that you enjoy the apartments! We do have a pool cleaning company that comes to the property often. If you ever feel the pool is not clean, please let us know! For any internet issues, Single Digits has asked that we refer you to them. If you have any further concerns we can address to improve your experience here, please contact info@connectionauburn.com!

name: Henry Kilpatrick
text: Love it here so far! My only complaint is that the post office tends to lose my mail on a regular basis but that's not you're fault. My roommates are awesome and I really enjoy living here. Haven't been able to utilize the pool or weight room yet due to my schedule but hopefully I will soon.

name: Kirsten Johnson
text: Great living! The staff is wonderful, and there are many opportunities to meet people due to all of the activities the staff puts together. The apartments are great! You can enjoy living with your friends, while having your own privacy. Wouldn't want to live anywhere else!

name: Nia Perkins
text: I’ve been staying at the connection for a year & love it. The staff is awesome & friendly favorite part about living here

resp.text:
Nia,

Thank you for the review! We are thrilled that the staff has been friendly and look forward to the rest of your stay with us!

name: Hunter Simpson
text: The Connection at Auburn? More like, The No Connection at Auburn. I've lived here for the past 4 years and up until this year I would have given 4/5 or even 5/5 stars, but ever since the new management took over it has been a disaster. The WiFi absolutely never works, and the front office blames Single Digits and Single Digits can never figure out what the problem is so nothing ever gets done. There are a lot less events now than previous years too, trivia nights are gone and replaced with inopportune events centered around renewal times or holidays only. Also, both apartments I have lived in have had silverfish living in them as well and that has never been fixed either. Two stars though because all things aside the apartments are very nice for the price.

resp.text:
Hunter,

We apologize for your negative experience here. While there was an ownership change in the past, both the staff and internet service remained the same. We have been asked by Single Digits to direct any internet concerns to them. However, we have also reached out to them to see if there are any changes we can make going forward to improve internet quality.

While it is true we have shifted to larger events to reward our residents even more, we do these year-round. If you have any event suggestions or changes you would like to see, resident feedback is always encouraged!

If you are having any pest control issues or have any maintenance requests, you can place a work order by phone, email, in the office, or online.

If there is anything else we can address to improve your experience here, please contact the office at info@connectionauburn.com!

name: Neema Kamau
text: I normally don’t bother giving bad reviews but this time is different. If I could give this place no stars, I would. At first I loved the place. It had a convienient location and the office staff was nice. During move in, I noted that the carpet was terribly stained and when I left, I didn’t bother cleaning a mess that I didn’t make. A few weeks after moving out I was charged $200 + dollars for carpet cleaning services and for leaving trash in the living room. I spoke with someone and assured him that we didn’t leave any trash and to please re-evaluate the charges. It basically seemed like it was their word against ours and they didn’t care much about ours. I went back and forth with the guy until I got sick of it and gave up. I am upset and would not recommend this place to anyone. They just try and get as much money out of you as possible and honestly it’s overpriced for the amount of space you get. They also don’t bother to clean any of the carpets before tenants move in but are quick to charge you for dirty carpets when you move out. It’s pathetic.

resp.text: We're sorry you had a negative experience as customer service is important to us. We would like to hear your concerns and assist you. Please contact the management office directly so that we can rectify your issues. We are available M-F 10-6, at 334.821.3301 or email us at connectionauburn@achliving.com

name: Mingxu Wang
text: WiFi HORRIBLE, i mean, HORRIBLE, if u know what I mean. I got 0 on 3 of my projects already. No more comments. Freak it. And the office just tell me they r not in charge about WiFi. No gaming, no Video call, even 0s for your homework.

name: Ali Taylor
text: Staff is super friendly and helpful, rooms are furnished well and cozy. The tour was great and they answered all our questions and made sure to kept up with us during all the paperwork. Matched roommates very well too!

name: Harry Potter
text: Worst experience ever. Don not apply! Not cleaned at all when moving in. Maintenance never able to fix anything. Irresponsible management.

name: Talon Crowell
text: The Connection feels like home. I have already made so many great friends and I've only been here a month! I spend most of my time at the pool and on the basketball court! The Connection is the best place to live on the Plains! War Eagle!

name: Caleb Cook
text: I don’t think I’ve ever lived somewhere with such poor management. Random charges that aren’t in your lease, and those incentives they promise you for signing the lease don’t come for about 6-7 months. Overall they are looking for ways to screw you over penny-by-penny.

resp.text:
Hello Caleb,

We are sorry to hear about your frustrations with our property. We sincerely appreciate you taking the time to review the Connection At Auburn and will do our best to keep you happy! Should you need anything, please feel free to contact us @ 334.821.3301 or by e-mail at info@connectionauburn.com.

name: Peter Parker
text:
谁住谁傻逼，千万别租。
They just want to charge you as much as possible and never care about your experience. After I moved out theu asked me 300 dollars move out charge, I asked them to show me the detail bill, they can only show me a paper which write I own them money, there has no such a detail on it. And this happened not only once!

In addition, two of my friends were charged as well, the amount is over 1000 dollars. They charge 1000 for a sofa which never used and damaged by my friend. I do not know where that bill comes from.

See how many 1 star in the comment and please do not choose here as your home.

resp.text:
Hello Hanwei,

We are sorry to hear about your frustration with our property. Our goal is to provide the most enjoyable living experience possible. For any move-out charge concerns, please email the manager you were contacted by and they will be more than happy to review your statement!

name: Megan Parker
text: The only good thing about this place is the price. If I had bothered to tour any other apartment complex in Auburn before deciding to live here, I would have chosen anything else. The staff was rude to my parents when they called to check on a problem I was having with the place. They have been very rude to me on occasion. They're very young and not helpful at all. I've had too many bad experiences to even count. My roommate and I are counting down the days until our lease is up. We have even heard other residents saying the same thing. The furniture is horrible. We pretty much slide off the couch every time we sit on it. The wifi is atrocious. I can never get anything done because it is always flickering on and off. Charter also stinks. My channels flicker out on me too. I know they claim to be a "gated community", but can you really call yourself that when your gates only work half the time? Once while walking to the transit, I saw a confrontation between a few residents and police officers who were swarming the place. I was freaked out when a guy tried to run away and the cop slammed him on the ground. I thought I was about to get shot or something. A couple days later I went into the office and asked what all the commotion was about. After all, I live here. I have a right to know. At first, the worker looked at me like I was stupid for asking. When I asked again, she was like "Oh, just a confrontation. We got it settled." They're just very unhelpful. Then, we had an ant problem and didn't get it resolved for TWO WEEKS. The gym and pool are the only redeeming qualities. I can't wait to get out of here. Literally counting down the days.

name: Kristin Chaump
text: Connection is great. Typical management issues, though the maintenance is more prompt. Love the amenities and actual apartment is very nice as well. Would definitely recommend to a friend

name: Win Strickland
text: The staff was extremely helpful and made my experience so wonderful that I would recommend to anyone that is considering living here

resp.text:
Win,

Thank you for the wonderful review, we are glad to hear you had such a pleasant experience!

name: Rhiannon Freeman
text: The last management was amazing, these people are the rudest, meanest people in the entire world. It's a bunch of little college girls, which we all are just about, but they think they own the place and can be as hateful as they want. If you're thinking about moving here, just dont.

name: K. Moore
text: My daughter lived here her sophomore year 2 1/2 years ago. Maintenance people nice but very slow getting help. Gate rarely worked and took a couple of weeks to fix. Office not friendly. Terrible couches which were slick and pillows would not stay on. As a result, although the rent was fair, she did not stay.

name: Uniquely 4U Crafts By: Monica
text: Great place and apartment complex that my daughter has lived in for the past two school terms at auburn university. Close commute to the campus as well as close to im major shopping and grocery stores. Plenty of amenities and a wonderful staff!

resp.text: Thank you! We always encourage feedback from our residents/parents and your feedback is especially nice! We sincerely appreciate you taking the time to review Connection At Auburn and will do our very best to keep your daughter happy! Should you need anything, please feel free contact us. 334.821.3301 or connectionauburn@achliving.com

name: Courtney Davis
text: I have thoroughly enjoyed living at the Connection for the past year.  I highly recommended this apartment complex as it is conveniently located near campus and has awesome amenities.  The staff is superb and is always willing to assist its residents.

name: Win Strickland
text: The staff was extremely helpful and made my experience so wonderful that I would recommend to anyone that is considering living here

resp.text:
Win,

Thank you for the wonderful review, we are glad to hear you had such a pleasant experience!

name: Meira Benitez
text: The Connection is an awesome place to live! The gym is clean, the staff is helpful, and the maintenance is typically very quick in their turnaround time. Absolutely recommended!

resp.text: We are so happy that you're pleased with our community. Our priority is to provide excellent customer service, so thank you for taking the time to share your experience with our future residents. If you need anything, please don't hesitate to contact our management office. 334.821.3301 or email us at connectionauburn@achliving.com

name: Kaylamarie Hemm
text: Awesome community to live in. The campus is close enough to walk or bike too if you really want. Or you can take the transit, one comes about every 15 minutes so its pretty efficient.

name: jiaxuan gao
text: This place makes me feel bad! ! ! I felt angry at this place. I stayed here for a year. I'm glad I'm leaving this place in August. First, we negotiate with the property when we sign the contract. We need two sets of houses that are next to each other because we have eight partners. Connotation promised us, but! ! They did not achieve it. Under my understanding, my other friends encountered the same problem. They are also separated. Second, when we registered, we requested apartments that live on the second floor and above, but! ! ! The property gave us the first floor and now my room has a lot of bugs. Outside the windows on the first floor there are flowers and in the summer there are many bees. This makes me very troubled. Third, when we registered, we were misled and chose to pay for parking spaces. However, since we stayed here, they have not mentioned this issue to me. They gave me an ordinary parking permit and continued to charge. When I discovered this problem, I came to the property to find help. The front desk recorded my problem very friendly and did not help me. I will still be charged until next month! ! ? ? ? When I was looking for management, they doubted the authenticity of my problem and repeatedly asked me to check my license to ensure that they did not make mistakes. Until I provided all the photos to the managers, they promised to cancel the next month's fees. but! ! They will not give me the cost before returning. I did not enjoy the proper parking spaces and it was their fault. They refuse to admit it. I am sorry for this place. Finally, the electricity bill made me understandable. In the first few months, our electricity bill was maintained at $150. Even if we often use air conditioning. but! ! ! In the last winter vacation, I was alone at home, and my electricity bill reached $300. In the following month, the electricity bill was still $300 until we completely shut down the air conditioner. This change was sudden and huge, which made me very shocked and unacceptable. My advice is to stay away from this place. Its service is not as imaginative as it is irresponsible! And so on, during the last winter vacation, the door of our laundry suddenly fell. It hurt my friend. I confirmed that we didn't touch it, and that its junction was broken. I have a suspicion of this place, it will enter my blacklist with my friend. I will never live here again.

name: Morgan Locklar
text: I love living at the Connection! It is incredibly convenient and I adore having my own space. Not to mention the amazing staff and pool. Couldn't have asked for more!

name: Nenya Moore
text: I love the amenities, I know this is the best place for my daughter. Very well kept complex. Excellent customer service.

name: Shelby White
text: My experience with the Connection at Auburn has been great. I feel extremely safe and comfortable here. It has really made my transition to college much smoother.

name: Rachel Kuntz
text: Everything is great! My only complaints are that the gym could use some updating, and the shower water pressure is extremely poor. However, the staff is very helpful and friendly, the pools and game room are great, and our apartment is soooo nice! I live in a four room apartment here, and I haven't seen any other apartment complex around top the ones here at the Connection!

name: Alura Neville
text: I love the Connection at Auburn! We have a great staff and awesome events. We cater to our residents and want to make sure they have the best living experience!

name: Nyra' Alcorn
text: I love the connections at Auburn. They matched me perfectly with great room mates that I will be able to call life long friends. The apartments and amenities are great as well

name: Liam Wood
text: Upon moving out and handing them my keys, I received a notice from the connection stating that I did not return my keys and was fined around $500 to be collected by a collections agency and took a hit to my credit score. I strongly recommend getting everything in writing, and a receipt for everything here.

resp.text: Liam, thank you for expressing your concerns. We are sorry to hear that you had a bad experience. We do allow a time frame for residents to express their concerns in regards to any charges. Please contact our office if you would like to discuss your concerns any further.

name: Rizwan Ibrahim
text: Living at the Connection in Auburn is great! It is a great place to live and is a great value. I have never heard horror stories from people from the connection unlike other apartments.

name: Gabi Marie
text:
I've lived here for 3 years and it's horrible. Let me just tell you SOME of my experiences over the years.
1. The apartments aren't really that clean when you move in, you can still have someone's stuff still in drawers and things like that.
2. You're suppose to get a notice that people are coming into your apartment. There have been MULTIPLE instances people just show up, luckily I was home. However! One time I didn't hear the door and they just walked right in. They never sent any type of email they were coming or put anything on the door.
3. Maintenance is slow and important. I promise you SOMETHING is going to break in your apartment. It's all cheap. My dryer, dish washer, AC, toilet has all broken and for all of them it took us having to bug them for them to even come up in a timely manner... ESPECIALLY for the AC that broke in the middle of the summer.
4. Black "stuff" grows in all of the bathroom drains. They claim it's just "dirty" but I've never seen this black stuff ever in my life. Just here at the connection.
5. The office staff can be friendly depending who you talk to, but management is truly useless.
6. They will find anything and everything to charge you for. They're definitely here to take your money.
7. When I moved in I was told every year you stay and resign your lease rent will go down. That's what kept me here for 3 years. However I'm now moving out because they started raising prices and I promise.. ITS NOT WORTH IT!
8. The "security guard" they have here is rude. I asked him a simple question about when the club house closed and he gave me a very rude response and laughed at me.
9. The hot tub has been broken forever. It's not even clean. It's truly disgusting.  Half the equipment in the gym is broken. Last time I went to the computer lab, more than half the computers didn't work and the printer didn't work either. The pool table and ping pong table are both broken in the club house, make sure not to lean on them. Almost all the chairs at the pools are broken and the ones that you're suppose to be able to sit in in the water are never cleaned so they have definitely grown some bacteria.
10. The front gate is always broken. If you're looking for a safe place with a gate and security, this isn't the place. Anyone can come in or out.

name: Cassidee Jones
text: Great place to live. Transit can take anywhere between 10-15 minutes to get to campus. It's a little far away from everything. Perfect size. Sometimes the appliances struggle but the oddest ways of fixing them work best. Lots of cabinet space and storage space in all rooms and kicthen.

name: Sam Bartlett
text: Hasty maintenance, pleasant desk staff, and fantastic amenities complement the spacious rooms at the Connection. The single downside is the parking availability. The high priced covered spaces take up half the parking and are only 1/5 occupied. If the price was knocked down to about half it's current rate, buying a covered space would be reasonable. This creates an issue where spaces anywhere near your apartment may be all occupied and your vehicle must be parked relatively far away.  The Connection also advertises as supplying HBO - but that is not currently available.

name: Amanda Youngpeter
text: The first year I lived here was fine, even though my apartment was given to me with soiled carpets, bent up blinds, no peep hole in front door and a flea investation. The maintenance worked pretty quickly. However they did end up charging my roommate for a dirty oven which they cleaned, a whole new counter top because of some chips on the side that were already there and a new laundry door because of the roller on top wouldn't stay in place, though I ended up fixing it myself because they seemed like they didn't want to bother with it. The second year went a whole lot worse. They tried to evict me due to miscommunication between there departments and their back gate has been somewhat down for a over a month now.(you can go out, but the clicker doesn't work so you can't come back in or out if you wanted to go on a walk) Also, I wouldn't trust roommate matching too much. The roommate they gave me for my second year told me her dog wasn't a yapper, however that dog seemed like it yapped nonstop. She also didn't take care of him very well. She wouldn't take him out before she left in the morning and when she left she was gone for majority of the day, so he would end up going to the bathroom in the apartment. I ended up taking care of him so much that it felt like he had became my dog and I don't do small dogs. The only good thing that came out of it was that the apartment itself was nice after it had been cleaned up, the bathtub was a very nice plus, and I basically had a pool view without paying the pool view price. It is also very convenient to interstate when the gate is working, location is fantastic. It's a great place to live if you have the patience to put up with management and going over those dang speed bumps. Wish I could stay where I'm at, but I don't have the mind nor the patience to deal with management.

name: Jared Sweat
text: The front desk is super helpful and is always nice to me whenever I have questions. Wifi could be a little better though!

resp.text:
Jared,

Thank you for the review, we are glad your experience here has been enjoyable!

name: Rizwan Ibrahim
text: Living at the Connection in Auburn is great! It is a great place to live and is a great value. I have never heard horror stories from people from the connection unlike other apartments.

name: Tamara Wyckoff
text: When I went on the tour of the Connection at Auburn I was very pleased and satisfied with my choice to move in! I move in this weekend and I cannot wait. I love everything about this place!

name: Nyra' Alcorn
text: I love the connections at Auburn. They matched me perfectly with great room mates that I will be able to call life long friends. The apartments and amenities are great as well

name: Gabriela Rodriguez
text: This place has the absolute worst management. Let's start with how they surprised me with a rent raise due to renovations AFTER I had already renewed my lease! So, basically I had to submit and pay more per month or be forced to move out. Then, they told us renovations would start May 23-24. Yea the floors got done on time, but they also tore down my curtains and completely took my bed apart without putting any of it back. Then, they never came back to finish the apartment. Every week we called and were met with the same response: "we'll send out a schedule next week." Turns out next week means the day before they claim renovations will finish. Except it didn't. Keep in mind, all of our kitchen items and drawers have to be removed for them to change the countertops. Imagine my surprise when I come home the following day after working my Saturday morning shift to find these people working in my apartment. This was almost TWO months after it was supposed to be finished. I had received no notification that they were going to be working in my apartment on the weekend. This is certainly not the only major problem I've had with management AND maintenance here. Unless you're okay with living with instability and bending to the will of others, don't waste your time or money here. The only good thing about this place is that it is close to Walmart.

name: Jentry Chesnut
text: Great place to live for a very fair price. With all the amenities and furnished apartments, it's definitely worth it. I'm glad I choose to live here at the Connection!

name: Ian Fraser
text:
TL;DR of previous review: communication with residents is poor.

EDIT: over my final year the general communication from the Connection improved somewhat and front office staff were much more responsive. Thus I've bumped up a couple stars.

The lack of stars is mostly due to the internet situation at this point. I spent 5+ hours spring semester on the phone with Single Digits, even had them bring out a tech to try and fix connectivity issues. They would blame The Connection, I'd talk to the front office and they'd blame Single Digits. At some point I don't care who's at fault I just want my internet connectivity to work consistently.

name: Amanda Youngpeter
text: The first year I lived here was fine, even though my apartment was given to me with soiled carpets, bent up blinds, no peep hole in front door and a flea investation. The maintenance worked pretty quickly. However they did end up charging my roommate for a dirty oven which they cleaned, a whole new counter top because of some chips on the side that were already there and a new laundry door because of the roller on top wouldn't stay in place, though I ended up fixing it myself because they seemed like they didn't want to bother with it. The second year went a whole lot worse. They tried to evict me due to miscommunication between there departments and their back gate has been somewhat down for a over a month now.(you can go out, but the clicker doesn't work so you can't come back in or out if you wanted to go on a walk) Also, I wouldn't trust roommate matching too much. The roommate they gave me for my second year told me her dog wasn't a yapper, however that dog seemed like it yapped nonstop. She also didn't take care of him very well. She wouldn't take him out before she left in the morning and when she left she was gone for majority of the day, so he would end up going to the bathroom in the apartment.
