It is also very convenient to interstate when the gate is working, location is fantastic. It's a great place to live if you have the patience to put up with management and going over those dang speed bumps. Wish I could stay where I'm at, but I don't have the mind nor the patience to deal with management.

name: Sydney Slaughter
text: As far as location, this complex is great. The transit ride alone is very convenient. Maintenance was always helpful and came quickly. The problems I have are with the room size, being that they are rather small and management. Upon moving out, I was charged for the replacement of my bedroom carpet and not returning a key (it was returned, but the workers in the office didn't file paperwork properly.) I had an area rug that covered my entire bedroom floor, yet management is claiming there are stains (NOT rips or tears, simply foot traffic from outside) bad enough to need a whole new carpet replacement. I emailed my concerns to management and they replied a week later saying the $225 is due in 2 days. I think The Connection is looking for any and every way to get your money. Be wary and GET EVERYTHING IN WRITING.

resp.text: We regret that you have had an unpleasant experience. Resident satisfaction is extremely important to us. Please give us the opportunity to change your opinion. We can be reached at 334.821.3301 & community email at connectionauburn@achliving.com. The management office is open M-F 10-5. We look forward to improving your opinion!

name: Jared Sweat
text: The front desk is super helpful and is always nice to me whenever I have questions. Wifi could be a little better though!

resp.text:
Jared,

Thank you for the review, we are glad your experience here has been enjoyable!

name: Joan Velasquez
text:
This is my first and only review I have ever made, but The Connection drove me to this. The Connection is easily the worst place I have lived in, I cannot stress this enough. Take your money somewhere else and save yourself many headaches and stress. If you don’t have the time to read my whole review with all the details, then just take a look at all the other reviews to get an idea of the quality of this place. And don’t be fooled by the 5 star reviews you see in the last year, because the connection offered the residents $100 dollars in exchange for a positive review. This is how desperate they are to make themselves look good. It should also give you an idea of how duplicitous their style of management truly is. They invest money, time, and effort into putting up a front and tricking people to sign-in instead of using that time to actually do their work properly and fix their current problems.
I lived with them for 2.5 years. My first year with them was ok, and I had no issues. However, everything started to go wrong when the new manager, Matthew, came in. This is why you should avoid this place at all costs:
1) Incorrect Late Fees and payment problems:
All apartment complexes have a resident portal where you can pay your rent online. These portals also allow you to save payment methods so that you don’t have to re-enter your payment information every month. I made my payments with the checking account of my bank (NOT my debit/credit card, because I don’t have to worry about changing the payment information if it ever got lost or stolen). When you make a payment, you receive a message and an email telling you that the payment went through. One day during my last semester with them, I received an email informing me of the following: My payments for the last two months had been rejected, that I had over $300 dollars in late fees, that they tried to reach me by calling me and by going to my apartment, and that if I did not made the full payment of that last two months plus late fees and charge back fees in the next 3 days, I would be evicted! I had no records in my phone of any calls being made to me from them, and I’m never at my apartment during business hours because I’m in the Auburn campus. But they could not be bothered to email me about this until 3 days before I would get evicted! They waited more than 70 days to send me a freaking email, and gave me less than a week to pay them. I immediately told them that I will pay the two months of rent but that I will not pay any extra charges or fees. I proved to them that I received a confirmation email from them for both payments. Apparently, that email was worthless, because that email only means that your payment request went through, not that the bank transferred the money. They told me that I must have made a mistake when filling out my payment information. I proved to them that this is impossible because  I used my saved Checking account to pay, the same account that I have used for the last 2 years without any issues. Then, they told me that the payments did not go through because I did not have enough money in the bank at the time of the payments! So now I had to give them proof of my bank records of the last two months to show them that at the time of the payment, I had more than enough money in my account. I felt like I was had to be a lawyer to not get overcharged by these people. But what really made me mad is that after all this proof, they still had to “talk” to their upper management to check on this. They proceeded to tell me that they wanted a freaking bank representative to basically prove to them that the bank did not make a mistake. Ridiculous! They could not admit that their online portal had a glitch or messed up. I had to invest too much time and effort in order to not get screwed over.
There is not enough space for me to write everything I want. So here are the highlights:
2) Incorrect parking charges 3) Inorrect Fees After Moving Out 4) Rent Kept Rising 5) Horrible communication with management 6) Bad Maitenance 7) you can hear everything

resp.text:
Hello Joan,

We are sorry to hear about your frustrations with our property. A manager will be reaching out to you soon to discuss the issues mentioned above. Thank you!

name: Walt Williams
text: Expect to be nickel and dimed for everything. They lost several of my packages. Every interaction with the office feels like a nightmare of paperwork. The apartments themselves are pretty nice though.

name: Kay Lyn
text: I've enjoyed living here. The only complaint I have is that there is a muddy walk to the transit stop and no where to stand in the rain while waiting for the transit. I really like the activities and I love that there is a dog park on the complex.

name: Andrew “Chase” R
text:
Updated review after 3 years:
Rent has increased to the point where The Connection is no longer a good deal for anyone on a budget.

The renovated floors leave gaps over an inch wide between the floors and doors, so you can hear EVERYTHING in the common area and anything louder than normal conversation volume from your roommates' rooms.

The new renovations as a whole are a bunch of gimmicks no one asked for so management could justify charging an extra $600 per year. The floors were installed looking scuffed and the countertops are great at hiding spills and messes so be sure to clean often. The 40" smart TV is nice if your roommates don't mind the noise, and the extra deep sinks are fantastic for hand washing dishes better than the dishwasher ever will.

Management doesn't communicate with the residents well, when they bother communicating at all. Even the people at the office are left out of the loop so you can hardly ever get straight answers from them, though they are always nice and never at fault themselves.

They cut bike locks and took all bikes off the property on short notice, while students were away on break, and have not been able to provide an adequate place for locking up bikes despite initially repeating promises of new equipment "next week" or "in a few days."

Maintenance has always been wonderful for me. They're always busy so you should expect to wait one or two business days, but I've never had to wait longer than two for any issue big or small.

The back gate is always padlocked and the front gate is always broken and left open. Don't let them fool you into thinking they finally fixed it, it will likely fail again after a few days and is a lost cause.

Junk mail is a huge problem. There are literal buckets of overflowing junk mail at every set of mail boxes.

The internet provider, Airwaves, was bought out by Single Digits and the connection on our (recently upgraded) networks have become unreliable. The connection became slow and intermittent overnight. Basic security procedures are not provided for guests and the connection is even worse if you don't register your MAC addresses online, which can be a glitchy process requiring a call to tech support.

I will no longer be recommending The Connection to others.

Original review w/ 5 stars c. 2016:
The rent isn't bad for what you get. My apartment is clean and hasn't had any issues. Management can be tough to deal with, but it's even worse at most other places. The key is to go to the office yourself and speak with someone in person, and keep coming back. I had trouble even signing my lease; errors with the website and repeated phone calls with different staff. But on my first visit about the issue everything was sorted out and on the second I had my lease signed.

resp.text:
Good Afternoon Chase,

Thank you for the review, I will try to address your concerns in the order mentioned!

For most properties, rent will change from year to year. To keep up with the ever-evolving market, we decided to renovate last year. These renovations included installing hardwood flooring throughout the entire unit, replacing the previous countertops with granite in both the kitchen and bathrooms, putting in new sink fixtures in the kitchen and bathrooms, and setting up a 55" tv in the common area of each renovated unit. While not everyone will appreciate these renovations equally, the majority will agree that they are both aesthetically pleasing and more practical.

As a management team, we do our best to make sure residents share the same knowledge that we do, whether it be through signage posted throughout the property, emails, etc. For the majority of updates, we will send an email to residents. To ensure you are receiving these emails, please make sure you are opted in to email updates in your resident portal. If you need any help changing this setting, please let us know!

Storing bikes in the breezeway of the buildings is not only unsightly, but also a fire hazard. Resident safety is of great importance to us. With this in mind, we required residents to either remove their bikes from the breezeway or we removed them. However, upon removal, we stored the bikes for about two months and gave residents the option to have them returned for free.

We are glad to hear that your experience with maintenance has been so wonderful! While each issue varies, it is nice to hear that maintenance has always responded in a timely manner.

You are correct that the back gate was locked for a short time period around the summer. At the time, our gate contractor was unable to get to the property immediately and we made the decision to lock the back gate with resident safety in mind. Otherwise, the gate was able to be opened with or without an access device. With all technology, there are issues that inevitably occur. We have actually recently spoken with our gate contractor and they will be here by the end of the week to take a look at the gate. We will work with them to make sure this is not a routine occurrence!

We completely understand your frustration with junk mail. Unfortunately, with the amount of companies who advertise through mail, there is not much we can do on our end. To encourage residents not to litter any junk mail, we set up bins by each mailbox area for disposal of junk mail.

For any internet issues, Single Digits has asked that we advise residents to reach out to them by phone at (877) 778-9283. The internet service being provided is the same that was provided by Airwaves. However, we have reached out to Single Digits to see if there is anything we can do on our end to help and are waiting to hear back.

We sincerely appreciate everything you mentioned in your review and hope that we helped clarify some of your concerns. If you have any future recommendations or concerns, please do not hesitate to reach out to us at (334) 821-3301 or info@connectionauburn.com. We are always open to resident feedback!

name: jacob korshak
text: Have tried multiple times to fix WiFi and internet and neither single digits or connection is helpful at all. Both say it's the others fault or something like that.

resp.text:
Jacob,

Thank you for the review. If there is anything we can do to improve your experience here, please email info@connectionauburn.com and we would be happy to help!

name: sherry Newton
text: Very poor management.  My daughter and her 3 roommates, who are all transfer students, were told in February they had a 4 bedroom apt available and signed a lease.   The end of March we were told an apt was not available and the girls would be dispersed to different apts.  along witn 41 other students.  Very poor management!!!!

name: Lydia Smith
text: This is the worst place ever. I lived here last year and did not have any problems, but this year has been a bust. I have not gotten the incentive that I was promised last year for renewing my lease for 2018-2019. The internet is a piece of garbage. The internet will cut off or I just can't use it to get on netflix for my t.v. because the internet is not good enough. My water is awful. When take a shower, four minutes into it the water turns cold. The carpet was nasty when I moved in, and they said they were going to come clean it and never did. I would honestly give them negative stars if google allowed it.

resp.text:
Good Afternoon Stuart,

We are sorry to hear of your frustrations. All incentives were sent out last Spring. If you did not receive yours, please contact the office and we would be happy to get it to you! All internet-related issues must be directed to Single Digits at (877) 778-9283. If there is anything else we can do to assist you, do not hesitate to contact the office at info@connectionauburn.com!

name: Lillian Jackson
text: I recommend The Connection for college students. Everything is kept clean and the staff is very nice.

name: BinaryCavemen
text: Absolutely horrible management that is not communicative. The internet is horrible and nothing has been done to fix. During peak hours even opening a web browser is difficult.

resp.text: We are sorry to hear of your negative experience. As a whole, the staff tries to be as responsive and helpful as possible. If you have any specific concerns we can address, please email info@connectionauburn.com!

name: Scott Barton
text: This is my third year renting from this apartment complex. It was all fine until this year. The management does NOT care about fixing things, or the inconvenience it causes you. I WOULD RENT SOMEWHERE ELSE.

name: Jessica Ramos
text: I have not yet moved in however ive ran into an issue that I have been trying to get settled since May it is now almost the end of July and I am still getting the run around. Please please make sure that any communication with management you get in writing!! especially if they tell you that move in can be done earlier due to specific circumstances!.... I would also like to add that half of my review was deleted on their Facebook page by their staff, it said not different than my review here.

resp.text: We're sorry you're having a negative experience as customer service is important to us. We would like to hear your concerns and assist you. Please contact the management office directly so that we can rectify your issues. We are available M-F 10-6, at 334.821.3301 or email us at connectionauburn@achliving.com

name: Lydia Ray
text: Even though the apartments are considerably nice, they're not nice enough to make up for the cost of rent. With mold on the walls, rust in the sink, thin walls, and stains in the carpet, I would not consider this a luxury apartment.  You can't even call it a gated complex. The gate is either always open or it won't even let you in at all. On top of that, the Connection management does not follow the proper rules and regulations. Originally I thought I had only signed for a sublease of six months until six months later when I thought I would be moving out, I was informed I actually automatically signed for a whole new year when I had signed for the first lease. Signing two leases at once is illegal. And then after turning down the first two people who wanted to sublease for me, they turned down the third applicant for his age even though he was a student at Auburn. This is age discrimination and also illegal. And finally with our fourth applicant, even though he passed, they made him pay the entire year up front. Also illegal. The office is absolutely rude and disrespectful. Do not live here. The only plus is they have nice pools but it definitely isn't worth it. And they will make it nearly impossible to leave once you do sign.

name: Amber Hubbard
text:
DO NOT LIVE HERE! Overall, the living situation is not bad but dealing with them after I moved out was terrible. I left the apartment complex several months ago and am only now having to pay >$100 to them for a condition that was pre-existing to my residence in the apartment. I emailed them about it and not only were the staff members rude but they also refused to listen to me or do anything about it. At this point I am forced to pay this ridiculous fee in order to avoid being sent to collections.

The location is great but dealing with the staff is terrible!

name: Alyxandra Benedict
text: If you're looking for a scam look no further. In the three years I've been there, I moved into a dirty apartment, had to wait a month for them to fix a black mold issue caused by a leak from their appliance, had my catalytic converter stolen because they wouldn't use the security measures they advertised, was charged large quantities of money for "cleaning" an apartment they were renovating, and now they refuse to return my security deposit claiming that I never had to pay one (my bank statements say otherwise). This "luxury" they advertise is a cheap facade. The management is non-existent, leaving underpaid college students to clean up their messes and deal with the rightfully angry clientel. I havent once seen the manager and every time I try to communicate with him it's always been through an uninformed second party. No one on site knows anything and management likes to keep it that way, so getting things done or getting information is impossible. This is especially infuriating when they do renovations. They may give you one days notice to get things in order, but that's not so great when they chose the middle of a break to tell you to empty your livingroom for the flooring guys or risk your stuff getting broken, or waiting until after they pressure wash the building to tell you they may have accidentally wrecked anything loose on your deck because they forgot to tell you to bring it in. The only time anyone has ever really gotten along with The Connection is when they just accepted the exorbitant charges they tack on for services they refuse to provide without a care for getting their moneys worth.

name: Ashleigh Payne
text: It was nice when the old owners were here. The apartments are nice and I like the apartment itself but the new management is terrible. They raised rent, then decided to renovate and raised rent AGAIN to stay in my unit that was going to be renovated, then there was a big fiasco where they wouldn’t guarantee that I could stay in my unit but still had to pay the higher rent. Maintenance is okay but sometimes they seem like they hate their job and hate you. Today they shut the water off to the entire community at 10:45 and didn’t tell anyone until 11:15, after it was too late to fill up jugs to drink and wash hands. They said it’ll be off for a minimum of 5 hours but who knows with how things have been going. The whole point in living here was that it was decently cheap but now the connection doesn’t really even have that going for it anymore. Unfortunately I signed my lease for the next term when rent was lower so I’m stuck here, but when the lease is up, I’m out.

name: Jessica Doyle
text: Apartment came with no damages, and I feel like the price is reasonable for what you get. The amenities are nice, but I do wish the WiFi was more consistent.

name: Katherine Thompson
text: best value for the money and they made it really easy to sublease. The furniture that is offered in the furnished apartment is the best I've seen in the apartments I have rented through the years

name: Andrew Adkins
text: good apartment and staff, but maintenance is slow. Be warned though the manager was very hard to contact if you had any problems.

resp.text: Thank you for choosing us as your home and for taking the time to share your opinion with our future residents. You may contact our management office if needed directly at 334.821.3301 M-F 10-6, or email us at connectionauburn@achliving.com

name: Emily Hicks
text: Lived here for 3 years and am only moving out because I graduated. This complex has been the best!! The staff are helpful, the apartments are spacious and well priced, the amenities are great, there are so many positive things. We only had one bug problem the whole three years, and there were yellow jackets getting in the apartment somehow, but once we figured out where they were coming in the maintenance staff took care of it for us. Also, a lot of places in auburn aren't efficiently built and that makes your utilities higher, and here the utilities are super manageable. I have heard of people finding more critters in the first floor apartments, so I would suggest an upper floor. Moving to atlanta has been the worst, because I was spoiled with this place!!

name: Jacob
text: Maintenance sucks, parking sucks, management is decent. But you get 3 pools so it's okay right?

name: Katiann Scherer
text: Parking situation could be better but the pool and fully furnished apartments are awesome!

name: Chris Garrison
text: Fantastic staff! Super convenient!

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Chris! We are glad that you are so pleased with the staff!

name: Allison Martin
text: Staff is so friendly and there are always activities to get the residents involved. You will never have a chance to be bored because there are always activities around.

name: Kelsey Turner
text: It has been an amazing experience, the location is great, the staff is great, and the price is pretty great too.

name: MARGARET DANIELS
text: For a first timer in getting an apartment the experience was made easy and comforting, when you first arrived. On the plus side it made my other friends a little jealous.

name: Alexander Weeden
text: I would not recommend the connection to anyone. The included internet is god-awful, especially during fall and spring semesters. Maintenance requests are slow, and management is unfriendly (borderline hostile at points). They will charge you an arm and a leg for absolutely anything they can find wrong with the apartment after move out, even in the common areas. The front gate is either broken and kept wide open, or broken and closed (good luck with the keypad, did not work in the whole 2 years I lived there). The back gate has been chained shut or broken for almost a year now. Aesthetically nice grounds and a few good amenities like the pool area, but nowhere near enough parking for residents (especially during football season). For inspections, they will give you a 5 day time frame to expect a visit, but don't worry because they'll show up a week late anyways. If you can't find anywhere else to live, this is the perfect complex for you.

name: Jack Ryan
text: I'm not complaining about the apartments they are fine, but our experiences with the staff have been awful. Frustrating is all I'm going to say.

name: P R
text: If you're a minority, think about renting elsewhere! They favor white people and you will see that after living here for more than a week. My roommate and I are both minorities and they treat both of us unfairly. We have made repeated complaints and the staff in the office almost mock us, namely the assistant manager, Zac.

name: Maggie Owens
text: they are not even worthy of one star. if you're looking to live at a place that actually cares about you as an individual person, do not live here. this place is so huge...ALL they care about is money. and they will get it any possible way they can from you. they will knock on the door once then come in your apartment any time they want to. i complained because they knocked once then unlocked the door and walked in on my friend in her towel. so they told me it was in the agreement when i signed the lease that they can and will come into your apartment any time they want to. the college students who worked there were nice. but the managers are the rudest, meanest people i've ever had to deal with. when i moved units, the apartment i moved in to had black mold all over the walls, the kitchen had some sort of white film all over the cabnits, oven and microwave, the floor was filthy with hair, change and popcorn behind the couch. theres no way they even swept the floor. when i went to complain about the cleaning cost, i showed them pictures.. and they still wouldn't give me a refund. the cleaning cost was a couple hundred dollars. you will regret signing a lease here. biggest mistake i made while i was at Auburn.

resp.text: We regret that you have had an unpleasant experience. Resident satisfaction is extremely important to us. Please give us the opportunity to change your opinion. Your review is anonymous so we ask that you contact us to rectify your concerns. We can be reached at 334.821.3301 & community email at connectionauburn@achliving.com. The management office is open M-F 10-6. We look forward to improving your opinion!

name: Caitlyn Marshall
text: This place is horrible! Management is really what makes the stay bad because they never handle anything correctly or go by the rules. We've been waiting for months to get problems we've been having resolved and they still haven't done anything. The staff doesn't care about anything and are extremely rude! I've even tried to contact Asset Campus Housing and they never return any phone calls. You'll really start to hear a lot of bad reviews after you move here and then it will be too late. Please do yourself a favor and not move here because you definitely will regret it!

name: Wayne Smith
text: I cant believe how nice my apartment is for the amount Im paying! I love this place. The pools, basketball court and the fact that the mgmt. keeps so many activities going makes for the best place Ive ever lived. Im sad to graduate and have to move out. :-[

We are open M-F 10-6. We look forward to correcting your issues!

name: Carson Lewis
text: VERY friendly awesome staff here that is always willing to help no matter what! Customer service is their number one priority that they exceed in well!

name: Karin Frament
text: The gate never works and my catalytic converter was stolen during Spring Break!! $3000 worth of damage when they cut it off...2 incidents the same day and 5 Honda's the same week!!!!  Manager doesn't care and won't respond to complaints for lack of security!

text: I hate living here I can not wait to move out! The maintance staff is so awful! If I could move out right now I would. Also they do not even read the roommate matching me and my roommate are like night and day and do not get along at all. The gym area is small and half the time non of the equipment works. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

text: Serious issues with online rental payment.   Late charges seem to incorrectly calculated and there is no grace period at the beginning of the month.

resp.text:
Deron,

Thank you for your review.  The online portal is one of many options you have to pay rent.  Along with it, you can pay through mail or in the office with a check or money order.  Rent is due on the 1st of every month.  While there is not a grace period, late fees do not begin until the 4th of the month, meaning you have until the 3rd each month to avoid late fees.  Should you have any additional concerns, please e-mail info@connectionauburn.com or call 334-821-3301 and we will be happy to answer them.

name: Jocsán Rivera

name: Steven S
text: Ridgecrest South , North tower is the best housing I have seen on campus. Covered Parking deck connected to the dorm is so convenient. 4 bedroom suite style dorm room. Each student has a single occupancy private room. A private bathroom shared by 2 students at each end. A kitchen with a full sized refrigerator sink and microwave. Common living area with a sectional couch and coffee table and TV stand. A small dinette table and chairs. Great for a freshman dorm room. Thanks UA! RTR!

resp.text: Thanks for the great review, Steven!

name: Sam Wight
text: Pretty great place to live. I lived here my freshman year and had very few complaints. The people here are all extremely nice, including the cleaning staff and RAs, and things are almost always quiet. It's a suite style dorm, so you have your own room and share a common area with 2-4 roommates. A good bit of furniture is provided, but I'd recommend bringing a card table at least for the main area, as well as a coffee table, as the provided side desk isn't very good. My room had a few different problems, including smelly air conditioning, a closet that smelled literally like cat pee, and a main area light that was extremely dim (had to buy three different lights to evenly light the room). I submitted all three of these problems as work orders, and the first two were solved really quickly (the next day). The light, however, literally took two weeks to get a replacement for, and is still unusually dim. Water pressure is also routinely a problem if you're on the fifth floor. The trash chutes are never open, which means that people leave their trash in the trash rooms and it smells whenever you walk by. Other than all this, though, this is probably the best place to live while on campus. If you have a bad roommate here, it's not as much of a problem as it is having one at new freshman or even Ridgecrest East as the two sides are separated. 10/10 would stay again.

name: Bruce Brown
text: as a parent, this is a nice dorm

resp.text: Thank you for the great review, Bruce!

name: John Glidden
text:
Honestly the best looking college dorm I've ever seen. And it's for Freshmen and on campus! This review is for the Ridgecrest Village as a whole, including South, East and West.
All three buildings are honors only dorms (that is, only students in the honors college) with 4 bedroom suites: in South (which houses both the North and South tower), each person gets their own 9' by 11' private bedroom (twin XL bed, desk, dresser, nightstand with drawer and locking cabinet, tv jack, Ethernet, phone line) and the suite shares a 12' by 14' living room (tv stand, tv jack, Ethernet, phone jack, high table with 2 tall chairs, couch, and 2 side tables) and a kitchenette (full refrigerator, microwave, and ample counter and cabinet space) amongst the 4 total roommates. Each suite also has 2 full bathrooms, which you share with one of your roommates. Before you move in, you fill out a roommate profile on the housing match site, where you can talk with several others with similar interests/living habits/study schedules/etc., and pick who you want to live with. As you get to know your roommates (generally several months) before you move in, most people will discuss who will bring what for the room (TV, wall hangings, curtains, whatever else you may want). East and West give you a little bit more room (but with a slightly smaller kitchen and showers) and an extra storage room. East and West are also a bit quieter, but South had nicer common areas, like the atrium, game room, and media room.
In all 3 buildings, there are a few 2 bedroom suites, however these are very limited and full up quickly. They are also smaller, and I personally prefer the 4 bedroom.
All 3 buildings also have several handicap accessible rooms, with larger bedrooms, bathrooms, accessible shower, and doorbell with a bright flashing light inside. There are also 2 elevators in each tower and multiple in East and West if they are needed. There may be additional accessibility features I am not aware of at this point.
In South, the laundry ($1.50 per wash and $1.25 per dryer- same across campus except international student living) and community kitchens (2 full ranges, 2 ovens, fire suppression system, 2 full refrigerators, and a seating area) are on the 2nd and 4th floors. The second floor also houses the atrium (used for several larger events put on by the college, and also used for group projects and studying), game and media rooms, so these suites fill up quickly. The 5th floor rooms all have extra tall ceilings, and several have an extra foot or 2 on the living room and bedrooms as they extend outwards from the building.
If you bring a car/truck, (which Alabama actually allows freshman to do) and you stay in any of the Ridgecrest dorms, you will be parking it in the parking garage underneath South, but it isn't more than a 90 second walk from either of the other 2 buildings.  If you prefer, there are several other lots you can park in if your vehicle doesn't fit, but the clearance is 7'8" with fairly large spots so most cars/trucks will fit. In all of the other dorms I can think of, you have to park elsewhere.  Ridgecrest is the only dorm village with built in parking for students (except handicap).
Many of then off campus housing options (which almost everybody takes with the exception of RAs and athletes) are nicer and less expensive, but as far as freshman dorms, Ridgecrest is by far my favorite.
Overall, you honestly can't go wrong with any place in the Ridgecrest village. The other suite style dorms (presidential, lakeside, riverside) are very similar, and very nice, but are for both honors and non-honors students. ROLL TIDE!

name: Taneisha Williams
text: I live here currently, and it’s awesome. Maintenance is super nice and helpful. The office staff is very informative of my questions, and they are ready to help right away. I will live here until I Graduate!! The amenities are cool to use, and convenient. I like kayaking at the lake! I highly recommend living here as a Junior.

resp.text: Thank you, Taneisha! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!! We're looking forward to another year of adventures with you!

name: Christopher (Gavin) Brazelton
text: Warning to potential renters. The 4.2 the cottages have is a lie. They get the residents to leave good reviews in exchange for free items through out the year. I work in housing and this is typically found as a bad practice by a bad company and typically looked down upon. I don’t typically do this but since I saw the good reviews I thought it was great. Let’s start from the beginning. I moved in and had already completed all move in paper work before getting there including my dog information and paid the pet deposit. I get there the day of move in and they say my dog cannot move in because they “lost the paper work” after a few hours of arguing I finally was able to move in in order to find my copy of all the paper work. We move in and the place is a mess nothing had been cleaned the carpets had stains everywhere. It was horrible I had never seen anything like it. They said they cleaned it which is weird since I could find tons of syrup or something spilt in the cabinets. I also found tons of dirty spots on the carpet through out the house. When I get to my room there was stains that looked like bleach stains which were easy to see since My bed was completely missing... my door was broke to the bathroom. Then come to find out the toilet was leaking. They never fixed the toilet i put in at least three work orders but it never got fixed so I just had to leave a cup under there and dump it every day so it would ruin my stuff... it wasn’t fixed until they changed out toilets for the entire community. Save yourself the trouble don’t live here was the worse experience of my college career would rather or lived in the dorm again.... I will add pics if I can..

resp.text: Christopher, thank you for your feedback. It is our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory. We know that if anything would have been brought to our attention that we would have addressed the situation to the best of our ability. Our team would be happy to speak with you and resolve the issues you are having. Please contact us at 205-409-2052 at your earliest convenience.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Kellianne! It is great that you appreciate our hardworking staff at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha. We're excited to welcome you home this fall!

Absolutely great experience, 10/10 recommend.

resp.text: Josh, thank you for your honest review! We love that you have enjoyed your time at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha, as well as our sense of community. We're happy to hear that you have enjoyed communicating with all of the Mackenzie's that our office has to offer, haha!

text:
I lived in 3 places throughout my undergrad at UA. The Cottages was the best of those experiences without a doubt. Large bedrooms, quality amenities, and great staff. Maintenance requests were always fulfilled, common areas were always clean and well kept, not to mention how affordable this place is. Also, I lived much closer to campus before and had a longer drive time. 25th, Jack Warner, and that side of University don't get backed up so it's a relatively quick commute.

Having lived other places, I couldn't recommend this one enough.

resp.text: Thank you, Emily! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!! We appreciate you taking the time to write such a kind review!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Addison! We pride ourselves in our amenities and we love that you and your pup have enjoyed them!!

name: Caitlin McCann
text: Very nice place. I like walking by the lake. It is sometimes difficult to get questions answered by management, and sometimes work orders take a while to go through, but overall a good place to live and I enjoy it.

resp.text: Thank you Caitlin for your honest feedback. We strive for the best customer service and apologize we did not meet the expectation. We’d love to make this up to you and discuss your concerns in person to assure they are taken care of correctly. Please contact us at (205) 409-2052 or stop by the leasing office and ask to speak with a member of our leasing team!

name: Shelby Johnson
text: Been living here since august, and I currently live in a 5 bedroom unit. Very spacious, love the pool and tennis courts, safe environment! Would totally recommended this over living in an apartment , it’s very nice to drive up to your house and not have to worry about elevators and parking decks!

resp.text: Thank you for your great feedback, Shelby! We pride ourselves in our amenities at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha, and we love that you have enjoyed them.

name: Hanna Jernigan
text: Such a wonderful team in the office and on maintenance. They are so helpful when signing your lease. The apartments are great as well.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Hanna! It is great that you appreciate our hardworking staff at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha.

name: Julia Lener
text: My favorite part about the cottages is the student environment in the complex. I have made so many friends and I love running down by the lake. Overall has been a great college experience here at the cottages.

resp.text: Julia, thank you for your honest review! We love that you have enjoyed your time at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha, as well as our sense of community.

name: Mel Alberico
text: I just moved into the cottages as a junior and can honestly say I wish I lived here in my previous years. It feels like such a safe and comfortable community. The houses are absolutely great and I love having a house instead of a crammed apartment. I run the lake every morning and it’s a beautiful view! Highly recommend The Cottages!

resp.text: That is so sweet of you to say! Thank you, we are glad to have you here.

name: Rachel Curtis
text: I have honestly had the greatest experience with the cottages! The events are always so much fun and the fact that I have my own house has been my favorite part. The lake is really peaceful and overall been the best experience ive had anywhere in town

resp.text: Thank you so much, Rachel! We're so happy to hear that you are enjoying your time here and look forward to seeing you at many more resident events in the future!

name: Heidi Risher
text: I lived here during college, and I absolutely loved the experience. There is literally nothing like it in Tuscaloosa. Trust me, I lived in another apartment one year, and that place didn’t come close to the cottages. I miss it!! 10/10 recommend

resp.text: Thank you, Heidi! We love hearing that you enjoyed living with us, and we miss having you at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!! Best of Luck!

name: Lauren Niemi
text: The Cottages is an awesome place to live and very safe. It has brought me awesome roommates as well as neighbors! The amenities are awesome! The lake is a great place to watch the sunsets or even fish. I’ve only been here for a month and it already feels like home. The houses are very spacious & a convenient location for students as the drive to campus is only about 3 minutes. The staff is very friendly! I highly recommend living at the cottages!

resp.text: Thanks so much, Lauren! We are so glad that your have had such positive experiences interacting with our team and that you are enjoying everything The Cottages has to offer!

name: Blake Swafford
text: Terrible service heat was out for five days. Peoples water gets arbitrarily shut off do not sign here. Management will not work with you at all. Staff was very unapologetic about the situation. We just resigned and are already having regrets. Only rated highly due to monetary incentive for positive reviews.

resp.text: Hey Blake, we are terribly sorry that you have had a bad experience. We did have to shut water off to 3 units that did not drip their pipes during the hard freeze warning to ensure that their houses did not flood when the pipes unfroze. Also, It looks like you put in your work order on February 19, 2021 and we contacted JC's Refrigeration to come take a look at your unit. From our understanding, your unit was taken care of and is working properly. You have also already spoken with our property manager as well to ensure that your complaint is taken care of. Thank you for taking time to give us a review. Please let us know if there is anything that we can do for you in the future. We hope that you have a great weekend!

name: Alex Hutto
text: The Cottages is like home away from home! I love how they were cottages instead of the traditional wall to wall apartments which meant that I didn’t have to worry about noisy neighbors. Also, the staff has always been super helpful with anything I ever needed. They listened and were patient with me even when I wasn’t as patient as I should have been at sometimes lol. Overall, I’m glad I chose the cottages when I lived in Tuscaloosa.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your awesome review, Alex! We love that you enjoyed your time at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha. We greatly appreciate your honest and detailed feedback!

name: Hallie abel
text: I’ve had a great experience living at the cottages the past couple years, I’d recommend it to anyone looking for student housing in Tuscaloosa.

resp.text: Thank you, Hallie! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Helen Rose
text: The cottages is a great place to live! It’s pet friendly and has great amenities-I would recommend for any student to live here and the houses are so cute.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your recommendation Helen! We love that you are having a great experience with us!

name: Sabina Jancikova
text: This is my second year living at The Cottages! This place felt like home the day I moved in! This community is so fun and enjoyable. Also the people living here can always help with whatever you need! Any problems that me and my roommates had, has always been taken care of in a timely manner! The people that work in the office are also very helpful, nice, and understanding!! I would recommend this place to live to everyone that’s looking for great community!

resp.text: Thank you, Sabina! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Kendall Frisbee
text: It’s great! You get all of the perks of an apartment with the comfort of a home. It’s also super pet friendly, and seeing my neighbors walking their dogs is a highlight of my mornings. Would definitely recommend for students looking for something cozy with the convenience of being close to campus.

resp.text: Hi Kendall, Thank you for sharing your experience with us! :)

name: Skylar Lien
text: I highly recommend living at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha! It has everything I need + more for a fantastic rate. The property is extremely well kept & their team has responded quickly to all of our work orders. Plus my roommate’s and I LOVE waking up to our lake view backyard every day.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Skylar! It is great that you appreciate our hardworking team and we're so happy to hear you are enjoying your cottage on the lake!

name: Chase Layton
text: This is a great place for me and my two roommates to live! They have great amenities here including full Tennis courts, large green spaces, a huge pool, and several workout rooms. I would highly recommend living here if you are really interested in these things!

resp.text: Thank you for your great feedback, Chase! We pride ourselves in our amenities at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha, and we love that you have enjoyed them.

name: Justin Porter
text: I’ve been in the cottages for about a month but so far it’s an excellent community to live. The houses and lawns are well kept so it’s a pretty walk around the lake or the community. The house I’m in is much bigger than I expected and there were no issues when I moved in so I am very pleased with that. My only complaints are that the gates are very slow, but that’s a minor inconvenience, and that there are a few hidden fees you can get but it’s all in the lease and the signing bonus more than covers it. It’s also a very safe community the only street that isn’t gated has security on it all night. Overall the cottages is a very nice and safe place to live if you’re willing to pay a little more, also if you’re a student at ua it seems like it’s further from campus than it is, it never takes me more then 10 minutes to get to campus and that’s with traffic.

resp.text: Thank you, Justin! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha! :)

name: Kayla Bryant
text: I just moved to the cottages like 2 months ago and I absolutely love it! There’s always different events going on for the residents and the staff is so nice! I’m definitely happy to call it home.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Kayla! It is great that you appreciate our hardworking staff and that you are enjoying your home here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha. We look forward to seeing you at more resident events!

name: Ashlee Sanders
text: This is my first year at The Cottages and it's been amazing! The houses are spacious and well-taken care of, and there's easy access to the lake and all of the amenities! I've had a great experience with management every time I've had a question, and the gates make the community feel very safe.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Ashlee! It is great that you appreciate our hardworking staff at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha.

name: Tyler Keenum
text: This property is one of the best in town! Great staff and beautiful cottages. Amenities are better than all the competition!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Tyler! It is great that you appreciate our hardworking staff at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha.

name: Lindsey Finn
text: This is my third year living at the Cottages and I absolutely love it! I love the spacious housing options and how it is dog friendly!! The lake is beautiful and it’s an all around great place to live!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Lindsey! We are so happy that you are enjoying your time here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha and are glad that you have decided to renew with us for another year!

name: Jennifer Rakes
text: Just want to give a shout out to all of the on site students and others that work at The Cottages leasing office! We had to reassign our sons lease and Mckenzie Logan and the multiple people  I spoke to there made this a less stressful process. Could not have done this without all of their help and PATIENCE! Thank you and all the best!

resp.text: Jennifer, thank you for your review! We are so happy to hear that you had such a wonderful experience with our onsite team, wishing you & your son the best!

name: Max Harouche
text: Very nice aesthetic. That’s all pretty much. If you like hidden fees and an unsafe place then you hit the jackpot. The likelihood that you’ll wake up one morning to either your car keyed or something stole from your car is very high. The security is a joke. Only quality is the pool.

resp.text: Thank you, Max, for your feedback. We take what you are saying very seriously. Although we cannot guarantee your safety, we do not want you to feel threatened in your home so we appreciate you bringing your concerns to our attention. We have made note of concern with our onsite security. Moving forward we will keep our eye on this and make fixes where necessary. Please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you by stopping by the leasing office or giving us a call at 205-409-2052.

name: Sean Hill
text:
TAKE PICTURES ON MOVE IN OR ELSE!! Any scratch, stain, dent or rip in anything in the apartment should be pictured and recorded in the move in sheet! Otherwise, they’ll turn around at move out and expect you to pay to get the apartment back into shape (whether they actually do that work or just bill you for it is another discussion).

Also, REVIEW YOUR FINAL STATEMENT! They tried to charge me $75 for DRIP PANS, only reversing that after numerous attempts to contact them and calling it “a billing error”. The factThe property is fairly nice, but their business is apparently based on exploiting college students and foreign workers who don’t have the knowledge to protect themselves.

Finally, I can confirm they do provide compensation for reviews on google from current residents, so keep that in mind for every review from someone who hasn’t done move-out.

resp.text: Sean, thank you for your feedback. It is our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory.  Our team would be happy to speak with you and resolve the issues if they haven't been already. Please contact disputes@cottagesatlaketamaha.com at your earliest convenience.

name: Alex Hill
text: Loved living here for the past 2 years. On to the 3rd. Many great amenities and it feels a lot more like home than a regular apartment. It is also a gated community which is nice.

resp.text: Thank you for your great feedback, Alex! We pride ourselves in our amenities at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha, and we love that you have enjoyed them.

name: Bryanna Mains
text: I'm so glad I moved here, and I can't wait to spend another year or two here! My roommates three roommates are amazing and our house is spacious and cozy, definitely a place I am glad to call home in Tuscaloosa.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Bryanna! We're so glad that you are enjoying your time here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha and are looking forward to the years to come!

name: David Hart
text: Very nice place and community. The layout is beautiful and the location is ideal. Customer service was very good and the workers explained everything very well and thoroughly.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, David! It is great that you appreciate our hardworking staff at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha.

name: Samuel (Sam) Gunn
text: Have loved living here so far! Truly feels like a community here and everyone is very friendly. Management is quick to respond to questions and concerns and is almost always doing giveaways for residents which is really nice!

resp.text: Thank you, Samuel! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Elissa Nation
text: This is my first year living in The Cottages, and I can go early say I love it here. I live in a 3 bedroom, and I have only had a few minor issues that were addressed as needed. Looking forward to renewing my lease.

resp.text: Thank you, Elissa! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!! We're looking forward to the years to come!

name: Izzy Crumpton
text: Prefer living here way more than the dorms or an apartment building. Living in your own house is so much quieter than the latter. There is also way more space in the units here than in other complexes in town!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Izzy! We're so glad that you love our property just as much as we love having you here!

name: Cameryn Robertson
text: So happy I moved here. I love my luxurious home so much. Thank you to the cottages for making me feel like i’m at home. Everything is perfect!!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much, Cameryn! We're so happy that you are enjoying your The Cottages and hope to continue to make you and your roommates feel at home!

name: Rae Hamilton
text: The management here is the worst! They do not care about their residents at all. They ignore the needs of residents and are slow and resistant to help their residents in any way. I do not recommend living here. My sister had a better experience back when is was called "The Retreat" and supposedly the new management is supposed to be better. I really don't think so. You overpay for bad management and a frustrating experience. They do not take care of the apartments, it is hard to get maintenance to fix problems, and they force people to live with pet owners even when their contract says they are not in a pet friendly apartment. They largely disregard the needs and preferences of the resident. Stay away!

resp.text: Rae, thank you for your feedback. It is our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory. Our team would be happy to speak with you and resolve the issues you are having. Please contact 205-409-2052 at your earliest convenience.

name: Jacob Vargas
text: Absolutely enjoy living here. The pool and lake make it the best place to live in Tuscaloosa. Never ran into a problem with the cottages and would definitely recommend living here to anyone!!!

resp.text: Thank you, Jacob! We're so glad that you are enjoying your time here with us and we are looking forward to the years to come!

name: Hailey Mrozek
text: A great community for college students! They have a great selection of amenities that are sure to satisfy everyone! I have lived here for 2 years now and couldn't imagine living any where else! My favorite parts are the private lake which is perfect for walking your dog because there are trails around the whole thing! The only issue we ever had was with some bugs getting in our house but we live against the tree line so its kind of to be expected. The good thing is they have an exterminator that comes to the property and you can put your house on a list to be treated! I'm going into my senior year so its sad to think this could be my last year here but if you're looking for great housing in T-town this is the place to be!

resp.text: Hailey, we are so glad that you decided to make The Cottages your home and that you will be spending another year with us. We're happy to have been able to fix the issue you had with the bugs in your cottage, please be sure to let us know if you need anything else, looking forward to another year with you and your pup!

name: John Hutto
text: Let me start of by saying that this place has been amazing! The atmosphere of the Cottages has always been like a home away from home and the community makes it feel like one even more. All the events that the Cottages host make it that much more fun. I highly recommend living here!!

resp.text: That is amazing, John! We are so happy that you have had such a positive experience with us. We cannot wait until we are able to host more events!

name: Emily Campbell
text: Such a great place to live! Very safe and many amenities offered. The beautiful lake is only a short walk away from your cottage :)

resp.text: Thanks, Emily! We are happy that you enjoy it here!

name: Bill Wilkens
text: My son loves this place. The cottages were nothing but nice to us and gave him a stable place to stay during the horrible situation and a fantastic property the past year. He sent me these pictures he took at the lake yesterday.

resp.text: We love our Lake Tamaha, glad to see that your son does as well. Please reach out if you guys need anything! #CottageLife

name: Brock Burks
text: Excellent service. Great community. Many facilities. It’s an overall package that is hard to put down.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review, Brock! We're happy to hear that you have been enjoying your time here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!

name: Darion Hawkes
text: I absolutely ADORE this place! The homes are so spacious and homey - it really takes student living to another level. The amenities are top notch but the pool is definitely my favorite. If that isn't enough, as the name suggests, they are right by the lake! Location, quality cottages, amenities and above-and-beyond customer service make choosing The Cottages @ Lake Tamaha  is a no-brainer.

resp.text: Awe, you have us blushing, Darion! Thank you for your honest review and thank you for choosing The Cottages at Lake Tamaha. #CottageLife

name: Austin Chisolm
text: Absolute experience living here! Staff is great and helpful. Beautiful atmosphere as well

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Austin! It is great that you appreciate our hardworking staff at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha.

name: RW Keeney
text: Absolutely love the neighborhood! Great prices for a high quality of living. All the neighbors are very welcoming and easy to make friends!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review, Ryan! We are so glad that you are making so many friends and loving the community!

name: David (Alex) Weaver
text: The cottages have a great environment to live in from the multiple green spaces to play sports to the pool and basketball courts there is always something to do here!

resp.text: Thank you for your great feedback, Alex! We pride ourselves in our amenities at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha, and we love that you have enjoyed them.

name: Will Collins
text: I moved in 3 weeks ago. So far I have enjoyed it, the staff has been very quick and polite to help with any issues I needed. Very satisfied

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Will! It is great that you appreciate our hardworking staff at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha.

name: James Hall
text: My daughter rented here for three years ... the last year cut short by COVID. Throughout her stay, the management here seemed only interested in money, not the safety or service of the students. My daughter's car was broken into because the managers refused to fix the gates. When her senior year was cut short, the management would not work with us on rent assistance. And once her lease expired, they sent us a bill for more than $450 for "damages" to the unit, including a $25 charge for not removing a shower curtain rod. DO NOT let your child live here. They care only about the dollar and will cut corners, cheat and lie to make more of it.

resp.text: Thank you for loyalty to The Cottages for 3 years, we are sorry that you had a few issues here and I hope that you contacted the office for all of the above. This has no doubt been a tough year for everyone. Please email disputes@cottagesatlaketamaha.com to discuss your move-out charges as we are willing to work with you there. Thanks again.

name: B
text: Staff is nice and love the amenities!

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We're so happy to hear that you have enjoyed our amenities and have had a nice experience with our team!

name: Kamryn Gilbert
text: Living at the cottages is an adventure!! Meeting new people and pups. A perfect college experience living at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Kamryn! We are so happy to hear that you are enjoying your time here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha and that you are really enjoying the sense of community that we take pride in!

name: John Stumpff
text: Be ware and ask questions about Simple Bills.  It is a rigged system to bring in a lot of money.  The thermostats are not adjustable ( you can’t turn off or down the ac when away for the summer for example) and you will be charged for utility overage when you are away.  During the Covid/summer break I have been billed every month ranging from $6 to $37.  We have not been in the apartment in three months.  This will be our last contract with this company.  Be ware of what you are agreeing to and shop around.  Read carefully.

resp.text: Hi John, these statements that you have made are untrue, be we understand that you may be frustrated. We would be happy to talk this over with you and discuss your overages. Please contact us at your earliest convenience.

name: Emily Vallario
text: I’ve lived here for 3 years and I love it! The amenities are great and the staff is always so friendly and accommodating. Love love love it!

resp.text: Thank you, Emily! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!! :)

name: Kelsey Finn
text: Been living here for 4 years. Dog friendly and a great place to live if you love hiking, swimming, fishing, and being out on a lake.

resp.text: Thank you, Kelsey! We love hearing that you & your pup enjoy living with us, and we love that the both of you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Emily DeLorenzo
text: I’m so happy to call this place home! It has so many great amenities and I love how everyone here is so friendly!!

resp.text: Thank you for your great feedback, Emily! We pride ourselves in our amenities at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha, and we love that you have enjoyed them.

name: David Patterson
text: The Cottages is a pretty nice place to live. The amenities are great and the staff is very helpful when you have an issue.

resp.text: Thank you for your great feedback, David! We pride ourselves in our amenities at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha, and we love that you  you appreciate our hardworking staff!

name: Jadah Nichols
text: The cottages is a very spacious place to live! I love the events they host for the residents!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Jadah! We are happy to hear that you are enjoying your time here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha and we look forward to seeing you at more of our upcoming events!

name: Nathanael (Nate) Jones
text: Great builds and a great location. It’s far enough away that you feel like you can get away from Tuscaloosa but still have everything close.

resp.text: Thank you, Nathanael! We're so glad you are enjoying your adventure here at The Cottages!

name: Megan Dravet
text: I love living at the cottages! It’s so beautiful here and the amenities are great!

resp.text: Thank you for your great feedback, Megan! We pride ourselves in our amenities at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha, and we love that you have enjoyed them.

name: Elena Zink
text: Such a fun place to live!!!! Awesome staff, great amenities, and affordable prices. I definitely recommend living here for any students searching for housing!!

resp.text: Thank you, Elena! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Brenna Snow
text: I’ve lived at the Cottages for two and a half years now. The houses are very spacious compared to apartments with the same amount of bedrooms. Our house had brand new appliances and furniture when we moved in, and so everything is very nice. I also love being able to park right in front of my house (much better than lugging groceries through the halls of an apartment complex!). If I ever had a maintenance issue, it was resolved quickly. Some people say it’s far from campus, but it’s only a five minute drive to the Northeast Commuter Lot taking University. They also offer short term leases, which is nice because I’m graduating this fall and won’t be trapped in a lease trying to find someone to sublet for the spring semester. Recommend!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your awesome review, Brenna! We love that you have enjoyed your time at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha. We greatly appreciate your honest and detailed feedback!

name: Daniel Hampton
text: I have spent one full semester living at the Cottages and have been pleased the whole time. I had a couple of maintenance issues at the beginning of the year but I was able to submit my own work orders without calling and maintenance was out there to fix it the next day. Also, I love the community and the residents that live here. Everyone is so friendly around here and I've actually even made tons more friends since living here. I look forward to spending the rest of my time living at the Cottages while I finish up school!

resp.text: Thank you, Daniel! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Kevin Miller
text:
I've had a ton of problems with the cottages,  they've been pretty good at fixing stuff when called, but have COVID safety for maintenence, which is understandable but makes you wish they gave you a functioning apartment in the first place.

I'll keep it simple, this place is cheap because they will make up the difference with some other fees, you cant swim in the lake, and there is no hot tub.

only thought to give this review an update after our internet started going in an out over the past hour. now I need to go to campus and work on classes. with no notice.

also make note of the distance,  the cottages are one of the furthest apartments.so factor in a years worth of extra mileage in gas as well.

resp.text: Kevin, thank you for your feedback. It is our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your expectations have not been met during your time here. We are not sure who informed you that you are not allowed to swim in Lake Tamaha as this is false information, you are allowed to swim in the lake however it is at your own risk as this information is stated on our signs near lake Tamaha since we do not have lifeguards on duty in the area. As for our Jacuzzi, we apologize if there was any miscommunication that lead you to believe that it is a heated hot tub rather than a Jacuzzi tub. We are not sure if you are aware of this, but there are 3 bus stops on our property for the Crimson Ride that you are more than welcome to take to campus Mon-Fri from 7am-9pm! We hope that you will find some of this information helpful and hope to make your experience at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha a better one!

name: Kate Howell
text: The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful, and they always are happy to answer any questions! The cottages themselves are beautiful and great for student living. The leasing process is so easy in that it’s entirely online. Would highly recommend looking into making at home at these beautiful cottages!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review, Kate! We are a paperless leasing office, which makes signing any documents a breeze! We appreciate your feedback!

name: Carly Gibbons
text: I have only good things to say about the cottages! My roommates and I absolutely love it here! We are close to the pool and the lake so its a quick walk to our favorite amenity spaces! Also the front office always has the cutest merch to give away and also they always has awesome giveaways with different prizes to give back to their residents!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, we love to hear that you and your roommates are enjoying the amenities! Keep rocking your cottages merch and be sure to stay tuned for more giveaways!

name: Zachary Duncan
text: The Cottages is probably my favorite complex in all of Tuscaloosa. The best thing about the Cottages is definitely the amenities. From the pool to the full sized basketball court to the sand volleyball, there is really something for everyone to do. It doesn’t even feel like housing it feels like a mini resort. I would recommend the Cottages to anyone.

resp.text: Hi Zachary, thank you for acknowledging our awesome amenities. We pride ourselves in the #CottageLife lifestyle!

name: Flum
text: Besides the fact you can get away with everything. The management is awful, wifi is shaky, the gates goes backwards. Only thing this place has going for them is the pool, basketball court, and volleyball court. I'm so glad I moved out of here. Not to mention if you live in an unlucky house your A/C will be broken when you move in or your dryer/washer won't do it's job well unless you run it twice.

resp.text: Flum, thank you for your feedback. We appreciate your honest review and understand the frustration. Our goal is to bring you the most up to date information and we apologize for missing the mark as this was not our intention.

name: Jonathon McLain
text: Love this place so much , just moved inlast year and I have no complaints ! Pool is super nice and everyone here is super friendly so far !

resp.text: Thank you, Jonathon! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Maya Williams
text: Moved in 2 weeks ago and love it here! Maintenance has been quick to respond to any issues we have had and everyone is super nice!

resp.text: Thank you, Maya! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Aiyana Pough
text: I love my cottage family, they are so sweet and on top of things! i’m so happy that I decided to live here!

resp.text: Thank you, Aiyana! We're so glad that you are enjoying your time here with us and that you feel so at home!

name: Carter Sheldon
text: Very nice facilities! The clubhouse has a lot of accommodations and is very clean.

resp.text: Thank you for your great feedback, Carter! We pride ourselves in our amenities at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha, and we love that you have enjoyed them.

name: Amber Fenimore
text: A worker named Samuel gave me and some of my friends a tour of the model home and he was an amazing help! He was able to answer all of our questions and gave us information to take home. Such a lovely tour guide and help! I would definitely recommend asking for him when getting a tour!

It makes things so convenient if you need to pay rent or submit a work order but don’t have time to go the clubhouse. Another one of my favorite things is how they are actual cottages so you don’t have to worry about shared walls like a normal housing complex. I recommend the Cottages to anyone!

resp.text: Ian, thank you for leaving this detailed feedback about your experience with The Cottages at Lake Tamaha. Thank you very much for sharing these comments about Resident Portal, we try to make it as easy as possible for our residents.

name: Joshua Harrelson

name: Theresa Gillson
