text: Great place, great management team!

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback! We love our hardworking team, too!

name: Samantha Rominger
text: I have enjoyed my time spent at the retreat. My room & bathroom were in great shape, as well as the rest of the house. I love the gym & tanning access. The only problems I had were with unessasry overages & delay in fixing the work orders we put in.

resp.text: Thank you for your business and your feedback. We love hearing how we are doing. If you need anything, please call (205) 553-6453, and we would be glad to help.

name: Adam Lewis
text: Megan at the front desk is helpful and pleasant. Taylor is what you want in a representative as well. She is awesome to work with

resp.text: Thanks Adam! We take pride in our customer service and our employees are rockstars!

name: Maya Pitts
text: The retreat is a very nice place to live. I've stayed here 2 years now and the staff is very friendly and helpful, the the cottages are spacious and the amenities are awesome too. The only reason why I rated it 4 stars instead of 5 is because when you put in a request for maintenance it takes a while. But other than that everything else is fine

resp.text: Thank you, Maya for your honest feedback. We love hearing how we are doing. Our team would be happy to speak with you and resolve the concerns you have listed. Please contact 205.553.6453 at your earliest convenience.

name: Paul Allen
text: I am surprised to see so many positive reviews for this dump, and I would be less surprised to find out that they are all fake. Let me preface this by saying I am writing anonymously. Given the seedy business practices of the current managers, I would not put it past them to hike my rate up once more after writing this. The mystery charges on my bill, ridiculous utility overages while I am not even living there, and poor customer service are only a few reasons we are signing elsewhere after two years of living here. The staff is incredibly incompetent and often times rude, as I am sure they are getting tired of dealing with irate customers. For the same price after overages, you could easily live closer to campus. The amenities are a total joke (broken gym equipment) and they have lost mail before. Buyer beware,  you might talk yourself into looking past the distance from campus but I promise one day you will realize that this place is simply too far away and poorly run to be worth it. You will have plenty of insects, broken appliances, and nary a helpful hand in sight. While great housing options are few and far between in this town, nothing will ever change until we take a stand and demand better options.

resp.text: Paul, thank you for your feedback. It is our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory.  Our team would be happy to speak with you and resolve the issues you are having. Please contact us at 205.553.6453 at your earliest convenience. Also, please let us know what gym equipment or any other amenity that is broken so we can resolve that issue as well. Thanks you for bringing this to our attention.

name: Sarah Cagle
text: This was my first year living at the retreat, and I have really loved it so far. Maintenance requests have always been addressed quickly (our heater went out during January, for example, but someone came out to fix it almost immediately). We did have a pretty big bug/ant problem (maybe because our house backs onto the woodsy area of the neighborhood?), and that was frustrating, but we notified maintenance and an exterminator came a couple of times and took care of it. I love the location, and we have only very rarely had issues with loud/parties noise. The lake is beautiful, and the amenities are great, although maybe a little excessive. My only real complaint is that, even though we are very careful to turn off all lights and conserve water, we almost always end up with utility overages, and when we initially moved in, we weren't notified about them until three and half months after our lease started. Other than that, I've been very happy with the Retreat, and I hope my experience continues to be a good one!

resp.text: Thanks Sarah for the honest review. We are always here to take care of your concerns and request. Don't hesitate to reach out. We want you to love your home.

name: Sean Stringer
text: I love it here. I will be living here for a third lease term beginning in the fall. Not too far from campus and the pool is great. I would definitely recommend living here if you're looking for somewhere to live!

resp.text: Thanks Sean for the review. We can't wait to spend another year with you! Have a great summer break!

name: Austin Harris
text: I have absolutely loved living at the retreat. I've been here for the past 2 years and it has been great since day 1. I find it to be a safe and perfect area to live.

resp.text: Thanks for the great review Austin!

name: Dedrick constant
text: One of the best places to live in the Tuscaloosa area. Excellent office staff and prodigious amenities. Thank you Megan for the assistance.

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Dedrick!

name: Elizabeth (Liza) Rollins
text: The Retreat is a very pretty place but it is not the best place. When you go to the office there is mostly students, they try their best but there is only so much they can do. I have had problems with complaints not being dealt with. It is understandable that a lot of people live there and things may take time but after looking at the complaints and deciding they weren't going to do anything they did not say anything, which was frustrating.

resp.text: Thank you for your business and your feedback. Our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory. Our team would be happy to speak with you and resolve the issues you are having. Please contact management at (205) 553-6453 at your earliest convenience.

name: Daniel Michaels
text: Highly recommend! I've spent two years here and have had a great experience.

resp.text: Thank you, Daniel! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Tessa Wilson
text: I love the idea of the Cottages instead of apartments. Makes you feel like you have your own house. Seems to be quiet and the atmosphere is relaxing.

resp.text: Thank you for your business and your feedback. We love hearing how we are doing.

name: Cassie McCay
text:
I worked, lived, and played with The Retreat for three years and miss it more every day. Despite the normal difficulties that a housing community WILL have with 1,300 + college students mainly living on their own for the first time- The Retreat is affordable and secure. To boot, the three years I lived at The Retreat were the best times of my life. Yes you live a little bit away from campus but it's a good thing. You meet new people outside of your greek life/major and some weekends just turn in to a house hop to see everyone which saves a ton of bar money. If you do choose to go out to the bar, The Retreat has a shuttle bus that will pick you up and take you home which is an safe haven for most residents. Random fact- I know someone who met their now wife on The Retreat Bar Bus. (just saying) There is also a police officer on call 24/7 if you have any security problems. Yes there will be problems but they will be fixed. You will meet the most amazing people. And you will have the most beautiful pool in the state. (in the summer this is the place to be) If you are looking for a quiet, secluded getaway, this is not your home. But if you are looking for a mix of both worlds, The Retreat is the way to go.
Miss you guys!
Cassie M.

name: Jazzy Hicks
text: Living in the cortages is awesome. I love the awesome pool here. Megan and all of the staff here is always helpful and awesome

resp.text: Megan is such a great employee! Thank you for the review!

name: Kelli Henry
text: Love this place. Good atmosphere. Good employees. Jackie was the best and very helpful.

resp.text: Kelli, thank you for leaving this  feedback about your experience with The Cottages at Lake Tamaha. Thank you very much for sharing these comments.

name: Malorie Talley
text: The Retreat has, by far, the best student housing site in Tuscaloosa. The access to the lake is great and the beautiful pool is amazing!! Staff is very helpful and work hard to make the residents happy! Very much recommended

resp.text: Thanks for the review Malorie!

name: Delaney Triezenberg
text: i love this place i’ve lived here the past two years, if i could live here again i would!

resp.text: Thank you, Delaney! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Robby Flesch
text: Actually living at the retreat was OK, expect for my deck which was absolutely destroyed and management did little to solve the problem after repeated inquiries. If you decide to live here be ready to get screwed on checkout. I was charged with utility overages for time I did not live there as well as other "cleaning" that was completely unnecessary . My bill was not even that bad compared to my roommate who was charged 800 dollars at move out. I was also not able to schedule a move out inspection date until july, in which case I was already gone and had no way of returning for the inspection.  If you decide to live take pictures and document things very well when you move in. Don't let these people screw you over.

name: Brandon Perdue
text: The best place to live in T-town. Friendly staff, great homes. You can’t go wrong here.

resp.text: Thanks so much, Brandon! Join us for our Ugly Sweater Shindig tomorrow December 15th from 4-6pm!

name: Kaylee Crenshaw
text: I love living here! They have an awesome pool and a great workout facility that I can use whenever.I love that I have my own house and that I don't ever feel likeI am disturbing others. Great place to live.

name: Madison Wilbourne
text:
First noise, I get it...it is a college town, but when you have people banging the walls next door and you hear loud dogs barking because they are chained in their backyards or left over night on the back porch in the cold weather, well it gets quite annoying and really sad honestly and this here leads to grounds, I’m tired of walking out in my front/back yard to walk on beer cans and step in dog poop. Yes  people who live here should clean it up (or better yet fine them like you say you are gonna do), but you also have people who work here to clean it up too, but the dumpster doesn’t help when it’s overflowing and all on the ground. Next safety, well my car has been broken into before and I have filed a report on it, y’all didn’t have the cameras working at the time anyways and I’m gonna say it’s because the gates that were “suppose” to be up 6 months ago have only been up for 2!
Neighborhood parking sucks because you constantly have people who don’t live here (we have decals) taking your spot and you have to end up walking a mile to get to your house.
Maintaince, well let’s just say if you have a leak coming from somewhere they will just paint over the leak and tell you it’s nothing. Also I hope you know how to fix a dryer because I had to learn! Staff, yea they won’t help either! You go up and ask for your package because it said it was signed off on your tracking number and they say well did we call you and I say no because you never call and it’s always up at your office! I’m not really gonna complain about the staff, it’s not their fault that they are young and inexperienced in this type of stuff, they obviously need some help up there with someone older than 22. Also I’m gonna pinpoint that I have a dog and I pick up my dogs poop when he does his business...so when I write a check for $300 dollars and put in the memo box PET AMMENDUM...it goes to the pet not my rent....which they put it towards my rent back in November (they have it in the system and I have a receipt) and then they proceeded to ask for another $300! If you want a place where you won’t be lied to and you will actually get some decent respect...do NOT live here! And yes owner I’m sure you’re gonna respond give us a call and we will help, but you will not because I’ve called multiple times and asked for help; I’m simply just allowing people looking for apartments to not look here if they want something better.

resp.text: Hey Madison, we tried giving you a call today but the line was busy. If you would like to give us a callback, we would love to address your concerns and hopefully resolve any issues you are currently having. Thanks and have a wonderful day!

name: Rita Barrentine
text: Love the Cottages. It has a beautiful pool and lake. The houses are beautiful and well maintained. The staff is always friendly and very helpful.

resp.text: Thanks Rita! We are so happy that you are enjoying our amenities. We love having you here with us!

name: Sarah Quick
text: The staff at the retreat has always been very nice, and the maintenance people come usually within the day! One issue has been the change in management recently, as I am not able to get certain paperwork because nobody knows where it is. That is very uncomforting and annoying since I am trying to sign a lease elsewhere (not because of the retreat, I love living there). Other than that, its been a great year!

resp.text: Thank you for your business and your feedback. We love hearing how we are doing. Our team would be happy to speak with you and resolve the concerns you are having. Please contact management at 205-553-6453.

name: Cathryn Hill
text: I absolutely love the retreat! We've had to call maintenance several times, and they always come the same day to fix whatever problem we have. They are really fast and so friendly! I love living here.

name: Sara Patta
text: I love the cottages! Great staff and amenities! Love the lake too!!!

resp.text: Thank you, Sara! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Jonathan Ruiz
text: I was truly impressed by the quick response i received in regards to a billing issue i had at the cottages at lake tamaha. The staff was very nice and helpful when i called, and the accounts manager, Courtney, was quick to call me back and further explain/fix my issue. I am also very happy with all the new upgrades at the cottages. Especially the internet and quartz counter tops!!!

resp.text: Thanks for the 5 stars! We love that you are as excited about the upgrades as we are! Let us know if there is anything else we can do for you, Jonathan!

name: Cassidy Duncan
text: Had multiple friends live here so i decided to move in this year and I love it!!! Such a great atmosphere!!

resp.text: Thank you, Cassidy! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Kawani Grace
text: I love The Retreat , its quiet , nice and worth every penny. I wouldn't move anywhere else! I love having my own house. I can be as loud as I want without feeling like im going to disturb others.

resp.text: Thank you Kawani! We are very glad you have had a great experience at The Retreat.

name: David Scott
text: I have lived at The Retreat for nearly 3 years now and things have gotten better and better and better.  I feel that the management, maintenance and overall look and feel of the apartment community at Lake Tamaha has improved with time and I hope that it will continue to improve. The key to a good apartment complex is getting quality people in terms of management and tenants who are working together to make that community safe, serene, secure and happy. Taking the good with the bad means that there will be bad days but at The Retreat the overall trend has been towards more good days than bad.  That's my perspective and my opinion: That having been said, I am sure that there are others in the community who both agree and disagree with me. I understand that and respect their views since they most assuredly will respect mine.

name: Jr Spencer
text: Great place to live. Very quiet during the week, and laid back. Great atmosphere to be around, the staff is extremely supportive and helpful.

resp.text: Thank you for your business and your feedback, JR. We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Retreat at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Sherri Hendrix
text: Stay clear of this place.  Just had the worst experience with them in a dispute over 4 rubber bands they are charging us a $100 for.  When my daughter tried to return them they wouldn't accept and threatened to send to collections and ding her good credit.  Welcome to a place where it's all about the money :(  And don't bother trying to talk to someone in person or over the phone.  They don't handle disputes that way. My suggestion is to never move in!! I wouldn't even give them a 1 star rating.

resp.text: Thank you Sherri, for leaving us this response. We regret that your daughter had a negative experience with us, but are glad you brought this to our attention. If you'd be willing, our manager would love to talk directly with you and your daughter and rectify these issues and to help turn your experience around. Please call 205.553.6453 at your earliest convenience.

name: Samantha Caspar
text: I have lived here for 3 years and absolutely love it! Our house is spacious and clean, and I have never had any problems with anything. The free printing and amenities are amazing!

name: Cole Cecchini
text: The Retreat is a great place to live. The scenery is beautiful and its awesome to have a gym, tanning beds, pool, lake, and a beautiful clubhouse to come home too! Plus- there is always something fun going on!

name: Chelsea Poirier
text:
When I signed my lease I was promised:
a working vending machine
a pool with surround sound speakers
a working coffee machine
a printer that would be available 24/7
Kind, knowledgeable staff
clean house and amenities
quick response to all work orders.

Since living here for 2.5 years, the printer has worked for a total of 6 months
the pool has been closed for months at a time more than once
The vending machine hasn’t worked since 2016
The staff has been rude, doesn’t know anything, and always give residence conflicting answers
My house has been trashed on the outside by neighbors and nothing is ever cleaned up
We have had scorpions, lizards, fleas, and other infestations which are met with multiple day wait times to get an exterminator out.
worst of all, I have lived here 2.5 years and have yet to be acknowledged by management EXCEPT with a payment issue.
Management has been flakey, lied, and have blatantly ignored customer complaints.

resp.text: Thanks Chelsea, for leaving us this response. Chelsea, we regret that you had a negative experience with us, but are glad you brought this to our attention. We would love to talk directly to you and rectify these issues. Please call (205) 553-6453 at your earliest convenience and let us know when you are available.

name: Anna Terry
text: Best living everrrrr!! :)

resp.text: Anna, thank you for your kind review! We love Camp Tamaha, too!

name: Everett Solares
text: Always a neat place, the management is great!!

resp.text: Everett, thank you for your feedback! We think our team is great, too.

name: TEXAN543
text: I'm in the process of moving out of here and find 2 cockroaches bigger than my thumb within a time span of two days. One crawling on my bed and one in my nightstand. I called the office to complain and see if they couldn't have someone come out to spray but they said that "pest control has already been out today and has left the property and won't be able to come back for a week". I'll be moved out in 4 days! I don't want to take these things with me to my new apartment. The management is sub par and just overall not very impressed with this apartment complex and the way they handle things. I would look elsewhere if you're looking for an apartment.

resp.text: Thank you for your honest feedback. We strive for the best customer service and apologize we did not meet the expectation. We’d love to make this up to you and discuss your concerns in person to assure they are taken care of correctly. Please contact us at 205-553-6453 or stop by the leasing office and ask to speak with Taylor Wilson.

name: Richard Knott
text: The Cottages at Lake Tamaha only respond to reviews so people will think the issue was resolved. When I called the number given to talk this matter over with management, I was told to send an email. The management staff is unprofessional and unreasonable!

resp.text: Hi Richard, we are upset to hear that you had this experience with us, however, as discussed over the phone we are not starting the dispute process for any FMO charges at this time. You will receive your final move-out statement in the next week or so in the mail. If you would like to discuss this further or have any questions as to why all disputes have to be in writing please call us at 205.409.2052

name: zack dorobiala
text: Great houses! Great environment!

resp.text: Thank you, Zack! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: McKenzie Lee
text: The houses themselves are fine and the amenities are nice. But the management staff really is terrible. The college students working do the best they can, but they can only do so much with such bad management. I have a roommate who I have put multiple complaints in about, and the Retreat has done nothing about it. I have heard several other roommate horror stories and unless money is involved, management simply does not care.

resp.text: Thanks McKenzie, for leaving us this response. McKenzie, we regret that you had a negative experience with us, but are glad you brought this to our attention. If you'd be willing, we would love to talk directly with you and rectify these issues. Our manager would really like to help turn your experience around. Please call 205-553-6453 at your earliest convenience.

name: A KiD Named Sig
text: Great place to live and they are always having events around town for free stuff!

resp.text: Thank you! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Ig Growth
text:
Megan was such a sweetheart the place was beautiful and she did a great job on our tour..

Thanks Again Megan

resp.text: Thanks for the review! We will be sure to let Megan know she did an awesome job! We can't wait to have you here with us at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!

name: Ben Fowler
text: Great place, but they need to figure out the trash problem. And there is always broken glass everywhere, watch out with doggos

resp.text: Benjamin, thank you for bringing your concerns to our attention. We appreciate all feedback and want our residents to love the place they call home. We are aware of this issue and it has been addressed. If you have any further concerns please contact Taylor at (205) 553-6453. We look forward to speaking with you.

name: Trevor Agee
text: Very nice living space, plenty of amenities to take advantage of, great events, awesome atmosphere, and nice people. Very good housing choice.

resp.text: Thank you for your business and your feedback, Trevor. We love hearing that you enjoy our amenities and events here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Jasmine Partridge
text: WORST PLACE IN TUSCALOOSA TO LIVE. They will literally lose all of your paper work, make you pay extra fines because of their mistakes. They have Horrible management, responds late to work orders besides that its beautiful.

resp.text: Thank you for your honest feedback. We strive for the best customer service and apologize we did not meet the expectation. We’d love to make this up to you and discuss your concerns in person to assure they are taken care of correctly. Please contact us at 205-409-2052 or stop by the leasing office and ask to speak with Taylor.

name: Robert Richards
text: After taking a tour by your leasing manager (forgot her name), I was convinced this is where my daughter will stay during her time at the Univ of Alabama. She's a mid-year transfer from the Univ of Texas and really excited about attending Bama. Many of her friends currently attend Bama and leaned very hard on her to transfer. Although I am a Texas Alum, I had to give into pressure and go along with the plan. So glad my daughter will have a nice place to live.

resp.text: Thank you, Robert! We love hearing that your daughter is excited to live The Cottages lifestyle. We hope her transfer to Alabama and her time at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha are wonderful!

name: Justin Stone
text: Couldn't think of a better place to live. Any problem I've ever had is quickly resolved by the office or maintenance staff. Definitely recommend living here

resp.text: Thank you, Justin. Your kind words have made our day brighter. We love hearing your feedback and having you here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!

name: Connor McClain
text: Great place to live and they actually invest in their residence with cool events!

resp.text: Thank you, Connor! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Tiffany Campbell
text:
The Retreat was an absolute pleasure to live in for 3 years. The staff is AMAZING(especially Dana and Joe.Oh and Marky).
The retreat has a great pool, lake, and fun activities for the residents. Oh yeah and the tanning beds are also a plus- I go EVERY SINGLE DAY.

name: Rachel Stacey
text: I'm not going to harp on individual things. Every one star review covered all my issues. Im moving out this year and I'm honestly terrified because I know they are going to find ways to charge insane amounts of money for non existent and unrealistic issues. So when I move out I'm going to have a staff member come look at everything and tell me if I will have a bill shipped to my house or not. I plan on videoing the staff member who says I'm 'good to go'. Game on

resp.text:
Hi Rachel,

Thanks for your review. We understand your concern about move out charges, but we assure you that we do not charge for unnecessary or nonexistent items or damages. We thoroughly walk each unit after move out and take pictures of all damages. You are more than welcome to schedule a move out inspection with a staff member. You can expect an email with directions on how to schedule an inspection closer to the move out date. Once you move out, you will receive a final account statement that lists any charges to your account. You can dispute any charges that you disagree with at that time. If you have any other questions or concerns, please feel free to give us a call at 205.553.6453.

name: Zac Stratton
text: Some great amenities and there are some little problems that do happen, but work orders are usually responded to fairly quickly.

resp.text: Thank you, Zac! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Taylor Danner
text: worst place i have ever lived at. As soon as I moved out, they charged me for ridiculous things. I had a random roommate when I first moved there and I did not this at the time, but her boyfriend was living with us and he actually had a restraining order from the Retreat which i did not find out until he overdosed on my front porch and I had to call 911 and then after complaining to the retreat they informed me he should not have even been on the property. Do not live there if you can avoid it. Now they are charging me ridiculous amounts for silly things. When I call to discuss they will not talk about it over the phone. I would never recommend living here to anyone. For the price you pay at the retreat, you can live much closer to campus and deal with better management and nicer accommodations.

resp.text: Thank you for your business and your feedback, Taylor. We strive to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory. Our team would be happy to speak with you and resolve the issues you are having. Please contact us at 205-553-6453 at your earliest convenience.

name: Brandon Mason
text: The most beautiful residential houses by far in Tuscaloosa. Considerably cheap for all that is included!

resp.text: Thank you, Brandon! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Dee Richey
text: Met Megan the housing fair and she gave me a lot of information and cool swag. I will be taking a tour soon.

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Dee! We will be sure to let Megan know how great of a job she did! Come see us and let us show you how life is better in a cottage!

name: Katie Mcgaughey
text: Cottages are so nice! Great pool and amenities def would recommend!!

resp.text: Thank you, Katie! We love hearing about your experience with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Mike Abrams
text:
My experience with the Cottages at Lake Tamaha in Tuscaloosa, AL has far exceeded expectations, and my son has not even started living there for the UA Fall/Spring 2018 term. I can only imagine that ANY item that may arise during my son's time at the Cottages will be handled with the class and professionalism that was shown to me by Leasing Manager Carol Cagle. That is peace of mind that cannot be bought for a parent who's child is living a few states away.

Bottom Line: I had a question about the accommodations that were provided and the terms of the contract that my son and two of his friends had signed. I explained my concerns and resolution options were discussed. Carol took it upon herself to discuss the matter with her corporate team minutes following my conversation with her, and I received a call from Carol within the hour letting me know that the matter had been resolved to my satisfaction.

YOU ROCK Carol Cagle and the Cottages. I can sleep well knowing that my child will be well cared for at the Cottages.

resp.text: Mike, thank you for leaving this detailed feedback about your experience with The Cottages at Lake Tamaha. We love hearing that our employees are providing great customer service! Thank you very much for sharing these comments.

name: Nick Paparelli
text: To say they care about there residents is a lie. They just care about money. They will not have any sympathy or any logical thoughts to help your experience. They freak out if your rent is a day late, but if the AC is broken they will not fix it, or when the dryer is broken for 6 months. This is the worst place to live in Tuscaloosa, the manager is empathetic and does not realize he is here to help the residents rather then himself. The secret to costumer service is be reliability, helpfulness, and caring towards your customers, they do not come close to accomplishing any of these.  do not recommend anyone staying here.

name: Hunter Wallace
text: The Retreat is the ultimate housing community for UA students. I love having my own cottage on the lake.  It's like having your own place without all of the responsibilities like lawn care and maintenance.

name: Amanda Goldberg
text: It has been great living at the Retreat and I have renewed my lease for next year. The amenities are very nice and it is easy to meet new people living here. I plan on living here the whole time I am attending school in Tuscaloosa!

name: Nino Galante
text: The cottages have great living space with a very fun environment!

resp.text: Thank you, Nino! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Meredith Parks
text: Nice retreat from campus.

resp.text: Thank you, Meredith! We agree that our property does have a "getaway" feel to it.

name: Brooks Bell
text: Not great location stinks, payments for rent each month are more than what they tell you when you sign your lease, houses are ok(water pressure is horrible) A TON of GIANT spiders(mostly brown recluse) and other bugs in and around my house. Views are great my dog loves it here, spacious area around lake. The gate they "fixed" Is really inconvenient because it opens and closes very slowly (it was better when they just left it open all the time). Also very loud, hard to get good sleep.

resp.text: Hello, Brooks. Thank you for the detailed feedback regarding The Cottages. We pride ourselves on ultimate cleanliness and apologize we have not lived up to these standards. We have taken note of your concern about the gates and put in a maintenance request to address this issue. If you have any further comments/concerns we’d love to hear them. Please stop by the leasing office or give us a call at (205) 553-6453.

name: Paws of UA
text: I love living at the cottages!!

resp.text: Thank you! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Chris Caruso
text: Awesome place to live! Won't be disappointed! Staff is great too. I lived here all three years off campus!

name: Tyler Blair
text: Super nice place. Well staffed and great atmosphere. Shout out to Anna!!

resp.text: Thanks for your review, Tyler! So happy you love our community as much as we do! Don't miss out on Campfire Cosmic Night tonight from 5-8 and experience Camp Tamaha  first hand!

name: Alex H
text: Don't live at these extremely overpriced, low quality apartments that are much further from campus than you would expect for the price. They have a pretty facade but are trash underneath. I moved in a year ago and my bedroom was in terrible shape. The bathroom was covered in hair, moldy, and just overall disgusting. After moving out they proceeded to attempt to charge me for repainting and re-carpeting even though the previous tenant was the one who left the room like that and management never fixed the room before I moved in. They will do whatever they can to scam you out of money. The managers won't even speak to you face to face when an issue arises and insist you email them no matter how serious the issue.

resp.text: Thank you Alex for your honest feedback. We strive for the best customer service and apologize we did not meet the expectation. We’d love to make this up to you and discuss your concerns in person to assure they are taken care of correctly. Please contact us at 205-553-6453 or stop by the leasing office and ask to speak with Taylor.

name: Jackie Stewart
text: I love the Cottages! The amenities are awesome! Ask for Jackie, she’s the best!

resp.text: Thank you, Jackie! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: tmart325
text: The workers are really friendly and accommodating, I recommend this place to all my friends   .

resp.text: Hello, Thank you for your 5 star review. We really appreciate your feedback!

name: Jordan Cantrell
text: The cottages is a beautiful apartment complex with amazing amenities, a really cool pool and the staff are super and helpful

resp.text: Thank you, Jordan! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Murphy Anne
text: I moved here in 2014 and I am really sad that I will have to leave this place in December. I've had the best experience throughout college living at The Retreat/The Cottages! Ever since Cardinal took over the Retreat and changed it to The Cottages, the roads have been repaved, the houses have been repainted, they've updated the decks, they've add pavilion parking, they've upgraded the amenities and updated some of the cottages to have brand new appliances and new counter tops. Luckily, my cottage was one of the cottages that got selected for the upgrades and it makes my cottage feel brand new. The Retreat/Cottages is less than 5-10 minutes away from campus based on the route you take and what area of UA you are going to, but I travel to the west side of campus everyday and my commute is 10 minutes max. Getting to target, midtown and downtown takes around 8-10 minutes as well, but I love the fact that I am "tucked away" from all the noise and busyness of traffic and nightlife when I want to be. I have gotten to know the office staff over the multiple years of living here and they are always so willing to help me and other residents. Although I am so happy to graduate from Alabama, I am sad to leave my little abode and not be able to lay out at the awesome pool anytime I please. If you are looking for housing near UA, live here!

resp.text: Murphy, thank you for leaving this detailed feedback about your experience with The Cottages at Lake Tamaha. Thank you very much for sharing these comments.

name: Kionna Dortch
text: Do NOT live here. You will be charged for things you didn't even think you would be charged for. Management is extremely hard to get in touch with, even when it something serious. The students that basically run the office are rude. They'll say you didn't pay rent even when you did. And upon move out, trust and believe you'll have a $200+ bill for something. And don't tell me to call and discuss the issue because everytime I've called, I've been told "we don't discuss issues over the phone, you can email the dispute email". They will neverrrrr get back in contact with you. They will try to milk you dry when it comes to money.

resp.text: Thank you for your business and your feedback. Our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory. Our team would be happy to speak with you and resolve the issues you are having. Please contact us at (205) 553-6453 at your earliest convenience.

name: Melissa Westbrook
text: This is honestly the worst place I have ever lived at. I needed to sublease from someone last minute and this was the only apartment complex available. My room was extremely filthy when I moved in. There was a large black stain at the doorway from the girl before me but when I attempted to alert them about this, they seemed to not care in the slightest. Turns out when I moved out they charged me $300 even after I tried telling them. On top of that, my roommate and I have had packages go missing after they were delivered and the internet was very spotty. I would never recommend this joke of a place to anyone. If you want to get a better place, I would recommend renting a house through a realtor over renting from any of Tuscaloosa's apartment complexes. If I could give you less than one star on here, I would in a heartbeat.

resp.text: Thank you for your business and your feedback, Melissa. Our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory. The only reason your bedroom wouldn't have been cleaned prior to your move in would be if you took the unit "as-is" assuming the current condition of the unit. Also, we always suggest that residents have a "signature required" on their packages so we know that the office accepted it. "Delivered" could mean to your door or mailbox. Please keep in mind we return packages to the original sender if it is not picked up within 14 days. If there is anything else you would like to speak with us, we would love to help. Please call us at 205-553-6453. Have a great day, Melissa.

name: Elena (Lena) Nastevska
text: I love it !! Great staff

resp.text: Elena, thank you for your review! We love our hardworking team, too!

name: Christine Rowe
text: The Retreat is a joke. The day I moved in was absolutely terrible. My room had not been cleaned from the person who previously lived in my room. The Retreat never did clean up the room for me. Almost everything in my house was broken. Nothing worked like it was supposed to. One of my roommates turned out to be psycho and The Retreat has evicted her multiple times. Wouldn't it be smart to turn the girl's key off? Yeah, they still haven't done that. So when my stuff gets messed with I'm going to be pressing charges. Their staff doesn't knock when they come to the house. And when a service person comes to fix things they don't clean up after themselves. My yard always looks like crap because of the parties they allow to happen. I'm fine with partying until people start making my whole area look like crap. Parking is an issue. I can never find a parking spot on a Friday or Saturday night. And I PAY to live here. Half of the cars here don't belong to residents. And pets are an issue. People don't clean up after their animals and The Retreat doesn't enforce any rules. They only care about getting money and not about their residents. And I know for a fact other people are having the same issues. Basically this place is a waste of money. I will not be resigning and I will not recommend this place to anyone.

name: Haley Boerema
text: This is the best place to live in tuscaloosa!

resp.text: We couldn't agree more! Thank you, Haley!

name: Triple AAA Alabama Alcoholic Adventures
text: The pool parties are fun and cool aspect of a house, and not an apartment.

resp.text: Thank you! We love hearing this feedback!

name: Nicoli Smith-Cavaiani
text: The Retreat is a great place to live when moving off campus, it's a very comfortable living and in it's own area. Pool is the best in town hands down

resp.text: Thank you, Nicoli. Your kind words have made our day. We love having you here at The Retreat at Lake Tamaha!

name: Richard G.
text: Awesome place to live. The atmosphere is great, the staff is very helpful, and the houses are great places to call home. I resigned my lease for next year and plan to stay at the Retreat until I graduate.

name: Allyson Greco
text: The houses are very nice, and so is the area around the houses and the property.  I do not have a car on campus and although the shuttle is very helpful, on weekends it is hard for me to get around since it is so far from campus.  It is also difficult to stay on campus at night since I do not need a car and constantly need to find a ride.  I would highly recommend living here if you will be bringing a car.  Also, we had a roach problem but they came and took care of it right away.  Staff is okay

resp.text:
Hi Allyson,

Thank you so much for the review. We are happy to hear you are enjoying it here. Please let us know if there's anything we can do for you.

name: Mellissa Cunningham
text: Been swimming here for ever. Good times here. Jackie was awesome

resp.text: Thank you, Mellissa! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Hannah V
text: Honestly this is one of the greatest places Ever! You should def contact the office for info because this place gets FULL!

resp.text: Thank you, Hannah! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Terence Hardy
text: I love my unit. It's spacious, comfortable, and convenient. There's no elevators going to the 3rd floor or anything like that. The retreat is the place to be!

resp.text: Thanks Terence! Roll Tide!

name: Caleb Underbakke
text: This horrible mismanaged disaster is the single worst decision I have made this year. The property is given to you in horrific condition and unclean, (my sink was broken for a week when i moved in) and the management is entirely inept. They will up charge you, add in fees that were never in the lease and then talk in circles until i had to bring in my entire house to the club house. They prey on ignorant students with shallow promises and dirty business practices. Plus the location sucks.  live somewhere else.

resp.text: Thank you for your business and your feedback, Caleb. Our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience has been anything less than satisfactory.  Our team would be happy to speak with you and resolve the issues you are having. Please contact our office at (205) 553-6453 at your earliest convenience.

name: Chris Corne
text: All phone calls and problems have been handled spectacularly!  No complaints! We were in an incompatible roommate situation, and were able to switch houses with relative ease.  Thank you!

resp.text: Thank you for the review Chris! We are glad you are happy with your new house and have had a great experience at The Retreat

name: Steven Novak
text: Would be a great place if they didn't screw you when your lease was o ver

resp.text: Steven, we thank you for leaving this review about move out charge concerns. Once you are getting ready to move out, please follow the move out packet that we provide for all residents moving out to help avoid move out charges. We understand that move out charges can be frustrating, but we want to assure you that the fees are due to policy. If there is anything we can help you with, please contact our office at 205.553.6453.

name: Kristine Mccoy
text: The Retreat at Lake Tamaha is a fun place to live. The amenities are great (when they are in service, which is not always), the location is perfect for me, it takes me 8 minutes to get parked on campus from my house if I take Jack Warner but is far enough away from campus when I want to be. It is reasonably quiet. The rent is high and there $50 utilities cap is never enough. I use minimum water and electricity and always seem to go over which is upsetting. My house was empty with only the refrigerator and ac running on 78 yet I still had over $50 in overages to pay. When I called to asked about this issue the staff told me that its better to go through conservice on my own but that would cause me and my roommate to lose our utilities cap that would be included in our rent anyway. Overall, its a nice place to live if you have the luxury of living here, but expect a lot of extra fees on top of your already high monthly rent.

name: Richard Lee
text: This place is awesome. 10/10 recommend

resp.text: Thank you, Richard! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Angela
text:
I honestly hate living here and I cannot wait to move out.
The rent is entirely overpriced for what you receive in turn and management is much more interested in trying to get as much money as they can from their residents. Furthermore, the leases they make you sign are virtually unbreakable.
They consistently make mistakes on their billing and overcharge residents for the most minor details. My unit has been infested with stink bugs for over a year with no change in the condition nor has a statement or strategy been released from management, since this issue amongst others such as, scorpion infestations, impacts many other units. My unit also had a wasp infection which took several weeks to resolve, since the staff was much more interested in protecting the reputation of the apartments rather than solving the issue at hand.
They attempt to build a “community” by having plenty of sponsored events, but in my opinion it’s just a marketing scheme to trap new residents and deflect current issues that impact residents.
I would recommend saving your money by not moving in despite all of the glitz and glamour that they advertise.

resp.text: Thank you Angela for your honest feedback. We strive for the best customer service and apologize we did not meet the expectation. We’d love to make this up to you and discuss your concerns in person to assure they are taken care of correctly. Please contact us at 205-553-6453 or stop by the leasing office and ask to speak with Taylor.

name: alex thomas
text: At first I was skeptical to live here because of the reviews, but after I moved in last year I am so glad I did and even renewed my lease for this year. I recommend the Retreat for any college students.  My friend and I were roommate matched with 2 other girls. I was kind of worried about it at first but I’m glad I did and we are living together next year. We do go over a little on utilities, but we did the same thing at my last apartment. Living with a house full of girls I guess it’s going to happen. I love being 5 mins away from everything, without getting stuck in the traffic. I would recommend anyone who didn’t want to live in the chaos and traffic but wanted to live close enough to they could still wake up late for class, to choose the Retreat. I love it here and even gained 2 new best friends!

name: Dalton Hare
text:
Living here was worse than living in the dorms. And costed more too. They advertise rent starting just under $600 but with monthly "fees" that no one could explain without wanting to bring in a lawyer my rent was always above $775. It even rose above $800 during January due to electric costs. These houses are not built to be energy savings in any way. Our average electric bill, for a house of 4 people, was over $320 every month with AC running about half the time. All the toilets and the dishwasher ran when I first moved in and it took 3 weeks and a call to a building inspector to get it fixed yet no comp was added to our $150 water bill. The local desk is run by kids, that I cant get upset with because they are just working for minimum, but they know nothing. They could not even tell me the name of the cable provider so I could request a repair service. Oh also cable, internet and phone are included in the rent and cannot be separated but youll be lucky to find a house that has all three working, or even finding two that work. My cable has never worked since move in but I gave up trying to get anything done about it. The local manager is a dolt. She gets paid in rent so she is expected to love the community but has no clue about anything. I got double charged twice for rent within the same month and she could not even tell me the name of the accountant who handled the rent. Getting a contact at the corporate office is a game in itself. The property has been bought and sold twice as long as I have lived here and that is only one year. The house itself is classic college living that I overpaid drastically for. I have 2 exposed, non working sockets in the living room since move in. I requested a repair and they just pulled the fuse saying they would get back to it. 10 months later I am still waiting. I have a broken kitchen light that has also not gotten repaired along with a leaking water heater, destroyed flooring and a kitchen cabinet. The upstairs porch railing even fell off during a storm and hit my girlfriend. Their version of repairs was to lock the door on us because it was unsafe to on it anymore. That porch was the reason I signed for the house initially. They also dont guarantee the random roommate process or have any safety protections. I had an ex random roommate move out over winter break because he had graduated. After clearing out, he broke back in and trashed the place as well as stealing everything that was not locked away. Even though he relinquished his keys, the property still had him listed as a tenant so us remaining roommates could not press charges. They even tried to bill us for the damaged door, although this was the one time I was able to get a charge removed with ease signifying that the local manager knows and has the power to do so. Upon refusal to resign our lease, the management team expedited the repair process and has already begun tearing out my kitchen and will be replacing it over the next two months. I have no kitchen for two months. The flashy gimmicks that initially drew me in, and I am sure  you, such as the clubhouse, lake and pool are just surface. The clubhouse has been "under construction" since august and is there but not private or usable space. The pool has been closed for a month now due to sewage leak and is not expected to open any time soon and the lake is disgusting, stagnant water. It is stocked but not well so fishing is difficult. Also there is a public access road cutting through the property to the lake so it isnt a private lake. Many public individuals walk by my house daily to get to the lake and left in unlocked houses and cars is common.

All in all I do not believe this place is worth looking. The price is comparable to higher end apartments, closer to campus and near the strip. You also dont incur the transportation costs such as a car, uber and a parking spot on campus. The expensive cost and poor management staff bring a three star review down to a one.

resp.text: Dalton, thank you for your feedback. It is our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory. I will be more than happy to put work orders in for your cottage. We are renovating cottages to boost your cottage experience. Please call our office so we may provide you with a time frame of when vendors will be in your cottage to upgrade your unit. We also have a Crimson Ride shuttle that runs to campus in 30 minute intervals for your convenience. Our clubhouse was under construction until the month of September to upgrade our amenities for our residents. Our pool is closed due to chlorine levels being very high and the pool needing a part that only one manufacturer makes. We are currently awaiting for that part to come in so we can get the pool open again for our residents and their guests. Lake Tamaha is a private lake and we have security to ensure only residents are using Lake Tamaha. Our team would be happy to speak with you and resolve the issues you are having. Please contact Taylor at 205-553-6453 at your earliest convenience.

name: Michaela Herring
text: Horrible horrible horrible do not do it as enticing as it may look, looks are definitely deceiving. Do not waste your money here. Immature staff, dirty units, and if you think about they are extracting 3500 on their houses when you can rent a house outside of the "student housing" for way less. They scream about the amenities which are only available in the summer and the "security" yea right. If you oppose any overage fees they give you they get upset like children and disrespects you. Yea def not worth it. If you are gonna live here, sublease ! That way you won't get sucked into a year here! If you don't believe me look at how many people are trying to sublease and get out of here!!

name: Dylan Pladers
text:
Great amenities. Horrible Staff. Get ready to play games.

Stay away from the Brookshires. Despite the huge closets upstairs, the house is only fitted with one AC unit, despite every other floor plan having two. The Retreat acknowledged last year that my AC wasn't strong enough to keep the upstairs sufficiently cooled in the summer, so nicely, they brought me a window unit to make it livable. This year however, I was told despite the precedent they set before, that they wouldn't be able to give me one again. The upstairs is a noticeable 7-8 degrees hotter now (April), and in the summer it can be as much as 10-15 degrees. Very dissapointed that the Retreat expects me to pay ~$400 for an AC to fix their houses poor design (I was given permission to purchase one, which I found laughable, considering I just want basic AC).

After going to the leasing office ~10 times this year, I've had maybe one employee actually try to help me. Good luck talking to a manager and not a college student, the managers are miraculously always busy, no matter the time of day. The college students will look you straight in the face and tell you they'll have manager call you back, and it NEVER HAPPENS. I'm not sure if the students in front office don't care enough to actually reach out, or if management believes if they ignore you long enough you'll go away since you're "just" a college student. I've requested a statement from one of the managers in writing ~5 times. Every time I'm insured an email is forthcoming, and then, nothing.

Also, if you sign your lease a second time, it is hit or miss if they actually come by and fix anything. I called at least 7 times over the summer, asking them to come fix what was broken or messed up in the house, as they had done for all of our neighbors who resigned their leases, and yet again I was reassured over and over that they were on it, only to never come and leave us high and dry.

I truly will never sign a lease again with the direction management has taken the Retreat this year. I only began having these problems this last year, my first year at the Retreat was great.

Edited:Removing personal info, updating situations.

Update: After finally working my way to management, they heard me out, while some concerns were taken care of, I'm still left with a bitter taste in my mouth after paying the high rent at the Retreat and being shafted as far as mid-summer clean-up goes. Maybe, maybe, stay at the Retreat for a year.

resp.text:
Thank you for your review, Dylan! It was a pleasure speaking with you in the office about some of the issues you are having. I'm glad we were able to find the email that our Operation's Manager sent you on January 6, 2016 regarding your carpet replacement. Regarding the parties on property, our lease states that you are not allowed to have more than 15 people at your house at one time. This is to help keep the noise level to a minimum. With your issues with our security staff, the offer still stands if you would like to meet with our head of security. We have spoken to the head of security regarding your allegations. We are taking your concerns seriously, and are looking into the matter. If you do not turn your wristbands at the end of your lease, we do charge $25.00 per wristband. After reviewing your account, I do not see where you were charged for any move out fees or wristbands. I understand that you have maintenance issues in your house and I am looking forward to receiving your email and working on getting those issues resolved for you. I personally read all Google reviews and found only one employee review, which was given before she started working here. If you have any other questions or concerns, please contact the office at 205-553-6453.

Thank you

Please contact us at 205.553.6453 or stop by the leasing office and ask to speak with Montana.

name: Brianna Velez
text: I love living at the cottages! Just renewed for the 2nd time!

resp.text: Thanks for the 5 stars, Brianna! We are so happy that you have decided to continue your adventure with us!

name: Alicia Hebron
text: Great if you want a clean gym, huge pool, nice house with space for everything, and a great staff!

name: Mimi Brown
text: Ive never had a more frustrating experience. This place is great for undergrads, but if you were a grad student, this is not the place to be at. The staff is great and all, but i really wish i spent all the time i had here somewhere else. This apartment complex is just overrated imo!! They had people move out 10 days before the end of the month, so i had to spend over $500 on accommodation for those days even though i paid the full rent for the entire month. I tried to explain that i didnt have anywhere else, they basically said they didnt care, and i had to move out. I dont even know what i was thinking when i signed the lease. Most apartments here have move-in days about 5-8 days into the month. Again this is a great place for undergrads, but if you are a grad student, find somewhere closer to campus, and where you dont have to pay ridiculous prices for an apartment that isnt worth that much. It was just one inconvenience after another.

resp.text: Thank you for your business and your feedback, Mimi. Our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory. We feel as if we are a great complex for all ages, not just undergraduates. Unfortunately, we do have to abide by the lease dates that are stated on the lease which is normally around the 22nd or 23rd of July, to be able to get the cottage ready for incoming tenants. If you have anything that you would like to discuss with us further, we would love to speak to you. Please call us at 205-553-6453. Have a great day, Mimi!

name: Hannah Honeycutt
text: The Retreat is a great place to live with a beautiful view of the lake as well as a clubhouse filled with activities. You will not find an apartment complex with more friendly residents and workers.

name: Archie Kern
text: The amenities are great, but the staff is horrible, and management is horrible. THe day we moved in our house was a mess. The wall were chipped, there were marks all over the wall, the carpet was stained, and our back door was molded at the bottom. On top of that they would not fix any of it. DO NOT MOVE THERE

name: Stuart Jackson
text: This place is awesome. I am definitely renewing

name: Alex Hamilton
text:
First off, I’d like to preface this review by informing everyone that the reason you are reading so many positive reviews of the retreat is because they offer to send students a free pizza in exchange for a Google review. Much like all the other tempting amenities offered by the retreat its nothing more than a front.
Let me not leave you with a review, but with a story.
Your first day at the retreat. You wake up at 7:01 exactly. The peaceful sounds of 40,000 birds aggressively chirping outside your window mix perfectly with the sound of landscapers yelling as they mow your grass. You walk downstairs and prepare breakfast. As you’re cleaning up after your meal you rejoice as you realize there is no garbage disposal. You load your dishes into the Ancient dishwasher and begin your five mile trek to the nearest garbage bin so that you can dispose of your trash. Now it’s time for class. As you stop by the clubhouse to print off important documents for class you’re informed for the 20th time that the printer isn’t working. This works out perfectly because in order to get to campus from the distant retreat you must leave no later than 48 hours before the start of class. This leaves you plenty of time to find another printer. You return from class eager to finish your favorite show on Netflix. Luckily for you the last time the retreat updated their Wi-Fi was when my grandfather was shot in WWII. I cannot stress this enough. THE WIFI IS TERRIBLE. Instead you turn on TV and flip through the retreat tv package which has a total of 4 channels.  Fear not, the clubhouse had so many exciting activities when you signed the lease, right? Wrong. The golf simulator hasn’t worked since the resurrection of Jesus and the gym smells like a dead cat. At least the pool is amazing right? It’s great until they shut it down to “drain” for two months in the summer. I am not kidding. They do it every. Single. Summer. A smart company would drain the pool in the fall and winter months  when no one would be there. Luckily for you, retreat management is no ordinary company. Now it’s nightfall and you feel like going out to the bars or going to get drinks and dinner. Perfect, just snag an uber and avoid having to drive altogether. Ubering to the retreat from the strip is NO LESS THAN $15 dollars. EVER.
Please, please, please god don’t live here. Management is terrible, they lie to you on your tours, and will fine the living daylights out of you on every monthly bill they can. Please, please, please live anywhere else.

EDIT: you'll notice how management responded to my review without addressing the issue and again lying to residents. 1) I have pictures documenting landscaping crews beginning as early as 6:50 which actually violates noise ordinances. When I tried bringing this up with management I was ignored until I threatened to call the city and have you reported  2) You don't assist anyone with printing needs. I have had to bring my own paper on numerous occasions and the staff was not "more than happy to assist" 3) Your shuttle service is terrible and you pointing out its hours of operation don't make it anymore convenient. Thank you though! 4) I shouldn't have to pay a premium charge to upgrade my wifi. You should provide wifi that allows me to load youtube videos in less than 4 hours. 5) Your office staff makes it absolutely impossible to get in touch with anyone who can control fines and overages. Over winter break when NONE of my roommates were living in the house for 2.5 weeks we were billed $30 each. It took five days to contact management and the overages were quickly dropped.
If you spent more time helping residents and less time sarcastically responding to honest reviews people wouldn't have issues living there.

Sincerely,
Resident of 1.5 years

resp.text: Thanks Alex, for leaving us this response. We regret that you had a negative experience with us, but are glad you brought this to our attention. In May, we did offer pizza to all residents that left a google review, either positive or negative, to get more feedback from our current residents. Our landscaping crew begins work no earlier than 8 AM once a week on Mondays. We are very proud of the fact that all of our cottages come equipped with helpful appliances such as washers, dryers, and dishwashers for no additional charge. We are sorry that you found our centrally-located trash compactor to be inconvenient, but it is located near our gates, making it easy to drop off your trash on your way out of the property. On your way to class, you may stop by our clubhouse to use our computer lab that offers free printing! Occasionally, we do run out of ink for the printer, but we are more than happy to assist your printing needs at the office front desk. Additionally, our community is located less than 2 miles from The University of Alabama, just a short drive away from the East Commuter Lot! We also offer a Crimson Ride shuttle for our residents that runs every 30 minutes Monday-Friday from 7 A.M. to 9 P.M and can be tracked on Transloc. Our wi-fi and cable package that we offer our residents, free of charge, are through AT&T U-Verse. I do apologize that you found your wi-fi to be unsatisfactory, however our cable package offers over 550 channels. AT&T would be happy to upgrade your channels if you would like to pay a premium charge. Alex, we are also very excited to announce all of the great clubhouse updates that are currently under renovation. Our pool will be closed for around 4 weeks, depending on weather, and we will hopefully have it back open by the 4th of July. We will have a renovated free weight room, cardio room, study room, and yoga room! We also offer a late-night shuttle that drops off on The Strip by Little Italy Thursday night from 10 P.M. to 2 A.M., Friday night from 10 P.M. to 3 A.M., and Saturday night from 10 P.M. to 2 A.M. If you are ever unhappy with your overages, you may contact Conservice to receive the exact bill from Tuscaloosa Water and Alabama Power. If you have problems with any fines you may receive or any any other concerns at all, please feel free to come to our office, open 7 days a week, to discuss this further. Thanks again for your review!

name: adam kinsella
text: Management is terrible they overcharge for reaonsons unexplained and have no answers to any questions, WiFi won’t even load on your iPhone, 5 light bulbs went out in our house within the first 3 months, no HD channels, claim they will add new cool things for residents but it never happens actually, vending machine hasn’t worked in a year, if you can get a house somewhere else do not stay at the cottages hands down worst place to rent in Tuscaloosa

resp.text: Thanks for your review, Adam! If there are any fluorescent light bulbs that are still currently ou in your cottage, please let us know so we can put in a work order for you. You are also able to put in work orders online through your resident portal. Our new wifi and cable provider services will be turned on March 1st. We sincerely apologize for all issues that have taken place thus far but we are actively trying to remedy the situation starting with using a different provider. For the meantime, if you have any trouble with your current internet we ask for you to directly call AT&T so they can troubleshoot your issues. Please let us know if there is anything else we can help you with. Thank You!

name: Jade
text: I lived at this residency for a year and had a terrible experience. Had several issues regarding the house we stayed in.  First off The lady bug infestation was inside our  home for well over 2 months .  Requested several work orders and nothing was ever done until about the 8th work order. Anytime I would call to the office I would be told the manager is out, which I later was informed that the manager at the time, Kelly, would tell them "she's out" when in reality she didn't want to deal with situations. This is absolutely unprofessional management. Second off our house became infested with centipedes for 2 months.(dealt with same issues of having to request work orders). Last I was without cable for several months and payed for it and never received any money back and when the issue would be brought nothing would be done about it by the the retreat management. I was also charged a ridiculous amount when I moved out for BS "fixes" such as lightbulbs, even though when I moved in the house was nasty not cleaned and I had broken glass all over the bathroom.

name: Emily Aaron
text:
Every one star review on here is 100% true. Then when you want to review about the TRUTH that the retreat does to you they send a smart reply back. The only reason I stay here is because I like the fact that I have a house. But before you think it is ok. Let's back up. First of all, the office staff is about the biggest group of unfriendly, rude, and just incompetent people I've ever seen. The managers are always "busy". And when you make a roommate complaint, the woman will email you like it is all your fault! (I had this happen twice, it was more accusing the first time) Also on these reviews I have seen personal replys to these people and it is not ok. Landmark needs to come in and fix these staff problems.
Also. Did you think I was done? Nope. The houses upon move in is DISGUSTING. When I transferred to my new house my grandmother had to clean the disgusting house. I would never recommend the retreat to anyone! The retreat needs to improve because the price I pay to stay in a place like this really is not worth it!

name: David Rifkin
text: TERRIBLE PLACE TO LIVE RIP OFF I WAS THREATENED WITH A MACHETTE AND WAS FORCED TO MOVE INTO A DIFFERENT APARTMENT. STAFF REFUSED TO NOTIFY THE LOCAL POLICE OR THE UNIVERSITY OF ALABAMA OUT OF THEIR SO CALLED REPUTATION. OVERAGES ARE CONSISTENT AND OUTRAGEOUS. POOL IS DIRTY WITH CIG BUDS, URINE, BEER CANS, AND SEMEN (PEOPLE HAVE SEX ALL THE TIME IN THERE). ALSO ITS RIGHT NEXT TO A HAZARDOUS WASTE RECYCLING PLANT WHICH GIVES THE LAKE A WEIRD GLOW AT NIGHT AND PUTS OFF THE SMELL OF SUAGE EVERYWHERE ONCE THE SUN GOES DOWN. WORST PLACE TO LIVE IN T-TOWN. EXPECT TO PAY AT LEAST $50-$100 MORE A MONTH WITH OVERAGES.

text: This was an exceptional place to reside for almost three years. I can’t say enough good things about my stay here and the management that handles everything professionally and in a very timely manner. I would recommend The Grove to anyone!

text: Good place to live. Rent is great compared to other student housing near South. The only downside is that you cannot park on campus since you are only allowed to have residential parking pass when living there so you have to find an alternative way to make it to class. But overall I enjoy living here. The staff is super nice and especially the maintenance crew they are so helpful.

name: Scotty Stimpson
text: For starters, capitalizing off a national pandemic is no way to run a business. A friend of mine, who has been severely impacted by COVID-19, called with a question regarding their lease and possible early termination. The man on the phone proceeded to laugh at her questions, which, mind you, were founded in reason and made logical sense. This sort of behavior is unacceptable and unprofessional. I'm not a current tenant of the Grove, and nor will I ever be.

name: Bailey Stephens
text:
The Grove is the perfect place to live if you’re in you 2nd or 3rd year of undergrad. It is close to campus, and a great price. The staff is friendly and accommodating and the maintenance men are relatively quick with response. They have great amenities like a pool, a tanning bed, a basketball court, a volleyball court, and a dog park.

Because it is associated with campus housing, dorm rules still apply. I live in low grade two bed room. Though it’s not “upgraded” we just had a new air conditioning unit installed inside and out. They also updated the shower head and sink spout! There is a big variation in room size between my roommates and my room, but we made it work! There is not a ton of provided storage, but additive storage has been beneficial, and I HIGHLY suggest it if you move here and have a lot of stuff. Downside is that the walls are VERY thin and other students tend to talk until late into the night. Other than that, it hasn’t been a bad experience!

The Grove is a fine place to live and worth the money, it can just be noisy. I would suggest this place to anyone not in a graduate program!

resp.text: Thank you, Bailey! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at Grove at Mobile!!

name: Carriea Steadman
text: I would not recommend no one really staying here because I have a hard time getting people to fix things and it is so unprofessional. These people move on their own time. You cannot even get in touch with the maintenance people for an emergency.This experience has been terrible and unprofessional since the beginning for me. It is beyond frustrating. When I put in a request for maintenance, the maintenance people mark it complete when nothing has even been fixed on two totally different occasions with the same issue.

name: Madison Frost
text: The front desk staff has always been nice and helpful. The actual apartments are not bad, good for the price. But maintenance is the absolute worst. There has not been a single time since I have lived here (almost 2 years) that I have been able to put in a maintenance request and it be addressed the first time. If you want something fixed then it takes at least two work orders. They mark it as “complete” but nothing has changed. Maintenance once claimed that they came in and fixed my bed and I was home all day... they never even came into my room. It’s frustrating when you’re paying $500 a month for an apartment with issue that are either never fixed or take a solid two weeks to get seen about. Management seriously needs to do something about this issue considering that I know I am not the only resident who has these problems. This is why I did not and will not renew my lease.

resp.text: We encourage all of our residents to communicate with us directly so problems can be solved quickly and efficiently. Our office is open M-F 10-8pm. Our phone number is 251-341-9412 or you can contact our management team directly at community email grovemobile@achliving.com. We want to make your home a sweet home.

name: Rachel Wyers
text: These apartments are poorly managed to say the least. The apartment complex itself is not that old but it has already gone downhill. I only sub-leased for two months and had to call maintenance three times to spray for cockroaches in the kitchen. Management was only getting the bug exterminators to spray my kitchen which wasn't solving the problem since the whole apartment complex had a terrible cockroach infestation problem. The rent is cheap for what you get but you can expect to pay more every summer because your power bill will be higher. They only allot $100 limit on your utility costs and it is easy to go over that in an Alabama summer. The Grove will try to convince you that it is cheaper to live at the Grove than on campus but this is not true. It all ends up being the same in the end.The crime is abnormally bad for such a place! The management does nothing to deter the crime. They have a gate that has been broken for at least a year. Vehicle break-ins are routine and every now and then you will get someone who gets a gun in their face. If you want to stay somewhere close to campus I suggest staying at Campus Quarters. The security is top notch (gates, security cameras everywhere), and no roaches!!!!!!!

name: James Martin
text: The grove has the WORST customer service possible. They do not return any email or phone calls my son (student) places to the management. He is no longer eligible for attendance at USA and his lease doesn't start until July (it is June) and they will not release him from the lease saying "he signed it when he 'was' eligible for USA." The grove is only allowed for eligible students and once ineligible, the lease is supposed to be terminated, with proof from the school (which was provided). The Grove doesn't want to terminate the contract and hold the parents (guarantor) liable for the payments until next July because my son was eligible. Common sense is not welcome at this apartment complex either. They can find a tenant (new student to fill this lease) faster than their recommend, "have the student find someone to assume the lease." I can't say this with enough emphasis, DO NOT apply to or allow you student to ever live in these apartments. If I were to rate this place on a scale of 1-10, I would give it a negative 5. When things are broken in the apartment, it takes weeks to months to get them fix. If you are looking for a place for your student to live and happen to hear the name "GROVE," see or drive by the "GROVE," RUN, fast, very fast. This mismanaged scam-shack is not the place for you or your student.

name: Kaleb Nailer
text: I'm entering my second year as a resident at the Grove Apartments, and I've seen my fair share of pros and cons. The cons are why my rating isn't a five star rating, but the staff at the office are the reason why my rating isn't a one star rating. One big con is that groundskeeping has been an issue as of late, and maintenance requests are very slow to be fulfilled. However, a massive pro is that the front office staff try to be as helpful as possible, especially Heather Burgess. Heather Burgess is one of if not the most dedicated members of the staff when it comes to serving the residents. She genuinely cares, and from my own personal experience, Heather has consistently gone above and beyond in order to address any grievance or solve any problem I may have had. Staffmembers like Heather Burgess are a huge reason for why I can't rate the Grove at a one star rating because they work incredibly hard to make living at the Grove a wonderful experience.
