name: A. Mendenhall
text:
If i could give a -150 rating i would! Will move you into an already raggedy apartment, tell you they will give you new furniture, then wait until you move out to do it and charge you for every cent it cost them!!! I would recommend anybody who move in to take pictures, record conversations, and request all of your info in writing with a signature because this is ridiculous! Never Again!

No thanks because when i called regarding the issue i was told u could do nothing about it. I wasn't even contacted before the issue went to debt collection. And was told by debt collection in a nasty way that i basically might as well pay because nothing will get done. So i will pay yal the money that I shouldn't owe in the first place just to get yal out of my life for good!!!! It makes no sense to charge people hundreds to thousands of dollars for already messed up furniture that was supposed to be replaced when they lived there but waited until we move out to add the charges on our accounts. Idc if it was new or old management this has gone on for too many years just look at your reviews. We all can't be lieing about the same issue of being charged hundreds of dollars! And all because the company dnt want to pay to replace it yourself. This company has a huge issue and i'm not gonna waste my time calling in again just so nothing can be done.

resp.text: Hello, thank you for your feedback. I am sorry to hear your experience was less than satisfactory. I am not able to find you in our records, please reach out to me at cm@groveatmobile.com. We do require all disputes be put in writing. If you send me an email, I will be more than happy to review your account and answer any questions you may have.

text: Overall the Grove is decent. I lived there a year (2016-17) and liked it well enough. My main complaints were that the couch smelled weird and that neighbors would always leave their trash under the stairs so the breezeways smelled terrible. Maybe with greater punishment they wouldn't do that. Rent was expected for what you get. The internet was very fast but very occasionally would go out, however management would email us every time and let us know they were diligently working to fix the problem, which usually didn't last long anyway. I would most likely live there again IF ONLY THEY ALLOWED PETS D:

text: Parents and students, please heed the warnings of the reviews! Do not sign a lease and ensure your student does not sign a lease if they get told they have to sign an early lease because apartments may not be available. If a students situation change and no long plans to reside there or even attend school...the Grove will threaten to ruin your credit and send your account to collections. You will either have to pay or find another tenant...Not worth it.

resp.text: Thank you, Adasia! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at Grove at Mobile!!

name: Aaron Etheredge
text:
I lived at the Grove for 3 years. Upon move out they charged me 500 in "damages" for things that were stupid. When I disputed these charges they never returned my phone calls. Corporate was no help either. Management switches every year or two because they're too crappy to hire professionals. Stay far away from the Grove. I can remember overhearing a conversation with managers shortly before move out on ways to hide negative reviews online, which is my main motivation for writing this.

I'm seriously considering hiring an attorney and launching a smear campaign by paying college kids to stand right off the property with signs about past experiences and how terrible they are. Perhaps when they start losing business they'll straighten up.

EDIT:

Since posting this, the management of The Grove has contacted me about my experience. I was informed that the Grove was bought out from the owners that I had such a bad experience with and that it is now under new management. I was in contact with a phenomenal woman who has worked at the property for several years and is now in a position of management. It is always such a pleasure to work with genuine people who can empathize with others.

Because of the fact that she has gone far above and beyond anything than I ever expected, I'm giving the new organization a much better review and rating.

The way that my problem was resolved was both quick, courteous, and professional. Because of this sincere desire from the new management to repair the reputation of The Grove with the community, I would now consider the Grove to be a legitimate choice for my future housing needs.

resp.text:
Aaron,

Thank you for giving us the opportunity to cure the situation you were in. We have thoroughly enjoyed being able to make things right for you, and really appreciate you being patient with us as we were trying to get everything resolved for you! Thank you again!

-Grove Management

name: Rachel Collins
text: Absolutely the worst student housing. Up front they lied to me about how much rent I would be paying, over charged myself and the roomates for electricity consistently (we had a $30 overage each when literally nothing except the fridge in the apartment was on while we were all away, A/C off). They charged me $200 to repaint ONE room when I reported that the walls were very damaged upon move in, and are terrible to deal with. Not to mention the property is poorly maintained and the residents are really loud. Also, it is supposed to be smoke free and everyone smokes, cigarette butts and smoke smells everywhere. Seriously, live ANYWHERE but there.

name: Cameron Wilson (WILDJETZ45)
text: DO NOT LIVE HERE! All these 5 star reviews are either people who don’t actually live here or employees because anyone who has lives here knows that this place is a nightmare. Just ask anyone who goes to South, The Grove has a well deserved reputation as the worst apartment in this area. Just in the 2 years I lived here my apartment was broken in to, there was a shooting in the apartment next to mine, my bike was stolen and my water was out for almost 3 weeks. Thats only the tip of the iceburg too! The Grove is plagued with problems all the time like their internet, the internet here will go out from time to time for DAYS AT A TIME. So they charge you way too much for what you get, there is always trash everywhere (there was an old condom on my staircase for almost 4 months), and I wouldn’t consider is a safe apartment by any means. So there is my review of the worst decision I have ever made in living here and hopefully I have saved someone else from making the same mistake I have.

resp.text: Cameron, thank you for your feedback. It is our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory. Our team would be happy to speak with you and resolve the issues you are having. Please contact me at cm@groveatmobile.com at your earliest convenience.

name: Brandon Booher
text: Great value, friendly staff, easy access to the university

resp.text: Thank you, Brandon! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at Grove at Mobile!!

text: very friendly staff! and always fun events !

resp.text: Thank you, Payton! We are so excited you decided to stay with us and cant wait to have you as a resident!

name: bree collier
text: Best place to stay near campus !

resp.text: Thank you, Bree! We love hearing that you love the Grove at Mobile!!

name: Kyle Regas
text: ***STAY AWAYYYY!!!*** Spacious yes, upscale no. This place was one of the dirtiest places I’ve ever lived. Not to mention they will charge you thousands of dollars when you move out claiming the (dirty carpets, walls, etc. to be caused by you). $1,600 later I learned my lesson to never ever rent from a place this unorganized/unethical. Stay away! Consider yourself warned. They will try to blame it on me having a dog, I assure you this is not the case.

resp.text: Our staff strives to provide all of our residents a clean and sanitary place to call home. This requires us to restore the apartments back to the original conditions once someone vacates. We disclose the requirement to leave the apartment in a clean and damage free condition upon move in to avoid costly damage charges at move out. Our move out inspections are done with move in inspections in hand so if there are deficiencies we are able to compare them to the condition of the apartment at move out and charges are not made on pre existing damages. Charges for damages are always based on the cost to restore to an acceptable living condition.

name: Kenneth Cotton
text: Terrible and trashy living environment. The front desk are rude and inconsiderate. Plus they will overcharge you for the smallest violations, but not fix your major problems in a timely manner. I encourage no one to stay here!

name: Dianna Archer
text: Do NOT live here. I'm writing this review because I wish someone had told me how horrible this place was before I moved in. This is honestly the most ghetto place I've ever lived. As a woman, I don't feel safe walking outside of my apartment at night. Take a drive around here at night and you'll see what I mean. There are loud parties almost every night, people smoking weed outside, and there seems to be an event that involves the police every other week. Yes, the price is inciting, but you can get just as good of a deal at The Edge or even some non-campus apartments. And after all the random overages and fees The Grove charges you for, you might have been better off living at Campus Quarters for $600 a month. Don't be fooled, the model apartment they show you when you go for a tour is nothing like the actual room you'll get. The first month that I lived here I had a downpour of water from my bathroom ceiling and the hot water in my apartment stopped working. It took maintenance over a week to fix it. I took freezing showers for over a week. I also had someone (who was believed to be on LSD) try to kick my apartment door down. If you want to keep your sanity and your safety, please don't live here. If I had a daughter, this would be the last place I would put her.

name: B C
text: Really awesome staff, super sweet super helpful

resp.text: Thank you,  BC!! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at Grove at Mobile!!

name: Tonya Jones
text: Room is nothing like the model. They are not upfront about everything. The Grove in Troy is where my oldest daughter lived and I assumed everything was going to be the same. Poor management of the Grove in Mobile never again in life -5.

name: Katherine Pope
text: The apartment itself was OK.  Management is awful!   Please, Please, Please keep a detailed record of your payments for they do not.  We had no electricity overages, so the total amount should have Never changed, (IT DID)  Due to them not knowing how to post payments to the correct account Multiple Times.  And now we are trying to sort all of this out.  But the icing on the cake, they have our contact information wrong as well. How can a large complex such as this operate this way!!!  Sooo glad we have moved out.   PS.  Took 3 weeks and several phone calls to get the ac repaired so the window unit could be removed!!

name: haylee raye
text:
PLEASE do not invest your time or money into this place. Front desk always has an attitude and regularly gives out the wrong information, maintenance just barges in and doesn't repair things to completion, the management (Patricia) is rude and condescending, the sales lady ( her name is Avery I think)  is equally rude.
I initially decided to stay here because it was the cheapest option, if only I had known that I would regularly be fined/ up-charged without reason. The wi-fi is slow, the air in my apartment regularly goes out ( i'm not the only one with these complaints) there are often overage fees that don't match actual usage and no one can ever explain why.
Parents, trust me, you're better off sending your kids to a nicer, slightly more expensive complex. At least then there would be a chance that they could live comfortably under bad management.

resp.text: Haylee, we take complaints seriously and when we attempted to locate you in our database your name does not appear. We believe this to be a questionable post and request that you contact us directly at grovemobile@achliving.com We would like to discuss your  review,as we do not show you as a current or former resident of The Grove.

name: Blair Smith
text: Do. Not. Live. Here. I could go on for at least 15 minutes on reasons to not live here. Especially if you are a transfer student and brand new to the Mobile area, DO NOT live here. They will take advantage of you and lie to make it sound like the apartment fits the needs you are looking for just like they did to me.

resp.text: Blair, thank you for your feedback. It is our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory. Our team would be happy to speak with you and resolve the issues you are having. Please contact  me at cm@groveatmobile.com.

name: Kandise M
text: This establishment disclosed that animals were not allowed in an attempt to draw in guests. The maintenance team does not complete tasks in a timely fashion. When I went to visit my family in April, I returned to an eviction notice saying I was moved out of the system. I also lost my last two months of free rent. This establishment is a major downgrade and management is insufficient as well. I am very displeased with my business transaction, and I have advised my friends against using your establishment due to the pest control as well. You all should do better and treat your guests with more respect. I am disgusted and disgraced by the way in which my business was handled unprofessionally. Very displeased. And the maintenance man watch you when you’re working out. Management changed, but the communication problem is still there. You also threw away all of my things without my knowledge. Im never sending anyone to your complex as a referral. And there is a BAD roach a and mold problem.

resp.text:
Kandise,

Thank you for your feedback. Since we spoke on the phone yesterday, please reach back out should you have any more questions.

Please don't make the same mistake I did.

name: LA Fishing
text: I can not begin to explain how terrible this apartment complex is. They fail to notify when lock's are changed so you get to find out yourself and are locked out of your apartment with nowhere to go, and have no number to call to get you help after hours. In all if you are reading this looking into this place... Pay a little more and go somewhere else. You will regret your decision in living here.

name: Cheree Green
text: I would not recommend my worst enemy to stay at this place. They treat their tenants as if they’re not students and they don’t work with you when you’re having problems with paying rent. When you’re late they threaten you with eviction notices, legal fees, and late fees all within a few days of being late mind you( after the 5th of each month). Parents do not let the Grove fool you into thinking that your child is in good hands because they’re not. This apartment complex is about making money plain and simple. The management is purely ridiculous, you can only speak to the assistant general manager via email, which is frustrating when you’re trying to handle business accordingly, other than that you’re handling business with students who tell you to email the assistant GM. The conservice bill is a joke they give you a $25 allowance every month which you’re bound to go over and it can get to be pretty high and if you don’t pay this with your rent by the 5th of every month they will threaten you with eviction notices as well. I am not one to leave reviews on anything but this place needed one so please HEAD MY WARNING AND DO NOT LEASE AT THE GROVE!!!

resp.text: We regret that you have had an unpleasant experience. Resident satisfaction is extremely important to us. Please give us the opportunity to rectify your concerns and change your opinion. 251-341-9412

name: Susan C
text: Filth, LOUD parties, and nothiing is ever done. Rooms are full of bed bugs. Do your research, there is a reason the rent here is cheap. You get what you pay for.

resp.text: Susan, thank you for your feedback. It is our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory.  Our team would be happy to speak with you and resolve the issues you are having. We do not see you in our system so we are unable to reach out to you. Please contact our Community Manager, Avery at 251-341-9412 at your earliest convenience.

name: Will Harkins
text: I was stuck living at this hole in the ground for 4 years.  They take the cake when it comes to lying and cheating their tenants.  They claim to be safe and secure gated community.  That gate out front is never closed, anyone who wants to can walk right in.  Swim in our pool, play on our basketball courts, and rob anyone they please.  I was robbed 3 times, my car vandalized, and the grove themselves took money that i gave no authorization for them to take.  Management likes to play dumb when you confront them about problems, and when you start pressing them hard about it, they become a bunch of smart mouths towards you.  Nothing about the grove is appealing, you're better off living in your vehicle than living at the grove.  Its horribly unsafe.  I watched someone stabbed outside my window 2 weeks into living there, cops showed up 20min after i called them.  My neighbor was robbed at knife point and her car stolen.  One of my roommates had his car stolen the other was in our apartment when someone kicked the door in and robbed him at knife point and stole everything he had and anything i had in the living room.  They hit you with fake charges and force you to pay them.  The place is dirty, and loud at night and cops wont do a darn thing if you call them.  I've been moved out for a while now, and im still having to deal with the idiots of grove management.  Spare yourself what I went through and still going through. And maintenance...my AC was broken for most of the 4 years i lived there...after the first 2 years i just gave up on them fixing it correctly all together...but even with my ac dead i still managed to go over on my utilities, to spite the fact that me and my room mates were never home to use power and kept the lights off all the time.

name: Gabrielle Green
text: it's so beautiful, stop sleeping on the grove

resp.text: Thank you Gabrielle!

name: Shawn Balk
text: The Grove is a great place to live because the rent is cheap and the commute to classes is minimal driving-wise.  In fact, for new incoming residents wanting a 3 BR 1200 sq. ft unit, the rent, which always includes all but like $10 of utilities, is only going to be $485/month.  In my case, it is only $455/month, because it is my second year here since a $30 cheaper rent was an incentive to sign for another year, six months early.  Often times, in my experience, the occupancy level is below capacity; My unit only has two of us, and my roommate is moving out at the end of this month, while I happen to be looking for someone to take my lease because I am doing a leave of absence from school.  The free internet and basic cable have been nice.  I don’t know if phone service is free or not because I just use my 688,9377 non-Mobile mobile (480) number.  There are volleyball and basketball courts and a soccer field for the athletic, and there is a fire pit and grills for outdoor hangouts.  I definitely recommend the Grove to incoming students, whether I was leaving or not.

name: Destanee Harris
text: I'm so glad this is my last month living in the grove. I have stayed here for two years and it's time for a change. The management is horrible they can't even keep a manger for 6 months. The people that work in the office will tell you anything to get you off the phone. My dryer was broke for atleast a month before, I kept calling and calling and they stated they were waiting on new dryers to come in. I found out they actually had a dryer in the  maintenance closet the whole time. The maintenance team is good they respond to the work orders when giving by the office but sometimes it never makes it to their hands so I can't blame them for poor management. The air conditioner in my apt goes out every summer two times already this summer. The air conditioner units are old and when water gets in them they stop working. This complex gets about 500 dollars from each resident each month but yet are too cheap to get new air units. The gate situation at night is terrible, people who have a gate card have to wait up to 15 mins some nights in long lines of cars just get home. This is a college campus most of the visitors are college students so just leave the gate open!!!! Closing it is absolutely crazy. They are trying to be like other complexes but don't have the  amenities  to try to follow in the footsteps of the others like Campus Quaters and the Edge. Don't stay here I recommend saving  money and living in a off campus complex.

name: Destiny Sealie
text: I will never live here again.They are horrible they do not work with their students period!!!!!!

The Ridge Team

Grove Management

text: I would never recommend living here to anyone for the following reasons: the gates are always broken, there’s been several break ins to apartments and vehicles in the parking lot and oneten cant and won’t do anything about it because all they have is a single camera at the front of the office so if there’s any damage to your car don’t expect to get help from them because i tried and they said they couldn’t see anything on their one and only camera even though i was parked in front of it, oh and they tow you from free parking spots if they don’t like the way you  parked but don’t worry they’ll give you a citation warning for $0 before towing you out and that’s a $250 fine so save the headache and go literally anywhere else they only care about money here and won’t help you with anything else unless it involves a payment. The staff is nice though.

Don’t waste your time or money!!!!

name: Gus Vinet
text: OneTen is an absolute AMAZING place to live. I can’t emphasize it enough! I honestly don’t even know where to begin.  I’ll first brag on the management and staff. I’ve never witnessed a more profession, caring, and helpful staff in my life. The extra events and amenities OneTen has to offer is no doubt my favorite  part about living here. I can say without a doubt, the staff really cares about us as students. The living arrangements are top notch. So very clean and organized. The pool area is beautiful. The gym is very useful being right there close to home. I can’t complain about anything! I feel safe at one ten with it being a gated complex and that really puts my parents at ease being so far away from home. I am very content with OneTen and am so very glad to call it my home for these four years.

resp.text: Wow!! Thank you so so much for your kind words, Gus! We've worked so hard to make sure our community is well taken care of, and that our residents know that we will forever be their home away from home! Thank you again; we hope you have a great holiday break. And if you need anything, please don't hesitate to reach out to us!!

text: This complex seems to target and cheat students.  When nobody is there to use the electricity still has overages.  Requiring clean carpet to be professionally cleaned,  when not needed, and many say the carpet was dirty when they move in.  Do not move there.

name: Cowan Woodham
text: Garbage apartment complex!! Too many problems to list and the staff obviously could care less. Don’t waste your time or money here!  I rather live in a raggedy cardboard box with a rabid squirrel than live here.

resp.text: Hi Zack! We would love to clear up some items with you, but unable to find you as a resident. Please reach out to us at info@liveoneten.com so that we can better ourselves and know where to improve!

name: Shelby Elmore

resp.text: Oh Hannah! Thank you so much for the kind words. We put alot of focus into our events and making sure you all love them! If there is anything we can do to always improve, you just let us know! -OneTen Management

name: Erika Schoemehl
text: Living here has been the worst mistake so far of my college career. It is a total waste of money, I live in a four bedroom apartment, the complex makes over $2,400 a month off my apartment alone monthly. The price we are paying does not at all match the amenities or treatment. My roommates and my other friends that live here have had copious amounts of issues, and the staff in the office, all but managers and maintenance, are college students who are not equipped with the knowledge on how to properly run an apartment complex the size of OneTen. There is paint all over the floors of the apartment, the finish on our floor is coming up, the granite on our sink wasn’t sealed, and none of the doors close properly, allowing air in which drives up the electric bill over the $25 monthly allowance per person. My roommate’s bathtub is cracked and her bathroom sink faucet doesn’t properly work and one of my bedroom windows lets water in when it rains (which is a lot in Mobile). You would expect a 100% pristine complex and rooms with the price we are paying. Recently, I was cleaning my apartment and decided to clean the vent that leads to my air filter for the HVAC system. Upon doing this, I took the cover off to clean it better. After I took this cover off, I discovered my filter had not been changed in at least nine months, but other people who have looked at it have estimated it had not been replaced in at least a year. OneTen currently uses VERY cheap monthly filters. These barely filter anything, and with them having to be changed monthly are setting themselves up for complete failure in this department. My whole HVAC unit is sopping wet and rusted, and the whole thing is most likely going to need to be replaced. It wasn’t until after I went to the office and complained about this that I noticed maintenance actually doing their job and replacing filters. IF YOU LIVE AT 110 CHECK YOUR FILTER!!!! It’s so simple to. I was diagnosed with a lung infection during the Fall semester, and this dirty air filter was the likely culprit. I am tempted to actually file a complaint with the Mobile Health Department. The trash compactor is also absolutely disgusting. There is trash covering the whole area around it, since the compactor was completely full. That is also a health hazard. I disposed of my very dirty air filter at the compactor, I had to put it on the ground outside since there was no where else to put it, and where I took the trash out the next day, it was gone. The ONLY piece of trash they cleaned up was my dirty air filter. I believe they did this so other tenants would not see it and check their own filter to see it’s status, removing evidence, if you will. With the rent money 110 is banking each month off college students, they could hire an outside trash pick up company to come and pick up the trash that has accumulated. There is also trash, dirt, cigarette butts, and dog feces all through out the complex and the stairwells in the buildings. The balconies of most of the buildings are also disgusting. All of this breeds infestations of bugs, rodents, and bacteria. If you are a college student and thinking about living here, don’t look at 110’s Instagram account and think everything here is amazing and wonderful. Our rent money is wasted on other student organizations and incentives to move in here. Don’t come here. Check out the other places, if I were doing this over again, I would rent in a non-student living complex. It’s much cheaper. With how much money me and my three roommates are paying each month here (~$2,400) we could afford to rent a 4,000 square foot house in Mobile. Don’t be a naïve young college student and live here. Management will only take you seriously if you get your dad on the phone. It’s not worth it. I cannot add photos to this review, but I will try to in another review.

resp.text: Hey Erika! Thank you so much for taking the time to write this. The property manager will be reaching out to you in order to straighten everything out that you've mentioned above. Thank you again!

name: Leah Tucker
text: One-Ten is the best! It's so upscale and makes me feel so fancy. Since it's brand new, obviously there's been some kinks, but we're working through them and getting everything in order. The staff is wonderful, especially Lo! ❤️ They go above and beyond to make sure the residents are well taken care of!

name: Savanna Wood
text: I was pleased with this place for the most part until I called multiple times about my building’s stairs constantly being covered in trash and not a single time have they done anything about it. No one picks up after their pets because they CAN’T with the trash in the pet areas overflowing and not being taken out in months! (I also called about this and no one has done anything about it) They try to fine residents for this but don’t seem to care at all about ensuring residents have access to a place to put waste. It’s ridiculous. I am furious that they seem to ignore any problem outside of “maintenance issues.” I never review places but I’m seriously just that angry I had to let y’all know that they absolutely don’t care!! They care about how they look on social media and that is it. And I bet someone from their office will reply to this. WELL HOW ABOUT REPLY TO MY EMAILS AND CALLS and actually fix the problem. Don’t waste your money living here please!

resp.text: Hi Savanna! Thank you for taking the time to write a review! We hope that we were able to clear up some confusion! Always be sure to give us a call or an email so that we can get those items taken care of for you!!

name: Liquid xF
text: Been here since it opened, through 3 years and 3 new managements(new management every year). They rushed the building process so there are half inch gaps everywhere for bugs to get cozy. Lightning struck the building I'm in and the lights have flickered for over a month with no response from management. 3 armed robberies have happened, no new security has been put up to combat the growing crime rate. My car was recently totaled in the parking lot from a drunk college kid doing 50 down the straight away, losing control on speed bumps. Cop couldn’t breathalyze, just thought he was cool and dabbed his drunk self up. Oh, no security footage for that either. They do however have security put up for the god awful gate that will smoke any car that gets to close. Management can’t get anything done in a quick or efficient manner although they’re the newest ones to get thrown into this mess. Do not live here.

resp.text: Hey there, thank you for taking the time to write us a review! All of the items you mentioned were taken care of immediately, including a MPD officer on site! We did have footage and it was provided! Please email us at info@liveoneten.com so that we can help clear some items up for you!

name: anonymous user
text: I do NOT suggest living here. These apartments were supposed to be top of the line, which is impossible if every material used is cheap quality. The walls are paper thin, paint chips from breathing on it, window/door seals aren't actually sealed, etc. I live in the building beside the dumpster and it is miserable to smell, should've been relocated somewhere that nobody surrounds. You have the option to write a maintenance complaint, yet management never takes the blame and rarely tries to help, making it all "your fault" even if theres no way. Besides the unprofessional management team, they attempt to fine you for EVERYTHING. You will check your account to pay rent and it will be higher because of some random fees such as "not picking up dog poop" when you don't even have a dog nor do your roommates!! Another thing is the bugs. Our unit has endless bugs and we keep it spotless everyday. This may have something to do with the floors being uneven and baseboards not meeting the ground, who knows. Just another reason I would not waste any time living here. Unfortunately, I am stuck another year yet I am counting down the days until I can move out.

name: Jordan Thomas
text: i love living here!! the staff is always quick to help you with anything and friendly!

resp.text: We love having you Jordan and thrilled to hear you are a fan of us as well! Thanks for the review!

name: Abby Krzywiecki

text: There are way too many things wrong with this place to list. I lived her for a year and moved out as soon as I could. I was very displeased and disappointed with my experience here and wouldn’t recommend signing a lease here to anyone.

text: Move in day today. The power wasn't on in the apartment, it wasn't cleaned at all, broken window, balcony door won't close all the way (on the first floor) no hot water, broken or missing hardware, the list goes on and on,,,  not a good first impression.    .    Spent way too much time asking people to do their job when it should have already been done!  Rent was paid on the first not allowed to move in until today. I want my first ten days of rent back at least!  Would you treat "family" like this?  I don't think so.   Boo

name: Kinsey Hassell
text: If you haven’t already signed a lease, DONT. It is a terrible place to live. There have been what seems like never ending problems since the day I moved in. From water damage on the floor and baseboards and now my apartment is INFESTED WITH TERMITES. When my roommate emailed management about the issue they told us there was “nothing they could do since it is termite season”. They then proceeded to tell us that WE needed to spray the baseboards and door entry’s. This place is nothing but problems. I do not recommend living here.

resp.text: We are sincerely sorry that your opinion of our Community has changed and we are working diligently with contractors on many things. For further details as to our plan of action on these items we welcome you to reach out and schedule a meeting with our manager, Lo, to get all the details. Or you are always welcome to email her at lrobinson@achliving.com. We strive to keep our residents happy and would like to change your opinion and make your stay here as comfortable and enjoyable as possible. We look forward to hearing from you and please let us know if there is anything else we can do. Thank you!

name: Darian Blackmon
text: DO NOT MOVE INTO ONTEN!!! OneTen is horrible! I signed my lease after the manager told me he would waive my move in fees then right after I signed it, HE LIES & says he never said he would waive my fees & says he won’t waive them. $390 worth of fees. Then the office decides to play a joke & call me to say they decided to waive them for the inconvience then they call back less than 5 minutes later saying they changed their minds. I heard a lot of laughing in the background. Horrible people. Horrible company. I never moved in & I will never move in. Now they are calling me, harassing me, saying I owe them $6600.00.. any college students, if you’re looking for a place to stay PLEASE look into Campus Quarters. I HIGHLY recommend them. I have been staying there since 2015. They are reasonable, HONEST, & respectful! They have a move in special right now so if anyone is looking for a referral where you can earn money instead of paying it, LET ME KNOW!!!!! I have countless amounts of friends who are leaving OneTen after only staying there for a year because of their unprofessionalism!

resp.text:
Hey Darian,

I know that we have already replied to your review on FB but of course didnt want to leave any stone unturned.  So please feel free to contact us via email or phone if you need to so we can better help.

name: Rufus Young
text: My girlfriend decided to look into moving here last year.. she regrets the day she walked into their office. Once she got there, the manager tells her he will waive her fees if her & her parent sign the lease before 6pm, electronically. Once she & her parent signed the lease, he says “Oh I’m sorry that special is over & we can’t waive the fees.” Then after speaking with her father(A LAWYER), he proceeds to LIE & say he never said he would waive them. Now they are harassing her, saying she owes $6600 A WHOLE YEAR LATER... it’s because NO ONE IS STAYING THERE OR TRYING TO MOVE IN... & they are looking for reason to get some sort of compensation out of people. After all that, they still decided to pick with my girlfriend. They called her saying they decided to waive her fees because of the inconvience. My girlfriend was satifisfied & was about to give them another shot... they call back saying that they changed their minds & that they weren’t going to waive her fees. It was a lot of laughing & giggling on the phone as they spoke as well. They are lame, disrespectful, & dishonest. Any college students looking for a great living arrangement, PLEASE come to Campus Quaters. My girlfriend has stayed there since 2015 & she has no complaints at all. They’re having a move in special right now where they are PAYING YOU to move in so if you’re looking for a referral, LET ME KNOW! But please think about moving into OneTen because you will regret it, just like ALL of my girlfiend’s friends did. No one is resigning with them because of their unprofessionalism.

resp.text:
Hey Rufus,

I know that we have already replied to your review on FB but of course didnt want to leave any stone unturned.  Please have your friend contact us via email or phone.

name: Ricky Mccammon

name: Shelby Bradley
text: Beautiful apartments!

name: James “Chubster11” Himes
text: Really nice and clean.

name: Madison Henrich
text:
Bellamy is an awesome place to live, IF you choose not to live at the dorms your freshman year. It’s basically like a glamorized college dorm (in the sense that it’s your own apartment with no RA) The people that work there are super sweet however most of them are college students that really aren’t equipped to deal with real problems. If you have any problems, you will need to find an adult who can help you which is hard considering there usually isn’t one working most days. You are basically paying for a room not an apartment, Florence is SUCH a cheap place to live, and this is the most expensive place to live here. One bedrooms (at other apartment complexes) go from 460-525 a month for a very spacious, nice, clean place. However Bellamy offers as less as “375” for a room, which is totally not true, you won’t pay less than $450 and it is just for a ROOM. That includes your living room, tv, pantry, refrigerator , and the rest of your apartment you have to share with up to 4 other people. I lived in a 5 bedroom where every single one of us had to pay different rents just because we signed our leases 1 day apart. They take advantage of college kids. Every single day is a party there (which is fun at first but it gets old). Every apartment is crazy loud with dozens of kids there partying every night, you cannot get anything done there with the noise. You are way better off to look at other apartments for cheaper and a better place of living and quality.
-a college sophomore who loved to party, was in a sorority and STILL was miserable there.
PLEASE let your kids get their own place or share with roommates at ANY other apartment complex than this one

name: Jason Simonian
text: Apartments main, or shared area, is large & inviting. The private space is actually large, welcoming and well appointed. The bath/shower combination comes with a curved shower rid, supply your own curtain, liner, and hooks. The bed frame is fit for a full size bed, no box spring required, just a mattress. The dresser, or dressers, are a pair of 2 drawer that can be stacked or placed under the bed.

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Jason! We are happy that you like your living area and that it is warm and inviting. Please let us know if you ever need anything in the office. Have a great day!

name: Amber Issacs
text:
They have random men come up and random people have the code, whenever you express you don’t feel comfortable they won’t do anything about it. I just want my money back, I don’t feel comfortable AT ALL. This has been the worst experience. Whatever you do, don’t even apply to live here.

This is my married name, of course you couldn’t find me. Because you refused to acknowledge my requests to change my name when I tried to let you know I got married.

resp.text: Amber, will you please call us at 256.298.9080 so we can discuss these issues with you and your name change.  Our Management  team would like to follow up and  see how we can help resolve this. Thank you! - Bellamy Management.

name: Grace Gaddy
text: It's a convenient place to stay with it's close proximity to UNA and it seems to have a lot of nice amenities. It may be furnished, but it isn't worth how much you pay for rent for such a small living space.

name: Katlin Parham
text: While Bellamy is nice to look at, the management is so disorganized. I did a lease takeover in January 2020 and I was recently charged $1600 that I did not owe, even though I hadn't lived there for 5 months. I did not receive an explanation as to why this happened; just an "it was an error" and a short apology. This is not the first time that management has made sloppy mistakes with a person's file. I've lived in worse apartments and have never had errors such as these. Rent from them at your own risk!

resp.text: We are so sorry about the inconvenience, Katlin. Unfortunately it was a mistake in the system and we own up to this mistake. We have fixed your account where you do not owe the amount anymore. Again, we do apologize for this error. If you have any other questions or concerns, please feel free to call us at the office. Have a great day!

name: taylor seney
text: Bellamy Florence has the nicest workers and they’re very welcoming. When me and my friends were looking into living there someone was always there to help us. The space is so beautiful and has everything any college student would dream of. I love Bellamy

resp.text: Thank you for the kind review, Taylor!

name: Cassie Forbes
text: Bellamy is convenient if you just want something fully furnished and close to UNA's campus, but the experience living here was not that great. Maintenance concerns were taken care of pretty quickly, but everything else was a bit of a disappointment. We had issues with our upstairs neighbors that went ignored for 10+ months, even after making multiple complaints. Trying to do a lease takeover was impossible; all the people that applied to take my lease were declined and Bellamy never let me know, leading me to believe that everything was in order until I got the notice that the next month's rent was due. The people who work in the office are nice, but could never really answer any questions I or my roommates had. The price seems fair for a fully furnished apartment, until you consider that 4 roommates paying individual leases amounts to nearly $1800 a month before utilities. Bellamy was far from the worst place I could have chosen to live after leaving the university dorms, but I definitely won't be going back.

resp.text: Cassie, thanks for taking the time to write this review.  We are so sorry that your experience at Bellamy has not been a positive one and want to work with you to address your concerns  We are working on noise complaints and now have a 24/hour call center available for any after hour complaints. We do apologize that this was an ongoing issue for you. Lease takeover's are screened the same as we do any resident who are moving into Bellamy, so they have to meet the same rental qualification as everyone else. We do apologize for any confusion this may have caused communicating this out, and we appreciate you for letting us know so we can do better in the future. We do try to be competitive with market rates and ensure that all of our apartments are fully furnished, have the best amenities, and we are able to host monthly contests and giveaways. If you have any suggestions on how we can add value to our property or would like to discuss the following issues, please call the office at 256.298.9080. Even though you are no longer living with us, we do value your feedback and would love to discuss these concerns in further detail. Have a great day! Sincerely, Bellamy management.

name: Morgan Ebert
text: Incredibly welcoming staff, and plenty of amenities! Great community to be a part of.

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Morgan! We are so happy that you have stayed with us another year!

name: Chase Evans
text: I love my apartment at Bellamy Florence and the entire Team! Not only do I live in the best apartment in Florence, but I live in the best community in Florence 💕 From walking in the clubhouse and having genuine laughs and conversation to seeing service team on grounds and getting a big smile. I love my Bellamy Florence 💕💕💕

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Chase. It is always a pleasure when you come by the clubhouse!

name: ANaiya King
text: Very immoral practices. Only care about swindling young students out of their money, not providing a safe and healthy living experience.

resp.text: We appreciate your honest feedback, ANaiya.  We are sorry that you have had this experience, and we would like to discuss any issues that you have had with our community. We do care about all of our residents and their experience here, and we want to make sure it is the very best.  Please call us at 256.298.9080 to discuss any issues that you have had with us so we can try to come up with a solution. Again, thank you for your honest feedback. Have a great day!

name: Jovana Marie
text: Bellamy is a wonderful place for students to live. The amenities are wonderful, but the staff is even better. Cornia always answers any questions I have and keeps me informed about clubhouse events. Elizabeth and Cedric are kind and helpful as well. They always have a smile when I stop by the clubhouse. Best place to live.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Jovana!

name: ID360 Media
text: I was very pleasantly surprised when my son found Bellamy Place as his student housing.  It is a well-thought-out, safe, clean and well-managed complex. The apartment layouts were well designed for roommates who may not know one another before arriving. The common elements are sufficient for the number of students. Kudos!

resp.text: Thank you for your review!

name: Madison McNeely Johns
text: Bellamy is hands down the nicest place in town. The gated community and each unit being all intertwined with smart home technology makes it so unique to this area. No other apartment complex in town is as student catered as Bellamy plus these apartments are fully furnished! I cannot wait to see the finished results and to move in this fall!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Madison! We are looking forward to having you as a resident!

name: Mackenzie B.
text: Honestly, shopping the Florence market, there are no student-specific options in the area for UNA kids. The off-campus picks for young adults include 5 apartment complexes run by one company with all very similar complaints. It seems like every apartment in the market is a combination of dangerous and outdated. I'm also surprised at the pet fees in the area are $700! Bellamy is a one of a kind opportunity for UNA Students to live in a clean, safe, and brand new community specifically tailored for them.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Mackenzie! We are so glad that you have noticed the value of student-living that we are bringing to the Florence area. We love our pet owners, along with all of our future residents! Please let us know how we can be of further assistance to you in the future!

name: Mollie Murphy
text: Multiple of my friends have stayed at Bellamy and it is HELL ON EARTH. They have a fine for anything you can think of. I wouldn’t be surprised if my friend got a fine for forgetting to flush her toilet once. They trick you into signing things that they make sound one way, like it’s helping you, but there’s always a catch, always a FINE FOR THE MOST RIDICULOUS THINGS I HAVE EVER SEEN. The owners of this insane establishment take down/remove posts that are negative off of their facebook page. They will also block you so you cannot express your concern. if you have something bad to say about Bellamy, you are immediately blocked. The workers are some of the only people here giving good reviews, which they have no right to even give, given they are completely biased. Bellamy came to “inspect” my friends apartment, and when we got back, her drawers were all left open, her things scattered. My question is, 1. Why can’t they have the decency to leave the room clean, how they found it. Ultimately my 2nd question is why the hell are these people going through their customers PERSONAL BELONGINGS. They are invasive, and have nothing to say or do with you unless it’s giving you a fine. I have also walked into a workers apartment at Bellamy. Keep in mind, this person WORKS HERE. There was marijuana everywhere. He was smoking it, come to find out the next day, he is turning people in for having marijuana in their apartment. But since he works there Bellamy lets illegal activity slide? That just goes to show the dictatorship they are running. They are money hungry, they don’t care about their residents, and this place is a sick joke of an apartment complex. If you don’t want to go bankrupt, DO NOT MOVE HERE. Honestly, if you want to enjoy your home at all, and your privacy, NEVER SIGN WITH BELLAMY. THEY ARE MONEY HUNGRY AND HAVE NO CARE FOR THEIR RENTERS OR THEIR EXPERIENCE. Do yourself a favor and stay far away. Peace out 🤙🏽. Sorry Bellamy, you can’t take this post down or fine me for it :)

resp.text: Thank you for your honest review Mollie. If your friends are still residents,  we would love to discuss and work on these issues in person! We hope you have a great day!

name: Ozzy Corpus
text: The only place in Florence that has any of the modern luxuries for college students. I'm excited to live there with my best friends! I love Bellamy!

name: John Stalin
text: If you have anyone that stays with you for more than 2 nights, like lets say a person your in a relationship with, even if your are married to them, they want each of you to have a lease each paying the same rent amount. Like for instance if your rent is $450, they want each of you to pay them $450 so for yall to stay in a room together, you will be paying $900 on rent for one month for jus 1 small bedroom and small bathroom. DO NOT SIGN A LEASE WITH THEM, its like PRISON!!

name: Dalton Stewart
text: Plan on paying anywhere from $2-$30 extra on rent due to “convenience fees”. And and extra $8-$10 on utilities due to a “covenience fee”.

name: emma woodard
text: Bellamy is definitely the nicest apartment community in the area! Can’t wait to move in this fall!!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Emma!

name: Lucky Stokes
text: Very nice facilities and community

resp.text: Thank you for your review Lucky!

name: Elijah Taylor
text: Everyone is amazing

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Eixgod!

name: Gabriel Sandrell
text: The best place to live in Florence!!!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Gabriel!

name: Jessica
text: Nice

resp.text: Thank you for your review Jessica!

text: Bellamy is the best in Florence!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Rebecca!
